hadiths.text: And from the Commander of the Faithful, Abu Hafs, Umar ibn Al-Khattab ibn Nufayl ibn Abd al-Uzza ibn Riyāh ibn Qart ibn Razāh ibn Adī ibn Lu’ayy ibn Ghalib al-Qurashī al-Adawī, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "Deeds are only by intentions, and for each person is only what he intended. So, whoever emigrated for Allah and His Messenger, his emigration is for Allah and His Messenger. And whoever emigrated for some worldly gain or a woman to marry, his emigration is for what he emigrated for." (Agreed upon for its authenticity. Narrated by the two Imams of the Hadith scholars: Abu Abdullah Muhammad ibn Isma'il ibn Ibrahim ibn al-Mughirah ibn Bardizbah al-Jafī al-Bukhārī, and Abu al-Husayn Muslim ibn al-Hajjāj ibn Muslim al-Qushayrī al-Naysābūrī, may Allah be pleased with them both, in their Sahih collections, which are the most authentic books compiled.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Ummul Mu'minin, Umm 'Abdullah, 'Aishah (may Allah be pleased with her) said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "An army will invade the Ka'bah, and when they are in a desert, the first and the last of them will be swallowed up by the earth." 'Aishah said: "I said: 'O Messenger of Allah, how will the first and the last of them be swallowed up, when among them are their markets and those who are not of them?'" He said: "The first and the last of them will be swallowed up, then they will be resurrected according to their intentions." (Agreed upon. This is the wording of Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Aishah (may Allah be pleased with her) reported that the Prophet (peace be upon him) said: "There is no emigration after the Conquest, but [you should] strive in the cause of Allah and be sincere in your intention. If you are called to go forth, then go forth." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Abdullah, Jabir bin Abdullah Al-Ansari, may Allah be pleased with them both, he said: We were with the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, on an expedition, and he said: "Indeed, there are men in Medina, you did not march a march, nor did you cross a valley, but they were with you, hindered by illness." And in another narration: "Except that they shared the reward with you." (Narrated by Muslim). (Narrated by Bukhari) From Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: We returned from the expedition of Tabuk with the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, and he said: "Indeed, there are people we left behind in Medina, we did not traverse a mountain pass or a valley, but they were with us, hindered by an excuse." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Yazid Ma'n bin Yazid bin Al-Akhnas, may Allah be pleased with them, and he, his father, and his grandfather were Companions. He said: My father Yazid brought out dinars to give as charity and placed them with a man in the mosque. I came and took them and brought them to him. He said: By Allah, it was not you I intended. So I disputed with him before the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and he said: "You shall have what you intended, O Yazid, and you shall have what you took, O Ma'n." (Narrated by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Ishaq Sa'd bin Abi Waqas Malik bin Ahb bin Abd Manaf bin Zuhrah bin Kilab bin Murrah bin Ka'b bin Lu'ayy Al-Qurashi Al-Zuhri, may Allah be pleased with him, one of the ten who were given glad tidings of Paradise, may Allah be pleased with them, he said: "The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, came to visit me during the Farewell Pilgrimage because of a severe pain that had afflicted me. I said: 'O Messenger of Allah, my pain has reached the extent you see, and I have wealth and only one daughter will inherit me. Should I give two-thirds of my wealth in charity?' He said: 'No.' I said: 'Then half, O Messenger of Allah?' He said: 'No.' I said: 'Then one-third, O Messenger of Allah?' He said: 'One-third, and one-third is a lot (or a great deal). It is better for you to leave your heirs rich than to leave them dependent on people. And you will not spend any spending seeking the Face of Allah except that you will be rewarded for it, even the bite you put in your wife's mouth.' He said: Then I said: 'O Messenger of Allah, should I be left behind my companions?' He said: 'You will not be left behind and do a deed seeking the Face of Allah except that you will increase in rank and elevation by it. And it may be that you will be left behind so that some people will benefit from you and others will be harmed by you.' May Allah fulfill the migration of my companions, and do not turn them back on their heels, but the wretched Sa'd bin Khawlah." The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, felt sorry for him that he died in Mecca. (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah Abdur-Rahman bin Sakhr (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "Indeed, Allah does not look at your bodies, nor at your forms, but He looks at your hearts and your deeds." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Musa Abdullah bin Qais Al-Ash'ari, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, was asked about a man who fights out of bravery, and fights out of partisanship, and fights out of showing off, which of these is in the cause of Allah? The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever fights so that Allah's word is uppermost, then he is in the cause of Allah." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Bakrah, Nafi' bin Al-Harith Al-Thaqafi (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "When two Muslims meet with their swords, the killer and the killed are in the Fire." I said: "O Messenger of Allah, this is the killer, but what about the killed?" He said: "He was eager to kill his companion." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "A man's prayer in congregation is twenty-odd degrees greater than his prayer in the marketplace and his home. That is because if one of you performs ablution and does it well, then comes to the mosque, desiring only prayer, and nothing prompts him but prayer, he does not take a step except that he is raised a degree for it, and a sin is forgiven for it, until he enters the mosque. When he enters the mosque, he is in prayer as long as prayer detains him, and the angels pray for one of you as long as he remains in the place where he prayed, provided he does not break his ablution." (Agreed upon, and this is the wording of Muslim.) And his saying, peace and blessings be upon him, "yinhizuhu" (he is prompted) is with a Fatha on the Ya and Ha and with a Zai: meaning it brings him out and moves him. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It is narrated from Abu Al-Abbas Abdullah bin Abbas bin Abdul Muttalib, may Allah be pleased with them both, from the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, in what he narrates from his Lord, the Blessed and Most High, that he said: "Allah has written good deeds and bad deeds, and then explained that: whoever intends to do a good deed and does not do it, Allah, the Blessed and Most High, writes it down with Him as a complete good deed. If he intends to do it and does it, Allah writes it down for him as ten good deeds, up to seven hundred fold, or many more. If he intends to do a bad deed and does not do it, Allah writes it down with Him as a complete good deed. If he intends to do it and does it, Allah writes it down as one bad deed." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It is narrated from Abu Abdur Rahman Abdullah bin Umar bin Al-Khattab, may Allah be pleased with them both, that he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: Three men from before you set out until the night forced them to take shelter in a cave. They entered it, and a rock fell from the mountain, blocking the entrance to the cave. They said: Nothing can save you from this rock except that you invoke Allah with your righteous deeds. One of them said: O Allah, I had two aged parents, and I never gave food to anyone before them, nor to my family or wealth. One day, I was driven away by seeking trees, and I did not return to them until they slept. I milked their evening portion for them, and I found them sleeping. I disliked waking them up, and giving food to anyone before them, nor to my family or wealth. So I stayed - and the cup was in my hand - waiting for them to wake up until dawn broke, and the children were crying at my feet. They woke up and drank their evening portion. O Allah, if I did that seeking Your Face, then relieve us of what we are in because of this rock. So it moved a little, but they could not get out. The second said: O Allah, I had a cousin, who was the most beloved person to me. In one narration: I loved her as much as men love women. I wanted her to submit to me, but she refused until a year of hardship befell her. She came to me, and I gave her one hundred and twenty dinars on the condition that she submit to me. She did, until when I was able to reach her... In one narration: When I sat between her legs, she said: Fear Allah, and do not break the seal except by its right. So I turned away from her, though she was the most beloved person to me, and I left the gold that I had given her. O Allah, if I did that seeking Your Face, then relieve us of what we are in. So the rock moved, but they could still not get out. The third said: O Allah, I hired laborers and gave them their wages, except for one man who left his due and went away. His wages grew until a lot of wealth was amassed from it. After a while, he came to me and said: O Abdullah, give me my wages. I said: All that you see of your wages: the camels, the cattle, the sheep, and the slaves. He said: O Abdullah, do not mock me! I said: I do not mock you. He took it all and drove it away, leaving nothing of it. O Allah, if I did that seeking Your Face, then relieve us of what we are in. So the rock moved, and they went out walking. (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him, say: "By Allah, I ask for Allah's forgiveness and turn to Him in repentance more than seventy times a day." (Narrated by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Al-Agharr bin Yasar Al-Muzani (may Allah be pleased with him) it is reported that the Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) said: "O people, turn to Allah and seek His forgiveness, for I turn to Allah and seek His forgiveness one hundred times a day." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hamza Anas bin Malik Al-Ansari, the servant of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him), may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "Allah is more delighted with the repentance of His servant than one of you is with his camel, which he lost in a desolate land." (Agreed upon). In a narration by Muslim: Allah is more delighted with the repentance of His servant when he repents to Him than one of you who was on his mount in a desolate land, and it escaped from him with his food and drink on it, and he despaired of it. So he went to a tree and lay down in its shade, having despaired of his mount. While he was thus, he saw it standing by him. So he took its reins and said, out of intense joy: "O Allah, you are my servant and I am your Lord." He made a mistake out of intense joy. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It is narrated from Abu Musa Abdullah bin Qais Al-Ash'ari, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, peace be upon him, that he said: "Indeed, Allah the Almighty extends His Hand at night to accept the repentance of the one who has sinned during the day, and He extends His Hand during the day to accept the repentance of the one who has sinned during the night, until the sun rises from the west." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever repents before the sun rises from the west, Allah will accept his repentance." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Abd al-Rahman Abdullah bin Umar bin al-Khattab, may Allah be pleased with them both, from the Prophet, may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him, he said: "Indeed, Allah the Mighty and Majestic accepts the repentance of the servant as long as he is not at the point of death." (Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and he said: A hasan hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Zur bin Hubaish, he said: I came to Safwan bin Assal, may Allah be pleased with him, to ask him about wiping over the two socks. He said: What brings you, O Zur? I said: Seeking knowledge. He said: The angels spread their wings for the seeker of knowledge, pleased with what he seeks. I said: From the companions of the Prophet, peace be upon him, I came to ask you: Did you hear him mention anything about that? He said: Yes, he used to order us, if we were traveling - or on a journey - not to remove our socks for three days and nights, except for impurity, but from passing urine, feces, and sleep. I said: Traveling. So while we were with him, an Arab called out to him in a loud voice: O Muhammad. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, answered him in a voice almost like his: "Here I am." I said to him: Woe to you, lower your voice, for you are with the Prophet, peace be upon him, and you have been forbidden to do this! He said: By Allah, I will not lower it. The Arab said: A man loves a people and has not yet joined them? The Prophet, peace be upon him, said: "A man will be with those he loves on the Day of Resurrection." And he kept talking to us until he mentioned a gate in the west, the width of which a rider would travel in forty or seventy years. Sufyan said, one of the narrators, before Al-Sham: Allah the Almighty created it the day He created the heavens and the earth, open for repentance, and it will not be closed until the sun rises from it. (Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and others, and he said: A hasan sahih hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It is narrated from Abu Sa'id Sa'd bin Malik bin Sinan Al-Khudri (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "There was a man among those who came before you who killed ninety-nine people. He asked about the most knowledgeable person on earth, and he was directed to a monk. He went to him and said, 'I have killed ninety-nine people. Is there any repentance for me?' The monk said, 'No.' So he killed him, thus completing one hundred. Then he asked about the most knowledgeable person on earth, and he was directed to a scholar. He said, 'I have killed one hundred people. Is there any repentance for me?' The scholar said, 'Yes. Who can stand between him and repentance? Go to such and such a land, for there are people there who worship Allah the Almighty. So worship Allah with them, and do not return to your land, for it is an evil land.' He set off, and when he was halfway, death came to him. The angels of mercy and the angels of punishment disputed over him. The angels of mercy said, 'He came as a penitent, turning his heart to Allah the Almighty.' The angels of punishment said, 'He has done no good deeds at all.' Then an angel in the form of a human came to them, and they made him an arbitrator between them. He said, 'Measure the distance between the two lands. Whichever he is closer to, he belongs to them.' They measured and found him closer to the land he intended, so the angels of mercy took him." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abdullah bin Ka'b bin Malik, who was the guide of Ka'b, may Allah be pleased with him, from his sons when he went blind, he said: I heard Ka'b bin Malik, may Allah be pleased with him, narrating his story when he lagged behind the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, in the expedition of Tabuk. Ka'b said: I never lagged behind the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, in any expedition he undertook except for the expedition of Tabuk. However, I did lag behind in the expedition of Badr, and no one was censured for lagging behind him. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, and the Muslims went out only for the caravan of Quraysh, until Allah the Almighty gathered them and their enemy without a prior appointment. And I witnessed with the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, the night of Al-Aqabah when we pledged allegiance to Islam, and I would not prefer to have witnessed Badr for it, even though Badr is more remembered by people than it. And the story of me lagging behind the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, in the expedition of Tabuk is that I was never stronger or more affluent than when I lagged behind him in that expedition. By Allah, I never gathered two riding beasts before it until I gathered them in that expedition. And the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, would not intend an expedition without showing otherwise, until that expedition. So the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, went on that expedition in intense heat, and faced a long journey and a vast desert, and faced a large number of enemies. So he made clear to the Muslims their situation so they could prepare for their expedition, and he informed them of the direction he intended. And the Muslims with the Messenger of Allah were many, and they were not gathered in a حافظ book (meaning, the Diwan). Ka'b said: So any man who wanted to stay behind would think that he would be hidden unless a revelation from Allah descended about him. And the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, went on that expedition when the fruits and the shade were pleasant. And I desired it. So the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, and the Muslims with him prepared, and I used to go out to prepare with him, and I would return without accomplishing anything, and say to myself: I am capable of that if I wish. So it continued to delay me until the seriousness of the matter intensified among the people. And the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, set out in the morning, and the Muslims with him, and I had not accomplished anything of my preparations. Then I went out and returned without accomplishing anything. So it continued to delay me until they hastened and the departure was missed. So I thought of setting out to catch up with them, and I wish I had done so, but it was not destined for me. So, when I went out among the people after the departure of the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, I felt saddened that I saw an example for me, except for a man who was openly known for his hypocrisy, or a man whom Allah the Almighty had excused from the weak, and the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, did not mention me until he reached Tabuk. And he said while sitting in the midst of the people in Tabuk: What happened to Ka'b bin Malik? A man from Banu Salima said: O Messenger of Allah, his two cloaks and his gaze at his sides detained him. So Mu'adh bin Jabal, may Allah be pleased with him, said to him: What a terrible thing you said! By Allah, O Messenger of Allah, we know nothing but good about him. So the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, remained silent. While he was in that state, he saw a man dressed in white being distorted by the heat haze. So the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: Be Abu Khaythama. And it was Abu Khaythama Al-Ansari, and he was the one who gave away a sa' of dates when the hypocrites taunted him. Ka'b said: When I learned that the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, had set out on his return journey from Tabuk, my anxiety overwhelmed me. So I began to think of lies and say: With what can I escape his displeasure tomorrow? And I sought the help of every wise person among my family for this. When it was said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, is about to arrive, falsehood was dispelled from me until I knew that I would never escape him with anything. So I resolved to tell the truth. And the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, arrived in the morning. And when he returned from a journey, he began with the Masjid and prayed two rak'ahs in it, then he sat down for the people. When he did that, the absentees came to him, making excuses to him and swearing allegiance to him. They were more than eighty men, so he accepted their outward excuses and pledged allegiance to them and sought forgiveness for them and entrusted their inner secrets to Allah the Almighty, until I came. When I greeted him, he smiled a smile of displeasure, then said: Come. So I walked until I sat before him, and he said to me: What made you lag behind? Did you not buy your mount? I said: O Messenger of Allah, by Allah, if I had sat with anyone else from the people of this world, I would have thought that I would escape his displeasure with an excuse. I have been given eloquence, but by Allah, I know that if I tell you a lie today that pleases you, Allah may soon displease you with me. And if I tell you the truth, you may be displeased with me, and I hope for the consequence of Allah the Almighty. By Allah, I had no excuse. By Allah, I was never stronger or more affluent than when I lagged behind you. He said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: As for this one, he has told the truth. Stand up until Allah judges you. And some men from Banu Salima walked and followed me, and they said to me: By Allah, we do not know of you having committed any sin before this. You were unable to offer an excuse to the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, like the absentees did. The Messenger of Allah's seeking forgiveness for you would have been enough for your sin. He said: By Allah, they continued to blame me until I wanted to return to the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, and deny myself. Then I said to them: Did anyone else face this with me? They said: Yes, two men faced it with you. They said what you said, and it was said to them what was said to you. I said: Who are they? They said: Mararah bin Ar-Rabi' Al-Amri, and Hilal bin Umayyah Al-Waqifi. He said: And they mentioned to me two righteous men who had witnessed Badr, and there was an example for me in them. He said: So I proceeded when they mentioned them to me. And the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, forbade speaking to us, the three of us, among those who lagged behind him. He said: So the people avoided us, or he said: They changed towards us, until I became unfamiliar with the land itself, and it was not the land I knew. And we remained in that state for fifty nights. As for my two companions, they succumbed and sat in their homes weeping. As for me, I was the strongest and most robust of the people. So I used to go out and attend prayers with the Muslims, and walk in the markets, and no one spoke to me. And I would go to the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, and greet him, and he was in his assembly after prayer, and I would say to myself: Did he move his lips to return the greeting? Then I would pray near him and steal glances at him. When I turned to my prayer, he would look at me. And when I turned to him, he would turn away from me. Until that long period of the Muslims' estrangement became too much for me, so I walked until I climbed the wall of Abu Qatadah's garden, and he was my cousin and the dearest person to me. So I greeted him, and by Allah, he did not return my greeting. So I said to him: O Abu Qatadah, I implore you by Allah, do you know that I love Allah and His Messenger, peace be upon him? He remained silent. I repeated and implored him, and he remained silent. I repeated and implored him, and he said: Allah and His Messenger know best. Then my eyes welled up, and I turned away until I climbed the wall. While I was walking in the market of Medina, a Nabatite from the Nabatites of Sham, who had come with provisions to sell in Medina, said: Who can guide me to Ka'b bin Malik? So the people began to point him to me until he came to me and handed me a letter from the King of Ghassan, and I was a scribe. I read it, and it said: To proceed, it has reached us that your companion has been estranged from you, and Allah has not placed you in a place of disgrace or neglect. So come to us, we will support you. When I read it, I said: And this is also from the trial. So I put it in the oven and burned it. And when forty of the fifty nights had passed, and the revelation was delayed, a messenger from the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, came to me, and he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, orders you to separate from your wife. I said: Shall I divorce her, or what shall I do? He said: No, rather separate from her, and do not approach her. And he sent a similar message to my companions. So I said to my wife: Go to your family and stay with them until Allah decides this matter. Then the wife of Hilal bin Umayyah came as a messenger to the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, and said to him: O Messenger of Allah, Hilal bin Umayyah is an old man who is helpless and has no servant. Would you dislike me to serve him? He said: No, but do not approach him. She said: By Allah, he has no desire for anything, and by Allah, he has been weeping since what happened to him until this day. So some of my family said to me: Would you ask permission from the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, regarding your wife? He has permitted the wife of Hilal bin Umayyah to serve him. I said: I will not ask permission from the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, regarding her. And how do I know what the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, would say if I asked him permission regarding her, and I am a young man? So I remained in that state for ten nights, so our fifty nights were completed since they forbade speaking to us. Then I prayed the dawn prayer on the morning of the fiftieth night on the roof of one of our houses. While I was sitting in the state that Allah the Almighty mentioned about us, my soul was constricted and the earth was vast as it was, I heard the voice of a caller atop the mountain of As-Sel' saying at the top of his voice: O Ka'b bin Malik, rejoice! So I fell down in prostration, and I knew that relief had come. So the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, announced to the people Allah the Almighty's acceptance of our repentance when he prayed the dawn prayer. So the people went to congratulate us, and those who congratulated us went before my companions. And a man spurred his horse and a runner from Aslam went before me and ascended the mountain. The voice was faster than the horse. When the one whose voice I heard came to me with good news, I took off my two garments and gave them to him for his good news. By Allah, I owned nothing else that day. And I borrowed two garments and wore them, and went to the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him. People met me in groups, congratulating me on my repentance and saying to me: May Allah's repentance upon you be blessed. Until I entered the Masjid and found the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, sitting, surrounded by people. So Talhah bin Ubaydullah, may Allah be pleased with him, stood up running until he shook my hand and congratulated me. By Allah, no one from the Muhajirun stood up except him. So Ka'b never forgot that from Talhah. Ka'b said: When I greeted the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, he said, his face beaming with joy: Rejoice in the best day that has passed over you since your mother gave birth to you. I said: Is it from you, O Messenger of Allah, or from Allah? He said: No, but from Allah the Almighty. And when the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, was pleased, his face would shine as if his face were a piece of the moon, and we would know that from him. When I sat before him, I said: O Messenger of Allah, from my repentance is that I give away all my wealth in charity to Allah and His Messenger. So the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: Keep some of your wealth for yourself, for it is better for you. So I said: I will keep my share in Khaybar. And I said: O Messenger of Allah, Allah the Almighty only saved me through truthfulness, and from my repentance is that I will speak nothing but the truth as long as I live. By Allah, I do not know of anyone among the Muslims whom Allah has tested with truthfulness since I mentioned that to the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, better than how Allah the Almighty has tested me. By Allah, I have not intended a lie since I said that to the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, until this day, and I hope that Allah the Almighty will protect me in what remains. He said: So Allah the Almighty revealed: {Allah has turned in forgiveness to the Prophet and to the Emigrants and the Helpers who followed him in the hour of hardship} until he reached: {He is to them Most Merciful, Benevolent. And to the three who were left behind until, when the earth constrained them despite its capacity} until he reached: {Fear Allah and be with the truthful.} (At-Tawbah 117, 119). Ka'b said: By Allah, Allah the Almighty has not bestowed upon me any greater blessing after He guided me to Islam than my telling the truth to the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, and not lying to him, so that I would not perish as those who lied perished. Allah the Almighty said to those who lied when the revelation descended, the worst He said to anyone, and Allah the Almighty said: {They will swear by Allah to you when you return to them that you might turn away from them. So turn away from them. Indeed, they are defilement, and their refuge is Hell - recompense for what they had earned. They will swear to you so that you may be pleased with them. But if you are pleased with them, then Allah is not pleased with the defiantly disobedient people.} (At-Tawbah 95, 96). Ka'b said: We, the three of us, were left behind from the command of those whose excuses the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, accepted when they swore allegiance to him, so he pledged allegiance to them and sought forgiveness for them. And the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, delayed our matter until Allah the Almighty decreed concerning it. Allah the Almighty said: {And to the three who were left behind.} And what is mentioned is not that we lagged behind in the raid, but rather it is His leaving us behind and delaying our matter from those who swore allegiance to Him and offered excuses to Him, and He accepted from them. Agreed upon. And in one narration: "That the Prophet, peace be upon him, went out on the expedition of Tabuk on Thursday, and he liked to go out on Thursday." And in another narration: "And he would not return from a journey except during the day at forenoon. So when he returned, he began with the Masjid and prayed two rak'ahs in it, then sat in it." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Nujayd - with a dammah on the noon and a fatha on the jeem - Imran bin Husayn al-Khuza'i, may Allah be pleased with them both, that a woman from Juhaynah came to the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, while she was pregnant from adultery. She said: "O Messenger of Allah, I have committed a Hadd, so implement it upon me." The Prophet of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, called her guardian and said: "Treat her well, and when she gives birth, come to me." So he did. The Prophet of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, ordered that her clothes be tied securely upon her, then he ordered that she be stoned to death. Then he, and his family and companions, prayed over her. Umar said to him: "Do you pray over her, O Messenger of Allah, when she has committed adultery?" He said: "She has repented a repentance that if it were divided among seventy people of the people of Medina, it would suffice them. And has she found anything better than that she offered herself to Allah, the Mighty and Majestic?" (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "If the son of Adam had a valley of gold, he would wish for two valleys, and nothing but dust will fill his mouth, and Allah accepts the repentance of those who repent." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (may Allah bless him and grant him peace) said: "Allah (Glorified and Exalted is He) laughs at two men, one of whom kills the other, and both of them enter Paradise. This one fights in the cause of Allah and is killed. Then Allah forgives the killer, and he becomes a Muslim and is martyred." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of Abu Malik Al-Harith bin Asim Al-Ash'ari (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Purity is half of faith. 'Al-hamdu lillah' (Praise be to Allah) fills the scales. 'Subhan Allah wa 'l-hamdu lillah' (Glory be to Allah and praise be to Allah) fill - or fill up - what is between the heavens and the earth. Prayer is a light, charity is proof, patience is illumination, and the Qur'an is an argument for you or against you. All people start their day as merchants of their souls, either freeing them or destroying them." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Sa'eed Sa'd bin Malik bin Sinan Al-Khudri, may Allah be pleased with them both, that some people from the Ansar asked the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) for something, and he gave it to them. Then they asked him again, and he gave it to them, until he had nothing left. When he had spent everything with his own hands, he said to them: "Whatever good I have, I will not withhold from you. Whoever seeks to be chaste, Allah will make him chaste. Whoever seeks to be self-sufficient, Allah will make him self-sufficient. Whoever seeks patience, Allah will make him patient. No one has been given a gift better and more abundant than patience." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Yahya Suhayb bin Sinan, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "How wondrous is the affair of the believer! All of his affair is good for him, and this is not for anyone except the believer. If he is pleased, he is grateful, and it is good for him. If he is harmed, he is patient, and it is good for him." (Reported by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: When the Prophet (peace be upon him) became gravely ill, he was overcome with anguish. Fatimah (may Allah be pleased with her) said: "Oh, my father's distress!" He said: "My father will have no distress after today." When he passed away, she said: "My father, he has answered the call of his Lord. My father, the Garden of Paradise is his abode. My father, we announce his departure to Gabriel." When he was buried, Fatimah (may Allah be pleased with her) said: "Did your hearts allow you to cast dust upon the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him)?" (Reported by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of Usamah bin Zayd bin Harithah, the freed slave of the Messenger of Allah (may Allah bless him and grant him peace) and his beloved and son of his beloved (may Allah be pleased with them both), he said: The daughter of the Prophet (may Allah bless him and grant him peace) sent word, saying: "My son is dying, so be present." So he sent a message conveying his greetings and saying: "To Allah belongs what He takes and to Him belongs what He gives, and everything with Him has a fixed term. So let her be patient and hope for reward." She sent back to him, adjuring him by Allah to come to her. So he stood up, and with him were Sa'd bin Ubadah, Mu'adh bin Jabal, Ubayy bin Ka'b, and Zayd bin Thabit, and some men (may Allah be pleased with them). The child was brought to the Messenger of Allah (may Allah bless him and grant him peace), and he placed him in his lap. His breath was rattling in his chest. His eyes welled up with tears. So Sa'd said: "O Messenger of Allah, what is this?" He said: "This is mercy which Allah the Almighty has placed in the hearts of His servants." And in another narration: "In the hearts of whomever He wills of His servants. Indeed, Allah has mercy on those of His servants who are merciful." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Suhayb (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "There was a king among those before you, and he had a sorcerer. When the sorcerer grew old, he said to the king: 'I have grown old, so send me a boy so I can teach him magic.' So a boy was sent to him to teach him. As he was on his way, he passed by a monk, and he sat with him and heard his words, which pleased him. When he came to the sorcerer, he passed by the monk and sat with him. When he came to the sorcerer, he would strike him. He complained about this to the monk, who said: 'If you fear the sorcerer, say: My family has imprisoned me. And if you fear your family, say: The sorcerer has imprisoned me.' While he was doing this, he came across a great beast that was blocking the people. He said: 'Today I will know which is better, the sorcerer's way or the monk's way?' He took a stone and said: 'O Allah, if the monk's way is more beloved to You than the sorcerer's way, then kill this beast so that the people may pass.' He threw it, killed it, and the people passed. He went to the monk and told him. The monk said to him: 'My son, you are better than me today. Your affair has reached what I see, and you will be tested. If you are tested, do not betray me.' And the boy used to heal the blind and the leper, and treat people from all ailments. A companion of the king, who had become blind, heard about him. He came to him with many gifts and said: 'All of this is for you if you heal me.' He said: 'I do not heal anyone; only Allah Almighty heals. If you believe in Allah, I will pray to Allah, and He will heal you.' So he believed in Allah Almighty, and Allah Almighty healed him. He went to the king and sat with him as he used to sit. The king said to him: 'Who restored your sight?' He said: 'My Lord.' The king said: 'Do you have a Lord other than me?' (He said: 'My Lord and your Lord is Allah.') So he took him and kept torturing him until he revealed the boy. The boy was brought, and the king said to him: 'My son, your magic has reached such a level that you heal the blind and the leper, and you do such and such.' He said: 'I do not heal anyone; only Allah Almighty heals.' So he took him and kept torturing him until he revealed the monk. The monk was brought, and it was said to him: 'Renounce your religion.' He refused. So a saw was brought, and it was placed on the parting of his head and sawed until his two halves fell apart. Then the king's companion was brought, and it was said to him: 'Renounce your religion.' He refused. So a saw was placed on the parting of his head and sawed until his two halves fell apart. Then the boy was brought, and it was said to him: 'Renounce your religion.' He refused. So he handed him over to some of his companions and said: 'Go with him to such and such a mountain, and ascend the mountain with him.' He said: 'O Allah, suffice me from them in whatever way You wish.' The mountain shook with them, and they fell. And he came walking to the king. The king said to him: 'What happened to your companions?' He said: 'Allah Almighty sufficed me from them.' So he handed him over to some of his companions and said: 'Go with him, carry him in a boat, and take him to the middle of the sea. If he renounces his religion, fine; otherwise, throw him overboard.' They went with him. He said: 'O Allah, suffice me from them in whatever way You wish.' The boat capsized with them, and they drowned. And he came walking to the king. The king said to him: 'What happened to your companions?' He said: 'Allah Almighty sufficed me from them.' The king said: 'You will not be able to kill me unless you do what I command you.' He said: 'What is it?' He said: 'Gather the people in a single open space, and crucify me on a trunk. Then take an arrow from my quiver, then place the arrow in the notch of the bow, then say: In the name of Allah, the Lord of the boy, then shoot me. If you do that, you will kill me.' So he gathered the people in a single open space and crucified him on a trunk. Then he took an arrow from his quiver, then placed the arrow in the notch of the bow, then said: 'In the name of Allah, the Lord of the boy,' then he shot him. The arrow struck his temple. He placed his hand on his temple and died. The people said: 'We believe in the Lord of the boy.' The king came, and it was said to him: 'Do you see what you were afraid of? By Allah, your fear has come upon you. The people have believed.' So he ordered ditches to be dug at the entrances of the streets, and fire was kindled in them. And he said: 'Whoever does not renounce his religion, throw him into it,' or it was said to him: 'Jump into it.' So they did, until a woman came with her child. She hesitated to fall into it. The boy said to her: 'O mother, be patient, for you are upon the truth.'" (Reported by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that the Prophet (peace be upon him) passed by a woman weeping by a grave. He said: "Fear Allah and be patient." She said: "Go away from me, for you have not been afflicted with my affliction." (She did not recognize him. It was said to her: "This is the Prophet, peace be upon him.") So she went to the Prophet's door, but found no doorkeepers with him. She said: "I did not recognize you." He said: "Patience is only at the first shock." (Agreed upon.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Allah the Almighty says: I have no reward for My believing servant with Me, if I take away his beloved from the people of this world and he remains patient, except Paradise." (Narrated by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, that she asked the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, about the plague. He informed her that it was a torment that Allah Almighty sends upon whom He wills, and Allah Almighty made it a mercy for the believers. So, there is no servant who is struck by the plague and remains in his land, patient and seeking reward, knowing that nothing will befall him except what Allah has decreed for him, but he will have the reward of a martyr. (Reported by Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that he heard the Messenger of Allah (may Allah bless him and grant him peace) say: "Allah, the Almighty, said: 'When I afflict my servant with the loss of his two beloved ones, and he endures it patiently, I will compensate him with Paradise.'" (Narrated by Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ata bin Abi Rabah, he said: Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them, said to me: "Shall I show you a woman from the people of Paradise?" I said: "Yes." He said: "This black woman came to the Prophet, peace be upon him, and said: 'I suffer from epilepsy, and I become uncovered. So, pray to Allah Almighty for me.'" He said: "If you wish, you can be patient and Paradise is yours, and if you wish, I will pray to Allah Almighty to heal you." She said: "I will be patient." She said: "I become uncovered, so pray to Allah that I do not become uncovered." So, he prayed for her. (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Abd al-Rahman Abdullah ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: It is as if I am looking at the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, recounting one of the prophets, prayers and peace of Allah be upon them, whom his people struck until they made him bleed, and he was wiping the blood from his face, saying: "O Allah, forgive my people, for they do not know." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Sa'eed and Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with them, from the Prophet, peace be upon him, he said: "No Muslim is afflicted with fatigue, nor with illness, nor with worry, nor with grief, nor with harm, nor with distress, even to the prick of a thorn, but that Allah expiates some of his sins because of it." (Agreed upon) 'And al-wasab' means: illness. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: I entered upon the Prophet, peace be upon him, and he was feverish. I said: O Messenger of Allah, you are feverish with a severe fever. He said: "Yes, I suffer from fever as two men among you suffer from fever." I said: Is that because you have two rewards? He said: "Yes, that is so. There is no Muslim who is afflicted with harm, even a thorn, or more, but Allah will atone for his sins because of it, and his sins will be shed like the tree sheds its leaves." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "He whom Allah intends good for, He afflicts him." (Narrated by Al-Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported that the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) said: "None of you should wish for death due to some affliction that has befallen him. If he must do so, then let him say: 'O Allah, keep me alive as long as life is better for me, and cause me to die when death is better for me.'" (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Abdullah Khabbab bin Al-Aratt (may Allah be pleased with him) that he said: "We complained to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) while he was leaning on his cloak in the shade of the Ka'bah. We said: 'Will you not ask Allah to help us? Will you not supplicate to Allah for us?' He said: 'Among those who came before you, a man would be taken and a pit dug for him, and he would be placed in it. Then a saw would be brought and placed on his head, and he would be sawn in half. Combs of iron would be used to comb his flesh and bones. None of this would turn him away from his religion. By Allah, Allah will complete this matter until a rider travels from San'a' to Hadramaut, fearing none but Allah and the wolf for his sheep. But you are impatient.'" (Reported by Al-Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) that he said: "On the day of Hunayn, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) favored some people in the distribution [of spoils]. He gave Al-Aqra' bin Habis one hundred camels, and he gave 'Uyainah bin Hisn the same, and he gave some of the nobles of the Arabs and favored them on that day in the distribution. Then a man said: 'By Allah, this is a distribution in which there is no justice, and the face of Allah is not sought in it.' So I said: 'By Allah, I will inform the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him).' So I came to him and informed him of what he had said. His face changed until it was like saffron. Then he said: 'So who will be just if Allah and His Messenger are not just?' Then he said: 'May Allah have mercy on Moses. He was harmed more than this and he was patient.' So I said: 'Indeed, I will never mention anything to him again after this.'" (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "When Allah intends good for His slave, He hastens his punishment in this world, and when Allah intends evil for His slave, He withholds his sin from him until he meets Him on the Day of Resurrection." And the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "The greater the reward, the greater the trial. When Allah loves a people, He afflicts them. So, whoever is pleased, there is pleasure for him, and whoever is displeased, there is displeasure for him." (Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and said to be Hasan). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that the son of Abu Talha (may Allah be pleased with him) was ill. Abu Talha went out, and the child passed away. When Abu Talha returned, he asked, "How is my son?" Umm Sulaim, the mother of the child, replied, "He is calmer than he has ever been." She then brought him his evening meal, and he ate. Afterward, he had intercourse with her. When he had finished, she said, "Bury the child."

The next morning, Abu Talha went to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and informed him. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) asked, "Did you have intercourse last night?" He replied, "Yes." The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said, "O Allah, bless them both." They were blessed with a son. Abu Talha said to me, "Carry him until you take him to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him)." He sent some dates with me. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) asked, "Does he have anything with him?" I replied, "Yes, some dates." The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) took the dates, chewed them, and then took them from his mouth and placed them in the child's mouth. He then rubbed his palate with them and named him Abdullah. (Agreed upon)

In a narration by Muslim: The son of Abu Talha, son of Umm Sulaim, died. She said to her family, "Do not tell Abu Talha about his son until I tell him." He came, and she brought him his evening meal, and he ate and drank. Then she made herself attractive to him as she had never done before. He then had intercourse with her. When she saw that he had had his fill and had intercourse with her, she said, "O Abu Talha, tell me, if some people lent a family their borrowed item, and then asked for it back, would they be allowed to refuse them?" He said, "No." She said, "Then consider your son as a gift." He said, "I was left until I was defiled, then you told me about my son?!" He went to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and told him what had happened. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said, "May Allah bless your night." He said, "Then she became pregnant."

He said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was on a journey, and she was with him. When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) approached the city from a journey, he did not approach it by night. As they neared the city, labor pains struck her. Abu Talha stayed behind with her, and the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) went on. Abu Talha said, "O Lord, you know that I like to go out with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) when he goes out, and to come in with him when he comes in. I have been detained by what you see." Umm Sulaim said, "O Abu Talha, I do not feel what I was feeling. Go on." So they went on, and labor pains struck her when they arrived, and she gave birth to a boy.

My mother said to me, "O Anas, let no one nurse him until you take him to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) in the morning." So when it was morning, I carried him and took him to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him).
The rest of the hadith is mentioned. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The strong is not the one who can overpower others, but the strong is the one who controls himself when he is angry." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Sulaiman bin Sard (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that he was sitting with the Prophet (peace be upon him) when two men were exchanging insults. One of them had a red face and his jugular veins were swollen. The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "I know a word that, if he were to say it, whatever he is feeling would disappear. If he were to say: 'I seek refuge in Allah from the accursed Satan,' whatever he is feeling would disappear." So, it was said to him: "Indeed, the Prophet (peace be upon him) said: 'Seek refuge in Allah from the accursed Satan.'" (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of Mu'adh bin Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever suppresses his anger, while being able to act upon it, Allah will call him on the Day of Resurrection before all creatures and let him choose from the wide-eyed houris whatever he wishes." (Reported by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said it is a hasan hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) that a man said to the Prophet (peace be upon him): "Advise me." He said: "Do not get angry." He repeated it several times. He said: "Do not get angry." Narrated by Al-Bukhari. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Narrated Abu Hurairah: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "The believer, male or female, is continually tested in his soul, his children, and his wealth, until he meets Allah, the Almighty, with no sins resting upon him." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, he said: Uyaynah ibn Hisn arrived and stayed with his nephew Al-Hurr ibn Qays. He was among those whom Umar, may Allah be pleased with him, kept close. The reciters, whether old or young, were among the companions of Umar's council and his advisors. So Uyaynah said to his nephew: "My nephew, you have influence with this commander. Ask permission for me to see him." So he asked, and Umar granted permission. When he entered, he said: "Hi, son of Al-Khattab! By Allah, you do not give us much, nor do you judge us with justice." Umar, may Allah be pleased with him, became angry to the point that he intended to strike him. Al-Hurr said to him: "O Commander of the Faithful, indeed Allah Almighty said to his Prophet, peace be upon him: '{Take to forgiveness, and enjoin good, and turn away from the ignorant}' (Al-A'raf: 199). And indeed, this one is among the ignorant." By Allah, Umar did not exceed it when he recited it, and he was one who stopped at the Book of Allah Almighty. (Narrated by Al-Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Indeed, after me there will be preferring others and matters that you will dislike!" They said: "O Messenger of Allah, what do you command us?" He said: "You fulfill the right that is due from you, and you ask Allah for what is due to you." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Yahya Usayd bin Hudayr (may Allah be pleased with him) that a man from the Ansar said: "O Messenger of Allah, will you not appoint me to a position as you appointed so-and-so?" He said: "Indeed, after me, you will face selfishness, so be patient until you meet me at the Fountain." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Ibrahim Abdullah bin Abi Awfa, may Allah be pleased with them both, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, on one of his days when he met the enemy, waited until the sun declined. Then he stood among them and said: "O people, do not wish to meet the enemy, and ask Allah for well-being. When you meet them, be patient, and know that Paradise is under the shade of swords." Then the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "O Allah, Revealer of the Book, Disperser of the clouds, Defeater of the confederates, defeat them and grant us victory over them." (Agreed upon) And with Allah is success. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

The first is from Ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, who said: "Verily, truth leads to righteousness, and righteousness leads to Paradise. A man may speak the truth until he is recorded with Allah as truthful. And verily, falsehood leads to wickedness, and wickedness leads to the Hellfire. A man may lie until he is recorded with Allah as a liar." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Second: From Abu Muhammad Al-Hasan bin Ali bin Abi Talib, may Allah be pleased with them both, he said: I memorized from the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him: "Leave what makes you doubt for what does not make you doubt, for truthfulness is reassurance, and lying is doubt." (Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi, who said it is a hasan sahih hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Third: From Abu Sufyan Sakhr bin Harb, may Allah be pleased with him, in his long hadith concerning the story of Heraclius, Heraclius said: "What does he command you - meaning the Prophet, peace be upon him?" Abu Sufyan said: "I said: 'He commands us to worship Allah alone and associate nothing with Him, and to abandon what our fathers said. He commands us to pray, to be truthful, to be chaste, and to maintain ties of kinship.'" (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Fourth: From Abu Thabit, and it was said Abu Saeed, and it was said Abu Al-Walid, Sahl bin Hunaif, who was a participant in Badr, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever asks Allah, the Almighty, for martyrdom with sincerity, Allah will cause him to attain the ranks of the martyrs, even if he dies in his bed." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Fifth: From Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "A prophet from among the prophets, may the prayers and peace of Allah be upon them, went to war and said to his people: No man who has consummated a marriage with a woman should follow me, while he still wishes to consummate the marriage with her and has not yet done so. Nor should anyone who has built houses whose roofs have not yet been raised. Nor should anyone who has bought sheep or pregnant camels awaiting their offspring. He went to war and approached the village at the time of the `Asr prayer, or close to it. He said to the sun: 'You are commanded, and I am commanded. O Allah, hold her back for us.' So she was held back until Allah granted him victory. He gathered the spoils of war. Fire came to consume them, but it did not consume them. He said: 'Among you is treachery.' So let one man from each tribe pledge allegiance to me. The hand of a man stuck to his hand. He said: 'Among you is treachery. Let your tribe pledge allegiance to me.' The hands of two or three men stuck to his hand. He said: 'Among you is treachery.' So they brought a head of gold like the head of a cow, and placed it. Fire came and consumed it. Spoils were not permissible for anyone before us. Then Allah made them permissible for us when He saw our weakness and inability, so He made them permissible for us." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

The sixth: From Abu Khalid Hakim bin Hizam, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "The two sellers have the choice as long as they do not separate. If they tell the truth and clarify, their transaction will be blessed. If they hide and lie, the blessing of their transaction will be diminished." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

As for the Hadith, the first is from Umar ibn al-Khattab, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: "While we were sitting with the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, one day a man of intensely white clothing and intensely black hair appeared. No trace of travel could be seen on him, and none of us recognized him. He sat down next to the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, placed his knees against his knees, and placed his hands on his thighs and said: 'O Muhammad, tell me about Islam.' The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: 'Islam is to bear witness that there is no god but Allah, and that Muhammad is His Messenger, to establish the prayer, to give the zakat, to fast Ramadan, and to perform the pilgrimage to the House if you are able to do so.' He said: 'You have spoken the truth.' We were amazed that he asked him and confirmed his truthfulness! He said: 'Then tell me about Iman.' He said: 'To believe in Allah, His angels, His books, His messengers, the Last Day, and to believe in divine decree, both its good and its evil.' He said: 'You have spoken the truth.' He said: 'Then tell me about Ihsan.' He said: 'To worship Allah as if you see Him, for if you do not see Him, He sees you.' He said: 'Then tell me about the Hour.' He said: 'The one who is asked about it knows no more than the one who is asking.' He said: 'Then tell me about its signs.' He said: 'That the slave woman gives birth to her mistress, and that you see barefoot, unclothed, destitute shepherds competing in building tall buildings.' Then he departed. I stayed for a long time. Then he said: 'O Umar, do you know who the questioner was?' I said: 'Allah and His Messenger know best.' He said: 'It was Jibril who came to you to teach you your religion.'" (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Second: From Abu Dharr Jundub bin Junadah and Abu Abdur Rahman Mu'adh bin Jabal, may Allah be pleased with them, from the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, who said: "Fear Allah wherever you are, and follow a bad deed with a good deed, it will erase it, and treat people with good manners." (Reported by Tirmidhi and he said it is a Hasan Hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Third: From Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, who said: "I was behind the Prophet, peace be upon him, one day, and he said: 'O young man, I shall teach you some words: Guard Allah, and He will guard you. Guard Allah, and you will find Him before you. When you ask, ask Allah, and when you seek help, seek help from Allah. And know that if the entire nation were to gather to benefit you with something, they would not be able to benefit you except with something that Allah has already decreed for you. And if they were to gather to harm you with something, they would not be able to harm you except with something that Allah has already decreed for you. The pens have been lifted, and the ink has dried.'" (Narrated by Tirmidhi, who said it is a hasan sahih hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Fourth: Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "You perform deeds that are finer in your eyes than hair; we used to consider them among the destructive sins during the time of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him)." (Narrated by Bukhari) He also said: "Al-Mawbiqat" means destructive sins. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

The fifth: From Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Verily, Allah is jealous, and Allah's jealousy is that a believer should not do what Allah has forbidden him." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Sixth: Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported that he heard the Prophet (peace be upon him) say: "Three among the Children of Israel, a leper, a bald man, and a blind man, Allah wanted to test them. So He sent an angel to them. He came to the leper and said: 'What do you desire most?' He said: 'A good color and good skin, and for this disease to leave me, which has made people detest me.' So he wiped him, and his disease left him, and he was given a good color. He said: 'What kind of wealth do you desire most?' He said: 'Camels,' or he said 'Cows' - the narrator doubted. So he was given a pregnant she-camel and told: 'May Allah bless it for you.' He came to the bald man and said: 'What do you desire most?' He said: 'Good hair, and for this condition to leave me, which has made people detest me.' So he wiped him, and his condition left him, and he was given good hair. He said: 'What kind of wealth do you desire most?' He said: 'Cows.' So he was given a pregnant cow and told: 'May Allah bless it for you.' He came to the blind man and said: 'What do you desire most?' He said: 'May Allah restore my sight so that I can see people.' So he wiped him, and Allah restored his sight. He said: 'What kind of wealth do you desire most?' He said: 'Sheep.' So he was given a ewe that had just given birth. These two produced offspring, and this one gave birth. So the first had a valley of camels, the second had a valley of cows, and the third had a valley of sheep. Then the angel came to the leper in his former form and said to him: 'I am a poor man and a traveler, and my journey has been cut off from me today, and I have no means to reach my destination except by Allah and then by you. I ask you by the One Who gave you the good color, the good skin, and wealth, for a camel to reach me in my journey.' He said: 'The rights are many.' He said: 'I almost recognize you. Were you not a leper whom people detested, and you were poor, and Allah gave you [wealth]?' He said: 'No, I inherited this wealth from my forefathers.' He said: 'If you are lying, may Allah return you to what you were.' He came to the bald man and said to him the same thing he said to the leper, and he responded to him the same way the leper responded. He said: 'If you are lying, may Allah return you to what you were.' He came to the blind man in his former form and said to him: 'I am a poor man and a traveler, and my journey has been cut off from me today, and I have no means to reach my destination except by Allah and then by you. I ask you by the One Who restored your sight, for a sheep to reach me in my journey?' He said: 'I was blind, and Allah restored my sight. Take whatever you wish and leave whatever you wish. By Allah, I will not prevent you from taking anything today for the sake of Allah, the Mighty and Majestic.' He said: 'Keep your wealth. You have been tested, and Allah is pleased with you, and displeased with your two companions.'" (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Seventh: Narrated from Abu Ya'la Shaddad bin Aws, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him, that he said: "The intelligent person is he who holds himself to account and acts for what comes after death. The weak person is he who follows his desires and entertains false hopes from Allah." (Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi, who said it is a Hasan Hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Eighth: From Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "Among the signs of a person's good Islam is his leaving that which does not concern him." (Hasan Hadith, narrated by Tirmidhi and others) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Ninth: It was narrated from 'Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "A man shall not be asked why he beat his wife." (Narrated by Abu Dawud and others) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

As for the hadiths, the first is from Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: It was asked, "O Messenger of Allah, who are the most noble of people?" He said: "The most pious." They said: "We are not asking about this." He said: "Then (it is) Yusuf, the Prophet of Allah, son of the Prophet of Allah, son of the Prophet of Allah, son of the friend of Allah." They said: "We are not asking about this." He said: "Then you are asking me about the origins of the Arabs? The best of them in the days of ignorance are the best of them in Islam, if they gain understanding." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Second: Abu Sa'id al-Khudri (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "This world is sweet and green, and Allah has made you stewards in it, and He watches how you act. So beware of the world and beware of women, for the first tribulation of the Children of Israel was concerning women." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Third: From Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Prophet (peace be upon him) used to say: "O Allah, I ask You for guidance, piety, chastity, and richness." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Fourth: From Abi Dharif Adi bin Hatim Al-Ta'i, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "Whoever swears an oath, then sees a better course of action in piety towards Allah, let him do what is more pious." (Reported by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Fifth: From Abu Umamah Suday bin Ajlan Al-Bahili, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) delivering a sermon during the Farewell Pilgrimage, and he said: "Fear Allah, and pray your five prayers, and fast your month, and give the Zakat of your wealth, and obey your leaders, and you will enter the Paradise of your Lord." (Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi, at the end of the Book of Prayer, and he said: This is a Hassan Sahih Hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them, that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "The nations were presented to me, and I saw a prophet with a small group of followers, and a prophet with one or two followers, and a prophet with no followers. Then a great multitude was shown to me, and I thought it was my Ummah. It was said to me: 'This is Moses and his people. But look to the horizon.' So I looked, and there was a great multitude. It was said to me: 'Look to the other horizon.' And there was a great multitude. It was said to me: 'This is your Ummah, and with them are seventy thousand who will enter Paradise without reckoning or punishment.'" Then he got up and entered his house. The people began to discuss who those who would enter Paradise without reckoning or punishment were. Some of them said: "Perhaps they are those who accompanied the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him)." Others said: "Perhaps they are those who were born into Islam and did not associate anything with Allah." And they mentioned other things. The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) came out to them and said: "What are you discussing?" They told him, and he said: "They are those who do not seek Ruqyah, nor ask for it to be performed for them, nor do they believe in omens, and they rely upon their Lord." Ukasha bin Mihsan stood up and said: "Pray to Allah to make me one of them." He said: "You are one of them." Then another man stood up and said: "Pray to Allah to make me one of them." He said: "Ukasha has preceded you." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

The second: Also from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to say: "O Allah, to You I have submitted, and in You I have believed, and in You I have trusted, and to You I have turned, and by You I have disputed. O Allah, I seek refuge in Your might, there is no god but You, lest You lead me astray. You are the Ever-Living Who does not die, while the jinn and mankind die." (Agreed upon) (This is the wording of Muslim, and Bukhari abridged it). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Third: From Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them, it is also narrated that he said: "Allah is sufficient for us, and He is the best disposer of affairs." Ibrahim, peace be upon him, said this when he was cast into the fire. And Muhammad, peace be upon him, said it when they said: "Indeed, the people have gathered against you, so fear them." But it [their saying this] increased them in faith, and they said: "Allah is sufficient for us, and He is the best disposer of affairs." (Narrated by Bukhari.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Fourth: It is narrated from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him, that he said: "People whose hearts are like the hearts of birds will enter Paradise." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Fifth: From Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) that he went with the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him) on a campaign to Najd. When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) returned, he returned with them. The midday heat overtook them in a valley with many thorny trees. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) dismounted, and the people dispersed to take shade under the trees. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) dismounted under a samra tree and hung his sword on it. We slept a sleep, and suddenly the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) was calling us, and an Arab was with him. He said: "This man snatched my sword while I was sleeping, and I woke up to find it drawn in his hand. He said: 'Who will protect you from me?' I said: 'Allah' - three times." He did not punish him and sat down. (Agreed upon). In another narration: Jabir said: We were with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) at Dhat al-Riqā'. When we came across a shady tree, we left it for the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him). Then a man from the polytheists came, and the sword of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) was hanging on the tree. He drew it and said: "Do you fear me?" He said: "No." He said: "Then who will protect you from me?" He said: "Allah." In the narration of Abu Bakr al-Isma'ili in his Sahih: He said: "Who will protect you from me?" He said: "Allah." He said: Then the sword fell from his hand, and the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) took the sword and said: "Who will protect you from me?" He said: "Be the best of those who take." He said: "Do you bear witness that there is no god but Allah, and that I am the Messenger of Allah?" He said: "No, but I promise you that I will not fight you, nor will I be with a people who fight you." So he let him go. He went to his companions and said: "I have come to you from the best of people." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

The sixth: From Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) say: "If you were to rely on Allah with true reliance, He would provide for you as He provides for the birds. They go out hungry in the morning and come back full in the evening." (Narrated by Tirmidhi, who said it is a hasan hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Seventh: It was narrated from Abu Umarah Al-Bara' bin Azib (may Allah be pleased with them both) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "O so-and-so, when you go to your bed, say: 'O Allah, I have surrendered myself to You, and I have turned my face to You, and I have entrusted my affairs to You, and I have sought refuge in You, desiring and fearing You. There is no refuge or safety from You except with You. I believe in Your Book which You revealed, and in Your Prophet whom You sent.' If you die during that night, you will die upon the Fitrah, and if you wake up, you will attain goodness." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Eighth: From Abu Bakr As-Siddiq, may Allah be pleased with him, from Abdullah bin Uthman bin Amer bin Amr bin Ka'b bin Sa'd bin Taym bin Murrah bin Ka'b bin Lu'ayy bin Ghalib Al-Qurashi At-Taymi, may Allah be pleased with him – he, his father, and his mother were companions, may Allah be pleased with them – he said: "I looked at the feet of the polytheists while we were in the cave, and they were above our heads. I said, 'O Messenger of Allah, if one of them were to look down at his feet, he would see us.'" He said: "What do you think, O Abu Bakr, of two, with Allah as the third of them?" (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Ninth: From the Mother of the Believers, Umm Salamah, whose name is Hind bint Abi Umayyah al-Makhzumiyyah, may Allah be pleased with her, that when the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, left his house, he would say: "In the name of Allah, I rely on Allah. O Allah, I seek refuge in You from going astray or being led astray, or from slipping or being caused to slip, or from wronging or being wronged, or from behaving foolishly or being treated foolishly." (A Sahih Hadith narrated by Abu Dawud, Al-Tirmidhi, and others with authentic chains of narration.) (Al-Tirmidhi said: A Hasan Sahih Hadith, and this is the wording of Abu Dawud.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Tenth: On the authority of Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Whoever says when he leaves his house: 'Bismillah, tawakkaltu 'alal-lah, wa la hawla wa la quwwata illa billah' (In the name of Allah, I trust in Allah, and there is no might nor power except with Allah), it will be said to him: 'You have been guided, you have been sufficed, and you have been protected, and Satan will move away from him.'" Narrated by Abu Dawud, At-Tirmidhi, An-Nasa'i, and others. At-Tirmidhi said: It is a hasan hadith. Abu Dawud added: "(He will say - meaning Satan - to another Satan): How can you deal with a man who has been guided, sufficed, and protected?" [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that two brothers lived during the time of the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him). One of them used to visit the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him), while the other worked for a living. The working brother complained about his brother to the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him), who said, "Perhaps you are provided for because of him." (Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi, with a sound chain of narration according to the conditions of Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Amr, and it was said: Abu 'Amrah Sufyan bin Abdullah, may Allah be pleased with him, said: I said, "O Messenger of Allah, tell me something about Islam, after which I will not have to ask anyone else." He said: "Say: I believe in Allah, and then remain steadfast." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, that he said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "Close in on it, and be steadfast, and know that none of you will be saved by his deeds." They said: "Not even you, O Messenger of Allah?" He said: "Not even I, unless Allah encompasses me with His mercy and bounty." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]
