Al-Zubayr had four wives, and each wife received one million two hundred thousand. So, all his wealth was fifty million two hundred thousand. Narrated by Bukhari. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Jabir, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Beware of injustice, for injustice is darkness on the Day of Resurrection, and beware of greed, for greed destroyed those before you. It led them to shed each other's blood and violate each other's sanctity." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Rights will surely be rendered to their owners on the Day of Resurrection, to the extent that the hornless sheep will be avenged by the horned sheep." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both) who said: We were talking about the Farewell Pilgrimage, and the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was among us, and we did not know what the Farewell Pilgrimage was, until the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) praised Allah and lauded Him, then he mentioned the Antichrist and dwelt at length upon him, saying: "No Prophet was sent by Allah but he warned his people about him. Noah and the Prophets after him warned their people about him. If he appears among you, then what is hidden from you concerning him is not hidden from you, for your Lord is not one-eyed. And he is one-eyed in his right eye, as if his eye were a floating grape. Know that Allah has forbidden you your blood and your property, as he has forbidden you the sanctity of this day of yours, in this city of yours, in this month of yours. Have I conveyed the message?" They said: "Yes." He said: "O Allah, bear witness" - three times. "Woe unto you, or woe betide you, see that you do not return to disbelief after me, striking the necks of some of you against the necks of others." (Narrated by Bukhari, and Muslim narrated part of it). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever unjustly seizes a handspan of land, it will be a collar of seven earths around his neck." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Musa (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Indeed, Allah gives respite to the wrongdoer, but when He seizes him, He does not let him escape." Then he recited: "And thus is the seizing of your Lord when He seizes the towns while they are doing wrong; indeed His seizing is painful and severe." (Hud: 102) (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Mu'adh (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) sent me and said: "You are going to a people of the People of the Book. So call them to testify that there is no god but Allah, and that I am the Messenger of Allah. If they obey that, then inform them that Allah has enjoined upon them five prayers each day and night. If they obey that, then beware of the best of their wealth. And fear the supplication of the oppressed, for it is not veiled from Allah in any way." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Humaid Abdul Rahman bin Sa'd Al-Sa'idi (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Prophet (peace be upon him) employed a man from Al-Azd, known as Ibn Al-Lutbiyyah, to collect charity. When he returned, he said: "This is for you, and this was gifted to me." The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) stood on the pulpit, praised Allah and lauded Him, then said: "To proceed, I employ one of you for a task that Allah has entrusted to me. He comes and says: 'This is for you, and this was gifted to me.' Would he not have sat in his father's and mother's house until his gift came to him, if he was truthful? By Allah, no one among you takes anything without its rightful due except that he will meet Allah Almighty carrying it on the Day of Resurrection. So let no one among you meet Allah carrying a camel that bleats, or a cow that moos, or a sheep that bleats." Then he raised his hands until the whiteness of his armpits was seen, and said: "O Allah, have I conveyed the message?" three times. (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever has wronged his brother in regard to his honor or anything else, let him seek his forgiveness today, before a day when there will be no dinars and no dirhams. If he has good deeds, they will be taken from him according to the extent of his wronging. If he has no good deeds, then the sins of his wronged brother will be taken and placed upon him." (Narrated by Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-Aas, may Allah be pleased with them, from the Prophet, peace be upon him, who said: "A Muslim is one from whose tongue and hand Muslims are safe, and a Muhajir is one who abandons what Allah has forbidden." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, may Allah be pleased with him, it is narrated that he said: "There was a man named Kurkurah who was in charge of the Prophet, peace be upon him, and he died. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: 'He is in the Fire.' They went to look at him and found that he had stolen a cloak." (Narrated by Al-Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Narrated by Abu Bakra, Nu'aym bin Al-Harith, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, peace be upon him, who said: "Time has come back to its original state, as it was on the day Allah created the heavens and the earth. A year is twelve months, out of which four are sacred. Three of them are consecutive: Dhu al-Qi'dah, Dhu al-Hijjah, and al-Muharram, and Rajab of Mudar, which is between Jumada and Sha'ban. Which month is this?" We said: "Allah and His Messenger know best." He remained silent until we thought he would name it something other than its name. He said: "Is it not Dhu al-Hijjah?" We said: "Yes." He said: "Which country is this?" We said: "Allah and His Messenger know best." He remained silent until we thought he would name it something other than its name. He said: "Is it not the Sacred City?" We said: "Yes." He said: "Which day is this?" We said: "Allah and His Messenger know best." He remained silent until we thought he would name it something other than its name. He said: "Is it not the Day of Sacrifice?" We said: "Yes." He said: "Indeed, your blood, your property, and your honor are forbidden to each other, as sacred as this day of yours, in this country of yours, in this month of yours. You will meet your Lord, and He will ask you about your deeds. Beware, do not return to disbelief after me, striking the necks of each other. Let the present convey it to those who are absent, for it may be that some to whom it is conveyed will be more mindful of it than some who have heard it." Then he said: "Have I conveyed the message? Have I conveyed the message?" We said: "Yes." He said: "O Allah, bear witness." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Umamah Iyas bin Tha'labah Al-Harithi (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Whoever usurps the right of a Muslim with his oath, Allah makes Hellfire obligatory for him and forbids Paradise for him." A man said: "Even if it is a small thing, O Messenger of Allah?" He said: "Even if it is a twig of Arak." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Adi ibn Umayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) that he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) say: "Whoever We appoint to a position, and he conceals from us even a needle or more, that will be considered embezzlement that he will bring on the Day of Resurrection." A black man from the Ansar stood up, as if I were looking at him, and said: "O Messenger of Allah, accept my resignation from your service." He said: "What is the matter with you?" He said: "I heard you say such and such." He said: "And I say it now: Whoever We appoint to a position, let him bring its little and its much. What he is given, he takes, and what he is forbidden from, he refrains from." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Umar ibn Al-Khattab, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: When it was the day of Khaybar, a group of the companions of the Prophet, peace be upon him, came and said: So-and-so is a martyr, and so-and-so is a martyr, until they passed by a man and said: So-and-so is a martyr. Then the Prophet, peace be upon him, said: No, indeed I saw him in the Fire because of a cloak he stole - or a garment. (Reported by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Qatadah Al-Harith bin Rib'i, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, that he stood among them, and mentioned to them that Jihad in the cause of Allah and faith in Allah are the best of deeds. A man stood up and said: "O Messenger of Allah, what do you think, if I am killed in the cause of Allah, will my sins be expiated for me?" The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said to him: "Yes, if you are killed in the cause of Allah while you are patient and seeking reward, advancing and not retreating." Then the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "What did you say?" He said: "What do you think, if I am killed in the cause of Allah, will my sins be expiated for me?" The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Yes, while you are patient and seeking reward, advancing and not retreating, except for debt, for Jibril told me that." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Do you know who the bankrupt is?" They said: "The bankrupt among us is he who has no dirhams and no possessions." He said: "Indeed, the bankrupt of my Ummah is he who comes on the Day of Resurrection with prayers, fasting, and charity, and comes having reviled this one, slandered this one, consumed the wealth of this one, shed the blood of this one, and struck this one. So, this one will be given from his good deeds, and this one will be given from his good deeds. If his good deeds run out before his obligations are fulfilled, then their sins will be taken and cast upon him, and then he will be thrown into the Fire." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Umm Salamah (may Allah be pleased with her), that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "I am only human, and you people bring your disputes to me. It is possible that some of you may be more eloquent in their argumentation than others, so I may judge in favor of whoever is more eloquent in their speech. Thus, whoever I judge to take his brother's right, then he is only taking a piece of the Fire." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "A believer remains in the spaciousness of his religion as long as he does not shed innocent blood." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Khawlah bint Amir Al-Ansariyyah, who was the wife of Hamzah (may Allah be pleased with him), she said: I heard the Messenger of Allah (may Allah bless him and grant him peace) say: "Indeed, men will wade into the wealth of Allah without right, so they will have the Fire on the Day of Resurrection." (Narrated by Al-Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Musa, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The believer is to the believer like a structure, each part supporting the other," and he interlaced his fingers. (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Whoever passes through any of our mosques or markets, and has arrows with him, let him hold them, or grasp their tips with his hand, so that he does not injure any of the Muslims with them." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Al-Nu'man bin Bashir, may Allah be pleased with them both, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The believers in their affection for each other, their mercy for each other, and their kindness for each other, are like one body. When any part of the body complains, the whole body responds with sleeplessness and fever." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, kissed Al-Hasan bin Ali, may Allah be pleased with them both. Al-Aqra' bin Habis was with him, and he said: "I have ten children, and I have not kissed any of them." The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, looked at him and said: "He who does not show mercy will not be shown mercy." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, she said: Some Bedouins came to the Messenger of Allah, may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him, and they said: Do you kiss your children? He said: "Yes." They said: By Allah, we do not kiss! Then the Messenger of Allah, may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Or do I have control if Allah has removed mercy from your hearts?" (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Jarir bin Abdullah (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "He who does not show mercy to people will not be shown mercy by Allah." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "If one of you leads the people in prayer, let him make it brief, for among them are the weak, the sick, and the old. And if he prays for himself, let him lengthen it as he wishes." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

'A'isha (Allah be pleased with her) reported that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) would sometimes refrain from an act, although he loved to do it, for fear that it might be enjoined upon his Ummah and thus become obligatory for them. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from her, may Allah be pleased with her, she said: The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, forbade them from continuing fasts (Wasl) as a mercy to them. So they said: "You continue fasts?" He said: "Indeed, I am not like you. I spend the night with my Lord feeding me and giving me drink." (Agreed upon). This means he is made strong as if he ate and drank. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Qatada Al-Harith bin Rab'i, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "I start to pray and I intend to prolong it, then I hear the crying of a child, so I shorten my prayer out of dislike for making his mother suffer." (Reported by Al-Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Jundub bin Abdullah, he said: The Messenger of Allah (may Allah bless him and grant him peace) said: "Whoever prays the dawn prayer, he is under the protection of Allah. So, do not let Allah seek you out in His protection for anything, for indeed, whoever Allah seeks out in His protection for anything, He will catch him, and then throw him on his face into the Hellfire." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "A Muslim is the brother of a Muslim; he neither oppresses him nor abandons him. Whoever helps his brother in need, Allah will help him in his own need. Whoever alleviates the distress of a Muslim, Allah will alleviate his distress on the Day of Resurrection. And whoever conceals the faults of a Muslim, Allah will conceal his faults on the Day of Resurrection." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "A Muslim is a Muslim's brother; he does not betray him, nor lie to him, nor forsake him. The whole of a Muslim is sacred to another Muslim: his honor, his property, and his blood. Piety is here," and he pointed to his chest. "It is sufficient evil for a man to belittle his Muslim brother." (Narrated by Tirmidhi, who said: A hasan hadith.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Do not envy each other, do not bid against each other, do not hate each other, do not turn your backs on each other, and do not undercut one another in a sale. And be, O servants of Allah, brothers. A Muslim is a brother to a Muslim; he does not wrong him, nor does he humiliate him, nor does he forsake him. Piety is here," and he pointed to his chest three times. "It is enough evil for a man to humiliate his Muslim brother. The whole of a Muslim is sacred to a Muslim: his blood, his wealth, and his honor." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "None of you truly believes until he loves for his brother what he loves for himself." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Support your brother, whether he is an oppressor or oppressed." A man said: O Messenger of Allah, I will support him if he is oppressed. What do you say if he is an oppressor, how do I support him? He said: "You restrain him - or prevent him - from oppression, for that is his support." (Narrated by Al-Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "A Muslim has five rights over another Muslim: returning the greeting, visiting the sick, following funerals, responding to invitations, and praying for the sneezer." (Agreed upon). And in a narration by Muslim: "A Muslim has six rights over another Muslim: if you meet him, greet him; if he invites you, respond to him; if he asks your advice, give him sincere advice; if he sneezes and praises Allah, respond to him; if he gets sick, visit him; and if he dies, follow his funeral." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu 'Imarah Al-Bara' bin 'Azib (may Allah be pleased with them both) that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) commanded us to do seven things and forbade us from doing seven things. He commanded us to visit the sick, follow the funeral procession, say "Yarhamuk Allah" to the one who sneezes, fulfill the oath of one who swears, help the oppressed, accept the invitation of one who invites, and spread the greeting of peace. He forbade us from wearing gold rings, drinking from silver, using red silk cushions, wearing silk and fine silk cloth. (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) from the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) who said: "No servant will cover a servant in this world, but Allah will cover him on the Day of Resurrection." (Reported by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "All of my Ummah will be forgiven except for those who openly commit sins. And among the open sins is that a person does something at night, then he wakes up, and Allah has covered his sin, and he says: 'O so-and-so, I did such-and-such last night.' He spent the night with his Lord covering him, and he woke up uncovering Allah's cover from himself." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "If a slave woman commits adultery and her adultery is proven, then she shall be flogged with the prescribed punishment, and she shall not be reprimanded. Then if she commits adultery a second time, she shall be flogged with the prescribed punishment and shall not be reprimanded. Then if she commits adultery a third time, he shall sell her, even if it is for a rope of hair." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: The Prophet, peace be upon him, was brought a man who had drunk wine. He said: "Flog him." Abu Hurairah said: "So among us was one who flogged with his hand, and one who flogged with his sandal, and one who flogged with his garment." When he left, some of the people said: "May Allah disgrace you." He said: "Do not say so; do not aid Satan against him." (Narrated by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "A Muslim is the brother of a Muslim; he does not wrong him, nor does he abandon him. Whoever is in need of his brother, Allah will be in need of him. Whoever relieves a Muslim of distress, Allah will relieve him of distress on the Day of Resurrection. And whoever conceals a Muslim, Allah will conceal him on the Day of Resurrection." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him), from the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) who said: "Whoever relieves a Muslim of a hardship from the hardships of this world, Allah will relieve him of a hardship from the hardships of the Day of Resurrection. Whoever eases the plight of an indebted person, Allah will ease his plight in this world and the Hereafter. Whoever conceals the faults of a Muslim, Allah will conceal his faults in this world and the Hereafter. Allah is in the aid of His servant so long as His servant is in the aid of his brother. Whoever treads a path in search of knowledge, Allah will make easy for him a path to Paradise. No people gather in a house from the houses of Allah (mosques), reciting the Book of Allah and studying it amongst themselves, except that tranquility descends upon them, mercy covers them, angels surround them, and Allah mentions them to those who are with Him. And he whose deeds lag behind him will not be hastened by his lineage. (Narrated by Muslim)." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Musa Al-Ash'ari, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: When a petitioner came to the Prophet, peace be upon him, he would turn to his companions and say: "Intercede, and you will be rewarded, and Allah will decree through the tongue of His Prophet what He wishes." (Agreed upon). (16) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, in the story of Barirah and her husband. He said: The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said to her: "Would you take him back?" She said: O Messenger of Allah, do you order me? He said: "I am only interceding." She said: I have no need for it. (Reported by Al-Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Every joint of a person must perform a charity each day that the sun rises. To act justly between two is a charity. To help a man with his mount, by helping him mount it or by lifting his luggage onto it, is a charity. And a good word is a charity. And every step that you take towards prayer is a charity. And removing harm from the road is a charity." (Agreed upon). (17) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Umm Kulthum bint Uqbah bin Abi Mu'ayt, may Allah be pleased with her, she said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "The liar is not he who reconciles between people by conveying good or speaking good." (Agreed upon). And in the narration of Muslim there is an addition, she said: "And I did not hear him permit anything that people say except in three cases, meaning: war, reconciling between people, and a man speaking to his wife, and a woman speaking to her husband." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may God be pleased with her, she said: The Messenger of God, may God's prayers and peace be upon him, heard the voices of two litigants at the door, their voices raised. One of them was asking the other to forgive him and to help him with something, and he was saying: "By God, I will not do it." So the Messenger of God, may God's prayers and peace be upon him, went out to them and said: "Where is the one who swears by God not to do good?" He said: "I am, O Messenger of God. He can have whatever he wishes." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu al-Abbas Sahl bin Sa'd al-Sa'idi (may Allah be pleased with him) that it reached the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) that there was strife among the Bani Amr bin Auf. So the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) went out to reconcile them, accompanied by people with him. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was detained, and the time for prayer arrived. "Would you lead the people in prayer?" he asked. He said, "Yes, if you wish." Bilal then called the Iqamah, and Abu Bakr stepped forward and said Takbir, and the people said Takbir. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came walking through the rows until he stood in the row. The people began to clap. Abu Bakr (may Allah be pleased with him) did not turn around in his prayer. When the people clapped a lot, he turned around and saw the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) gestured to him. Abu Bakr (may Allah be pleased with him) raised his hands, praised Allah, and went backward until he stood in the row. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) stepped forward and led the people in prayer. When he finished, he turned to the people and said, "O people, why is it that when something happens to you during prayer, you begin to clap? Clapping is for women. Whoever has something happen to him during his prayer should say, 'Subhan Allah' (Glory be to Allah), for no one hears him say 'Subhan Allah' except that they turn around. O Abu Bakr, what prevented you from leading the people in prayer when I gestured to you?" Abu Bakr said, "It was not fitting for the son of Abu Quhafah to lead the people in prayer in the presence of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him)." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It is narrated on the authority of Harithah ibn Wahb (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: I heard Allah's Messenger (may peace be upon him) say: "Shall I inform you about the dwellers of Paradise? Every weak and unassuming person. If he were to swear by Allah, He would surely fulfill his oath. Shall I inform you about the dwellers of Hell-fire? Every one who is rough, arrogant and conceited." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Al-Abbas Sahl bin Sa'd As-Sa'idi (may Allah be pleased with him) that he said: A man passed by the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), and he said to a man sitting with him: "What do you think of this one?" He said: "He is one of the nobles of the people. By Allah, if he proposes, he will be married, and if he intercedes, his intercession will be accepted." The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) remained silent. Then another man passed by, and the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to him: "What do you think of this one?" He said: "O Messenger of Allah, this is a man from the poor Muslims. If he proposes, he will not be married, and if he intercedes, his intercession will not be accepted, and if he speaks, his word will not be heard." Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "This one is better than the earth full of people like him." (Agreed upon) (22) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Sa'eed Al-Khudri (may Allah be pleased with him), from the Prophet (peace be upon him) who said: "Paradise and Hell argued. Hell said: 'The arrogant and the proud are in me.' Paradise said: 'The weak and the poor are in me.' So Allah judged between them: 'Verily, you are Paradise, by My mercy I shall show mercy through you to whomsoever I will. And verily, you are Hell, by My torment I shall torment with you whomsoever I will. And to both of you I shall fill them.'" (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "A corpulent man will be brought on the Day of Resurrection, and he will not weigh the wing of a mosquito with Allah." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, that a black woman used to sweep the mosque, or a young man. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) missed him/her and asked about him/her. They said: "He/She died." He said: "Why did you not inform me?" It was as if they belittled his/her matter. So he said: "Show me his/her grave." They showed him his/her grave, and he prayed for him/her. Then he said: "These graves are filled with darkness for their inhabitants, and Allah the Almighty illuminates them for them by my prayer for them." (Agreed upon) (23) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, it is narrated that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "There are many a dishevelled, dust-covered person, pushed away from the doors, who if they swore by Allah, He would fulfill their oath." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Usamah, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, peace be upon him, who said: "I stood at the gate of Paradise, and behold, the majority of those who entered it were the poor, and the wealthy were detained, except for the people of the Fire, they were ordered to the Fire. And I stood at the gate of the Fire, and behold, the majority of those who entered it were women." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that the Prophet (peace be upon him) said: "Three spoke in the cradle: Jesus, son of Mary, and the companion of Juraij. Juraij was a devout man, so he took a cell and stayed in it. His mother came to him while he was praying and said: 'O Juraij.' His mother came to him while he was praying and said: 'O Juraij.' He said: 'O Lord, my mother and my prayer.' So he turned to his prayer and she left. The next day, she came to him while he was praying and said: 'O Juraij.' He said: 'O Lord, my mother and my prayer.' So he turned to his prayer. She said: 'O Allah, do not let him die until he sees the faces of unchaste women.' The Children of Israel discussed Juraij and his worship. There was a prostitute whose beauty was admired, and she said: 'If you wish, I will tempt him.' So she presented herself to him, but he did not look at her. She went to a shepherd who used to shelter near his cell and allowed him to have his way with her, and he lay with her. She became pregnant, and they began to beat him. He said: 'What is wrong with you?' They said: 'You committed adultery with this prostitute and she gave birth to a child from you.' He said: 'Where is the boy?' They brought him, and he said: 'Let me pray.' So he prayed. When he finished, he approached the boy and poked him in the belly and said: 'O boy, who is your father?' He said: 'So-and-so the shepherd.' Then they turned to Juraij, kissing him and wiping themselves on him, and said: 'We will build your cell of gold.' He said: 'No, rebuild it of mud as it was.' So they did. And while a child was nursing from his mother, a man passed by riding a fine horse with good attire. She said: 'O Allah, make my son like this.' The child left the breast and looked at him. He said: 'O Allah, do not make me like him.' Then he returned to his breast and began to nurse.' It is as if I am looking at the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) as he narrated his nursing by placing his index finger in his mouth, and he began to suck it. He said: 'And they passed by a slave girl while they were beating her and saying: You committed adultery, you stole. And she said: Allah is sufficient for me, and He is the best disposer of affairs.' His mother said: 'O Allah, do not make my son like her.' So he left the nursing and looked at her. He said: 'O Allah, make me like her.' Then they reconsidered the conversation. She said: 'A man of good appearance passed by and I said: O Allah, make my son like him, and you said: O Allah, do not make me like him. And they passed by this slave girl while they were beating her and saying: You committed adultery, you stole. And I said: O Allah, do not make my son like her, and you said: O Allah, make me like her?!' He said: 'That man was a tyrant, and I said: O Allah, do not make me like him. And this woman, they say to her: You committed adultery, but she did not commit adultery. You stole, but she did not steal. And I said: O Allah, make me like her.'" (Agreed upon). (25) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Sa'd bin Abi Waqqas (may Allah be pleased with him) that he said: We were with the Prophet (peace be upon him) six people. The polytheists said to the Prophet (peace be upon him): "Drive away these people, they will not dare to approach us." And I was with Ibn Mas'ud and two men whose names I do not recall. So, what Allah willed to befall the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) befell him. He thought to himself, so Allah the Almighty revealed: "And do not drive away those who call on their Lord morning and afternoon, seeking His countenance." (Al-An'am: 52). (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abi Hubayrah, ‘A’idh ibn ‘Amr al-Muzani, who was among those who pledged allegiance under the tree, may Allah be pleased with him, that Abu Sufyan passed by Salman, Suhayb, and Bilal, along with a group of people. They said: "The swords of Allah have not taken their toll on the enemy of Allah as they should have." Abu Bakr, may Allah be pleased with him, said: "Are you saying this to the chief of Quraysh and their leader?" He then went to the Prophet, peace be upon him, and informed him. He said: "O Abu Bakr, perhaps you have angered them? If you have angered them, then you have angered your Lord." He came to them and said: "My brothers, have I angered you?" They said: "No, may Allah forgive you, my brother." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Sahl bin Sa'd (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "I and the one who looks after an orphan will be in Paradise like this," and he pointed with his index finger and middle finger, separating them slightly. (Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Narrated Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) said: "The one who takes care of an orphan, whether he is his relative or not, he and I will be in Paradise like this," and the narrator, Malik ibn Anas, indicated with his index and middle fingers. (Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: The Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) said: "The poor person is not the one whom a date or two, or a morsel or two, turns away. Rather, the poor person is the one who abstains from begging." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, from the Prophet, peace be upon him: "The one who strives for the widow and the poor is like the mujahid in the cause of Allah." And I think he said: "And like the one who stands in prayer and never tires, and like the one who fasts and never breaks his fast." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, he said: "The worst food is the food of the wedding banquet; it is withheld from those who come to it, and invited to it are those who refuse it. And whoever does not answer the invitation has disobeyed Allah and His Messenger." (Reported by Muslim). And in a narration in "The Two Sahihs" from Abu Hurayrah, from his saying: "What an evil food is the food of the wedding banquet; the rich are invited to it and the poor are left out." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that the Prophet (peace be upon him) said: "Whoever takes care of two girls until they reach maturity will come on the Day of Resurrection with me and this person like these two." He then joined his fingers. (Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her) narrated: A woman came to me with her two daughters asking for something, and I found nothing with me except a single date. I gave it to her, and she divided it between her two daughters and did not eat any of it. Then she got up and left. The Prophet (peace be upon him) came in to us, and I told him what had happened. He said: "Whoever is tested with any of these daughters and treats them well, they will be a shield for him from the Hellfire." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may God be pleased with her, she said: A poor woman came to me carrying two daughters. I gave her three dates. She gave each one of them a date, and she raised a date to her mouth to eat it. Her daughters asked her for some of it, so she split the date she wanted to eat between them. I was pleased with her action. I mentioned what she did to the Messenger of God, peace be upon him. He said: "God has made Paradise obligatory for her because of this, or He has freed her from the Fire because of it." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Shuraih Khuwaylid bin 'Amr Al-Khuzā'i (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "O Allah, I declare forbidden the rights of the two weak ones: the orphan and the woman." (Hasan hadith, narrated by An-Nasa'i with a good chain of narration). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Mus'ab bin Sa'd bin Abi Waqqas, may Allah be pleased with them both, he said: Sa'd felt he had an advantage over those below him, so the Prophet, peace be upon him, said: "Are you not supported and provided for except by your weak ones?" (Narrated by Bukhari) This is transmitted as mursal, for Mus'ab bin Sa'd is a Tabi'i. (And Al-Hafiz Abu Bakr Al-Barqani narrated it in his Sahih as muttasil from Mus'ab, from his father, may Allah be pleased with him.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Al-Darda' Uwaimir, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "Seek me among your weak, for you are only aided and provided for through your weak." (Narrated by Abu Dawud with a good chain of narration). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It is narrated from Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Treat women kindly, for woman was created from a rib, and the most crooked part of the rib is its uppermost part. If you try to straighten it, you will break it, and if you leave it, it will remain crooked. So, treat women kindly." (Agreed upon).

In another narration in the two authentic books (Al-Bukhari and Muslim), it is reported: "A woman is like a rib. If you straighten her, you will break her, and if you enjoy her, you will enjoy her while she is crooked."

In a narration by Muslim, it is reported: "Woman was created from a rib, she will not be straight for you in any way. So, if you enjoy her, enjoy her while she is crooked, and if you try to straighten her, you will break her, and her breaking is her divorce." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abdullah bin Zam'ah (may Allah be pleased with him), that he heard the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him) giving a sermon, and he mentioned the she-camel and the one who slaughtered it. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "When the most wicked of them rose up" - he said: "A strong, rebellious, and defiant man rose up for it among his people." Then he mentioned women and admonished them, saying: "Let one of you not strike his wife as he strikes a slave, then he may lie with her at the end of the day." Then he admonished them about laughing at breaking wind, saying: "Does any of you laugh at what he does?" (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) said: "A believing man should not hate a believing woman; if he dislikes one trait in her, he will be pleased with another." Or he said: "He will be pleased with another." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from 'Amr bin Al-Ahwas Al-Jushami (may Allah be pleased with him) that he heard the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) during the Farewell Pilgrimage, after he praised Allah and glorified Him, and mentioned and exhorted, then said: "Behold, treat women well, for they are your helpers, and you do not possess anything of them except that. If they commit an evident indecency, then forsake them in bed, and strike them, but not in a severe manner. If they obey you, then do not seek a way against them. Behold, you have a right over your wives, and your wives have a right over you. Your right over them is that they shall not allow anyone you dislike to tread on your beds, nor allow anyone you dislike to enter your houses. Behold, their right over you is that you treat them well in their clothing and their food." (Reported by Tirmidhi, who said: This is a Hasan Sahih Hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Muawiyah bin Haidah, may God be pleased with him, he said: I said, O Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, what is the right of one of us over his wife? He said: "That you feed her when you eat, and you clothe her when you clothe yourself, and you do not strike the face, and you do not revile, and you do not forsake except in the house." A hasan hadith narrated by Abu Dawud, and he said: The meaning of "you do not revile" is: do not say, may God make you ugly. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Hurairah that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "The most complete of believers in faith are those with the best character, and the best of you are those who are best to their wives." (Tirmidhi said: This is a Hasan Sahih Hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Iyās ibn Abī Dhubāb, may Allāh be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allāh, peace be upon him, said: "Do not strike the female servants of Allāh." Then 'Umar, may Allāh be pleased with him, came to the Messenger of Allāh, peace be upon him, and said: "Women have become bold against their husbands." So he permitted striking them. Then many women came around the household of the Messenger of Allāh, peace be upon him, complaining about their husbands. So the Messenger of Allāh, peace be upon him, said: "Many women have come around the household of Muhammad, complaining about their husbands. Those are not the best among you." (Narrated by Abū Dāwūd with a sound chain of narration). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-Aas, may Allah be pleased with them, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The world is a provision, and the best provision of the world is the righteous wife." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) said: "If a man calls his wife to his bed and she refuses, and he sleeps angry with her, the angels curse her until morning." (Agreed upon). And in a narration for it: "If a woman sleeps boycotting her husband's bed, the angels curse her until morning." And in a narration, the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) said: "By the One in whose hand is my soul, there is no man who calls his wife to his bed and she refuses him, except that He who is in the Heavens is angry with her until he is pleased with her." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, also that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "It is not permissible for a woman to fast while her husband is present except with his permission, nor to allow anyone into his house except with his permission." (Agreed upon, and this is the wording of Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both) from the Prophet (peace be upon him) who said: "Each of you is a shepherd, and each of you is responsible for his flock. The ruler is a shepherd and is responsible for his flock. A man is a shepherd for his household and is responsible for his flock. A woman is a shepherdess for her husband's house and her children, and is responsible for them. Each of you is a shepherd and each of you is responsible for his flock." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Ali Talq bin Ali, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "If a man calls his wife for his need, she should come to him even if she is at the oven." (Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and Al-Nasa'i, and Al-Tirmidhi said: A hasan sahih hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him, he said: "If I were to command anyone to prostrate to anyone, I would command the wife to prostrate to her husband." (Reported by Al-Tirmidhi and he said: This is a Hasan Sahih hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Umm Salamah, may Allah be pleased with her, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Any woman who dies and her husband is pleased with her will enter Paradise." (Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi, who said it is a hasan hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Mu'adh bin Jabal, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, he said: "No woman annoys her husband in this world except that his wife among the Houris says: 'May Allah kill you! He is only a temporary guest with you, soon to leave you for us.'" (Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and he said it is a Hasan Hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Usama bin Zaid, may Allah be pleased with them both, that the Prophet, peace be upon him, said: "I have not left after me a temptation more harmful to men than women." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "A dinar you spent in the cause of Allah, and a dinar you spent in freeing a slave, and a dinar you gave as charity to a poor person, and a dinar you spent on your family; the greatest of them in reward is the one you spent on your family." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Abdullah - and he is also called Abu Abd al-Rahman - Thawban bin Bujd, a freed slave of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "The best dinar a man spends is a dinar he spends on his family, and a dinar he spends on his mount in the cause of Allah, and a dinar he spends on his companions in the cause of Allah." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Umm Salamah, may Allah be pleased with her, who said: "I said, O Messenger of Allah, will I be rewarded for spending on the children of Abu Salamah, as I will not leave them like this and like that, but rather they are my children? He said: 'Yes, you will have the reward for what you spend on them.' (Agreed upon)." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Sa'd bin Abi Waqas, may Allah be pleased with him, in his long hadith which we presented at the beginning of the book in the chapter on intention, that the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said to him: "And you will not spend seeking the face of Allah except that you will be rewarded for it, even what you put in your wife's mouth." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Mas'ud Al-Badri, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, he said: "If a man spends on his family a spending he counts towards his reward, it is charity for him." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-Aas, may Allah be pleased with them, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "It is enough sin for a person to neglect those whom he supports." This is a sound Hadith. (Reported by Abu Dawud and others). And Muslim narrated it in his Sahih with a similar wording, he said: "It is enough sin for a person to withhold from those whom he owns their sustenance." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It is narrated on the authority of Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "No day dawns upon the servants of Allah but that two angels descend. One of them prays: 'O Allah, give to the one who spends (in charity),' and the other prays: 'O Allah, give to the one who withholds.'" (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, he said: "The upper hand is better than the lower hand. Start with those you support. The best charity is that which is given out of sufficiency. And whoever seeks chastity, Allah will make him chaste. And whoever seeks to be self-sufficient, Allah will make him self-sufficient." (Narrated by Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that Abu Talhah (may Allah be pleased with him) was the richest of the Ansar in Medina in terms of date palms. His most prized possession was a garden called Bairuha', which faced the mosque. The Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) used to enter it and drink its sweet water. Anas said: When this verse was revealed: "You will not attain righteousness until you give freely of what you love." (3:92) Abu Talhah stood up and went to the Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) and said: "O Messenger of Allah, Allah the Almighty has revealed to you: 'You will not attain righteousness until you give freely of what you love.' My most prized possession is Bairuha', and I give it as charity to Allah, hoping for its reward and its provision with Allah. So, O Messenger of Allah, place it where Allah directs you." The Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) said: "Excellent! That is profitable wealth. That is profitable wealth. I have heard what you said. I think you should give it to your relatives." Abu Talhah said: "I will do so, O Messenger of Allah." So Abu Talhah distributed it among his relatives and his cousins. (Agreed Upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Narrated Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) that Al-Hasan bin Ali (may Allah be pleased with them both) took a date from the Sadaqah (charity) and put it in his mouth. The Messenger of Allah (may Allah bless him and grant him peace) said: "Pooh, pooh! Throw it away. Did you not know that we do not eat Sadaqah?" (Agreed upon). And in another narration: "Sadaqah is not lawful for us." And his saying "Khu khu" can be pronounced with a sukun on the "kha" and can be pronounced with a kasra with tanween, and it is a word used to reprimand a child away from disgusting things. Al-Hasan (may Allah be pleased with him) was a child. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Abu Hafs 'Umar bin Abi Salamah 'Abdullah bin 'Abd al-Asad, the foster son of the Messenger of Allah (may Allah bless him and grant him peace), reported that he was a boy in the care of the Messenger of Allah (may Allah bless him and grant him peace), and his hand used to roam about in the dish. So the Messenger of Allah (may Allah bless him and grant him peace) said to him: "O boy, invoke the name of Allah, and eat with your right hand, and eat from what is near you." And that has been my way of eating ever since. (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn `Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "You are all shepherds, and each of you is responsible for his flock. A woman is a shepherd in her husband's house and is responsible for her flock. A servant is a shepherd of his master's property and is responsible for his flock. So, all of you are shepherds, and each of you is responsible for his flock." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Amr bin Shu'aib, from his father, from his grandfather, may Allah be pleased with them, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Order your children to pray when they are seven years old, and discipline them for it when they are ten, and separate them in their beds." (Hasan hadith narrated by Abu Dawood with a Hasan chain of narration). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Thuraiya, Sabrah bin Ma'bad Al-Juhani (may Allah be pleased with him) said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "Teach the child to pray when he is seven years old, and strike him for it when he is ten years old." It is a Hasan (good) hadith, narrated by Abu Dawud and At-Tirmidhi, who said it is a Hasan hadith. The wording of Abu Dawud is: "Order the child to pray when he reaches seven years of age." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Umar and Aisha, may Allah be pleased with them, they said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Jibril kept recommending the neighbor to me until I thought he would make him an heir." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Dharr, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "O Abu Dharr, when you cook soup, add more water to it, and take care of your neighbors." (Reported by Muslim). And in another narration from him, from Abu Dharr, he said: My close friend, peace be upon him, advised me: "When you cook soup, add more water to it, then look for a household among your neighbors and send them some of it appropriately." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "By Allah, he does not believe! By Allah, he does not believe! By Allah, he does not believe!" It was said, "Who is it, O Messenger of Allah?" He said: "He whose neighbor is not safe from his harm!" (Agreed upon). In a narration by Muslim: "He will not enter Paradise whose neighbor is not safe from his harm." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, it is narrated that the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "O Muslim women, let no neighbor consider a gift from her neighbor as insignificant, even if it be a knuckle of a sheep." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "No neighbor should prevent his neighbor from placing a beam on his wall." Then Abu Huraira said: "What is it that I see you turning away from it! By Allah, I will throw it between your shoulders." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day, let him not harm his neighbor, and whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day, let him honor his guest, and whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day, let him speak good or remain silent." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It is narrated from Abu Shuraih Al-Khuza'i, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, peace be upon him, said: "Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day, let him honor his guest. Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day, let him speak good or remain silent." (Narrated by Muslim with this wording, and Bukhari narrated some of it). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, she said: I said: O Messenger of Allah, I have two neighbors, to which of them should I give a gift? He said: "To the one whose door is nearest to yours." (Narrated by Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abdullah bin Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The best of companions to Allah the Almighty is the one who is best to his companion, and the best of neighbors to Allah the Almighty is the one who is best to his neighbor." (Narrated by Tirmidhi, who said it is a hasan hadith.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of Abu Abd al-Rahman Abdullah ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: I asked the Prophet, peace be upon him: Which deed is most beloved to Allah the Almighty? He said: "The prayer at its appointed time." I said: Then which? He said: "Kindness to parents." I said: Then which? He said: "Striving in the cause of Allah." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "No son can fully repay his father, unless he finds his father as a slave and buys him and then sets him free." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him also, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day, let him honor his guest. Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day, let him maintain ties of kinship. Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day, let him speak good or remain silent." Agreed upon. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "Indeed, Allah Almighty created creation until, when He finished with them, the womb stood up and said: 'This is the station of one who seeks refuge in You from severance.' He said: 'Yes, are you not pleased that I will unite with whoever unites with you and sever ties with whoever severs ties with you?' It said: 'Yes.' He said: 'Then that is for you.'" Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "Read, if you wish: 'Then, if you turned away, would you commit corruption on earth and sever your ties of kinship? Those are the ones whom Allah has cursed, so He has made them deaf and blinded their eyes.'" [Muhammad: 22, 32] (Agreed upon). And in a narration by Al-Bukhari: Then Allah Almighty said: "Whoever unites with you, I will unite with him, and whoever severs ties with you, I will sever ties with him." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: A man came to the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, and said: O Messenger of Allah, who is most deserving of my good companionship? He said: "Your mother." He said: Then who? He said: "Your mother." He said: Then who? He said: "Your mother." He said: Then who? He said: "Your father." (Agreed upon). And in another narration: O Messenger of Allah, who is most deserving of good companionship? He said: "Your mother, then your mother, then your mother, then your father, then your closest, closest." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, he said: "May his nose be rubbed in the dust, then may his nose be rubbed in the dust, then may his nose be rubbed in the dust, who reached his parents, one or both, in old age, and did not enter Paradise." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, a man said: "O Messenger of God! I have relatives whom I join, and they sever me; I am kind to them, and they are cruel to me; I am patient with them, and they are ignorant towards me." He said: "If you are as you say, then it is as if you are feeding them hot ashes, and a supporter from God will continue to be with you against them as long as you remain on that." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever loves that his provision be expanded for him and his lifespan be extended, let him maintain kinship." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: Abu Talha was the wealthiest of the Ansar in Medina in terms of date palms, and his most beloved possession was Bairaha. It faced the Masjid, and the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) used to enter it and drink from its sweet water. When this verse was revealed: "You will never attain righteousness until you give from that which you love" (Al-Imran: 92), Abu Talha stood up and went to the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) and said: "O Messenger of Allah, indeed Allah, the Blessed and Most High, says: 'You will never attain righteousness until you give from that which you love.' And my most beloved possession is Bairaha, and it is charity to Allah, the Most High. I hope for its reward and stored provision with Allah, the Most High. So place it, O Messenger of Allah, wherever Allah shows you." The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "Excellent! That is profitable wealth, that is profitable wealth! I have heard what you said, and I think you should give it to your relatives." Abu Talha said: "I will do so, O Messenger of Allah." So Abu Talha distributed it among his relatives and cousins. (Agreed upon). Its wording has been previously explained in the chapter on spending from what one loves. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-'As, may Allah be pleased with them both, he said: A man came to the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, and said: "I pledge allegiance to you on emigration and striving, seeking reward from Allah Almighty." He said: "Do you have either of your parents alive?" He said: "Yes, both of them." He said: "Do you seek reward from Allah Almighty?" He said: "Yes." He said: "Then return to your parents and be good to them." (Agreed upon. This is the wording of Muslim). And in another narration by both of them: A man came and asked for permission to strive. He said: "Are your parents alive?" He said: "Yes." He said: "Then strive in (serving) them." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, the Prophet (peace be upon him) said: "The one who recompenses is not the one who maintains ties, but rather the one who, when his ties are cut, maintains them." (Narrated by Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Narrated by Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her) that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "The womb is attached to the Throne and says: 'Whoever connects me, Allah connects him; and whoever severs me, Allah severs him.'" (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from the Mother of the Believers, Maymunah bint Al-Harith (may Allah be pleased with her) that she freed a slave girl without asking the permission of the Prophet (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him). When it was her turn (for him to spend the night with her), she said: "O Messenger of Allah, did you know that I freed my slave girl?" He said: "Did you do that?" She said: "Yes." He said: "Had you given her to your maternal uncles, it would have been greater for your reward." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Asma bint Abi Bakr (may Allah be pleased with them both) that she said: My mother came to me while she was a polytheist during the time of Allah's Messenger (peace be upon him). I asked Allah's Messenger (peace be upon him) for a religious opinion, saying: "My mother has come to me, and she desires (kindness from me). Should I be kind to my mother?" He said: "Yes, be kind to your mother." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Zainab Al-Thaqafiyyah, the wife of Abdullah bin Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with her, she said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Give charity, O women, even if it is from your jewelry." She said: I returned to Abdullah bin Mas'ud and said to him: "You are a man of little means, and the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, has commanded us to give charity, so go to him and ask him. If this will suffice for me, otherwise I will give it to others." Abdullah said: "Rather, you go to him." So I went, and I found a woman from the Ansar at the door of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, and my need was her need. The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, was a man who inspired awe. Bilal came out to us, and we said to him: "Go to the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, and inform him that two women are at the door asking you: Does charity suffice for them to their husbands and to orphans in their laps? And do not tell him who we are." So Bilal entered upon the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, and asked him. The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said to him: "Who are they?" He said: "A woman from the Ansar and Zainab." The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Which Zainab is she?" He said: "The wife of Abdullah." The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "They have two rewards: the reward of kinship and the reward of charity." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Sufyan Sakhr bin Harb, may Allah be pleased with him, in his long hadith about the story of Heraclius, that Heraclius said to Abu Sufyan: "And what does he command you to do?" meaning the Prophet, peace be upon him. I said: "He says: 'Worship Allah alone, and associate nothing with Him, and abandon what your forefathers say, and he commands us to perform Salah, and to be truthful, and to maintain chastity, and to uphold the ties of kinship.'" (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Dharr, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "You will conquer a land in which the qirat is mentioned." In one narration: "You will conquer Egypt, and it is a land in which the qirat is named. So treat its people kindly, for they have a covenant and a kinship." In another narration: "So when you conquer it, treat its people well, for they have a covenant and a kinship," or he said: "a covenant and a kinship." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that when this verse was revealed: "And warn your nearest kin" (Ash-Shu'ara: 214), the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) called out to the Quraysh. They gathered, and he addressed them generally and specifically, saying: "O children of Abd Shams, O children of Ka'b bin Lu'ayy, save yourselves from the Fire. O children of Murrah bin Ka'b, save yourselves from the Fire. O children of Abd Manaf, save yourselves from the Fire. O children of Hashim, save yourselves from the Fire. O children of Abd al-Muttalib, save yourselves from the Fire. O Fatimah, save yourself from the Fire. For I do not possess for you any power against Allah. However, you have a blood tie which I will maintain with its due." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Abdullah Amr bin Al-Aas, may Allah be pleased with them, he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, openly, not secretly, say: "Indeed, the family of so-and-so are not my allies. My allies are Allah and the righteous believers. But they have a kinship which I will maintain with its due ties." (Agreed upon. The wording is Bukhari's). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Ayyub Khalid bin Zayd al-Ansari, may Allah be pleased with him, that a man said: "O Messenger of Allah, tell me of a deed that will admit me to Paradise and distance me from the Fire." The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "You worship Allah, and you do not associate anything with Him, and you establish the prayer, and you give the zakah, and you maintain the ties of kinship." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Narrated by Salman bin Amir (may Allah be pleased with him), from the Prophet (peace be upon him) who said: "When one of you breaks his fast, let him break it with dates, for they are blessed. If he does not have dates, then with water, for it is purifying." And he said: "Charity to a poor person is charity, and charity to a relative is two: charity and kinship." (Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and he said: Hadith Hassan). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, he said: I had a wife and I loved her, and Umar hated her. He said to me: Divorce her. I refused. Umar, may Allah be pleased with him, came to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and mentioned that to him. So the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "Divorce her." (Narrated by Abu Dawud and Tirmidhi, who said: It is a hasan sahih hadith.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu ad-Darda, may Allah be pleased with him, that a man came to him and said: "I have a wife, and my mother orders me to divorce her?" He said: "I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: 'The father is the middle of the gates of Paradise. If you wish, you may neglect that gate, or you may guard it.'" (Narrated by Tirmidhi and said: Hasan Sahih Hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Al-Bara' bin Azib, may Allah be pleased with them both, from the Prophet, peace be upon him, he said: "The maternal aunt is in the position of the mother." (Narrated by Tirmidhi, who said: A good, authentic hadith). In this chapter, there are many famous hadiths in the Sahih, including the hadith of the companions of the cave, and the hadith of Juraij, which have been mentioned before, and many famous hadiths in the Sahih which I have omitted for brevity. Among the most important of these is the long hadith of Amr bin Absah, may Allah be pleased with him, which includes many principles of Islam and its manners. I will mention it in full, if Allah wills, in the chapter on hope. In it, he said: I entered upon the Prophet, peace be upon him, in Mecca, meaning in the beginning of prophethood, and I said to him: "What are you?" He said: "A prophet." I said: "And what is a prophet?" He said: "Allah Almighty has sent me." I said: "With what has He sent you?" He said: "He has sent me with maintaining kinship ties, breaking idols, and worshipping Allah alone without associating anything with Him." (The full hadith is mentioned. And Allah knows best). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Bakrah Nafi' bin Al-Harith, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "Shall I not inform you of the greatest of sins?" three times. We said: "Yes, O Messenger of Allah." He said: "Associating partners with Allah, and undutifulness to parents." He was reclining, so he sat up and said: "And the false word and the false testimony." He kept repeating it until we said: "We wish he would stop." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-Aas, may Allah be pleased with them both, from the Prophet, peace be upon him, he said: "The major sins are: associating others with Allah, disobeying parents, killing a soul, and the false oath." (Narrated by Al-Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Among the major sins is a man reviling his parents!" They said: "O Messenger of Allah, does a man revile his parents?" He said: "Yes; he insults a man's father, so that man insults his father, and he insults a man's mother, so that man insults his mother." (Agreed upon). And in another narration: "Indeed, among the greatest of major sins is a man cursing his parents!" It was said: "O Messenger of Allah, how does a man curse his parents?" He said: "He insults a man's father, so that man insults his father, and he insults a man's mother, so that man insults his mother." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Muhammad Jubayr ibn Mut'im (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "No one who severs ties will enter Paradise." Sufyan, in his narration, said: meaning, one who severs ties of kinship. (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of Abu Isa Al-Mughira ibn Shu'bah, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, peace be upon him, who said: "Allah has forbidden you to disobey your mothers, to bury your daughters alive, and to be stingy or to take what is not yours. He dislikes for you idle talk, excessive questioning, and the wasting of wealth." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, that the Prophet, peace be upon him, said: "The best of righteousness is that a man should keep good relations with the friends of his father." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abdullah bin Dinar, from Abdullah bin Omar (may Allah be pleased with them both), that an Arab man met him on the road to Mecca. Abdullah bin Omar greeted him, mounted him on a donkey he was riding, and gave him a turban he had on his head. Ibn Dinar said: "So we said to him: May Allah reform you, they are Arabs and they are satisfied with little." So Abdullah bin Omar said: "The father of this man was a friend to Omar bin Al-Khattab (may Allah be pleased with him), and I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) say: 'Indeed, the most righteous of righteousness is a man maintaining ties with the family of his father's friend.'" In another narration from Ibn Dinar, from Ibn Omar, that when he went to Mecca, he had a donkey on which he would rest when he tired of riding the camel, and a turban with which he would tie his head. So one day, while he was on that donkey, an Arab man passed by him, and said: "Are you not the son of so-and-so, son of so-and-so?" He said: "Yes." So he gave him the donkey and said: "Ride this," and gave him the turban and said: "Tie your head with this." Then some of his companions said to him: "May Allah forgive you, you gave this Arab man a donkey on which you used to rest, and a turban with which you used to tie your head?" He said: "I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) say: 'Indeed, among the most righteous of righteousness is a man maintaining ties with the family of his father's friend after his father has passed away.'" And his father was a friend of Omar (may Allah be pleased with him). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Usayd - with a dammah on the hamza and a fatha on the seen - Malik bin Rabi'ah As-Sa'idi, may Allah be pleased with him, said: While we were sitting with the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, a man from Banu Salamah came to him and said: "O Messenger of Allah, is there any good I can still do for my parents after their death?" He said: "Yes, praying for them, seeking forgiveness for them, fulfilling their promises after they are gone, maintaining the ties of kinship that can only be maintained through them, and honoring their friends." (Narrated by Abu Dawud). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her) who said: I was not jealous of any of the wives of the Prophet (may Allah bless him and grant him peace) as much as I was jealous of Khadijah (may Allah be pleased with her). I never saw her, but he used to mention her often. Sometimes he would slaughter a sheep, cut it into pieces, and send them to Khadijah's friends. So I would say to him: "It is as if there was no one in the world but Khadijah!" He would say: "She was like this and like that, and I had children from her." (Agreed upon) In another narration: "He would slaughter a sheep and send from its meat as much as they could take to her friends." In another narration: "When he slaughtered a sheep, he would say: 'Send it to Khadijah's friends.'" In another narration, she said: Halah bint Khuwaylid, Khadijah's sister, asked permission to enter upon the Messenger of Allah (may Allah bless him and grant him peace). He recognized Khadijah's (request for) permission, and he was pleased with that, so he said: "O Allah, Halah bint Khuwaylid." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas bin Malik (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that he went on a journey with Jarir bin Abdullah Al-Bajali (may Allah be pleased with him), and Jarir served him. Anas said to him, "Do not do this." Jarir replied, "I have seen the Ansar do something for the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) that made me vow not to accompany anyone of them without serving him." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Yazid bin Hayyan narrated: I, Husain bin Sabrah, and Amr bin Muslim went to Zaid bin Arqam (may Allah be pleased with him). When we sat with him, Husain said to him: "O Zaid, you have encountered much good. You saw the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him), heard his sayings, fought with him, and prayed behind him. You have encountered much good, O Zaid. Narrate to us what you heard from the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him)." Zaid said: "My nephew, by Allah, my age has grown, my time has passed, and I have forgotten some of what I used to remember from the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him). So, accept what I narrate to you, and do not compel me to narrate what I do not." Then he said: "The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) stood up one day among us as a preacher at a place called Khumm, between Mecca and Medina. He praised Allah, glorified Him, admonished, and reminded. Then he said: 'After this, O people, I am but a human being, and soon the messenger of my Lord will come and I will answer. I am leaving among you two weighty things. The first is the Book of Allah, in it is guidance and light. So take the Book of Allah and hold on to it.' He encouraged the Book of Allah and made it desirable. Then he said: 'And my household, I remind you of Allah regarding my household, I remind you of Allah regarding my household.'" Husain said to him: "Who are his household, O Zaid? Are not his wives part of his household?" He said: "His wives are part of his household, but his household are those who are forbidden from charity after him." He asked: "And who are they?"
