He said: "They are the family of Ali, the family of Aqeel, the family of Ja'far, and the family of Abbas." He asked: "Are all of these forbidden from charity?" He said: "Yes." (Narrated by Muslim).

In another narration: "Indeed, I am leaving among you two weighty things: one is the Book of Allah, and the rope of Allah. Whoever follows it will be on guidance, and whoever abandaves it will be on misguidance." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, from Abu Bakr, may Allah be pleased with him, in aوقف (mowqoof) narration to him that he said: "Guard Muhammad, peace be upon him, concerning his household." (Narrated by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Mas'ud Uqbah bin Amr Al-Badri Al-Ansari, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The one who leads the people in prayer is the one who is the most knowledgeable of the Book of Allah. If they are equal in recitation, then the one who is most knowledgeable of the Sunnah. If they are equal in the Sunnah, then the one who is the earliest to emigrate. If they are equal in emigration, then the one who is the oldest. A man should not lead another man in prayer in his authority, nor should he sit in his house on his honor except with his permission." (Narrated by Muslim). And in another narration by him: "Then the one who is the oldest of them in Islam" instead of "oldest in age" or "Islam". And in another narration: The one who leads the people in prayer is the most knowledgeable of the Book of Allah, and the earliest in recitation. If their recitation is equal, then the one who is the earliest to emigrate leads them. If they are equal in emigration, then the oldest among them should lead them in prayer. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, used to touch our shoulders in prayer and say: "Straighten up and do not diverge, lest your hearts diverge. Let those among you who are of sound minds and understanding be next to me, then those who follow them." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abdullah bin Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Let those among you who are of sound mind and good understanding come next to me, then those who follow them." Three times: "And beware of the clamor of the markets." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Yahya, and it was said: Abu Muhammad Sahl ibn Abi Hathmah - with the fat-hah on the haa and sukūn on the thaa - al-Ansari, may Allah be pleased with him, said: Abdullah ibn Sahl and Muhayisah ibn Mas'ud went to Khaybar, and it was a truce. They separated, and Muhayisah came to Abdullah ibn Sahl, who was writhing in his blood, killed. So he buried him, then he came to Medina. Then Abdur-Rahman ibn Sahl, and Muhayisah and Huwaysah, sons of Mas'ud, went to the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him. Abdur-Rahman started to speak, so he said: "The elder, the elder," and he was the youngest of the people, so he fell silent. Then they spoke, and he said: "Will you swear and make your killer deserving (of punishment)?" And the rest of the hadith was mentioned. (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Jabir, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, used to bury two men from the martyrs of Uhud together in one grave, then he would say: "Which of them had taken more of the Quran?" And when one of them was pointed out to him, he would put him in the grave first. (Narrated by Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, that the Prophet, peace be upon him, said: "I saw myself in a dream brushing my teeth with a siwak. Two men came to me, one older than the other. I gave the siwak to the younger one, and it was said to me: 'Give it to the older one.' So I gave it to the older of them." (Narrated by Muslim and Bukhari in a suspended narration). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Musa, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Indeed, among the veneration of Allah the Almighty is honoring the elderly Muslim, and the carrier of the Quran who is not excessive in it nor deviates from it, and honoring the just ruler." (A hasan hadith narrated by Abu Dawud). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Amr ibn Shu'ayb, from his father, from his grandfather, may Allah be pleased with them, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "He is not one of us who does not show mercy to our young and does not know the honor of our elders." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Maymun ibn Abi Shabib, may Allah have mercy on him, that Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, an Imam, passed by a beggar and gave him a piece of bread. And a man passed by her wearing fine clothes and appearance, so she sat him down and he ate. She was asked about that, and she said: "Allah's Messenger, peace and blessings be upon him, said: 'Treat people according to their status.'" (Narrated by Abu Dawud). But Maymun said that he did not meet Aisha. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, he said: Uyaynah bin Hisn arrived and stayed with his nephew Al-Hurr bin Qais, who was among those whom Umar, may Allah be pleased with him, brought close to him. The readers, whether old or young, were the companions of Umar's council and consultation. So Uyaynah said to his nephew: "O my nephew, you have a standing with this prince, so ask permission for me to see him." So he asked permission for him, and Umar, may Allah be pleased with him, granted permission. When he entered, he said: "O son of Al-Khattab, by Allah, you do not give us the substantial, nor do you judge us with justice." Umar, may Allah be pleased with him, became angry to the point that he intended to strike him. So Al-Hurr said to him: "O Commander of the Faithful, Allah, the Most High, said to his Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him: '{Take to forgiveness, and enjoin good, and turn away from the ignorant.}' (7:199) And this is one of the ignorant." By Allah, Umar did not go beyond this when it was recited to him, for he was one who would stop at the Book of Allah, the Most High. (Narrated by Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Sa'id Samura bin Jundab (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: "I was a young boy during the time of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him), and I used to memorize from him. Nothing prevented me from speaking except that there were men here older than me." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "No young man honors an elder for his age, but Allah appoints someone to honor him in his old age." (Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi, who said it is a strange hadith.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that Abu Bakr (may Allah be pleased with him) said to Umar (may Allah be pleased with them) after the death of the Messenger of Allah (may Allah bless him and grant him peace): "Let us go to Umm Ayman (may Allah be pleased with her) to visit her, as the Messenger of Allah (may Allah bless him and grant him peace) used to visit her." When they reached her, she wept. They said to her, "What makes you weep? Do you not know that what is with Allah is better for the Messenger of Allah (may Allah bless him and grant him peace)?" She replied, "I do not weep because I do not know that what is with Allah Almighty is better for the Messenger of Allah (may Allah bless him and grant him peace), but I weep because the revelation has been cut off from the sky." This moved them to tears, and they began to weep with her. (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him, that a man visited his brother in another village. So Allah, the Almighty, appointed a guardian angel on his path. When he reached him, he said: "Where are you going?" He said: "I am going to my brother in this village." He said: "Do you have any favor to ask of him that you are repaying?" He said: "No, except that I love him for the sake of Allah, the Almighty." He said: "Then I am a messenger from Allah to you, that Allah has loved you as you loved him for His sake." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever visits a sick person or visits a brother of his for the sake of Allah, a caller will call out to him, saying: 'May you be well, may your path be well, and may you occupy a dwelling in Paradise.'" (Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi, who said: It is a hasan hadith, and in some versions ghareeb.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Musa Al-Ash'ari (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The example of a good companion and a bad companion is like that of the seller of musk and the blacksmith. As for the seller of musk, he will either give you some as a gift, or you will buy some from him, or you will find a good fragrance from him. And as for the blacksmith, he will either burn your clothes, or you will find a bad odor from him." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him), from the Prophet (peace be upon him), he said: "A woman is married for four things: for her wealth, for her lineage, for her beauty, and for her religion; so take the one who is religious, may your hands be rubbed with dust." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Abbas, may God be pleased with them, he said: The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said to Gabriel: What prevents you from visiting us more often than you do? Then it was revealed: "And we do not descend except by the command of your Lord. To Him belongs what is before us and what is behind us and what is between them." (Narrated by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Sa'id al-Khudri, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, he said: "Keep company only with a believer, and let only a God-fearing person eat your food." (Reported by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi with a sound chain of narration.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him, said: "A man follows the religion of his friend, so let one of you look at whom he befriends." (Narrated by Abu Dawud and Tirmidhi with a sound chain of narration, and Tirmidhi said: This is a hasan hadith.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Musa Al-Ash'ari, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "A person will be with whomever he loves." (Agreed upon). And in another narration, he said: It was said to the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him: A man loves a people but has not joined them? He said: "A person will be with whomever he loves." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported that a Bedouin said to the Messenger of Allah (may Allah bless him and grant him peace): "When is the Hour?" The Messenger of Allah (may Allah bless him and grant him peace) said: "What have you prepared for it?" He said: "Love of Allah and His Messenger." He said: "You will be with whom you love." (Agreed upon) This is the wording of Muslim. In another narration for both, it says: "Not much fasting, nor prayer, nor charity, but I love Allah and His Messenger." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: A man came to the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, and said: O Messenger of Allah, what do you say about a man who loves a people but has not joined them? The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "A man is with whom he loves." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him, he said: "People are like mines of gold and silver. The best among them in the time of ignorance are the best among them in Islam, when they gain understanding. And souls are assembled hosts. Those that recognized each other from among them, they fraternized, and those that did not recognize each other from among them, they differed." (Narrated by Muslim). (Narrated by Bukhari) his saying: "Souls" from the narration of Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Usayr bin Amr, and it is said: Ibn Jabir, and it is with a dammah on the hamzah and a fatha on the seen, that he said: When reinforcements from the people of Yemen came to Umar bin Al-Khattab, he would ask them: "Is Uways bin Amir among you?" until he came upon Uways, may Allah be pleased with him, and said to him: "Are you Uways bin Amir?" He said: "Yes." He said: "From Murad, then from Qaran?" He said: "Yes." He said: "Did you have vitiligo, and you were cured of it except for the spot of a dirham?" He said: "Yes." He said: "Do you have a mother?" He said: "Yes." He said: "I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: 'Uways bin Amir will come to you with reinforcements from the people of Yemen, from Murad, then from Qaran. He had vitiligo, and he was cured of it except for the spot of a dirham. He has a mother, to whom he is dutiful. If he swore by Allah, He would fulfill it for him. So if you can have him ask for forgiveness for you, then do so.'" So he asked for forgiveness for him, and he asked for forgiveness for him. Umar said to him: "Where are you going?" He said: "To Kufa." He said: "Shall I not write to its governor for you?" He said: "I prefer to be among the humble people." When it was the following year, a man from their nobles performed Hajj and met Umar, and asked him about Uways. He said: "I left him with a poor dwelling and little possessions." He said: "I heard the Messenger of Allah say: 'Uways bin Amir will come to you with reinforcements from the people of Yemen, from Murad, then from Qaran. He had vitiligo and was cured of it except for the spot of a dirham. He has a mother, to whom he is dutiful. If he swore by Allah, He would fulfill it for him. So if you can have him ask for forgiveness for you, then do so.'" So he went to Uways and said: "Ask forgiveness for me." He said: "You are newly returned from a righteous journey. Ask forgiveness for me." He said: "Did you meet Umar?" He said: "Yes." So he asked for forgiveness for him, and the people realized who he was, and he set off on his way. (Narrated by Muslim). And in another narration by Muslim, from Usayr bin Jabir, may Allah be pleased with him, that the people of Kufa came to Umar, may Allah be pleased with him, and among them was a man who used to mock Uways. So Umar said: "Is anyone from Qaran here?" So that man came, and Umar said: "The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, has said: 'A man will come to you from Yemen called Uways. He has no one in Yemen except a mother, and he had a white spot, so he supplicated to Allah, and it went away except for the spot of a dinar or a dirham. So whoever meets him among you, let him ask for forgiveness for you.'" And in a narration by him from Umar, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: "I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: 'The best of the Tabi'un is a man called Uways. He has a mother and he had a white spot. So tell him to ask for forgiveness for you.'" [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from 'Umar bin Al-Khattab (may Allah be pleased with him) that he said: "I sought permission from the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) to perform 'Umrah, and he gave me permission and said: 'Do not forget us in your supplications, O my brother.' He said a word that I would not be pleased to have the whole world in exchange for it. In another narration, he said: 'Include us in your supplications, O my brother.'" A Hadith is authentic (Reported by Abu Dawud and At-Tirmidhi, who said it is Hasan Sahih). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, who said: The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, used to visit Quba, riding or walking, and pray two rak'ahs there. (Agreed upon). And in another narration: The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, used to come to the mosque of Quba every Saturday, riding or walking, and Ibn 'Umar used to do that. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Anas, may God be pleased with him, from the Prophet, may God's peace and blessings be upon him, he said: "Three things, if they are in a person, he will find the sweetness of faith in them: that Allah and His Messenger are dearer to him than anything else, that he loves a person and does not love him except for the sake of Allah, and that he hates to return to disbelief after Allah has saved him from it, just as he hates to be thrown into the fire." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, peace be upon him, he said: "Seven are the ones whom Allah will shade on the Day of Resurrection, when there is no shade but His: the just ruler; a young man who grew up in the worship of Allah, the Mighty and Majestic; a man whose heart is attached to the mosques; two men who love each other for the sake of Allah, meeting and parting upon that; a man whom a woman of status and beauty tempted, but he said, 'Indeed, I fear Allah'; a man who gives charity and conceals it, such that his left hand does not know what his right hand spends; and a man who remembered Allah in seclusion and his eyes overflowed with tears." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God's prayers and peace be upon him, said: "Allah the Almighty will say on the Day of Resurrection: 'Where are those who loved each other for My sake?' Today I will shade them in My shade, on a day when there is no shade but My shade.'" (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "By Him in Whose hand is my soul, you will not enter Paradise until you believe, and you will not believe until you love one another. Shall I not guide you to something that, if you do it, you will love one another? Spread peace among yourselves." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "A man visited his brother in another village, and Allah appointed an angel for him on his path." and the hadith was mentioned until his saying: "Indeed, Allah has loved you as you have loved him for His sake." (Narrated by Muslim, and it was previously mentioned in the chapter before this.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Al-Bara' bin Azib, may Allah be pleased with them both, from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, that he said concerning the Ansar: "None but a believer loves them, and none but a hypocrite hates them. Whoever loves them, Allah loves him, and whoever hates them, Allah hates him." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Mu'adh, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) say: Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, said: "Those who love one another for My sake, will have minbars of light, and the Prophets and martyrs will envy them." (Tirmidhi narrated it and said: It is a Hasan Sahih Hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Idris Al-Khawlani, may Allah have mercy on him, he said: I entered the mosque of Damascus, and there was a young man with shining front teeth, and people were with him. When they differed on something, they referred it to him, and they acted upon his opinion. So I asked about him, and it was said: This is Mu'adh ibn Jabal, may Allah be pleased with him. The next day, I went early in the morning, and I found him already there before me, and I found him praying. So I waited for him until he finished his prayer. Then I approached him from the front, and greeted him, then I said: By Allah, I love you. He said: By Allah? I said: By Allah. He said: By Allah? I said: By Allah. Then he took hold of the hem of my garment and pulled me towards him, and said: Be glad, for I heard the Messenger of Allah, may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him, say: Allah the Almighty said: "My love is incumbent upon those who love each other for My sake, those who sit together for My sake, those who visit each other for My sake, and those who spend for My sake." A Hadith is authentic (Narrated by Malik in Al-Muwatta with an authentic chain). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Abu Karimah Al-Miqdad bin Ma'd Yakrib, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, peace be upon him, who said: "If a man loves his brother, he should tell him that he loves him." (Reported by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said it is a hasan hadith.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Mu'adh (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) took his hand and said: "O Mu'adh, by Allah, I love you. Then I advise you, O Mu'adh, do not fail to say after every prayer: 'O Allah, help me to remember You, to thank You, and to worship You in the best manner.'" A Saheeh Hadith. (Reported by Abu Dawud and An-Nasa'i with a Saheeh chain of narration). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, that a man was with the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, when a man passed by him. He said: "O Messenger of Allah, I love this man." The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said to him: "Have you told him?" He said: "No." He said: "Tell him." So he caught up with him and said: "I love you for the sake of Allah." He said: "May Allah love you, for whom you loved me." (Narrated by Abu Dawood with a Sahih chain of narration). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "Allah the Almighty said: 'Whoever shows enmity to a friend of Mine, I shall declare war against him. My servant does not draw near to Me with anything more beloved to Me than what I have made obligatory upon him. My servant continues to draw near to Me with voluntary acts of worship until I love him. And when I love him, I become his hearing with which he hears, his sight with which he sees, his hand with which he strikes, and his foot with which he walks. If he asks Me, I will give him, and if he seeks refuge in Me, I will grant him refuge.'" (Reported by Al-Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, from the Prophet, peace be upon him, he said: "When Allah loves a servant, He calls Gabriel and says: 'Allah loves so-and-so, so love him.' Then Gabriel loves him, and calls among the inhabitants of the heaven: 'Allah loves so-and-so, so love him.' Then the inhabitants of heaven love him, and he is accepted on earth." (Agreed upon) In a narration by Muslim: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "When Allah loves a servant, He calls Gabriel and says: 'I love so-and-so, so love him.' Then Gabriel loves him, and calls among the inhabitants of the heaven, saying: 'Allah loves so-and-so, so love him.' Then the inhabitants of heaven love him, and he is accepted on earth. And when Allah hates a servant, He calls Gabriel and says: 'I hate so-and-so, so hate him.' Then Gabriel hates him, and calls among the inhabitants of the heaven, saying: 'Allah hates so-and-so, so hate him.' Then he is hated on earth." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, sent a man to lead a detachment. He used to recite to his companions in their prayers, and he would conclude with "Say: He is Allah, the One and Only." When they returned, they mentioned this to the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him. He said: "Ask him why he used to do that?" So they asked him, and he said: "Because it is the description of the Most Merciful, and I love to recite it." The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Tell him that Allah, the Exalted, loves him." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Jundub bin Abdullah, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever prays the morning prayer, he is under the protection of Allah. So do not let Allah seek anything from you from His protection, for whoever Allah seeks anything from His protection, He will overtake him, and then cast him down on his face into the Hellfire." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "I have been ordered to fight people until they testify that there is no god but Allah, and that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah, and they establish prayer, and they give charity. If they do that, they have protected their blood and wealth from me, except by the right of Islam, and their reckoning is with Allah the Almighty." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Abdullah Tariq bin Ashim, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) say: "Whoever says there is no god but Allah, and disbelieves in what is worshipped besides Allah, his blood and his property are forbidden, and his reckoning is with Allah the Almighty." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu al-Miqdad ibn al-Aswad, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: I said to the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him: What do you think if I encounter a disbeliever and we fight, and he strikes one of my hands with a sword and cuts it off, then he takes refuge behind a tree and says: "I have submitted to Allah." Should I kill him, O Messenger of Allah, after he has said that? He said: "Do not kill him. If you kill him, then he is in your position before you killed him, and you are in his position before he said the word he said." (Agreed upon)

(And the meaning of "he is in your position" is: his blood is protected and he is judged to be a Muslim. And the meaning of "you are in his position" is: your blood is permissible to be shed by retribution for his heirs, not that he is in your position in disbelief; and Allah knows best). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Usama ibn Zayd, may Allah be pleased with them both, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, sent us to al-Harqah of Juhaynah. We came upon the people at their water sources, and I and a man from the Ansar caught up with a man from them. When we reached him, he said: "There is no god but Allah." The Ansari man stopped, but I stabbed him with my spear until I killed him. When we arrived in Medina, this reached the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, and he said to me: "O Usama, did you kill him after he said 'There is no god but Allah'?" I said: "O Messenger of Allah, he only said it to seek refuge." He said: "Did you kill him after he said 'There is no god but Allah'?" He kept repeating it to me until I wished I had not embraced Islam before that day. (Agreed upon) And in another narration: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Did he say 'There is no god but Allah' and you killed him? I said: 'O Messenger of Allah, he only said it out of fear of the weapon.' He said: 'Then why did you not open his heart to see if he said it or not?'" He kept repeating it until I wished I had embraced Islam on that day. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Jundub bin Abdullah, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, sent a detachment of Muslims to a group of polytheists, and they met. A man from the polytheists, when he wished to target a Muslim, would target him and kill him. And a man from the Muslims targeted him when he was unaware, and we used to say that it was Usama bin Zayd. When he raised his sword against him, he said, "There is no god but Allah," and he killed him. The messenger came to the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, and he asked him and informed him, until he informed him of the story of the man and what he did. So he called him and asked him, and he said: "Why did you kill him?" He said: O Messenger of Allah, he caused great harm to the Muslims, and he killed so-and-so and so-and-so - and he named a number of people - and I attacked him. When he saw the sword, he said, "There is no god but Allah." The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Did you kill him?" He said: Yes. He said: "Then what will you do with 'There is no god but Allah' when it comes on the Day of Resurrection?" He said: O Messenger of Allah, ask forgiveness for me. He said: "Then what will you do with 'There is no god but Allah' when it comes on the Day of Resurrection?" He kept repeating: "What will you do with 'There is no god but Allah' when it comes on the Day of Resurrection?" (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abdullah bin Utbah bin Mas'ud, he said: I heard Umar bin Al-Khattab, may Allah be pleased with him, say: "People used to be held accountable by revelation during the time of the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, and revelation has ceased. Now we hold them accountable by what becomes apparent to us of your deeds. Whoever shows us good, we trust them and draw them near, and we have nothing to do with their hidden intentions. Allah will judge them for their hidden intentions. And whoever shows us evil, we do not trust them, nor do we believe them, even if they say their hidden intentions are good." (Reported by Al-Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, told us, and he is the truthful, the confirmed: "Verily, one of you is formed in his mother's womb as a drop of fluid for forty days, then he becomes a clinging mass like that, then he becomes a lump of flesh like that. Then an angel is sent to him, and he breathes the spirit into him and is commanded with four words: his sustenance is written, his lifespan, his deeds, and whether he is wretched or blessed. By the One besides Whom there is no god, one of you may do the deeds of the people of Paradise until there is nothing between him and it but a cubit, but the Decree overtakes him and he does the deeds of the people of the Fire, and enters it. And one of you may do the deeds of the people of the Fire until there is nothing between him and it but a cubit, but the Decree overtakes him and he does the deeds of the people of Paradise, and enters it." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Hell will be brought on that day, having seventy thousand reins, with each rein seventy thousand angels pulling it." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Al-Nu'man bin Bashir, may Allah be pleased with them both, he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "The person who will have the lightest torment on the Day of Resurrection is a man who will be made to wear two coals in the soles of his feet, and his brain will boil from them. He will not think that anyone else is suffering more than him, yet he will be the one with the lightest torment." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Samura bin Jundub, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Some of them the Fire will take up to their ankles, and some it will take up to their knees, and some it will take up to their waists, and some it will take up to their collarbones." (Reported by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, that the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "People will stand before the Lord of the worlds until one of them is submerged in his sweat up to the middle of his ears." (Agreed upon) (And ar-rashḥ: sweat). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported that the Messenger of Allah (may Allah bless him and grant him peace) delivered a sermon the like of which I had never heard before. He said: "If you knew what I know, you would laugh little and weep much." The Companions of the Messenger of Allah (may Allah bless him and grant him peace) covered their faces and were sobbing. (Agreed upon) In another narration, it is reported that something reached the Messenger of Allah (may Allah bless him and grant him peace) about his Companions, so he delivered a sermon and said: "Paradise and Hell were shown to me, and I have never seen anything like this day in good and evil. If you knew what I know, you would laugh little and weep much." So the Companions of the Messenger of Allah (may Allah bless him and grant him peace) did not experience a day harder than that. They covered their heads and were sobbing. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Al-Miqdad, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "On the Day of Resurrection, the sun will draw near to the creation until it is a distance of one mile from them." Sulaym bin 'Amir, the narrator from Al-Miqdad, said: "By Allah, I do not know what he meant by a mile, whether it is the distance of the earth or the kohl that is used to adorn the eye." Then people will be in their sweat according to their deeds. Some will be up to their ankles, some up to their knees, some up to their waists, and some will be bridled by sweat." And the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, gestured with his hand to his mouth. (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "People will sweat on the Day of Resurrection until their sweat goes into the earth seventy cubits, and it will bridle them until it reaches their ears." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: We were with the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, when he heard a crash, and he said: "Do you know what this is?" We said: Allah and His Messenger know best. He said: This is a stone that was thrown into the fire seventy years ago, and it has been falling in the fire until it reached its bottom, so you heard its crash." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Adi bin Hatim, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "None of you will speak to his Lord except that He will speak to him without an interpreter between them. He will look to his right and see nothing but what he has sent forward. He will look to his left and see nothing but what he has sent forward. He will look in front of him and see nothing but the Fire facing him. So fear the Fire, even by giving half a date." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Dharr, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "I see what you do not see; the heaven groaned, and it was right for it to groan. There is not a space of four fingers in it but that an angel has his forehead placed in prostration to Allah the Almighty. By Allah, if you knew what I know, you would laugh little and weep much, and you would not enjoy women on beds, and you would go out into the open spaces crying out to Allah the Almighty." (Narrated by Tirmidhi and said: A hasan hadith). And "att" with the opening of the hamza and the shaddah on the ta', and "ta'itt" with the opening of the ta' and a hamza with a kasra after it. And "ateet" is the sound of the saddle and the pack-saddle and the like, and its meaning is that the abundance of worshipping angels in the heaven has made it heavy, so it groaned. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Burzah - with a Baa' and then a Zay - Nudhlah bin 'Ubaid Al-Aslami, may Allah be pleased with him, said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The feet of a servant will not move on the Day of Resurrection until he is asked about his life, how he spent it; about his knowledge, what he did with it; about his wealth, from where he earned it and how he spent it; and about his body, in what he wore it out." (Narrated by At-Tirmidhi and said: It is a Hasan Sahih Hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, recited: "That Day it will report its news." Then he said: "Do you know what its news is?" They said: "Allah and His Messenger know best." He said: "Its news is that it will bear witness for every male and female servant about what they did on its surface, saying: 'So-and-so did such-and-such on such-and-such a day.' These are its news." (Tirmidhi narrated it and said: It is a Hasan Sahih Hadith.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Sa'id al-Khudri, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "How can I be at ease when the one holding the horn has already taken it into his mouth and listened, waiting to be ordered to blow, so he blows?" It was as if this weighed heavily on the companions of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, so he said to them: "Say: Allah is sufficient for us, and He is the best Disposer of affairs." (Narrated by Tirmidhi, who said it is a hasan hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever fears travels by night, and whoever travels by night reaches the destination. Verily, the merchandise of Allah is expensive. Verily, the merchandise of Allah is Paradise." (Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi, who said: A hasan hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, that she said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "People will be gathered on the Day of Resurrection barefoot, naked, and uncircumcised." I said: "O Messenger of Allah, men and women all looking at each other?" He said: "O Aisha, the matter is too grave for them to be concerned about that." And in another narration: "The matter is more important than them looking at each other." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ubadah ibn As-Samit, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever testifies that there is no god but Allah alone, without a partner, and that Muhammad is His servant and His Messenger, and that Jesus is the servant of Allah and His Messenger, and His word which He cast to Mary, and a spirit from Him, and that Paradise is true and Hellfire is true, Allah will admit him to Paradise, whatever his deeds may have been." (Agreed upon) And in a narration by Muslim: "Whoever testifies that there is no god but Allah, and that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah, Hellfire will be forbidden to him." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Dharr, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, says: Whoever comes with a good deed, he shall have ten times its like or more. And whoever comes with an evil deed, the recompense of an evil deed is an evil deed like it, or I shall forgive. And whoever draws near to Me by a span, I draw near to him by a cubit. And whoever draws near to Me by a cubit, I draw near to him by a fathom. And whoever comes to Me walking, I come to him with haste. And whoever meets Me with sins filling the earth, but does not associate anything with Me, I shall meet him with forgiveness like that." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Jabir narrated: A Bedouin came to the Prophet and said: "O Messenger of Allah, what are the two things that make one deserving?" He said: "Whoever dies not associating anything with Allah will enter Paradise, and whoever dies associating anything with Him will enter Hell." Narrated by Muslim. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Narrated by Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, while Mu'adh was riding behind him on the mount, said: "O Mu'adh." He said: "Here I am, O Messenger of Allah, and at your service." He said: "O Mu'adh." He said: "Here I am, O Messenger of Allah, and at your service." He said: "O Mu'adh." He said: "Here I am, O Messenger of Allah, and at your service," three times. He said: "There is no servant who testifies that there is no god but Allah, and that Muhammad is His servant and His Messenger, truthfully from his heart, but Allah will forbid him from the Fire." He said: "O Messenger of Allah, shall I not inform the people so that they may rejoice?" He said: "Then they will rely on it." Mu'adh informed people of it at his death for fear of sin. (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah - or Abu Sa'id al-Khudri - may Allah be pleased with them both: The narrator was in doubt, and doubt about the specific Companion does not harm, for they are all upright. He said: During the expedition of Tabuk, the people were afflicted with famine, so they said: "O Messenger of Allah, if you permit us, we shall slaughter our camels and eat their meat and use their fat." The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "Do so." Then Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) came and said: "O Messenger of Allah, if you do so, the backs will be weakened. But call them with the remainder of their provisions, and then supplicate to Allah for them with blessings, so that Allah may place blessings in it." The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "Yes." So he called for a large leather mat, and it was spread out. Then he called for the remainder of their provisions, and a man would come with a handful of barley, and another would come with a handful of dates, and another would come with a piece of bread, until a small amount of that gathered on the mat. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) supplicated for blessings. Then he said: "Take it into your containers." So they took it into their containers until there was no container in the camp that they did not fill. And they ate until they were full, and there was some left over. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "I bear witness that there is no god but Allah, and that I am the Messenger of Allah. No servant meets Allah with these two (testimonies) without doubt, and then he will be kept from Paradise." (Reported by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Uthban bin Malik, may Allah be pleased with him, who was among those who participated in Badr, that he said: "I used to lead my people, the Bani Salim, in prayer. A valley separated me from them, and when it rained, it was difficult for me to cross it to reach their mosque. So I came to the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, and said to him: 'My eyesight has worsened, and the valley between me and my people overflows with rain, making it difficult to cross. I wish you would come and pray in my house, in a place I would take as a prayer place.' The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: 'I will do that.' The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, and Abu Bakr, may Allah be pleased with him, came after the day had become hot. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, asked for permission to enter, and I granted him permission. He did not sit down until he asked: 'Where in your house would you like me to pray?' I pointed to the place where I wanted him to pray. The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, stood up, said the Takbir, and we lined up behind him. He prayed two rak'ahs and then concluded the prayer with Taslim, and we concluded with Taslim when he did. I kept him for a Khazirah that was being prepared for him. The people of the house heard that the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, was in my house, so some men gathered until the house was full. Then a man said: 'What happened to Malik, I don't see him!' Another man said: 'He is a hypocrite; he does not love Allah and His Messenger.' The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: 'Do not say that. Do you not see that he said: "There is no god but Allah, seeking the countenance of Allah the Almighty?"' He said: 'Allah and His Messenger know best. As for us, by Allah, we do not see his affection or his speech except from hypocrites!' Then the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: 'Indeed, Allah has forbidden the Fire from anyone who says: "There is no god but Allah, seeking the countenance of Allah."' (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Umar ibn Al-Khattab, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, came with captives. Among the captives was a woman who was searching. She found a child among the captives and took him, pressed him to her stomach, and nursed him. So the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Do you think this woman would throw her child into the fire?" We said: "No, by Allah." He said: "Allah is more merciful to His servants than this mother is to her child." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "When Allah created the creation, He wrote in a book which is with Him above the Throne: 'Verily, My mercy overcomes My wrath.'" (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "Allah made mercy one hundred parts, and kept ninety-nine with Him, and sent down one part to the earth, and from that part, creatures show mercy to each other, to the extent that a beast lifts its hoof from its young for fear of hurting it."
And in another narration: "Indeed, Allah Almighty has one hundred mercies, from which He sent down one mercy between jinn, humans, beasts, and creeping things, and by it they are compassionate to each other, and by it they show mercy to each other, and by it the wild animal is compassionate to its young. And Allah Almighty has kept ninety-nine mercies with which He will show mercy to His servants on the Day of Resurrection." (Agreed upon)
Muslim also narrated it from the narration of Salman Al-Farisi, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Indeed, Allah Almighty has one hundred mercies, and from them is a mercy by which creation shows mercy to each other, and ninety-nine for the Day of Resurrection."
And in another narration: "Indeed, Allah Almighty created, on the day He created the heavens and the earth, one hundred mercies, each mercy being as vast as the distance between heaven and earth. He placed one mercy on earth, by which a mother is compassionate to her child, and wild animals and birds are compassionate to each other, and when the Day of Resurrection comes, He will complete it with this mercy." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, from the Prophet, peace be upon him, in what is narrated from his Lord, Blessed and Exalted is He, He said: "My servant committed a sin, and said: 'O Allah, forgive my sin.' So Allah, Blessed and Exalted is He, said: 'My servant committed a sin, and he knew that he had a Lord who forgives sins and punishes for sins.' Then he sinned again, and said: 'O Lord, forgive my sin.' So Blessed and Exalted is He, said: 'My servant committed a sin, and he knew that he had a Lord who forgives sins and punishes for sins.' Then he sinned again, and said: 'O Lord, forgive my sin.' So Blessed and Exalted is He, said: 'My servant committed a sin, and he knew that he had a Lord who forgives sins and punishes for sins. I have forgiven My servant, so let him do as he wills.'" (Agreed upon). And His saying, Blessed and Exalted is He: "so let him do as he wills" means: as long as he keeps doing this, sinning and repenting, I will forgive him, for repentance destroys what came before it. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him it is narrated, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "By Him in Whose hand is my soul, if you did not commit sins, Allah would take you away and bring a people who commit sins, then they would seek forgiveness from Allah the Almighty, and He would forgive them." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Ayyub Khalid bin Zaid, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "Were it not for the fact that you commit sins, Allah would have created a creation that commits sins, and they would seek forgiveness, and He would forgive them." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: We were sitting with the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, with Abu Bakr and Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, among a group of people. The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, stood up from among us and was delayed from us. We feared that he might be intercepted, so we became frightened and stood up. I was the first to become frightened, and I went out searching for the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, until I came to a garden of the Ansar. (And the hadith was mentioned at length until he said:) Then the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Go and whoever you meet behind this wall, testifying that there is no god but Allah, with his heart firmly believing it, then give him glad tidings of Paradise." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-Aas, may Allah be pleased with them both, that the Prophet, peace be upon him, recited the saying of Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, about Ibrahim, peace be upon him: "My Lord, they have led astray many of mankind. So whoever follows me, he is of me" (Ibrahim: 36), and the saying of Isa, peace be upon him: "If You punish them, they are Your servants; but if You forgive them, indeed You are the Exalted in Might, the Wise" (Al-Ma'idah: 118). Then he raised his hands and said: "O Allah, my Ummah, my Ummah," and he wept. Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, said: "O Gabriel, go to Muhammad, and your Lord knows best, and ask him what makes him weep?" Gabriel came to him, and the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, told him what he said, and He knew best. Allah the Almighty said: "O Gabriel, go to Muhammad and say: 'Indeed, We will please you concerning your Ummah and will not dissatisfy you.'" (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Mu'adh bin Jabal, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: "I was riding behind the Prophet, peace be upon him, on a donkey, and he said: 'O Mu'adh, do you know what is the right of Allah over His servants, and what is the right of the servants over Allah?' I said: 'Allah and His Messenger know best.' He said: 'The right of Allah over His servants is that they worship Him and associate nothing with Him, and the right of the servants over Allah is that He does not punish those who associate nothing with Him with anything. So I said: 'O Messenger of Allah, shall I not give glad tidings to the people?' He said: 'Do not give them glad tidings, lest they rely on it.'" (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of Al-Bara' bin Azib, may Allah be pleased with them both, from the Prophet, peace be upon him, who said: "When a Muslim is asked in the grave, he testifies that there is no god but Allah, and that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah. This is what Allah Almighty says: {Allah keeps firm those who believe with the firm word in worldly life and in the Hereafter} (Ibrahim: 27) (Agreed upon)." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, he said: "If the disbeliever does a good deed, he is rewarded with a portion of it in this world. As for the believer, Allah the Almighty stores his good deeds for him in the Hereafter and grants him sustenance in this world for his obedience." In another narration: "Allah does not wrong a believer for a good deed that he is rewarded for in this world and recompensed for in the Hereafter. As for the disbeliever, he is fed by the good deeds he has done for Allah the Almighty, in this world, until when he meets Allah in the Hereafter, he will have no good deed to be recompensed for." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Jabir, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The example of the five prayers is like a flowing river that is abundant at the door of one of you, from which he washes himself five times every day." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, say: "No Muslim man dies and forty men who do not associate anything with Allah stand over his funeral, but Allah will accept their intercession for him." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: We were with the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, in a tent, about forty of us. He said: "Do you accept to be a quarter of the people of Paradise?" We said: "Yes." He said: "Do you accept to be a third of the people of Paradise?" We said: "Yes." He said: "By Him in whose hand is my soul, I hope that you will be half the people of Paradise, and that is because only a Muslim soul will enter Paradise, and you among the polytheists are like a white hair on the hide of a black bull, or like a black hair on the hide of a red bull." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Musa Al-Ash'ari, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "On the Day of Resurrection, Allah will bring a Jew or a Christian to every Muslim and say: 'This is the ransom for you from the Fire.'" And in another narration from him, from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, he said: "On the Day of Resurrection, people from among the Muslims will come with sins like mountains, and Allah will forgive them." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "On the Day of Resurrection, the believer will be brought near to his Lord until He covers him with His protection and mercy. Then He will remind him of his sins, saying: 'Do you recognize such-and-such a sin? Do you recognize such-and-such a sin?' He will say: 'O my Lord, I recognize them.' Then He will say: 'Indeed, I have concealed them for you in this world, and today I forgive them for you.' Then he will be given his book of good deeds." (Agreed upon). (His protection and mercy). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him, that a man kissed a woman, then he came to the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, and told him, so Allah the Almighty revealed: "And establish prayer at the two ends of the day and at the approach of the night. Indeed, good deeds do away with evil deeds." (Hud: 114) The man said: Is this for me, O Messenger of Allah? He said: "For all of my Ummah, all of them." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated: A man came to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and said: "O Messenger of Allah, I have committed a sin for which I should be punished, so punish me." The prayer time arrived, and he prayed with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). When the prayer was finished, he said: "O Messenger of Allah, I have committed a sin for which I should be punished. Implement the Book of Allah upon me." He said: "Did you pray with us?" He said: "Yes." He said: "Your sin has been forgiven." (Agreed upon)

And his saying: "I have committed a sin" means: a sin that necessitates chastisement, and not the true legal Hadd punishment like the Hadd for adultery, wine, and others, because these Hadd punishments are not waived by prayer, and it is not permissible for the Imam to abandon them. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "Allah is pleased with a servant who eats a meal and praises Him for it, or drinks a drink and praises Him for it." (Narrated by Muslim). "Al-uklah" is with a fatha on the hamza, meaning one instance of eating, like Al-ghudwah and Al-ashwah, and Allah knows best. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Musa, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, peace be upon him, he said: "Verily, Allah the Almighty extends His Hand by night to accept the repentance of the one who has sinned during the day, and He extends His Hand by day to accept the repentance of the one who has sinned during the night, until the sun rises from the west." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Abu Nujayh, Amr bin Absah (with Fath on the 'Ain and Ba') Al-Sulami, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: When I was in the pre-Islamic period, I thought that people were astray and that they were not upon anything, and they used to worship idols. Then I heard about a man in Makkah who was telling news. So I mounted my camel and went to him. I found him to be the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) in hiding, his people being harsh with him. I was gentle until I entered upon him in Makkah and said to him: "What are you?" He said: "I am a Prophet." I said: "And what is a Prophet?" He said: "Allah has sent me." I said: "And with what has He sent you?" He said: "He has sent me with maintaining the ties of kinship, breaking idols, and that Allah be worshipped alone, with no partner." I said: "And who is with you in this?" He said: "A free man and a slave." And with him that day were Abu Bakr and Bilal, may Allah be pleased with them. I said: "I will follow you." He said: "You will not be able to do so today. Do you not see my condition and the condition of the people? But return to your family, and when you hear that I have appeared, come to me." He said: "So I went to my family, and the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) arrived in Madinah, and I was with my family. I kept inquiring about the news and asking people when he arrived in Madinah, until a group of my family arrived in Madinah. I said: 'What happened to this man who arrived in Madinah?' They said: 'People are rushing to him, and his people wanted to kill him, but they could not do that.' So I arrived in Madinah and went to him and said: 'O Messenger of Allah, do you recognize me?' He said: 'Yes, you are the one who met me in Makkah.' He said: 'So I said, O Messenger of Allah, tell me about what Allah has taught you that I do not know. Tell me about the prayer?' He said: 'Pray the morning prayer, then cease from praying until the sun rises by the length of a spear. For it rises when it rises between the horns of Satan, and at that time the disbelievers prostrate to it. Then pray, for the prayer is witnessed and present until the shadow equals a spear's length. Then cease from praying, for at that time Hell is kindled. When the shadow returns, then pray, for the prayer is witnessed and present until you pray the afternoon prayer. Then cease from praying until the sun sets, for it sets between the horns of Satan, and at that time the disbelievers prostrate to it.' He said: 'So I said, O Prophet of Allah, tell me about ablution.' He said: 'None of you performs his ablution, rinses his mouth, and snuffs water into his nose and then expels it, but the sins of his face, its eyes, and its nostrils fall away with the water. Then when he washes his face as Allah has commanded him, the sins of his face fall away from the edges of his beard with the water. Then he washes his hands up to the elbows, but the sins of his hands fall away from his fingertips with the water. Then he wipes his head, but the sins of his head fall away from the edges of his hair with the water. Then he washes his feet up to the ankles, but the sins of his feet fall away from his fingertips with the water. If he then stands and prays, and praises Allah the Almighty, and glorifies Him and magnifies Him as He deserves, and dedicates his heart to Allah the Almighty, he will depart from his sins as he was on the day his mother gave birth to him.'" Amr bin Absah narrated this hadith to Abu Umamah, the companion of the Messenger of Allah. Abu Umamah said to him: "O Amr bin Absah, look at what you are saying! In one sitting, this man is given this?" Amr said: "O Abu Umamah, my age has become advanced, my bones have become weak, and my end is near, and I have no need to lie about Allah the Almighty, nor about the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him). If I had not heard it from the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) but once or twice or three times, until he counted seven times, I would not have narrated it. But I heard it more than that." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Musa Al-Ash'ari, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, peace be upon him, he said: "When Allah Almighty intends mercy for a nation, He takes its Prophet before it, making him a forerunner and a predecessor before it. And when He intends the destruction of a nation, He punishes it while its Prophet is alive, and destroys it while he is looking on, and it pleases his eye with their destruction when they denied him and disobeyed his command." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: Allah, the Exalted, said: "I am as My servant thinks I am, and I am with him when he remembers Me. By Allah, Allah is more pleased with the repentance of His servant than one of you is pleased with finding his lost camel in the desert. And whoever draws near to Me a hand-span, I draw near to him an arm's length; and whoever draws near to Me an arm's length, I draw near to him two arm's lengths; and if he comes to Me walking, I come to him running." (Agreed upon) This is the wording of one of Muslim's narrations. Its explanation was given in the preceding chapter. It is narrated in the two Sahihs: "And I am with him when he remembers Me" with the letter 'nun', and in this narration "where" with the letter 'tha'. Both are correct. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Jabir bin Abdullah, may Allah be pleased with them both, that he heard the Prophet, peace be upon him, three days before his death saying: "None of you should die except while having good thoughts of Allah, the Mighty and Sublime." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, narrated that he heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "Allah the Almighty said: 'O son of Adam, as long as you call upon Me and hope in Me, I shall forgive you for whatever you have done and I shall not care. O son of Adam, if your sins reached the sky, then you sought forgiveness from Me, I would forgive you. O son of Adam, if you came to Me with sins nearly filling the earth, and then you met Me without associating anything with Me, I would come to you with forgiveness nearly filling the earth.'" (Narrated by Tirmidhi, who said it is a hasan hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "If the believer knew what punishment Allah had, no one would aspire to His paradise. And if the disbeliever knew what mercy Allah had, no one would despair of His paradise." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "When the bier is placed and the people or men carry it on their shoulders, if it was righteous, it says: 'Take me forward, take me forward!' And if it was unrighteous, it says: 'Woe to you! Where are you taking it?' Everything hears its voice except mankind, and if they heard it, they would swoon." (Narrated by Al-Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said, "Paradise is closer to one of you than the strap of his sandal, and Hellfire is like that." (Narrated by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said to me: "Recite the Qur'an to me." I said: "O Messenger of Allah, shall I recite to you while it was revealed to you?" He said: "I love to hear it from others." So I recited Surat An-Nisa' to him, until I came to this verse: {So how will it be when We bring from every nation a witness and We bring you, [O Muhammad], as a witness over these?} (An-Nisa': 41). He said: "That is enough for you now." So I turned to him, and indeed his eyes were shedding tears. (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Anas, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, delivered a sermon the like of which I have never heard. He said: "If you knew what I know, you would laugh little and weep much." He said: So the companions of the Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, covered their faces, and they were weeping. (Agreed upon), and its explanation has preceded in the chapter on fear. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: A man who cries from the fear of Allah will not enter the Fire until the milk returns to the udder, and dust in the cause of Allah and the smoke of Hellfire do not meet together. (Narrated by At-Tirmidhi, who said it is a Hasan Sahih hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Seven are the ones whom Allah will shade with His shade on the Day when there is no shade but His shade: a just ruler, a young person who grew up in the worship of Allah, a man whose heart is attached to the mosques, two men who loved each other for the sake of Allah, meeting on that basis and parting on that basis, a man whom a woman of noble status and beauty invited, and he said: 'Indeed, I fear Allah,' and a man who gave charity and concealed it so much that his left hand did not know what his right hand spent, and a man who remembered Allah in private and his eyes shed tears." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abdullah bin Al-Shikhir, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: I came to the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, while he was praying, and his chest was making a rumbling sound like that of a boiling pot due to weeping. (A sahih hadith narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi with a sahih chain of narration). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said to Ubayy bin Ka'b, may Allah be pleased with him: "Verily Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, has commanded me to recite to you: 'Lam Yakun allatheena kafaroo'" He said: "And He named me?" He said: "Yes." So Ubayy wept. (Agreed upon) And in another narration: So Ubayy began to weep. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: Abu Bakr said to Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, after the death of the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him: "Let us go to Umm Ayman, may Allah be pleased with her, to visit her as he used to visit her." When they reached her, she wept. So they said: "What makes you weep? Do you not know that what is with Allah is better for the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him?" She said: "I am not weeping because I do not know that what is with Allah is better for the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him. Rather, I am weeping because the revelation has been cut off from the sky." So she stirred them to weep, and they began to weep with her. (Narrated by Muslim and it has preceded in the chapter on visiting righteous people.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, he said: When the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, became severely ill, it was said to him about the prayer, and he said: "Tell Abu Bakr to lead the people in prayer." So 'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, said: "Abu Bakr is a tender-hearted man, when he recites the Qur'an, weeping overcomes him." He said: "Tell him to lead [the prayer]." In another narration from 'A'ishah, may Allah be pleased with her, she said: I said: "If Abu Bakr stands in your place, the people will not hear from his weeping." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Narrated by Ibrahim bin 'Abdullah bin 'Auf, from 'Abdullah bin 'Auf, may Allah be pleased with him, that food was brought to him and he was fasting. He said, "Mus'ab bin 'Umair, may Allah be pleased with him, was killed and he was better than me. Nothing was found to shroud him with except a cloak. If his head was covered, his feet would become bare, and if his feet were covered, his head would become bare. Then, the world was spread out for us (or he said, 'We were given of this world what we were given'). We feared that our good deeds had been hastened for us." Then he started weeping until he left the food. (Reported by Al-Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Umamah Suday ibn Ajlan Al-Bahili, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, peace be upon him, he said: "Nothing is more beloved to Allah the Almighty than two drops and two traces: a drop of tears from the fear of Allah, and a drop of blood shed in the cause of Allah. As for the two traces: a trace in the cause of Allah the Almighty, and a trace in a duty from the duties of Allah the Almighty." (Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and said it is a Hasan hadith).
A hadith from Al-Irbad ibn Sariyah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, admonished us with an admonition that made hearts tremble and eyes shed tears. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of 'Amr bin Al-Awf Al-Ansari, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) sent Abu 'Ubaidah bin Al-Jarrah, may Allah be pleased with him, to Bahrain to collect its tribute. He came back with money from Bahrain. The Ansar heard of Abu 'Ubaidah's arrival and came for the dawn prayer with the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him). When the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) finished the prayer, he turned and they met him. The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) smiled when he saw them, then said: "I think you heard that Abu 'Ubaidah has come with something from Bahrain?" They said: "Yes, O Messenger of Allah." He said: "Rejoice and be pleased with what will make you happy. By Allah, it is not poverty that I fear for you, but I fear that this world will be spread out for you as it was spread out for those before you, and you will compete for it as they competed for it, and it will destroy you as it destroyed them." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, sat on the pulpit, and we sat around him, and he said: "Indeed, among the things I fear for you after me is what will be opened to you of the adornment of this world and its splendor." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Verily, the world is sweet and green, and Allah, the Almighty, has made you successors in it, and He watches how you act. So beware of the world and beware of women." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]
And from Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "O Allah, there is no life but the life of the Hereafter." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, from the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, he said: "Three things follow the deceased: his family, his wealth, and his deeds. Two return and one remains. His family and his wealth return, and his deeds remain." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The most comfortable person from the people of Hellfire in this world will be brought on the Day of Resurrection, and he will be dipped once in the Fire. Then it will be said to him: 'O son of Adam, did you ever see any good? Did any comfort ever come to you?' He will say: 'No, by Allah, O Lord.' And the most miserable person in this world from the people of Paradise will be brought, and he will be dipped once in Paradise. Then it will be said to him: 'O son of Adam, did you ever see any misery? Did any hardship ever come to you?' He will say: 'No, by Allah, no misery ever came to me, nor did I ever see any hardship.'" (Reported by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Al-Mustawrid bin Shaddad (may Allah be pleased with him), he said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "This world compared to the Hereafter is like this: let one of you dip his finger in the sea and see what he brings back?" (Reported by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Jabir, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, passed by the market while people were on his sides. He passed by a dead, small-eared kid, so he took it by its ears and said: "Who among you would like this for a dirham?" They said: "We don't want it for anything, and what would we do with it?" Then he said: "Would you like it to be yours?" They said: "By Allah, even if it were alive, it would be a defect because it is small-eared. So how can it be when it is dead!" Then he said: "By Allah, the world is less significant to Allah than this is to you." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Dharr, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: I was walking with the Prophet, peace be upon him, in a rocky area in Medina. Suddenly, a mountain appeared before us. He said: "O Abu Dharr!" I said: "Here I am, O Messenger of Allah." He said: "I would not be pleased to have gold equal to this mountain, and three days pass while I have a dinar of it, except what I reserve for debt, except that I give it to the servants of Allah like this, and like this, and like this." He gestured to his right, his left, and behind him. Then he walked and said: "Indeed, the many will be the few on the Day of Resurrection, except for those who give wealth like this, and like this, and like this." He gestured to his right, his left, and behind him. "And they are few." Then he said to me: "Stay where you are until I come to you." Then he went off into the darkness of the night until he disappeared. I heard a voice rise, and I feared that someone might have attacked the Prophet, peace be upon him. I wanted to go to him, but I remembered his saying: "Do not leave until I come to you." So I stayed until he came to me. I said: I heard a voice and was afraid. I mentioned it to him. He said: "Did you hear it?" I said: "Yes." He said: "That was Gabriel who came to me and said: Whoever dies from your Ummah without associating anything with Allah will enter Paradise." I said: "Even if he committed adultery and theft?" He said: "Even if he committed adultery and theft." (Agreed upon, and this is the wording of Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him), from the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) who said: "If I had gold as much as the mountain of Uhud, I would be pleased not to let three nights pass with any of it remaining with me except for what I would keep for a debt." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Look at those who are below you, and do not look at those who are above you, for that is more likely to prevent you from despising Allah's blessings upon you." (Agreed upon, and this is the wording of Muslim). And in a narration of Bukhari: "When one of you looks at someone who is favored over him in wealth and creation, let him look at someone who is below him." And in a narration of Bukhari: "When one of you looks at someone who is favored over him in wealth and creation, let him look at someone who is below him." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, from the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, he said: "Woe to the slave of the dinar and the dirham and the brocade and the silk garment! If he is given, he is pleased; and if he is not given, he is not pleased." (Narrated by Al-Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, may Allah be pleased with him, it is narrated, he said: "I have seen seventy of the people of the Suffah, none of whom had a cloak, but rather a waist wrap or a cloak tied around their necks. Some of them reached their shins, and some reached their ankles. He would hold it with his hand for fear that his nakedness might be seen." (Narrated by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him it is narrated that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The world is a prison for the believer and paradise for the disbeliever." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, that he said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) took me by the shoulders and said: "Be in this world as if you were a stranger or a traveler on the road."
