About him, he said: A slave girl from the slave girls of Medina would take the hand of the Prophet, peace be upon him, and take him wherever she wished. (Narrated by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Al-Aswad bin Yazid, he said: Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, was asked: "What did the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, do in his house?" She said: "He would be in the service of his family - meaning, helping his family - and when the prayer time came, he would go out to pray." (Narrated by Al-Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Rifā'ah Tamīm bin Usayd (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: I came to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) while he was delivering a sermon. I said: "O Messenger of Allah, a stranger has come asking about his religion, he does not know what his religion is?" The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) turned to me and left his sermon until he reached me. He brought a chair and sat on it, and began to teach me from what Allah had taught him. Then he returned to his sermon and completed the latter part of it. (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported that when the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) ate food, he would lick his three fingers. He said: "If a morsel of food falls from any of you, he should remove any dirt from it and eat it, and not leave it for the devil." And he commanded that the plate should be wiped. He said: "For you do not know in which of your foods the blessing lies." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, peace be upon him, said: "Allah has not sent any prophet except that he grazed sheep." His companions said: "And you?" He said: "Yes, I used to graze them for the people of Makkah for some qiraat." (Narrated by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, who said: "If I were invited to a forearm or a shank, I would accept, and if I were gifted a shank or a forearm, I would accept." (Reported by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The camel of the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him), Al-Adhba', was not outrun, or it could barely be outrun. Then an Arab came on his camel, and he outran her. This grieved the Muslims, until the Prophet (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) recognized it and said: "It is incumbent upon Allah that He does not raise anything of this world except that He lowers it." (Narrated by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abdullah bin Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) from the Prophet (peace be upon him) who said: "He will not enter Paradise, whoever has an atom's weight of pride in his heart." A man said: "Indeed, a man likes his clothes to be good and his shoes to be good?" He said: "Indeed, Allah is beautiful and loves beauty. Pride is to reject the truth and look down on people." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Salamah bin Al-Akwa' (may Allah be pleased with him) that a man ate in the presence of the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) with his left hand. He said: "Eat with your right hand." He said: "I cannot." He said: "May you never be able to." Nothing prevented him except arrogance. He said: "So he never raised it to his mouth." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Haritha bin Wahb, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "Shall I not inform you about the people of the Fire? Every harsh, arrogant, and proud person." (Agreed upon). Its explanation has preceded in the chapter on the weak Muslims. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Sa'eed (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Paradise and Hellfire argued, and Hellfire said: 'The arrogant and the proud are in me.' And Paradise said: 'The weak and the poor are in me.' So Allah judged between them, saying: 'Verily, you, Paradise, are My mercy, with whom I shall show mercy to whomever I wish. And verily, you, Hellfire, are My punishment, with whom I shall punish whomever I wish. And to both of you, I shall fill them.'" (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported that the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) said: "Allah will not look on the Day of Resurrection at him who trails his garment out of pride." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: The Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Three will not speak to them, nor purify them, nor look at them on the Day of Resurrection, and for them is a painful torment: an old man who commits adultery, a king who lies, and a poor person who is arrogant." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, said: "Glory is My cloak and pride is My garment. Whoever wrestles with Me for one of them, I will punish him." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "While a man was walking, wearing fine clothes, pleased with himself, with his hair combed, strutting in his walk, Allah caused the earth to swallow him. He will continue to sink in it until the Day of Resurrection." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Salama bin Al-Akwa' (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "A man will continue to exalt himself until he is written among the tyrants, and what befell them will befall him." (Narrated by Tirmidhi and said: Hadith Hasan. "Exalt himself" means: to be arrogant and haughty.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him, was the most excellent of people in character. (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: I have not touched brocade or silk softer than the palm of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him), nor have I smelled a scent sweeter than the scent of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him). I served the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) for ten years, and he never said to me, "Uff," nor did he say to anything I did, "Why did you do that?" Nor to anything I did not do, "Why did you not do such and such?" (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from As-Sa'b bin Jathamah, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: "I presented a wild donkey as a gift to the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him), and he returned it to me. When he saw the effect on my face, he said: 'We did not return it to you except that we are in a state of Ihram.'" (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from An-Nawwas bin Sam'an, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: I asked the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, about righteousness and sin. He said: "Righteousness is good character, and sin is what pricks your conscience and you dislike people knowing about it." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-Aas, may Allah be pleased with them both, he said: Allah's Messenger, peace and blessings be upon him, was not lewd nor was he wantonly wicked. And he used to say: "The best of you are those who are the best in character." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Ad-Darda' (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "There is nothing heavier on the believer's scale on the Day of Resurrection than good manners, and Allah hates the vulgar and the obscene." (Reported by At-Tirmidhi, who said it is a hasan sahih hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, that he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, was asked about what most causes people to enter Paradise. He said: "Piety towards Allah and good character." And he was asked about what most causes people to enter the Fire. He said: "The mouth and the private parts." (Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi, who said it is a hasan sahih hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The most perfect of believers in faith are those who are best in character, and the best among you are those who are best to their wives." (Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi, who said: It is a hasan sahih hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, she said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "A believer reaches by his good character the rank of the one who fasts and prays." (Narrated by Abu Dawud) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Umamah Al-Bahili, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "I am the guarantor of a house in the outskirts of Paradise for one who abandons argumentation, even if he is in the right. And a house in the middle of Paradise for one who abandons lying, even if he is joking. And a house at the top of Paradise for one who has good manners." (A sahih hadith narrated by Abu Dawud with a sahih chain of narration). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Indeed, the most beloved of you to me and the closest of you to me in seat on the Day of Resurrection will be the best of you in character. And indeed, the most hated of you to me and the furthest of you from me on the Day of Resurrection will be the talkative, the pretentious, and the arrogant." They said: "O Messenger of Allah, we know the 'talkative' and the 'pretentious,' but what are the 'arrogant'?" He said: "The arrogant are those who are arrogant." (Narrated by Tirmidhi and he said: It is a hasan hadith). "Al-Tharthar" is one who talks a lot artificially. "Al-Mutashaddiq" is one who is condescending to people with his speech, and he speaks with his mouth full, shaking hands and glorifying his speech. "Al-Mutafayhiq" originates from "al-fahq," which means to be full. He is one who fills his mouth with speech, expands upon it, and says strange things out of arrogance and haughtiness, showing his virtue over others. Tirmidhi narrated from Abdullah ibn al-Mubarak (may Allah have mercy on him) in his explanation of good character, saying: It is a cheerful face, doing good deeds, and refraining from causing harm. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said to Ashajj Abd al-Qais: "You possess two qualities that Allah loves: forbearance and deliberation." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may God be pleased with her, she said: The Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Indeed, God is gentle and loves gentleness in all matters." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from her, that the Prophet, peace be upon him, said: "Indeed Allah is gentle and loves gentleness, and He gives on gentleness what He does not give on harshness, nor on anything else." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from her, that the Prophet, peace be upon him, said: "Kindness is not found in anything but that it adorns it, and it is not removed from anything but that it disfigures it." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: A Bedouin urinated in the Masjid, and the people stood up to confront him. So the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Leave him alone, and pour a bucket of water, or a jug of water, over his urine. For you have been sent to make things easy and not to make things difficult." (Narrated by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him) said: “Make things easy and do not make them difficult; give good news and do not make people run away.” [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Jarir bin Abdullah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him, say: "Whoever is deprived of gentleness is deprived of all good." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) that a man said to the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him): "Advise me." He said: "Do not get angry." He repeated it several times, saying: "Do not get angry." (Narrated by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Ya'la Shaddad bin Aws, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, he said: "Indeed, Allah has decreed excellence in all things. So when you kill, kill well, and when you slaughter, slaughter well. Let one of you sharpen his blade and comfort his sacrifice." (Reported by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Narrated by Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her): The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) was never given a choice between two matters except that he would choose the easier of them, as long as it was not a sin. If it was a sin, he would be the furthest of people from it. And the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) never avenged himself for anything, except when the sanctity of Allah was violated, then he would avenge for Allah, the Almighty. (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Shall I not inform you of whom the Fire is forbidden for - or whom the Fire is forbidden to? It is forbidden for everyone who is near, gentle, soft, and easy." (Narrated by Tirmidhi and he said: A hasan hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, said to the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him: "Did you ever experience a day that was harder than the day of Uhud?" He said: "I suffered a great deal from my people, and the hardest that I suffered from them was on the day of Al-Aqabah, when I presented myself to Ibn Abd Yaleel bin Abd Kilal, but he did not respond to what I wanted. So I departed, distressed, and I did not regain my senses until I was at Qarn ath-Tha'alib. I raised my head, and behold, a cloud had shaded me. I looked, and there was Gabriel, peace be upon him. He called me and said: 'Indeed, Allah has heard what your people said to you and how they responded to you. He has sent you the angel of the mountains to command him whatever you wish concerning them.' So the angel of the mountains called me and greeted me, then said: 'O Muhammad, Allah has heard what your people said to you, and I am the angel of the mountains. My Lord has sent me to you to command me whatever you wish. If you wish, I can crush them between the two mountains.'" The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Rather, I hope that from their loins will come those who worship Allah alone and associate nothing with Him." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from her, she said: Allah's Messenger (ﷺ) never struck anything with his hand, neither a woman nor a servant, except when he was striving in the cause of Allah. And he never took revenge for anything that was done to him, except when something of the prohibitions of Allah Almighty was violated, then he would take revenge for Allah Almighty. (Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported that he was walking with the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him). He was wearing a coarse-bordered Najrani cloak. A Bedouin overtook him and pulled his cloak very roughly. I looked at the side of the Prophet's (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) shoulder, and I saw the mark of the cloak's rough border on it because of the roughness of his pull. He smiled and then said: "O Muhammad, give me something from the wealth of Allah which is with you." The Prophet (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) turned to him and smiled, then he ordered that he be given something. (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: "It is as if I am looking at the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, recounting a prophet from among the prophets, prayers of Allah and peace be upon them, whom his people struck until they made him bleed, while he was wiping the blood from his face and saying: 'O Allah, forgive my people, for they do not know.'" (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The strong man is not the one who can wrestle others down, but the strong man is the one who controls himself when he is angry." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that a man said: "O Messenger of Allah, I have relatives whom I treat well, but they treat me badly. I am kind to them, but they are cruel to me. I am patient with them, but they are ignorant towards me!" The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "If you are as you say, then it is as if you are feeding them hot ashes. And there will always be a supporter from Allah the Almighty over you as long as you remain on that." (Narrated by Muslim) This has been explained previously in the chapter on maintaining kinship. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Mas'ud 'Uqbah bin 'Amr al-Badri (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: A man came to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and said: "I indeed stay behind from the morning prayer because of so-and-so, for he prolongs it for us!" He said: I have never seen the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) angrier in an admonishment than he was on that day. He said: "O people! Some of you are repellent. Whoever leads the people in prayer, let him be brief, for among them are the old, the young, and those who have needs." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may God be pleased with her, she said: The Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, returned from a journey, and I had covered a small alcove of mine with a curtain that had images on it. When the Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, saw it, he tore it down and his face changed color, and he said: "O Aisha, the people most severely punished by God on the Day of Resurrection are those who imitate the creation of God." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from her that Quraysh were concerned about the matter of the Makhzumite woman who stole, and they said: "Who will speak to the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, about her?" They said: "Who dares to do so except Usama bin Zaid, the beloved of the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him?" So Usama spoke to him, and the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "Do you intercede in a Hadd (punishment) from the Hadds of Allah the Almighty?!" Then he stood and gave a sermon, and said: "Verily, those before you were destroyed because if a noble among them stole, they would leave him, and if a weak person among them stole, they would apply the Hadd to him! And by Allah, if Fatima the daughter of Muhammad stole, I would cut off her hand." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (peace be upon him) saw a phlegm in the Qiblah, which displeased him so much that it was seen on his face. He got up and scraped it with his hand, saying: "When any one of you stands for prayer, he is talking to his Lord, and his Lord is between him and the Qiblah. So, none of you should spit in the Qiblah, but to his left, or under his feet." Then he took the end of his cloak and spat into it, and folded some of it over the other, saying: "Or he should do like this." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him, say: "Each of you is a shepherd and each of you is responsible for his flock. The Imam is a shepherd and responsible for his flock. A man is a shepherd in his family and responsible for his flock. A woman is a shepherd in her husband's house and responsible for her flock. A servant is a shepherd of his master's property and responsible for his flock. And each of you is a shepherd and responsible for his flock." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Ya'la Ma'qil bin Yasar, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) say: "No servant whom Allah has entrusted with a flock, who dies while deceiving his flock, except that Allah will forbid Paradise to him." (Agreed upon) And in a narration: "He did not surround it with his sincere advice, he will not find the scent of Paradise." And in a narration by Muslim: "No ruler who oversees the affairs of the Muslims, then does not strive for them and give them sincere advice, except that he will not enter Paradise with them." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, say in this house of mine: "O Allah, whoever has been entrusted with a matter of my Ummah and has been hard on them, then be hard on him. And whoever has been entrusted with a matter of my Ummah and has been kind to them, then be kind to him." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) said: "The prophets used to lead the Children of Israel. Whenever a prophet died, another prophet succeeded him. But there will be no prophet after me. There will be caliphs and they will be many." They said: "O Messenger of Allah, what do you order us to do?" He said: "Give allegiance to the first, then the next, then the next. And give them their due rights, and ask Allah for what is due to you, for Allah will ask them about what He entrusted them with." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from 'A'idh bin 'Amr, may Allah be pleased with him, that he entered upon 'Ubaidullah bin Ziyad, and said to him: "O son, I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: 'The worst of shepherds is the harsh one.' So beware of being among them." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Maryam al-Azdi, may Allah be pleased with him, that he said to Mu'awiyah, may Allah be pleased with him: "I heard the Messenger of Allah, may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him, say: 'Whoever Allah has appointed to a position over the affairs of the Muslims, and he conceals himself from their needs, necessities, and poverty, Allah will conceal Himself from his needs, necessities, and poverty on the Day of Resurrection.'" So Mu'awiyah appointed a man to attend to the people's needs. (Narrated by Abu Dawud and Tirmidhi). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him), from the Prophet (peace be upon him) who said: "Seven [people] will be shaded by Allah on the Day when there is no shade but His: a just ruler, a young person who grew up in the worship of Allah the Almighty, a man whose heart is attached to the mosques, two men who loved each other for the sake of Allah, meeting and parting upon that, a man whom a woman of noble birth and beauty invited, and he said: 'Indeed, I fear Allah,' and a man who gave charity and concealed it so much that his left hand did not know what his right hand spent, and a man who remembered Allah when he was alone, and his eyes shed tears." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-As, may Allah be pleased with them both, he said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "Verily, those who are just will be on minbars of light by Allah: they are those who are just in their judgments, and in their families, and in all that they are in charge of." (Reported by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Awf bin Malik, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "The best of your leaders are those whom you love and who love you, and for whom you pray and who pray for you. And the worst of your leaders are those whom you hate and who hate you, and whom you curse and who curse you!" He said: We said, O Messenger of Allah, should we not fight them? He said: "No, as long as they establish prayer among you, no, as long as they establish prayer among you." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Iyad bin Himar, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "The people of Paradise are three: a just and successful ruler, a merciful man with a tender heart towards all relatives and Muslims, and a chaste and modest man with a family." (Reported by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, from the Prophet, peace be upon him, who said: "It is incumbent upon every Muslim to hear and obey in what he likes and dislikes, unless he is commanded to do something sinful. If he is commanded to do something sinful, then there is no hearing and no obedience." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: When we pledged allegiance to the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, on hearing and obeying, he used to say to us: "Within your ability." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "Whoever breaks away from obedience will meet Allah on the Day of Resurrection without any proof against him, and whoever dies without a pledge of allegiance on his neck dies the death of ignorance." (Narrated by Muslim). And in another narration by him: "And whoever dies while separating from the group, he dies the death of ignorance." (Narrated by Muslim). And in another narration by him: "And whoever dies while separating from the group, he dies the death of ignorance." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) said: "Listen and obey, even if a black slave, whose head is like a raisin, is appointed over you." (Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "You must listen and obey in hardship and ease, in what you like and dislike, and even when others are preferred over you." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abdullah bin Amr, may Allah be pleased with them both, he said: We were with the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, on a journey, and we stopped at a place. Some of us were setting up their tents, some were practicing archery, and some were with their livestock. Suddenly, the herald of the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, called out: "As-Salatu Jami'ah" (Prayer is ready). We gathered to the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, and he said: "Indeed, no prophet was before me but it was incumbent upon him to guide his Ummah to the best he knew for them, and to warn them of the worst he knew for them. And this Ummah of yours, its end has been made in its beginning, and its end will be afflicted with trials and matters that you will find objectionable. And tribulations will come, some of them making others seem light, and a tribulation will come and the believer will say: 'This is my destruction,' then it will pass. And a tribulation will come and the believer will say: 'This, this is it.' So whoever wishes to be saved from the Hellfire and enter Paradise, let death come to him while he believes in Allah and the Last Day, and let him treat people as he wishes to be treated. And whoever pledges allegiance to an Imam, giving him his hand and the fruit of his heart, let him obey him if he can. If another comes to dispute with him, then strike the neck of the other." (Narrated by Muslim). "Yantadil" means: competing in shooting arrows. "Al-jashr" (with a dammah on the Jim and a fathah on the Shin and a raa): are the animals that graze and stay in their place overnight. And his saying: "Yuraqiqu ba'duha ba'dan" means: some of them become light compared to others, i.e., light because of the magnitude of what comes after, so the second makes the first seem light. It is said: its meaning is that some of them make others eager for them by beautifying and exaggerating them, and it is said: some of them resemble each other. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hunaida, Wa'il ibn Hujr, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: Salama ibn Yazid al-Ju'fi asked the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, saying: "O Prophet of Allah, what do you think if rulers are appointed over us who demand our rights and deny us our rights, what do you command us?" So he turned away from him. Then he asked him again, and the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Listen and obey; for they are burdened with what they are burdened, and you are burdened with what you are burdened." (Reported by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abdullah bin Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Indeed, after me there will be selfishness and matters that you will find objectionable!" They said: "O Messenger of Allah, how do you command those among us who reach that time?" He said: "You fulfill the right that is due from you, and you ask Allah for what is due to you." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "Whoever obeys me has obeyed Allah, and whoever disobeys me has disobeyed Allah. And whoever obeys the commander has obeyed me, and whoever disobeys the commander has disobeyed me." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them both) that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "Whoever dislikes something from his ruler, let him be patient, for whoever leaves the authority (of the ruler) even by a span, dies the death of ignorance." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Bakra (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) say: “Whoever insults the Sultan, Allah will insult him.” (Narrated by At-Tirmidhi, who said it is a Hasan hadith). And in this regard, there are many hadiths in the Sahih, and some of them have preceded in other chapters. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Sa'id Abdur-Rahman bin Samurah (may Allah be pleased with him), he said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said, "O Abdur-Rahman bin Samurah: Do not ask for leadership, for if you are given it without asking, you will be burdened with it, and if you are given it after asking, you will be left to it. And if you swear an oath, and you see that something else is better than it, then do what is better and expiate your oath." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Dharr, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "O Abu Dharr, I see you as weak, and I love for you what I love for myself. Do not command two people, nor be in charge of the property of an orphan." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him it is narrated that he said: "I said, 'O Messenger of Allah, will you not appoint me to a position?' He then struck me on the shoulder with his hand and said, 'O Abu Dharr, you are weak, and it is a trust, and it will be a source of disgrace and regret on the Day of Resurrection, except for him who takes it by its right and fulfills what is due from him in it.'" (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "You will be eager for leadership, and it will be a cause of regret on the Day of Resurrection." (Narrated by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Abu Sa'id and Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with them, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Allah has not sent any prophet, nor appointed any caliph, but he had two types of advisors: an advisor who commands good and urges him towards it, and an advisor who commands evil and urges him towards it. And he who is protected is protected by Allah." (Narrated by Al-Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, who narrated: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "When Allah intends good for a ruler, He appoints for him a truthful minister. If he forgets, the minister reminds him, and if he remembers, the minister helps him. And when Allah intends evil for him, He appoints for him an evil minister. If he forgets, the minister does not remind him, and if he remembers, the minister does not help him." (Reported by Abu Dawud with a good chain of narration, according to the condition of Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Abu Musa Al-Ash'ari (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: I, along with two of my cousins, went to the Prophet (peace be upon him). One of them said: "O Messenger of Allah, appoint us over some of what Allah has entrusted to you." The other said the same. The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: "By Allah, we do not appoint to this office anyone who seeks it or is eager for it." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, that the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, passed by a man from the Ansar who was admonishing his brother about modesty. So the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "Leave him, for modesty is from faith." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Imran ibn Husayn, may Allah be pleased with them both, that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Modesty brings nothing but good." (Agreed upon) And in a narration of Muslim: "Modesty is all good." And he said: "Modesty is all good." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Faith has seventy-odd branches, or sixty-odd branches, the most excellent of which is the saying: 'There is no god but Allah,' and the least of which is removing harm from the road. And shyness is a branch of faith." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was more modest than a veiled virgin in her chamber, and when he disliked something, we would recognize it in his face. (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Sa'eed Al-Khudri (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The worst of people in the sight of Allah on the Day of Resurrection will be the man who has intercourse with his wife and she with him, then he discloses her secrets." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abdullah bin Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, that Umar, may Allah be pleased with him, when his daughter Hafsa became widowed, said: I met Uthman bin Affan, may Allah be pleased with him, and I offered him Hafsa, and I said: If you wish, I will marry Hafsa, daughter of Umar, to you. He said: I will consider my affair. He stayed for some nights, then he met me and said: It has occurred to me that I will not marry on this day. I met Abu Bakr Al-Siddiq, may Allah be pleased with him, and he did not return anything to me. I was more displeased with him than I was with Uthman. I stayed for some nights, then the Prophet, peace be upon him, proposed to her, and I married her to him. Abu Bakr met me and said: Perhaps you were displeased when I did not return anything to you when I offered Hafsa to you? I said: Yes. He said: Nothing prevented me from returning to you concerning what you offered me, except that I knew that the Prophet, peace be upon him, had mentioned her. I would not have revealed the secret of the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him. And if the Prophet, peace be upon him, had left her, I would have accepted her. (Narrated by Al-Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, narrated: The wives of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, were with him when Fatima, may Allah be pleased with her, approached, walking in a manner exactly like that of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him. When he saw her, he welcomed her and said, "Welcome, my daughter." Then he seated her to his right or left, and then he whispered something to her, and she wept bitterly. When he saw her distress, he whispered to her a second time, and she laughed. I said to her, "The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, singled you out among his wives for a secret, and then you wept!" When the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, stood up, I asked her, "What did the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say to you?" She replied, "I would not reveal the secret of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him." When the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, passed away, I said, "I adjure you by the right I have over you, tell me what the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said to you." She said, "As for now, yes. When he whispered to me the first time, he informed me that Gabriel used to present the Quran to him once or twice every year, and that he had presented it to him twice this year. I do not see my end except that it is near. So, fear Allah and be patient, for I am an excellent predecessor for you." So I wept the weeping you saw. When he saw my distress, he whispered to me a second time and said, "O Fatima, are you not pleased to be the leader of the believing women, or the leader of the women of this nation?" So I laughed the laughter you saw. (Agreed upon) (This is the wording of Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Thabit, from Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: "The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, passed by me while I was playing with the boys. He greeted us, and then sent me on an errand. I was delayed in returning to my mother. When I came, she said: 'What kept you?' I said: 'The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, sent me on an errand.' She said: 'What was his errand?' I said: 'It is a secret.' She said: 'Do not tell anyone the secret of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him.' Anas said: 'By Allah, if I were to tell it to anyone, I would tell it to you, O Thabit.' (Narrated by Muslim, and Bukhari narrated some of it in a shortened form)." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "There are three signs of a hypocrite: when he speaks, he lies; when he makes a promise, he breaks it; and when he is entrusted with something, he is treacherous." (Agreed upon). In Muslim's narration, it is added: "And even if he fasts and prays and claims to be Muslim." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-Aas (may Allah be pleased with them both) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "There are four qualities, whoever has them all will be a pure hypocrite. And whoever has one of them will have a trait of hypocrisy until he abandons it: when he is entrusted, he betrays trust; when he speaks, he lies; when he makes a covenant, he breaks it; and when he disputes, he acts immorally." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Prophet (may Allah bless him and grant him peace) said to me, "When the wealth of Bahrain arrives, I will give you so and so." The wealth of Bahrain did not arrive until the Prophet (may Allah bless him and grant him peace) passed away. When the wealth of Bahrain arrived, Abu Bakr (may Allah be pleased with him) ordered that it be announced: "Whoever had a promise or a debt from the Messenger of Allah (may Allah bless him and grant him peace) should come to us." I came to him and said, "The Prophet (may Allah bless him and grant him peace) said to me so and so." He gave me a handful, and I counted it, and it was five hundred. He then said to me, "Take its like." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-Aas (may Allah be pleased with them both) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to me: "O Abdullah, do not be like so-and-so. He used to pray at night, then he abandoned praying at night!" (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of 'Adi bin Hatim (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Guard yourselves against the Fire, even if it is by giving half a date in charity. And whoever does not find that, then by a good word." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And Abu Huraira narrated that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "And a good word is charity." (Agreed upon) And this is part of a hadith previously narrated in full. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Dharr, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said to me: "Do not belittle any good deed, even if you meet your brother with a cheerful face." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported that when the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) spoke a word, he would repeat it three times so that it would be understood by him, and when he came to a group of people, he would greet them three times. (Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may God be pleased with her, she said: The speech of the Messenger of God, may God bless him and grant him peace, was clear and decisive, understood by everyone who heard it. (Narrated by Abu Dawud). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of Jarir bin Abdullah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said to me during the Farewell Pilgrimage: "Make the people listen." Then he said: "Do not revert to disbelief after me, striking the necks of one another." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Abu Wa'il Shaqiq bin Salamah, who said: Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) used to remind us every Thursday. A man said to him: "O Abu Abdur-Rahman, I wish you would remind us every day." He replied: "The only thing that prevents me from doing so is that I dislike tiring you out, and I choose occasions to advise you, just as the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) used to choose occasions to advise us, for fear of boring us." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu al-Yaqzan, Ammar bin Yasir, may Allah be pleased with them both, he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, say: "The length of a man's prayer and the shortness of his sermon are an indication of his understanding. So lengthen the prayer and shorten the sermon." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Mu'awiyah bin Al-Hakam Al-Sulami (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: "While I was praying with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him), a man in the congregation sneezed, and I said: 'May Allah have mercy on you.' The people stared at me. I said: 'What is wrong with you that you are looking at me?' They started hitting their thighs with their hands. When I saw them trying to silence me, I remained silent. When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) finished praying, may my father and mother be sacrificed for him, I had never seen a teacher better than him before or after. By Allah, he neither rebuked me, nor hit me, nor reviled me. He said: 'This prayer is not suitable for any of the speech of people; it is only for glorifying Allah, magnifying Him, and reciting the Quran,' or as the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said. I said: 'O Messenger of Allah, I am newly from the days of ignorance, and Allah has brought Islam. And among us are men who go to soothsayers.' He said: 'So do not go to them.' I said: 'And among us are men who believe in omens?' He said: 'That is something they find in their hearts, so let it not deter them.'" (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Al-Irbaad ibn Saariyah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah gave us such an admonition that our hearts trembled and our eyes shed tears, and the hadith was mentioned, and it has been previously narrated in full in the chapter on the command to adhere to the Sunnah, and we mentioned that Al-Tirmidhi said: "It is a hasan sahih hadith." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her) that she said: "I never saw the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) laughing heartily until I saw his uvula, he only used to smile." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) say: "When the prayer is called, do not come to it running, but come to it walking, and with tranquility. Then whatever you catch, pray, and whatever you miss, complete it." (Agreed upon) Muslim added in another narration: "For indeed, if one of you intends for the prayer, then he is in prayer." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, that he was with the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, on the Day of Arafah. The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, heard behind him a severe urging, beating, and the sound of camels. He gestured with his whip towards them and said: "O people, observe tranquility, for righteousness is not in rushing." (Reported by Al-Bukhari, and Muslim reported part of it). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Narrated Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "He who believes in Allah and the Last Day, let him honor his guest; he who believes in Allah and the Last Day, let him uphold the ties of kinship; and he who believes in Allah and the Last Day, let him speak good or remain silent." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Shuraih Khuwaylid bin Amr Al-Khuzai (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: "I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) say: 'Whoever believes in Allah and the Last Day, let him honor his guest his due.' They said: 'And what is his due, O Messenger of Allah?' He said: 'One day and one night. Hospitality is for three days, and whatever is beyond that is charity for him.' (Agreed upon). In a narration of Muslim: 'It is not permissible for a Muslim to stay with his brother until he causes him to sin.' They said: 'O Messenger of Allah, how does he cause him to sin?' He said: 'He stays with him when he has nothing to offer him.'" [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Ibrahim - and he was also called Abu Muhammad, and he was also called Abu Muawiyah - Abdullah bin Abi Awfa, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, gave glad tidings to Khadijah, may Allah be pleased with her, of a house in Paradise made of hollow reeds, wherein there will be no noise nor toil. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Musa Al-Ash'ari (may Allah be pleased with him) that he performed ablution in his house and then went out saying, "I will stay with the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) and be with him all day today." He went to the Masjid and asked about the Prophet (peace be upon him). They said, "He went this way." So he went out following his tracks, asking about him, until he entered the well of Arees. He sat by the door until the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) finished his need and performed ablution. I stood up to approach him, and he was sitting on the well of Arees, in the middle of its edge, and he had uncovered his legs and dangled them into the well. I greeted him, then turned away and sat by the door, saying, "I will be the doorkeeper of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) today." Then Abu Bakr (may Allah be pleased with him) came and pushed the door. I said, "Who is it?" He said, "Abu Bakr." I said, "Wait a moment." Then I went and said, "O Messenger of Allah, this is Abu Bakr seeking permission." He said, "Allow him and give him glad tidings of Paradise." I turned back and said to Abu Bakr, "Enter, and the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) gives you glad tidings of Paradise." Abu Bakr entered and sat to the right of the Prophet (peace be upon him) with him in the middle of the edge, and dangled his legs into the well as the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) had done, and uncovered his legs. Then I returned and sat, having left my brother performing ablution and to join me. I said, "If Allah wills good for so-and-so [meaning his brother], he will come." Then someone was moving the door. I said, "Who is it?" He said, "Umar bin Al-Khattab." I said, "Wait a moment." Then I came to the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him), greeted him and said, "This is Umar seeking permission?" He said, "Allow him and give him glad tidings of Paradise." So I came to Umar and said, "Enter, and the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) gives you glad tidings of Paradise." Umar entered and sat with the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) in the middle of the edge to his left, and dangled his legs into the well. Then I returned and sat, and I said, "If Allah wills good for so-and-so [meaning his brother], he will come." Then a person came and moved the door. I said, "Who is it?" He said, "Uthman bin Affan." I said, "Wait a moment." I came to the Prophet (peace be upon him) and informed him. He said, "Allow him and give him glad tidings of Paradise along with a trial that will befall him." So I came and said to him, "Enter, and the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) gives you glad tidings of Paradise along with a trial that will befall you." He entered and found the edge filled. He sat opposite them from the other side. Saeed bin Al-Musayyab said, "I interpreted this as their graves." (Agreed upon) In another narration it was added: "And the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) commanded me to guard the door." And in it, when Uthman was given the glad tidings, he praised Allah Almighty and said, "Allah is the one sought for help." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) that he said: We were sitting around the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him), and with us were Abu Bakr and Umar (may Allah be pleased with them), among a group of people. The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) got up from our midst and was delayed from us. We feared that he might be intercepted and we became alarmed. So we got up. I was the first to be alarmed. I went out searching for the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) until I reached a garden belonging to the Ansar of Bani Najjar. I went around it, looking for a door, but I did not find one. Then I saw a small stream entering the garden from a well outside. I squeezed myself through and entered upon the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him). He said: "Abu Hurayrah?" I said: "Yes, Messenger of Allah." He said: "What is wrong?" I said: "You were among us, and you got up and were delayed from us. We feared that you might be intercepted, and we became alarmed. I was the first to be alarmed. I came to this garden and squeezed through as a fox squeezes through." He said: "O Abu Hurayrah," and gave me his sandals. He said: "Go with these sandals of mine, and whoever you meet behind this wall, testifying that there is no god but Allah, with his heart certain of it, give him glad tidings of Paradise." The hadith was narrated in full. (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And Ibn Shamasah narrated: We attended Amr ibn Al-'Aas, may Allah be pleased with him, when he was on his deathbed. He wept for a long time and turned his face to the wall. His son said to him: "O my father, did not the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) give you glad tidings of such and such?" He turned his face and said: "The best thing we can count on is the testimony that there is no god but Allah, and that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah. I have been in three stages. I remember when no one hated the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) more than I did, nor was anyone dearer to me than to have been able to seize him and kill him. If I had died in that state, I would have been among the people of Hellfire. When Allah placed Islam in my heart, I came to the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him) and said: 'Extend your right hand so that I may pledge allegiance to you.' He extended his right hand, but I withheld mine. He said: 'What is wrong, O Amr?' I said: 'I wanted to stipulate.' He said: 'What do you want to stipulate?' I said: 'That I be forgiven.' He said: 'Do you not know that Islam demolishes what came before it, and that Hijrah demolishes what came before it, and that Hajj demolishes what came before it?' And no one was dearer to me than the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him), nor was anyone more respected in my eyes than him. I could not bear to look at him fully out of reverence for him. If I were asked to describe him, I could not, because I could not look at him fully. If I had died in that state, I would have hoped to be among the people of Paradise. Then we were in charge of things, and I do not know what my situation will be. So, when I die, do not let a wailing woman or fire accompany me. When you bury me, throw sand upon my grave liberally. Then stand around my grave for the time it takes to slaughter a camel and divide its meat, so that I may feel your companionship and see what I will present to the messengers of my Lord." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Among them is the hadith of Zaid bin Arqam, may Allah be pleased with him - which preceded in the chapter on honoring the household of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him - he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, stood among us as a preacher, so he praised Allah and commended Him, and admonished and reminded. Then he said: "To proceed: O people, I am but a human. The messenger of my Lord is about to come, and I will answer. I am leaving among you two weighty things: The first is the Book of Allah, in it is guidance and light. So take hold of the Book of Allah and adhere to it." So he urged for the Book of Allah and desired it. Then he said: "And my household, I remind you of Allah regarding my household." (Narrated by Muslim). It preceded in its entirety. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Malik bin Huwairith, may Allah be pleased with him, narrated that we came to the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) when we were young men of similar age. We stayed with him for twenty nights. The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) was kind and compassionate. He thought that we missed our families, so he asked us about those we left behind. We informed him, and he said, "Go back to your families, stay with them, teach them, and instruct them. Pray such and such prayer at such and such time, and pray such and such prayer at such and such time. When prayer is due, let one of you call the Adhan, and let the eldest among you lead the prayer." (Agreed upon) Bukhari added in one narration: "And pray as you saw me praying." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Umar bin Al-Khattab (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: I asked the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) for permission to perform 'Umrah, and he gave me permission and said: "Do not forget us in your supplications, my brother." He said a word that would not please me to have the whole world in exchange for it. In another narration, he said: "Include us in your supplications, my brother." (Narrated by Abu Dawud and At-Tirmidhi, who said it is a Hasan Sahih Hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Salim bin Abdullah bin Umar, that Abdullah bin Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, used to say to a man when he wanted to travel: "Come closer to me so I can bid you farewell, as the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, used to bid us farewell." He would say: "I entrust your religion, your trust, and the conclusion of your deeds to Allah." (Narrated by Tirmidhi, who said: It is a Hasan Sahih Hadith.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abdullah bin Yazid Al-Khatmi, the Companion, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: When the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, wanted to bid farewell to an army, he would say: "I entrust to Allah your religion, your trusts, and the conclusions of your deeds." A hadith is authentic, (narrated by Abu Dawud and others with an authentic chain of narration). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: A man came to the Prophet, peace be upon him, and said: "O Messenger of Allah, I wish to travel, so provide for me." He said: "May Allah provide you with taqwa." He said: "Add more." He said: "And may Allah forgive your sins." He said: "Add more." He said: "And may He make good easy for you wherever you may be." (Narrated by At-Tirmidhi and he said: It is a hasan hadith.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to teach us the Istikhara (seeking guidance from Allah) in all matters, just as he used to teach us the Surahs of the Qur'an. He would say: "When one of you is concerned about a matter, let him pray two rak'ahs of non-obligatory prayer, then say: 'O Allah, I seek guidance from Your knowledge, and seek strength from Your power, and ask of Your great bounty. For You have power and I have no power, and You know and I do not know, and You are the Knower of the unseen. O Allah, if You know that this matter is good for me in my religion, my livelihood, and the end of my affairs,' or he said, 'in my present and future affairs,' then ordain it for me, and make it easy for me, and bless it for me. And if You know that this matter is evil for me in my religion, my livelihood, and the end of my affairs,' or he said, 'in my present and future affairs,' then turn it away from me, and turn me away from it, and ordain for me whatever is good, wherever it may be, and make me pleased with it.'" He said: "And he should mention his need." (Reported by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]
On the authority of Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Prophet (peace be upon him) would take a different route on the day of Eid. (Narrated by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to go out by the way of Shajarah and enter by the way of Mu'arrass. And when he entered Makkah, he would enter by the upper valley pass and go out by the lower valley pass. (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may God be pleased with her, she said: The Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, liked to begin with his right in all his affairs: in his purification, in his combing, and in his wearing of sandals. (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from her, she said: The Messenger of Allah's right hand was for his purification and his food, and his left hand was for his toilet and whatever was unpleasant. A Hadith is authentic. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Umm 'Atiyyah (may Allah be pleased with her) that the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to them when washing his daughter Zainab (may Allah be pleased with her): "Begin with the right side and the parts of the body that are washed during ablution." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him, said: "If one of you puts on his shoes, let him start with the right, and if he takes them off, let him start with the left. Let the right be the first to be put on, and the last to be taken off." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Hafsah (may Allah be pleased with her) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to use his right hand for his food and drink and his clothes, and he used his left hand for other than that. (Reported by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, and others). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "When you wear, and when you perform Wudu', start with your right sides." A sahih hadith. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, came to Mina. He went to the Jamrah and stoned it, then he went to his lodging in Mina and sacrificed. Then he said to the barber, "Take," and he pointed to his right side, then to his left side, and then he began to give it to the people. (Agreed upon) In a narration: When he stoned the Jamrah, sacrificed his sacrifice, and shaved, he handed the barber his right side and he shaved it. Then he called Abu Talhah Al-Ansari, may Allah be pleased with him, and gave it to him. Then he handed him the left side and said, "Shave," and he shaved it. He gave it to Abu Talhah and said, "Distribute it among the people." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of 'Umar bin Abi Salamah (may Allah be pleased with them both) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to me: "Say Bismillah, eat with your right hand, and eat from what is nearest to you." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

'Aishah (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "When any one of you eats, he should mention the name of Allah, the Exalted. If he forgets to mention the name of Allah, the Exalted, at the beginning, he should say: 'In the name of Allah at the beginning and at the end.'"
(Reported by Abu Dawud and Tirmidhi) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Jabir, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "When a man enters his house and remembers Allah the Almighty upon entering and upon eating, Satan says to his companions: You have no place to spend the night and no dinner. And when he enters and does not remember Allah the Almighty upon entering, Satan says: You have found a place to spend the night. And if he does not remember Allah the Almighty upon eating, he says: You have found a place to spend the night and dinner." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Narrated Hudhaifah (may Allah be pleased with him): When we attended food with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), we would not put our hands in it until the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) started and put his hand in. And we attended food with him once, and a slave girl came as if she were pushing, and she went to put her hand in the food, so the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) took her hand, then an Arab came as if he were pushing, and he took her hand. So the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Indeed, Satan considers food lawful that Allah's name is not mentioned upon, and indeed he came with this slave girl to make it lawful through her, so I took her hand. Then he came with this Arab to make it lawful through him, so I took his hand. And by Him in Whose Hand is my soul, his hand is in my hand along with their hands." Then he mentioned Allah's name and ate. (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Umayyah bin Musha, the companion, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, was sitting, and a man was eating. He did not say the name of Allah until nothing of his food remained but a morsel. When he raised it to his mouth, he said: "In the name of Allah, at the beginning and at the end." The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, laughed, then said: "The devil was still eating with him, and when he mentioned the name of Allah, he vomited what was in his stomach." (Reported by Abu Dawud and An-Nasa'i) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, she said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, was eating food with six of his companions. Then an Arab came and ate it in two bites. The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "If he had said the name of Allah, it would have sufficed for you." (Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Umamah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Prophet, may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him, when his table was raised, would say: "Praise be to Allah, abundant, good and blessed praise, that is not to be renounced or abandoned, nor are we independent of it, our Lord." (Narrated by Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Mu'adh bin Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever eats food and says: 'Praise be to Allah, who fed me this and provided it to me without any might or power from myself,' his past sins will be forgiven." (Reported by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: "The Messenger of Allah, may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him, never criticized food. If he desired it, he ate it, and if he disliked it, he left it." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) asked his family for condiment, and they said: "We have nothing but vinegar." So he called for it, and began to eat it, and say: "What an excellent condiment is vinegar, what an excellent condiment is vinegar." (Reported by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "If one of you is invited, he should accept the invitation. If he is fasting, he should pray (for the one who invited him), and if he is not fasting, he should eat." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Abu Mas'ud al-Badri (may Allah be pleased with him) reported that a man invited the Prophet (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) to a meal he had prepared for five people. A sixth man followed them. When they reached the door, the Prophet (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) said: "This man has followed us. If you wish, grant him permission, and if you wish, he may go back." The man said: "Rather, I grant him permission, O Messenger of Allah." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Umar bin Abi Salamah (may Allah be pleased with them both) that he said: "I was a young boy in the care of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him), and my hand used to roam about in the dish. The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said to me: 'O young boy, mention Allah's name, eat with your right hand, and eat from what is in front of you.'" (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Salama bin Al-Akwa', that a man ate in the presence of the Messenger of Allah with his left hand, so he said: "Eat with your right hand." He said: "I cannot." He said: "May you not be able to!" Nothing prevented him except arrogance! And he never raised it to his mouth. ((Narrated by Muslim)) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Jabala bin Suhaim narrated: A year of drought befell us during the time of Ibn al-Zubayr, and we were granted dates. Abdullah bin Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both) used to pass by us while we were eating and say: "Do not eat two dates at a time, for the Prophet (peace be upon him) forbade eating two dates at a time, except if a man asks his brother for permission." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Wahshi bin Harb, may Allah be pleased with him, the companions of the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "O Messenger of Allah, we eat and are not satisfied." He said: "Perhaps you eat separately?" They said: "Yes." He said: "Then gather for your food and mention the name of Allah, and it will be blessed for you." (Narrated by Abu Dawud) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, from the Prophet, may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him, he said: "Blessing descends in the middle of the food, so eat from its sides and do not eat from its middle." (Reported by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abdullah bin Bishr, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, had a large dish called "Al-Ghurra", which four men used to carry. When it was forenoon and they performed the Duha prayer, that dish was brought, meaning it was filled with food, and they gathered around it. When they became many, the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, knelt down. An Arab man said: "What is this sitting posture?" The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Allah has made me a noble servant, and He has not made me a stubborn tyrant." Then the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Eat from around it, and leave its peak so that it may be blessed." (Narrated by Abu Dawud) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Abu Juhaifa Wahb bin Abdullah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "I do not eat reclining." (Reported by Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: I saw the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) sitting in a squatting posture eating dates. (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "When one of you eats food, he should not wipe his fingers until he licks them or has them licked." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Ka'b bin Malik, may Allah be pleased with him, reported: I saw the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, eating with three fingers, and when he finished he licked them. (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) ordered licking the fingers and the plate, and said: "You do not know in which of your foods the blessing lies." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "If a morsel of food falls from one of you, let him pick it up, remove any dirt from it, and eat it, and not leave it for the devil. And let him not wipe his hand with a napkin until he licks his fingers, for he does not know in which part of his food the blessing is." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Indeed, Satan attends you in all of your affairs, even when he attends you at your food. If one of you drops a morsel, let him pick it up and remove what is on it of dirt, then let him eat it and not leave it for Satan. When he finishes, let him lick his fingers, for he does not know in which of his food the blessing lies." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that when the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) ate food, he would lick his three fingers and say: "If a morsel of food falls from any of you, let him pick it up, remove any dirt from it, and eat it, and not leave it for the devil." He also ordered us to wipe the platter clean and said: "You do not know in which part of your food the blessing lies." (Reported by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Sa'id bin Al-Harith, that he asked Jabir, may Allah be pleased with him, about ablution from what the fire has touched, and he said: "No, in the time of the Prophet, peace be upon him, we did not find such food except little. And if we found it, we had no napkins except our hands, forearms, and feet. Then we would pray without performing ablution." (Narrated by Al-Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "The food of two is sufficient for three, and the food of three is sufficient for four." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) say: "The food of one is enough for two, and the food of two is enough for four, and the food of four is enough for eight." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]
It was narrated from Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) used to breathe three times while drinking. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, it is narrated that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Do not drink in one gulp like the gulping of a camel. Rather, drink in twos and threes, and mention Allah's name when you drink, and praise Him when you finish." (Narrated by Tirmidhi) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]
And from Abu Qatadah, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, forbade breathing into the vessel. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, was brought milk mixed with water. An Arab was on his right, and Abu Bakr, may Allah be pleased with him, was on his left. He drank, then gave it to the Arab and said: "The right, then the right." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Sahl bin Sa'd (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was brought a drink, and he drank from it. To his right was a boy, and to his left were old men. He said to the boy: "May I give this to these people?" The boy said: "No, by Allah, I would not give my share of you to anyone." So the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) gave it to the boy. (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of Abu Sa'eed Al-Khudri (may Allah be pleased with him), who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade breaking the mouths of waterskins, meaning to break their openings and drink from them. ((Agreed upon)) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, forbade drinking from the mouth of a waterskin or a waterskin bag. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Umm Thabit, Kabsha bint Thabit, the sister of Hassan bin Thabit (may Allah be pleased with them both), she said: The Messenger of Allah (may Allah bless him and grant him peace) came to me, and he drank from the mouth of a hanging waterskin while standing. I went to its mouth and cut it off. (Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi, who said: A hasan sahih hadith). I only cut it off to preserve the place of the Messenger of Allah's (may Allah bless him and grant him peace) mouth and to seek blessings from it and to protect it from being common. This hadith is to show permissibility, and the two previous hadiths are to show what is better and more complete, and Allah knows best. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Narrated Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, forbade blowing into a drink. A man said: "I see a particle in the container." He said: "Pour it out." He said: "I am not satisfied with one gulp?" He said: "Then remove the cup from your mouth." (Reported by Al-Tirmidhi) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, prohibited breathing into the vessel, or blowing into it. (Reported by Al-Tirmidhi) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]
And Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, said: I gave the Prophet, peace be upon him, to drink Zamzam water, and he drank while standing. (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Al-Nuzal bin Sabra, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: Ali, may Allah be pleased with him, came to the door of Al-Rahba and drank standing up, and said: I saw the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, do as you saw me do. (Narrated by Al-Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both) narrated: We used to eat while walking during the time of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him), and we used to drink while standing. (Narrated by Tirmidhi) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]
