And from Amr ibn Shu'ayb, from his father, from his grandfather, may Allah be pleased with them, he said: "I saw the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, drinking while standing or sitting." (Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, that he forbade a man from drinking while standing. Qatadah said: So we said to Anas: And eating? He said: That is worse - or more impure. And in another narration of his, the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, forbade drinking while standing. (Reported by Muslim) And in another narration of his, the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, forbade drinking while standing. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "None of you should drink while standing. If anyone forgets, he should vomit." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Abu Qatadah (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "The one who serves the people drinks last." (Tirmidhi) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated: The prayer was established, so those who lived nearby went to their families, and some people remained. Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was brought a stone basin, but the basin was too small for him to spread his hand in it. So all the people performed ablution. They asked: How many were you? He said: Eighty and more. (Agreed upon) This is the narration of Al-Bukhari. And in the narration of Muslim: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) asked for a vessel of water, and a wide-mouthed pitcher containing some water was brought to him, and he put his fingers in it. Anas said: I started looking at the water gushing from between his fingers, and I estimated that between seventy and eighty people performed ablution. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abdullah bin Zaid, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Prophet, peace be upon him, came to us, and we brought him water in a pot made of brass, and he performed ablution. (Narrated by Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Jabir, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, entered upon a man from the Ansar, and with him was a companion. The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "If you have water that has been standing overnight, we will drink it; otherwise, we will drink from the stream." (Narrated by Al-Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Hudhayfah (may Allah be pleased with him) it is narrated that the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him) forbade us from wearing silk and brocade, and from drinking in vessels of gold and silver, and he said: "They are for them in this world, and they are for you in the Hereafter." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Umm Salamah, may Allah be pleased with her, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "He who drinks in a silver vessel, truly he is only swallowing fire from Hell into his belly." (Agreed upon)
And in another narration: "Indeed, he who eats or drinks in a vessel of silver and gold." And in a narration of his: "Whoever drinks in a vessel of gold or silver, truly he is only swallowing fire from Hell into his belly." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Wear white from your clothes, for they are among your best clothes, and shroud your dead in them." (Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Samura (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "Wear white clothing, for it is purer and better, and shroud your dead in it." (Narrated by An-Nasa'i and Al-Hakim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Al-Bara' (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was of medium stature. I have never seen anything more beautiful than him, and I saw him wearing a red garment. (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Abu Juhaifah Wahb bin Abdullah (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated: I saw the Prophet (peace be upon him) in Mecca, in Al-Abtaḥ, in a red tent made of leather. Bilal brought water for his ablution, some sprinkled it and some took it. The Prophet (peace be upon him) came out wearing a red garment, as if I could see the whiteness of his legs. He performed his ablution, and Bilal called for prayer. I kept following his mouth here and there, saying to the right and to the left: "Come to prayer, come to success." Then a short spear (ʿanazah) was planted for him, and he went forward and prayed. A dog and a donkey passed in front of him, and he was not prevented. (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Rifa'ah al-Taimi, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: I saw the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, wearing two green garments. (Narrated by Abu Dawud and Tirmidhi) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) entered on the day of the conquest of Mecca wearing a black turban. (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Sa'id Amr bin Hurayth, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: It is as if I am looking at the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, wearing a black turban, with its ends hanging down between his shoulders. (Narrated by Muslim)
And in another narration by him: That the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, addressed the people, and he was wearing a black turban. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was shrouded in three white Sahulian cloths of cotton, without a shirt or a turban. ((Agreed upon)) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from her, she said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, went out one morning, and he was wearing a striped cloak of black hair. (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Narrated Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: "I was traveling with the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) one night, and he said to me: 'Do you have water?' I said: 'Yes.' So he dismounted from his mount and walked until he disappeared into the darkness of the night. Then he came back and I poured water for him from the waterskin. He washed his face, and he was wearing a woolen cloak. He could not get his arms out of it until he pulled them out from the bottom of the cloak. So he washed his arms and wiped his head. Then I went to take off his shoes, and he said: 'Leave them, for I entered them in a state of purity.' And he wiped them." (Agreed upon) In another narration: "And he was wearing a Syrian cloak with tight sleeves." And in another narration: "This incident occurred during the expedition of Tabuk." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Umm Salama (may Allah be pleased with her) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) liked the shirt the most among all clothes. (Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]
From Asma bint Yazid Al-Ansari, may Allah be pleased with her, she said: The sleeves of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, reached the wrists. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both) that the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "Whoever drags his garment out of arrogance, Allah will not look at him on the Day of Resurrection." So Abu Bakr said: "O Messenger of Allah, my garment hangs low until I adjust it." So the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said to him: "You are not among those who do it out of arrogance." (Narrated by Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Allah will not look on the Day of Resurrection at him who trails his garment out of pride." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]
And from him, from the Prophet, peace be upon him, he said: "Whatever is below the ankles of the izar is in the Fire." Narrated by Bukhari. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Dharr, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, peace be upon him, he said: "There are three whom Allah will not speak to on the Day of Resurrection, nor look at them, nor purify them, and for them is a painful punishment." He said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, recited it three times. Abu Dharr said: They are ruined and have lost! Who are they, O Messenger of Allah? He said: "The one who trails his garment, the one who boasts of his favors, and the one who sells his goods by false oath." And in another narration: "The one who trails his garment." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, from the Prophet, may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him, he said: "Letting the lower part of the loincloth, the shirt, and the turban hang down; whoever drags something out of arrogance, Allah will not look at him on the Day of Resurrection." (Narrated by Abu Dawood and An-Nasa'i) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And Abu Jarrah Jabir bin Salim, may Allah be pleased with him, said: I saw a man whose opinion people followed; whatever he said, they followed it. I asked: Who is this? They said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him. I said: "Allah's peace be upon you, O Messenger of Allah" - twice. He said: "Do not say 'Allah's peace be upon you,' rather say 'Peace be upon you,' for 'Allah's peace be upon you' is the greeting of the dead." I said: "Peace be upon you." I asked: "Are you the Messenger of Allah?" He said: "I am the Messenger of Allah. If any harm befalls you and you call upon me, He will remove it from you. If a year of drought befalls you and you call upon me for sustenance, He will cause it to grow for you. If you are in a barren land or a desert and your mount gets lost, and you call upon me, He will return it to you." I said: "Advise me." He said: "Do not revile anyone." He said: I have not reviled any free person, nor a slave, nor a camel, nor a sheep after that. "And do not belittle any good deed, even if you speak to your brother with a cheerful face. That is a good deed. And raise your garment to the middle of your calf; if you refuse, then to the two ankles. And beware of letting your garment trail, for that is of pride, and Allah does not love pride. And if a man insults you and defames you with what he knows about you, do not defame him with what you know about him, for the consequences of that will be upon him." (Reported by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: While a man was praying with his garment trailing, the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) said to him: "Go and perform ablution." So he went and performed ablution. Then he came back and he said: "Go and perform ablution." A man said: "O Messenger of Allah, why did you order him to perform ablution and then leave him?" He said: "He was praying with his garment trailing, and Allah does not accept the prayer of a man whose garment is trailing." (Narrated by Abu Dawud) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And Qais bin Bishr Al-Taghlabi narrated from his father, who was a companion of Abu Al-Darda', that there was a man in Damascus, a companion of the Prophet, peace be upon him, called Sahl bin Hanzalah. He was a recluse, rarely associating with people, spending his time in prayer. When he finished, he would engage in glorifying and magnifying Allah until he returned to his family. He passed by us one day while we were with Abu Al-Darda', and Abu Al-Darda' said to him, "A word that benefits us and does not harm you." He said, "The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, sent a detachment, and they returned. One of them came and sat in the gathering where the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, used to sit. He said to a man next to him, 'If you had seen us when we met the enemy, and so-and-so attacked and struck with his spear, saying, "Take this from me, I am the young man from Ghifar." What do you think of his saying?' The man replied, 'I do not think his reward is invalidated.' Another heard this and said, 'I see no harm in that.' They disputed until the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, heard them and said, 'Subhan Allah! There is no harm in being rewarded and praised.' I saw Abu Al-Darda' pleased with this and he kept looking up at him and saying, 'Did you hear this from the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him?' He would reply, 'Yes.' He kept repeating it until I thought he would fall on his knees. He said, 'Another day he passed by us, and Al-Darda' said to him, "A word that benefits us and does not harm you." He said, "The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said to us: 'The one who spends in good is like one who extends his hand in charity and does not withhold it.'" Then he passed by us another day, and Abu Al-Darda' said to him, "A word that benefits us and does not harm you." He said, "The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: 'What a good man Khuraym Al-Asadi is! If only he had a shorter forelock and his garment was shorter!' This reached Khuraym, so he got a razor and cut his forelock to his ears, and raised his garment to his shins." Then he passed by us another day, and Abu Al-Darda' said to him, "A word that benefits us and does not harm you." He said, "I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, say: 'You are coming to your brethren, so prepare your mounts and prepare your clothing until you are like a mark among people, for Allah does not love obscenity or being obscene.'" (Narrated by Abu Dawud) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Sa'id al-Khudri, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The garment of a Muslim should reach to the middle of the shank. There is no harm in it between it and the ankles. What is below the ankles is in the Fire. And whoever trails his garment out of vanity, Allah will not look at him." (Narrated by Abu Dawud) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both) who said: I passed by the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) while my lower garment was loose. He said: "O Abdullah, raise your lower garment." So I raised it, then he said: "Add more." So I added more, and I continued to be mindful of it thereafter. Some of the people said: "To where?" He said: "To the middle of the shins." (Reported by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him it is narrated that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Whoever drags his garment out of pride, Allah will not look at him on the Day of Resurrection." Umm Salamah said: "Then what should women do with their hems?" He said: "Let them lengthen them by a span." She said: "Then their feet will be exposed." He said: "Then let them lengthen them by a cubit, and no more." (Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Narrated from Mu'adh bin Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "Whoever abandons wearing fine clothes out of humility to Allah, while he is capable of wearing them, Allah will call him on the Day of Resurrection before all creatures and give him the choice of whichever garments of faith he wishes to wear." (Tirmidhi) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of 'Amr bin Shu'ayb, from his father, from his grandfather, may Allah be pleased with them, that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Indeed, Allah loves to see the mark of His favor on His servant." (Narrated by Tirmidhi) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of Umar ibn Al-Khattab, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Do not wear silk, for whoever wears it in this world will not wear it in the Hereafter." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, say: "Only he who has no share in the Hereafter wears silk." (Agreed upon)
And in a narration of Bukhari: "He who has no share in the Hereafter." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Whoever wears silk in this world will not wear it in the Hereafter." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ali, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: I saw the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, take silk and place it in his right hand, and gold and place it in his left hand, then he said: "These two are forbidden for the males of my Ummah." (Reported by Abu Dawud) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Musa Al-Ash'ari, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Silk and gold have been forbidden for the males of my Ummah, and made lawful for their females." (Reported by Al-Tirmidhi) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Hudhaifah, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, forbade us to drink in vessels of gold and silver, and to eat in them, and from wearing silk and brocade, and from sitting on them. (Narrated by Al-Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) permitted Zubair and Abdur Rahman bin Auf (may Allah be pleased with them) to wear silk due to itching they suffered from. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Mu'awiyah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Do not ride on silk or on striped fur." (Narrated by Abu Dawood) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu al-Malih, from his father, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, forbade the skins of wild beasts. (Narrated by Abu Dawud, Tirmidhi, and An-Nasa'i) And in a narration of Tirmidhi: He forbade the skins of wild beasts from being used as furnishings. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) would put on a new garment, he would name it by its name, be it an 'Imamah (turban), a Qamis (shirt), or a Rida' (cloak). He would say: "O Allah, to You is all praise. You have clothed me with it. I ask You for its good and the good of what it was made for, and I seek refuge with You from its evil and the evil of what it was made for." (Reported by Abu Dawud and Tirmidhi, who said it is a Hasan hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Al-Bara' bin Azib (may Allah be pleased with them both) who said: When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) went to his bed, he would lie on his right side, and then say: "O Allah, I have surrendered myself to You, and directed my face to You, and entrusted my affair to You, and sought refuge in You with my back, desiring and fearing You. There is no refuge nor safety from You except with You. I believe in Your Book which You sent down, and in Your Prophet whom You sent." (Narrated by Bukhari with this wording in the Book of Etiquette in his Sahih) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said to me: "When you come to your bed, perform ablution as you do for prayer, then lie down on your right side, and say...". And he mentioned similar things, and in it: "And make them the last of what you say." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, she said: The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, used to pray eleven rak'ahs at night. When dawn broke, he would pray two light rak'ahs, then he would lie down on his right side until the muezzin came and informed him. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Narrated Hudhaifah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Prophet (peace be upon him) when he went to bed at night, he would place his hand under his cheek and say, "O Allah, with Your name I die and live." And when he woke up, he would say, "All praise is due to Allah Who revived us after He caused us to die, and to Him is the return." (Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Yash ibn Tuhfa al-Ghaffari (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that his father said: "While I was lying on my stomach in the mosque, a man nudged me with his foot and said: 'This is a lying posture that Allah dislikes.' I looked and it was the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him)." (Narrated by Abu Dawud with a Sahih chain of narration.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him), from the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) who said: "Whoever sits in a place where he does not remember Allah the Almighty, it will be a loss for him from Allah the Almighty. And whoever lies down in a place where he does not remember Allah the Almighty, it will be a loss for him from Allah." (Narrated by Abu Dawud with a hasan chain of narration). "Al-tirah" is with a kasrah on the "ta," and it means: a deficiency, and it is also said to mean: a consequence. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abdullah bin Zaid (may Allah be pleased with him) that he saw the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) lying down in the mosque, with one leg crossed over the other. (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Jabir bin Samura, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: When the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, prayed Fajr, he would sit cross-legged in his place until the sun rose beautifully. A sahih hadith, narrated by Abu Dawud and others with sahih chains of transmission. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, he said: I saw the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, in the courtyard of the Kaaba, sitting with his legs clasped in his hands like this. And he described his hands clasped, which is sitting in the Qurfasa position. (Narrated by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Qaylah bint Makhramah, may Allah be pleased with her, she said: "I saw the Prophet, peace be upon him, sitting in the qurfa'ah position. When I saw the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, humble in his posture, I trembled with fear." (Reported by Abu Dawud and Tirmidhi). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Al-Sharid bin Suwaid, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, passed by me while I was sitting like this, and I had placed my left hand behind my back and leaned on the heel of my hand. He said: "Do you sit the sitting of those who are angered?!" (Narrated by Abu Dawood with a sound chain of narration). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "None of you should get up from his place and then sit in it again. Rather, make room for one another." Ibn Umar would not sit in a place after someone had stood up for him. (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "If one of you stands up from his gathering, then returns to it, he has more right to it." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Jabir bin Samrah, may Allah be pleased with them both, he said: When we came to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, one of us would sit where he reached. (Narrated by Abu Dawood and Tirmidhi, and he said: "A good hadith.") [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Abdullah Salman Al-Farsi, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "No man performs Ghusl on Friday, and purifies himself as much as he can, and anoints himself with his oil, or applies some of the perfume of his household, then goes out and does not separate two people, then prays what has been decreed for him, then listens when the Imam speaks, except that his sins between that Friday and the next Friday will be forgiven." (Narrated by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Amr ibn Shu'ayb, from his father, from his grandfather, may Allah be pleased with them, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "It is not permissible for a man to separate two people except with their permission." Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said: "It is a hasan hadith." In a narration by Abu Dawud: "A man should not sit between two people except with their permission." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Hudhayfah ibn al-Yaman, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) cursed the one who sat in the middle of a circle. Narrated by Abu Dawud with a sound chain of narration. And At-Tirmidhi narrated from Abu Mijlaz that a man sat in the middle of a circle, so Hudhayfah said: Cursed by the tongue of Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) is the one who sat in the middle of a circle. At-Tirmidhi said: "Hasan Sahih Hadith". [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And Abu Sa'id al-Khudri, may Allah be pleased with him, narrated that he heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "The best of gatherings are the widest ones." (Reported by Abu Dawud with a sound chain of narration according to the conditions of Bukhari.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Narrated by Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Whoever sits in a gathering and talks too much in it, and before leaving his sitting place, says: 'Glory be to You, O Allah, and praise be to You. I bear witness that there is no god but You. I seek Your forgiveness and I repent to You,' then he will be forgiven whatever was said in that gathering." (Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi, who said it is a Hasan Sahih Hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Barzah (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: When the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) wanted to get up from a gathering, he would say: "Glory be to You, O Allah, and praise be to You. I bear witness that there is no god but You. I seek Your forgiveness and turn to You in repentance." A man said: "O Messenger of Allah, you say something that you did not used to say before?" He said: "That is an expiation for what happens in the gathering." (Narrated by Abu Dawud). (Narrated by Al-Hakim Abu Ubaidullah in Al-Mustadrak from the narration of Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her) and said: It is authentic with a chain of narration). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, rarely stood up from a gathering until he supplicated with these supplications: "O Allah, allot to us a fear of You that will prevent us from disobeying You, and obedience to You that will bring us to Your Paradise, and certainty that will make the afflictions of this world seem light to us. O Allah, let us enjoy our hearing, our sight, and our strength as long as You keep us alive, and make it [our enjoyment] inherit from us. And let our vengeance be upon those who wronged us, and grant us victory over those who opposed us. And do not let our affliction be in our religion, and do not make this world our greatest concern, nor the extent of our knowledge, nor let those who have no mercy upon us have power over us." (Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi, who said it is a hasan hadith.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, he said, the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "No people rise from a gathering without remembering Allah the Almighty in it, except that they rise from it as if they were from a dead donkey, and it will be a regret for them." (Narrated by Abu Dawud with a sound chain of narration). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, he said: "No people sit in a gathering in which they do not remember Allah the Almighty, nor send blessings upon their Prophet, except that it becomes a source of regret for them. If He wills, He will punish them, and if He wills, He will forgive them." (Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and he said: "A hasan hadith.") [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, from the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, he said: "Whoever sits in a gathering where Allah the Almighty is not remembered will have a loss from Allah, and whoever lies down in a place where Allah is not remembered will have a loss from Allah." (Narrated by Abu Dawud). This has preceded recently, and we have explained "loss" therein. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Hurayrah that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Nothing is left of the prophethood except the good tidings." They said: "What are the good tidings?" He said: "The good dream." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "When the time draws near, the believer's dream will hardly lie, and the believer's dream is a part of forty-six parts of prophecy." (Agreed upon). And in another narration: "The truest of you in dreams is the truest of you in speech." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "Whoever sees me in a dream will see me when awake – or as if he saw me when awake – for Satan cannot appear in my form." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri, may Allah be pleased with him, that he heard the Prophet, peace be upon him, say: "If one of you sees a dream that he likes, it is from Allah Almighty, so he should praise Allah for it and narrate it." And in another narration: "He should not narrate it except to one whom he loves." And if he sees otherwise, what he dislikes, then it is from Satan, so he should seek refuge from its evil, and not mention it to anyone, for it will not harm him." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Qatadah, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Prophet, peace be upon him, said: "A good dream is from Allah, and a bad dream is from Satan. So if anyone sees something he dislikes, let him blow to his left three times and seek refuge in Allah from Satan, for it will not harm him." (Agreed upon). Blowing is a gentle puff without saliva. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "If one of you sees a dream that he dislikes, he should spit to his left three times, seek refuge with Allah from Satan three times, and turn over to the side on which he was not lying." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu al-Asqa', Wathilah ibn al-Asqa', may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Among the greatest falsehoods is for a man to claim lineage other than his father, or to claim to have seen what his eyes have not seen, or to say about the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, what he did not say." (Narrated by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-'Aas (may Allah be pleased with them both) that a man asked the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him): "Which aspect of Islam is best?" He said: "To feed the hungry, and to greet those whom you know and those whom you do not know." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him, who said: When Allah the Almighty created Adam, peace be upon him, He said: "Go and greet that group of angels, who were sitting, and listen to what they greet you with, for it is your greeting and the greeting of your descendants." So he said: "As-salamu alaykum," and they said: "As-salamu alayka wa rahmatullah," and they added: "wa rahmatullah." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Umara al-Bara' bin Azib, may Allah be pleased with them both, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, commanded us with seven things: visiting the sick, following funerals, responding to the sneezer, helping the weak, aiding the oppressed, spreading the greeting of peace, and fulfilling the oath of the one who swears. (Agreed upon, this is the wording of one of the narrations of Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "You will not enter Paradise until you believe, and you will not believe until you love one another. Shall I not tell you of something that, if you do it, you will love one another? Spread peace among yourselves." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Yusuf Abdullah bin Salam, may Allah be pleased with him, that he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) say: "O people, spread the greetings of peace, feed the hungry, and maintain the ties of kinship. Pray when people are sleeping, and you will enter Paradise in peace." (Narrated by Tirmidhi, who said it is a Hasan Sahih hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Tufail bin Abi bin Ka'b, that he used to come to Abdullah bin Umar, and go with him to the market. He said: When we went to the market, Abdullah would not pass by a merchant, nor a shopkeeper, nor a poor person, nor anyone, but he would greet him. Tufail said: I came to Abdullah bin Umar one day and he asked me to accompany him to the market. I said to him: What are you doing in the market when you do not stop at a sale, nor inquire about goods, nor bargain for them, nor sit in the market gatherings? And I would say: Let us sit here and talk. He said: O Abu Batn - and Tufail had a large belly - we only go out for the sake of greeting, so we greet whomever we meet. (Narrated by Malik in Al-Muwatta with a sahih chain of narration). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from 'Imran bin Husain (may Allah be pleased with them both) that a man came to the Prophet (peace be upon him) and said: "As-salamu alaykum." He replied to him, and then he sat down. The Prophet (peace be upon him) said: "Ten." Then another man came and said: "As-salamu alaykum wa rahmatullah." He replied to him, and he sat down. He said: "Twenty." Then another man came and said: "As-salamu alaykum wa rahmatullah wa barakatuh." He replied to him, and he sat down. He said: "Thirty." (Narrated by Abu Dawud and Tirmidhi, who said it is a Hasan Hadith.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, she said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him, said to me: "This is Gabriel, he sends you his greetings." She said: I said: "And upon him be peace, and the mercy of Allah and His blessings." (Agreed upon) And thus it occurred in some narrations of the two Sahihs: "and His blessings," and in some of them with it omitted, and an addition by a trustworthy narrator is accepted. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, peace be upon him, when he spoke a word, he would repeat it three times so that it would be understood from him, and when he came to a people and greeted them, he would greet them three times. (Narrated by Bukhari) And this is understood in the case where the group is large. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Al-Miqdad (may Allah be pleased with him) in his long hadith, he said: We used to reserve for the Prophet, peace be upon him, his share of milk. He would come at night and give a greeting that would not wake the sleeping, but would be heard by the awake. The Prophet, peace be upon him, came and greeted as he used to greet. (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Asma bint Yazid, may Allah be pleased with her, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, passed by the mosque one day, and a group of women were sitting. He beckoned with his hand in greeting. (Reported by Al-Tirmidhi, who said it is a hasan hadith) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Umamah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The closest of people to Allah are those who initiate greetings." (Narrated by Abu Dawud with a good chain of narration, and narrated by Tirmidhi with a similar wording and said: It is a hasan hadith, and it was mentioned after this.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And Abu Juhaymah Al-Hujaymi (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that he came to the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) and said: "Assalamu 'alaik, O Messenger of Allah." He said: "Do not say 'Assalamu 'alaik'; for 'Assalamu 'alaik' is the greeting of the dead." (Narrated by Abu Dawud and Tirmidhi, who said it is a Hasan Sahih Hadith. It has preceded in full.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The rider should greet the walker, and the walker should greet the one who is sitting, and the smaller group should greet the larger group." (Agreed upon) and in a narration of Al-Bukhari: "And the young should greet the old." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of Abu Umamah Sudayy bin ‘Ajlan Al-Bahili (may Allah be pleased with him), who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: “The closest of people to Allah are those who begin with salam.” (Narrated by Abu Dawud with a good chain of narration). And it was narrated by At-Tirmidhi from Abu Umamah (may Allah be pleased with him) that it was said: “O Messenger of Allah, two men meet, which of them should begin with salam?” He said: “The one who is closer to Allah, the Almighty.” At-Tirmidhi said: This is a hasan hadith. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Narrated Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, in the Hadith of the man who prayed badly, that he came and prayed, then he came to the Prophet (peace be upon him) and greeted him. He returned his greeting and said: "Go back and pray, for you have not prayed." So he went back and prayed, then he came and greeted the Prophet (peace be upon him), until he did that three times." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, from the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him), who said: "When one of you meets his brother, let him greet him. If a tree, wall, or stone comes between them, and then he meets him again, let him greet him." (Narrated by Abu Dawud). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) said to me: "O my son, when you enter upon your family, then greet them with Salam, it will be a blessing upon you and upon your household." (Narrated by Tirmidhi and he said: It is a Hasan Sahih Hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that he passed by some children, greeted them, and said: "The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) used to do this." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of Sahl bin Sa'd (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: "There was a woman among us - and in another narration: there was an old woman for us - who would take the roots of chard and put them in the pot, and grind some barley. When we prayed Friday and finished, we would greet her, and she would present it to us." (Reported by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Umm Hani, Fakhita bint Abi Talib (may Allah be pleased with her), she said: "I came to the Prophet, peace be upon him, on the day of the Conquest while he was bathing, and Fatimah was shielding him with a garment. I greeted him, and mentioned the hadith." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Asma bint Yazid, may Allah be pleased with her, she said: The Prophet, peace be upon him, passed by us, a group of women, and greeted us. (Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said: A hasan hadith, and this is the wording of Abu Dawud.) And the wording of Al-Tirmidhi is: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, passed by the mosque one day, and a group of women were sitting, and he gestured with his hand to greet them. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated on the authority of Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Do not greet the Jews and the Christians with peace, and if you meet any of them on the road, force them to the narrowest part of it." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]
Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said, "If the People of the Book greet you, then say: Wa alaykum." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Usamah, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, passed by a gathering containing a mixture of Muslims and polytheists - idolaters and Jews - and the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, greeted them. (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, that he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "When one of you comes to a gathering, he should salute, and when he wishes to leave, he should salute. The first salutation is not more deserving than the last." (Reported by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said it is a hasan hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Musa Al-Ash'ari, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Seeking permission is three times, and if permission is granted, then enter, otherwise return." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Sahl bin Sa'd, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Permission to enter was made only for the sake of eyesight." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Rubayyi' bin Harash, he said: A man from Banu 'Amir narrated to us, he sought permission to enter upon the Prophet, peace be upon him, while he was in a house, and he said: "May I enter?" So the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said to his servant: "Go out to this man and teach him how to seek permission, and say to him: Say, 'Peace be upon you, may I enter?'" The man heard him and said: "Peace be upon you, may I enter?" So the Prophet, peace be upon him, gave him permission, and he entered. (Narrated by Abu Dawud with a sound chain of narration). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Kalada bin Al-Hunbal, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: I came to the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, and I entered upon him without greeting him. The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Go back and say, 'Peace be upon you, may I enter?'" (Reported by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said it is a hasan hadith.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated in his famous Hadith about Al-Isra (the Night Journey): The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "Then Jibril ascended with me to the lowest heaven and asked for it to be opened. It was said: 'Who is it?' He said: 'Jibril.' It was said: 'And who is with you?' He said: 'Muhammad.' Then he ascended with me to the second, third, fourth, and all the heavens. And at the gate of each heaven, it was said: 'Who is it?' And he would say: 'Jibril.'" (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Dharr, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: I went out one night, and I saw the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, walking alone. I began to walk in the moonlight, and he turned and saw me, so he said: "Who is this?" I said: Abu Dharr. (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Umm Hani (may Allah be pleased with her) who said: I came to the Prophet (peace be upon him) while he was bathing and Fatimah was shielding him. He said: "Who is this?" I said: "I am Umm Hani." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that he said: I came to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and knocked on the door. He said: "Who is it?" I said: "I." He said: "I, I?!" as if he disliked it. (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Prophet (peace be upon him) said: "Allah loves sneezing and dislikes yawning. So, if one of you sneezes and praises Allah, it is a right upon every Muslim who hears him to say: 'May Allah have mercy on you.' As for yawning, it is from Satan. So, if one of you yawns, he should try to suppress it as much as he can, for when one of you yawns, Satan laughs at him." (Reported by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, from the Prophet, may God's peace and blessings be upon him, he said: "If one of you sneezes, he should say: 'Praise be to God.' And his brother or his companions should say to him: 'May God have mercy on you.' If he says to him: 'May God have mercy on you,' he should say: 'May God guide you and set your affairs right.'" (Narrated by Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Abu Musa (may Allah be pleased with him) reported that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "When any one of you sneezes and praises Allah, you should say: Yarhamuk Allah (may Allah have mercy on you), and when he does not praise Allah, you should not say it." (Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Narrated Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) said: Two men sneezed in the presence of the Prophet (peace be upon him). He said "Yarhamukallah" (May Allah have mercy on you) to one of them, but not to the other. The one to whom he did not say it said: "So-and-so sneezed, and you said 'Yarhamukallah' to him, but when I sneezed, you did not say it to me?" He said: "This one praised Allah, and you did not praise Allah." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: When the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, sneezed, he would cover his mouth or his garment with his hand and lower – or suppress – his voice. The narrator was in doubt. (Narrated by Abu Dawud and Tirmidhi, who said it is a hasan sahih hadith.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Musa, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Jews would sneeze in the presence of the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, hoping he would say to them: "May Allah have mercy on you." So he would say: "May Allah guide you and set your affairs aright." (Reported by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said: A hasan sahih hadith.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Sa'eed Al-Khudri (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "If one of you yawns, he should cover his mouth with his hand, for Satan enters." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Abu Al-Khattab Qatadah, he said: I asked Anas: "Was handshaking practiced by the companions of the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him?" He said: "Yes." (Narrated by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: When the people of Yemen came, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The people of Yemen have come to you, and they were the first to come with the practice of shaking hands." (Narrated by Abu Dawud with a sound chain of transmission). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Narrated Al-Bara' (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "No two Muslims meet and shake hands, but they are forgiven before they part." (Narrated by Abu Dawud). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: A man said, "O Messenger of Allah, if a man meets his brother or his friend, should he bow to him?" He said, "No." He said, "Should he embrace him and kiss him?" He said, "No." He said, "Should he take his hand and shake it?" He said, "Yes." (Narrated by Tirmidhi and he said: It is a Hasan hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Safwan bin Assal, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: A Jew said to his companion: "Let us go to this Prophet, peace be upon him." So they came to the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, and asked him about nine clear signs. The hadith mentioned up to his saying: So they kissed his hand and his foot, and said: "We bear witness that you are a Prophet." (Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and others with authentic chains of narration). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, a narration in which he said: We approached the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, and we kissed his hand. (Narrated by Abu Dawud). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, who said: Zayd ibn Harithah came to Medina while the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, was in my house. He came to him and knocked on the door. The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, got up to meet him, dragging his garment. He embraced him and kissed him. (Narrated by Tirmidhi and he said: This is a hasan hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Dharr, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said to me: "Do not belittle any good deed, even if it is just meeting your brother with a cheerful face." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Prophet, peace be upon him, kissed Al-Hasan bin Ali, may Allah be pleased with them both. Al-Aqra' bin Habis said: "I have ten children, and I have not kissed a single one of them." So the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "He who does not show mercy will not be shown mercy!" (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Al-Bara' bin Azib (may Allah be pleased with them both) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) commanded us to visit the sick, to follow the funeral procession, to reply to the sneezer, to fulfill the oath of one who swears, to help the oppressed, to accept the invitation, and to spread greetings of peace. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The rights of a Muslim over a Muslim are five: returning the greeting, visiting the sick, following the funeral procession, responding to an invitation, and replying to the sneeze." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, it is narrated that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: Allah the Mighty and Majestic says on the Day of Resurrection: "O son of Adam, I was sick and you did not visit me!" He will say: "O Lord, how could I visit You, when You are the Lord of the worlds?" He will say: "Did you not know that My servant so-and-so was sick and you did not visit him? Did you not know that if you had visited him, you would have found Me with him? O son of Adam, I asked you for food and you did not feed me!" He will say: "O Lord, how could I feed You, when You are the Lord of the worlds?" He will say: "Did you not know that My servant so-and-so asked you for food and you did not feed him? Did you not know that if you had fed him, you would have found that with Me? O son of Adam, I asked you for water and you did not give me water!" He will say: "O Lord, how could I give You water, when You are the Lord of the worlds?" He will say: "My servant so-and-so asked you for water and you did not give him water! Did you not know that if you had given him water, you would have found that with Me?" (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Musa Al-Ash'ari, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said, "Visit the sick, feed the hungry, and free the captive." (Narrated by Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Thawban, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, he said: "When a Muslim visits his Muslim brother, he remains in the fruit-gathering of Paradise until he returns." It was said: "O Messenger of Allah, what is the fruit-gathering of Paradise?" He said: "Its fruit." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ali, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "No Muslim visits another Muslim in the morning except that seventy thousand angels pray for him until the evening. If he visits him in the evening, then seventy thousand angels pray for him until the morning, and he will have a harvest in Paradise." (Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and said: It is a hasan hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: A Jewish boy used to serve the Prophet (peace be upon him). He fell ill, so the Prophet (peace be upon him) went to visit him. He sat by his head and said to him, "Embrace Islam." The boy looked at his father, who was present, and his father said to him, "Obey Abul-Qasim." So he embraced Islam. The Prophet (peace be upon him) left, saying, "All praise is due to Allah, Who saved him from the Fire." (Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, that the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, if a person complained of pain in his body, or had a sore or a wound, the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, would say with his finger like this, and Sufyan bin Uyaynah, the narrator, placed his index finger on the ground and then raised it and said: "In the name of Allah, the earth of our land, with the saliva of some of us, it heals our sick, by the permission of our Lord." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from her, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, used to visit some of his family, and he would wipe his right hand on them and say: "O Allah, Lord of mankind, remove the suffering, and heal, for You are the Healer. There is no healing except Your healing, a healing that leaves no sickness." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, that he said to Thabit, may Allah have mercy on him: "Shall I not recite the incantation of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, over you?" He said: "Yes." He said: "O Allah, Lord of mankind, Remover of suffering, cure, for You are the Healer. There is no healer but You, a healing that leaves no sickness." (Narrated by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Sa'd bin Abi Waqqas, may Allah be pleased with him, that he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, visited me and said: "O Allah, heal Sa'd, O Allah, heal Sa'd, O Allah, heal Sa'd." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Abdullah Uthman bin Abi Al-As, may Allah be pleased with him, that he complained to the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, of a pain he felt in his body. So the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Place your hand on the place of pain in your body and say: In the name of Allah - three times - and say seven times: I seek refuge in Allah's might and power from the evil of what I feel and fear." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, from the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, he said: "Whoever visits a sick person whose death has not yet come, and says seven times by him: 'I ask Allah the Mighty, the Lord of the Mighty Throne, to heal you,' Allah will heal him from that illness." (Narrated by Abu Dawood and Al-Tirmidhi, who said: it is a hasan hadith. Al-Hakim said: it is a sahih hadith according to the condition of Bukhari.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, entered upon a Bedouin to visit him. When he entered upon someone he was visiting, he would say: "No harm, purification, if Allah wills." (Narrated by Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Sa'eed Al-Khudri (may Allah be pleased with him) that Jibreel came to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and said: "O Muhammad, are you suffering?" He said: "Yes." He said: "In the name of Allah, I perform Ruqyah for you, from everything that harms you, and from the evil of every soul or envious eye. Allah shall cure you. In the name of Allah, I perform Ruqyah for you." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Abu Sa'eed Al-Khudri and Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with them, that they testified that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever says: 'There is no god but Allah, and Allah is the greatest,' his Lord testifies to him, saying: 'There is no god but I, and I am the greatest.' And when he says: 'There is no god but Allah alone, with no partner,' He says: 'There is no god but I alone, with no partner.' And when he says: 'There is no god but Allah, to Him belongs dominion and to Him belongs all praise,' He says: 'There is no god but I, to Me belongs dominion and to Me belongs all praise.' And when he says: 'There is no god but Allah, and there is no might nor power except by Allah,' He says: 'There is no god but I, and there is no might nor power except by Me.'" And he used to say: "Whoever says it in his illness and then dies will not be consumed by the Fire." (Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and said: It is a hasan hadith) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them, that Ali bin Abi Talib, may Allah be pleased with him, went out from the presence of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, during the illness in which he passed away. The people said: "O Abu Al-Hasan, how is the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, this morning?" He said: "By Allah's grace, he is well." (Narrated by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, who said: I heard the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, while he was leaning on me, say: "O Allah, forgive me and have mercy on me and join me with the Highest Companion." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from her, she said: I saw the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, when he was near death, and he had a cup with water in it. He would put his hand in the cup, then wipe his face with the water, and say: "O Allah, help me with the pangs of death and the agony of death." (Reported by Al-Tirmidhi). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from ‘Imran bin Husain (may Allah be pleased with them) that a woman from the tribe of Juhainah came to the Prophet (peace be upon him) and she was pregnant from adultery. She said: "O Messenger of Allah, I have committed a sin for which a prescribed punishment is due, so implement it upon me." The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) called her guardian and said: "Be kind to her, and when she gives birth, bring her to me." So he did. Then the Prophet (peace be upon him) ordered for her and her clothes were fastened around her, then he ordered for her and she was stoned to death, then he prayed over her. (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: I entered upon the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, and he was suffering from a fever. I touched him, and said: "You are suffering from a very strong fever." He said: "I suffer from a fever twice as much as any of you." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Sa'd bin Abi Waqqas, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, came to visit me because of a severe pain I was suffering. I said: I am in the condition you see, and I have wealth, and no one inherits me except my daughter. And he mentioned the hadith. (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Al-Qasim bin Muhammad, he said: Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her) said: "Oh my head!" So the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Nay, it is I, oh my head!" And he mentioned the hadith. (Narrated by Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of Mu'adh (may Allah be pleased with him), who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Whoever's last words are: 'There is no god but Allah,' will enter Paradise." (Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Hakim, who said: It is a sound chain of narration.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Sa'id al-Khudri, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "Prompt your dying ones with the declaration of 'There is no god but Allah'." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Umm Salamah (may Allah be pleased with her) that she said: "The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) entered upon Abu Salamah when his sight had become dimmed. He closed his eyes and said: 'When the soul is taken, the sight follows it.' Some of his family members wailed. He said: 'Do not invoke curses upon yourselves except for good, for the angels say amen to what you say.' Then he said: 'O Allah, forgive Abu Salamah, and raise his rank among the rightly guided, and grant him successors among those who remain. Forgive us and him, O Lord of the worlds, and widen his grave and illuminate it for him.'" (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Umm Salamah (may Allah be pleased with her) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "When you are with a sick person or a dead person, say good things, for the angels say Amen to what you say." She said: "When Abu Salamah died, I came to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and said: 'O Messenger of Allah, Abu Salamah has died.' He said: 'Say: O Allah, forgive me and him, and grant me a good successor after him.'" She said: "And Allah granted me a successor who was better for me than him: Muhammad (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him)." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from her, she said: I heard the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) say: "No servant is afflicted with a calamity, and he says: 'To Allah we belong and to Him we shall return. O Allah, reward me in my calamity and give me better than it in exchange.' Except that Allah Almighty will reward him in his calamity and give him better than it in exchange." She said: "When Abu Salamah died, I said what the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) had commanded me, and Allah gave me better than him in exchange, who was the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him)." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It is narrated from Abu Musa (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "When the child of a servant dies, Allah the Almighty says to His angels: 'Have you taken the child of My servant?' They say: 'Yes.' He says: 'Have you taken the fruit of his heart?' They say: 'Yes.' He says: 'What did My servant say?' They say: 'He praised You and said: To Allah we belong and to Him we return.' Allah the Almighty says: 'Build for My servant a house in Paradise and call it the House of Praise.'" (Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi, who said it is a Hasan hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: Allah the Almighty says: "There is no reward for My believing servant with Me if I take away his beloved from the people of this world and he remains patient, except Paradise." (Narrated by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Usama bin Zaid (may Allah be pleased with them both) who said: One of the daughters of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) sent to him inviting him and informing him that her son was dying. So he said to the messenger: "Go back to her and tell her that what Allah takes belongs to Him, and what He gives belongs to Him, and everything with Him has an appointed term. So tell her to be patient and to seek reward." The Hadith continues. (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Ibn `Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) visited Sa`d ibn `Ubadah, accompanied by `Abd ar-Rahman ibn `Awf, Sa`d ibn Abi Waqqas, and `Abdullah ibn Mas`ud (may Allah be pleased with them). The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) wept. When the people saw the weeping of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), they wept. He said: "Do you not hear? Allah does not punish by the tears of the eye, nor by the sadness of the heart, but He punishes by this, or shows mercy." And he gestured towards his tongue. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Usamah ibn Zayd (may Allah be pleased with them both) that the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) was presented with his grandson while he was dying. The eyes of the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) overflowed with tears. Sa'd said to him, "What is this, O Messenger of Allah?" He said, "This is mercy which Allah the Almighty has placed in the hearts of His merciful servants." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) went to his son Ibrahim (may Allah be pleased with him) while he was in his death throes. The eyes of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) began to shed tears. Abdur Rahman bin Auf said to him, "O Messenger of Allah, even you?" He replied, "O Ibn Auf, it is mercy." Then he added another statement, saying, "The eyes shed tears and the heart grieves, and we do not say except what pleases our Lord. Indeed, we are grieved by your parting, O Ibrahim." (Narrated by Bukhari, and Muslim narrated a part of it). And there are many other authentic and well-known hadiths on this topic. Allah knows best. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Abu Rafi, the freed slave of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Whoever washes a dead person and conceals his faults, Allah will forgive him forty times." (Narrated by Al-Hakim and said it is authentic according to the condition of Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Whoever attends the funeral until the prayer is offered for it, he will have one Qirat, and whoever attends until it is buried, he will have two Qirats." It was said: "And what are the two Qirats?" He said: "Like two great mountains." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "Whoever follows the funeral of a Muslim, believing and seeking reward, and stays with it until he prays over it and finishes its burial, he will return with two qirats of reward, each qirat is like Uhud. And whoever prays over it, then returns before it is buried, he will return with one qirat." (Narrated by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Umm 'Atiyyah (may Allah be pleased with her) who said: "We were forbidden from following funerals, but it was not a firm prohibition." (Agreed upon). Its meaning is: "And the prohibition was not emphasized as it is emphasized for forbidden things." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, she said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "No deceased person is prayed over by a community of Muslims numbering one hundred, all of whom intercede for him, but that they will be accepted to intercede for him." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "No Muslim man dies and forty men stand over his funeral, associating nothing with Allah, but Allah will accept their intercession for him." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Marthad bin Abdullah Al-Yazani, he said: Malik bin Hubayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) if he prayed over a funeral, and people prayed over it in three rows, then they were sufficient for it, and then he said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Whoever prays over him in three rows, has made it obligatory." (Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said: It is a hasan hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of Abu Abdur-Rahman bin Awf bin Malik (may Allah be pleased with him), who said: The Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) prayed over a funeral, and I memorized some of his supplication, wherein he said: "O Allah, forgive him, have mercy on him, give him soundness, pardon him, make his resting place honorable, enlarge his entrance, and cleanse him with water, snow, and hail. Purify him from sins as a white garment is purified from dirt. Replace his home with a better home, his family with a better family, and his spouse with a better spouse. Admit him to Paradise and protect him from the punishment of the grave and the punishment of the Fire." So much so that I wished I were that deceased. (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah, Abu Qatadah, and Abu Ibrahim Al-Ash'ali from his father - and his father was a companion - may Allah be pleased with them, from the Prophet, peace be upon him, that he prayed over a funeral and said: "O Allah, forgive our living and our dead, our young and our old, our males and our females, our present and our absent. O Allah, whoever among us You keep alive, keep him alive upon Islam, and whoever among us You cause to die, cause him to die upon faith. O Allah, do not deprive us of his reward, and do not let us be tempted after him." (Narrated by Tirmidhi) from the narration of Abu Hurairah and Abu Hurairah is authentic and Al-Ash'ali, and Abu Dawud narrated it from the narration of Abu Hurairah and Abu Qatadah. Al-Hakim said: The hadith of Abu Hurairah is authentic according to the conditions of Bukhari and Muslim. Tirmidhi said: Bukhari said: The most authentic narration of this hadith is the narration of Al-Ash'ali. Bukhari said: And the most authentic in this chapter is the hadith of Auf bin Malik. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, say: "When you pray over the deceased, be sincere in your supplication for them." (Narrated by Abu Dawud). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, in the prayer over a funeral: "O Allah, You are its Lord, and You created it, and You guided it to Islam, and You took its soul, and You know its secret and its public. We have come to intercede for him, so forgive him." (Reported by Abu Dawud). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Wathilah bin Al-Asqa' (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) prayed over a Muslim man, and I heard him say: "O Allah, so-and-so, son of so-and-so, is under Your protection and the bond of Your covenant. Protect him from the trial of the grave and the torment of the Fire. You are the Owner of fulfillment and praise. O Allah, forgive him and have mercy on him, for indeed You are the Oft-Forgiving, the Most Merciful." (Narrated by Abu Dawud) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abdullah bin Abi Awfa, may Allah be pleased with them, that he performed four takbirs over the funeral of his daughter. After the fourth takbir, he stood for a duration equivalent to the time between two takbirs, asking for forgiveness for her and supplicating, then he said: "The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, used to do this." In another narration: "He performed four takbirs, and he remained for a while until I thought he would perform five, then he said salam to his right and to his left. When he finished, we said to him: 'What is this?' He said: 'I do not add to what I saw the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, do, or: This is what the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, did.'" (Narrated by Al-Hakim and he said: It is a sahih hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Hasten with the funeral procession, for if the deceased is righteous, it is a good thing you are sending them to. And if they are otherwise, it is an evil from which you are ridding yourselves." (Agreed upon). And in a narration of Muslim: "So it is a good thing you are sending them to." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to say: "When the funeral bier is placed, and men carry it on their shoulders, if it was righteous, it would say: 'Send me forward.' And if it was not righteous, it would say to its family: 'Woe to you, where are you taking it?' Everything hears its voice except humans, and if a human heard it, he would fall unconscious." (Narrated by Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The soul of the believer is suspended by its debt until it is repaid." (Tirmidhi, who said it is a Hasan Hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Husain bin Wahwah, may Allah be pleased with him, that Talhah bin Al-Bara', may Allah be pleased with him, fell ill. The Prophet, peace be upon him, came to visit him and said: "I see that death has overtaken Talhah. So inform me about it and hasten with him, for it is not fitting for the corpse of a Muslim to be kept among his family." (Narrated by Abu Dawud). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Ali, may Allah be pleased with him, that he said: We were at a funeral in Baqi al-Gharqad when the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, came to us and sat down. We sat around him, and he had a stick with him. He bowed his head and began to poke with his stick, then he said: "There is no one among you except that his place in Hellfire and his place in Paradise has been written." They said: "O Messenger of Allah, should we not then rely on our book?" He said: "Act, for everyone is made to facilitate what he was created for." And the rest of the hadith was mentioned. (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Abu Amr - and it was said: Abu Abdullah, and it was said: Abu Layla - Uthman bin Affan, may Allah be pleased with him, said: The Prophet, peace be upon him, when he finished burying the deceased, would stand over him and say: "Ask for forgiveness for your brother and ask for him to be steadfast, for he is now being questioned." (Narrated by Abu Dawud). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Amr ibn al-As (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: When you bury me, stand around my grave for as long as it takes to slaughter a camel and distribute its meat, so that I may feel at ease with you, and know what to reply to the messengers of my Lord. (Reported by Muslim. It has preceded in its entirety). And Al-Shafi'i (may Allah have mercy on him) said: It is recommended to recite something from the Quran at his grave, and if they complete the entire Quran at his grave, it would be good. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may God be pleased with her, that a man said to the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him: My mother died suddenly, and I think if she had spoken, she would have given charity. Does she have a reward if I give charity on her behalf? He said: "Yes." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "When a person dies, all his deeds come to an end except for three: a continuous charity, or knowledge that is benefited from, or a righteous child who prays for him." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that some people passed by a funeral procession, and they spoke well of the deceased. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "It is incumbent." Then they passed by another funeral procession, and they spoke ill of the deceased. The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "It is incumbent." 'Umar ibn al-Khattab (may Allah be pleased with him) asked: "What is incumbent?" He said: "This one you spoke well of, so Paradise is incumbent for him. And this one you spoke ill of, so Hellfire is incumbent for him. You are the witnesses of Allah on earth." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Abu Al-Aswad narrated: I came to Medina and sat with Umar ibn Al-Khattab (may Allah be pleased with him). A funeral procession passed by, and the deceased was praised. Umar said: "It is obligatory."
