And from Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, from the Prophet, peace be upon him, he said: "Make some of your prayers in your houses, and do not make them graves." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) said: "When one of you performs his prayer in his mosque, let him make a portion of his prayer for his house, for Allah will make his prayer in his house a source of goodness." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from 'Umar bin 'Atā' that Nāfi' bin Jubayr sent him to Al-Sā'ib bin Yazīd, the nephew of Numayr, to ask him about something he saw Mu'āwiyah do during prayer. He said: Yes, I prayed Jum'ah with him in the enclosure. When the Imām concluded, I stood in my place and prayed. When he entered, he sent for me and said: Do not repeat what you did. If you pray Jum'ah, do not follow it with another prayer until you speak or leave, for the Messenger of Allāh, may Allāh's peace and blessings be upon him, commanded us not to follow one prayer with another until we speak or leave. (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of Ali, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: "Witr is not an obligation like the prescribed prayer, but it is a Sunnah of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him. He said: 'Allah is Witr and loves Witr, so pray Witr, O people of the Quran.'" (Reported by Abu Dawud and Tirmidhi). He said: It is a Hasan hadith. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, performed Witr at all hours of the night: at the beginning, the middle, and the end of the night. And his Witr concluded at dawn. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]
And from Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him: "Make the last of your prayers at night Witr." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Sa'eed al-Khudri, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Perform Witr prayer before the morning comes." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, used to pray at night, and she was lying across in front of him. When the Witr prayer remained, he would wake her up, and she would pray Witr. (Narrated by Muslim). And in another narration by him: When the Witr prayer remained, he would say: "Get up and pray Witr, O Aisha." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn 'Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, that the Prophet, may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Hasten to perform Witr prayer before the dawn." (Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi). And he said: It is a Hasan Sahih Hadith. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Jabir, may Allah be pleased with him, who said that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever fears that he will not be able to perform the night prayer, let him perform Witr at its beginning. And whoever is ambitious to perform it at its end, let him perform Witr at the end of the night, for the prayer at the end of the night is witnessed, and that is better." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) advised me to fast three days of every month, to pray two rak'ahs of Duha, and to perform Witr prayer before sleeping. (Agreed upon) Witr prayer before sleeping is only recommended for those who are not confident they will wake up at the end of the night; if one is confident, then the end of the night is better. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It is narrated on the authority of Abu Dharr, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, peace be upon him, said: "Charity is incumbent upon every joint of one of you every day. So, every glorification (of Allah) is a charity, and every declaration of His Oneness is a charity, and every declaration of His Greatness is a charity, and enjoining good is a charity, and forbidding evil is a charity, and all of this is accomplished by two rak'ahs that one prays in the forenoon (Duha)." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) used to pray four rak'ahs of Duha prayer, and would add more as Allah willed. (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Umm Hani, Fakhitah bint Abi Talib, may Allah be pleased with her, she said: "I went to the Messenger of Allah, may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him, in the year of the Conquest, and I found him performing ghusl. When he finished his ghusl, he prayed eight rak'ahs, and that was in the forenoon." (Agreed upon, and this is a summary of the wording of one of Muslim's narrations.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Zaid bin Arqam (may Allah be pleased with him) that he saw people praying in the forenoon, and he said: "They know that prayer at another time is better. Indeed, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: 'The prayer of the repentant is when the young camels' feet are scorched.'" (Reported by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Qatadah, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "When one of you enters the mosque, he should not sit down until he has prayed two rak'ahs." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Jabir, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: I came to the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, while he was in the Masjid, and he said: "Pray two rak'ahs." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said to Bilal: "O Bilal, tell me the most hopeful deed you have done in Islam, for I heard the sound of your sandals before me in Paradise." He said: "I did not do any deed that is more hopeful to me than that I did not purify myself with a purification at any hour of the night or day, except that I prayed with that purification whatever Allah decreed for me to pray." (Agreed upon, and this is the wording of Al-Bukhari.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The best day on which the sun has risen is Friday. On this day, Adam was created, on this day he was admitted to Paradise, and on this day he was expelled from it." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever performs ablution and perfects it, then comes to Friday prayer, and listens attentively, his sins between him and the next Friday, and three more days, will be forgiven. And whoever touches pebbles has spoken in vain." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, he said: "The five prayers, and from one Friday to the next, and from Ramadan to Ramadan, are expiations for what is between them, as long as the major sins are avoided." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him and from Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, that they heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say on the steps of his pulpit: "People must cease their neglect of the Friday prayers, or Allah will seal their hearts, and then they will be among the heedless." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "When one of you comes for Jumu'ah, let him perform ghusl." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Sa'eed Al-Khudri, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Washing on Friday is obligatory for every male who has reached puberty." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Samurah, may Allah be pleased with him, it is narrated that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "Whoever performs Wudu' on Friday, it is good. But whoever performs Ghusl, then Ghusl is better." (Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said it is a Hasan Hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Salman, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "No man washes on Friday and purifies himself as much as he can, and anoints himself with his oil or perfumes himself with the perfume of his household, then he goes out and does not separate two people, then he prays what is decreed for him, then he listens quietly when the Imam speaks, except that he will be forgiven what is between him and the next Friday." (Narrated by Al-Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) said: "Whoever performs Ghusl on Friday like the Ghusl of Janabah, then goes at the first hour, it is as if he sacrificed a camel. Whoever goes at the second hour, it is as if he sacrificed a cow. Whoever goes at the third hour, it is as if he sacrificed a horned ram. Whoever goes at the fourth hour, it is as if he sacrificed a chicken. Whoever goes at the fifth hour, it is as if he sacrificed an egg. When the Imam comes out, the angels attend to listen to the remembrance." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, that the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) mentioned Friday, and he said: "There is an hour on it, if a Muslim servant encounters it while he is standing in prayer, asking Allah for something, He will give it to him." And he gestured with his hand, making it brief. (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Burda bin Abi Musa Al-Ash'ari, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: Abdullah bin Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, said: Did you hear your father narrating from the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, concerning the hour of Jumu'ah? He said: I said: Yes, I heard him say: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "It is between when the Imam sits down until the prayer is finished." (Reported by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aws bin Aws, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Indeed, one of your best days is Friday, so send many blessings upon me on that day, for your blessings are presented to me." (Narrated by Abu Dawud with a sound chain of narration). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of Sa'd bin Abi Waqqas, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: We went out with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) from Mecca, intending for Medina. When we were near Azwarā', he dismounted and raised his hands, and supplicated to Allah for an hour, then he prostrated. He remained for a long time, then stood up and raised his hands for an hour, then prostrated - he did this three times - and said: "I asked my Lord, and interceded for my Ummah, and He gave me one-third of my Ummah. So I prostrated to my Lord in gratitude. Then I raised my head and asked my Lord for my Ummah, and He gave me one-third of my Ummah. So I prostrated to my Lord in gratitude. Then I raised my head and asked my Lord for my Ummah, and He gave me the other third. So I prostrated to my Lord." (Reported by Abu Dawud) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, she said: The Prophet, peace be upon him, used to stand in prayer at night until his feet became swollen. I said to him: "Why do you do this, O Messenger of Allah, when Allah has forgiven your past and future sins?" He said: "Should I not be a grateful servant?" (Agreed upon, and from Al-Mughirah ibn Shu'bah, a similar hadith, agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ali, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, came to him and Fatima at night and said: "Will you not pray?" (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Salim bin Abdullah bin Umar bin Al-Khattab, may Allah be pleased with them, from his father: that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "What an excellent man Abdullah would be if he prayed at night." Salim said: After that, Abdullah would sleep but little. (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-Aas, may Allah be pleased with them both, he said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "O Abdullah, do not be like so-and-so: he used to pray at night, then he abandoned praying at night." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: A man was mentioned to the Prophet, peace be upon him, who slept through the night until morning! He said: "That is a man in whose ears - or he said: in his ear - Satan urinated." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him), that the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) said: "Satan ties three knots at the back of your head while you are asleep. He strikes each knot and says: 'You have a long night ahead, so sleep.' If one of you wakes up and remembers Allah, one knot is untied. If he performs ablution, another knot is untied. If he prays, all three knots are untied, and he wakes up refreshed and in good spirits. Otherwise, he wakes up in bad spirits and lazy." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abdullah bin Salam, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "O people, spread peace, feed the hungry, and pray at night when people are asleep, you will enter Paradise in peace." (Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and he said: A hasan saheeh hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "The best of fasting after Ramadan is the fasting of Allah's month, Al-Muharram, and the best of prayer after the obligatory prayer is the night prayer." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The night prayer is two by two, and if you fear the dawn, then pray Witr with one Rak'ah." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]
And from him, he said: The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, used to pray at night two by two, and he used to pray Witr with one Rak'ah. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, would break his fast for so many days in the month that we would think he would not fast any of it, and he would fast so many days that we would think he would not break his fast from any of it. And you would not wish to see him praying at night except that you would see him, nor sleeping except that you would see him. (Narrated by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, used to pray eleven rak'ahs - meaning at night - and he would prostrate for a length of time equivalent to one of you reciting fifty verses before raising his head. And he would pray two rak'ahs before the Fajr prayer, then lie down on his right side until the caller for prayer came to him. (Narrated by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from her, she said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) never prayed more than eleven rak'ahs in Ramadan or at other times. He prayed four, and do not ask about their beauty and length. Then he prayed four, and do not ask about their beauty and length. Then he prayed three. I said: O Messenger of Allah, do you sleep before praying Witr? He said: "O Aisha, my eyes sleep, but my heart does not sleep." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]
And from her, the Prophet, peace be upon him, used to sleep the first part of the night and stand the last part of it to pray. (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: I prayed with the Prophet (peace be upon him) one night, and he kept standing until I had a mind to do a bad thing. It was asked: What did you have in mind? He said: I had a mind to sit down and leave him. (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Hudhaifah (may Allah be pleased with him) it is narrated: I prayed with the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) one night, and he began with Surat Al-Baqarah. I said: He will bow at the hundredth verse. But he continued. I said: He will recite it in one rak'ah. But he continued. I said: He will bow. Then he began Surat An-Nisa' and recited it. Then he began Surat Al-'Imran and recited it, reciting slowly. When he came to a verse containing glorification, he glorified; and when he came to a verse asking a question, he asked; and when he came to a verse asking for refuge, he sought refuge. Then he bowed and began to say: Glory be to my Lord, the Most Great. His bowing was nearly as long as his standing. Then he said: Allah hears him who praises Him; to You be praise. Then he stood for a long time, nearly as long as he bowed. Then he prostrated and said: Glory be to my Lord, the Most High. His prostration was nearly as long as his standing. (Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Jabir, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, was asked: Which prayer is best? He said: "The longest Qunut." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-'As, may Allah be pleased with them, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The most beloved prayer to Allah is the prayer of David, and the most beloved fasting to Allah is the fasting of David. He used to sleep half the night and stand for a third of it and sleep for a sixth of it, and he would fast one day and break his fast on the next." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) reported that he heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) say: "There is in the night an hour, no Muslim man attains it while praying and asks Allah for good in this world and the hereafter, but He will grant it to him, and this is every night." (Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "If one of you stands up at night, let him begin the prayer with two light units of prayer." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, who said: When the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, stood for prayer at night, he would begin his prayer with two light rak'ahs. (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from her, may Allah be pleased with her, she said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, if he missed the night prayer due to illness or some other reason, he would pray twelve rak'ahs during the day. (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It is narrated from Umar ibn Al-Khattab, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever sleeps through his portion [of the Quran] or a part of it, and then recites it between the Fajr prayer and the Dhuhr prayer, it will be written for him as if he had recited it during the night." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) said: "May Allah have mercy on a man who gets up at night, prays, and wakes his wife. If she refuses, he sprinkles water on her face. And may Allah have mercy on a woman who gets up at night, prays, and wakes her husband. If he refuses, she sprinkles water on his face." (Reported by Abu Dawud with a sound chain of narration). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him and from Abu Saeed, may Allah be pleased with them both, they said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him, said: "If a man wakes his wife at night and they pray, or pray two rak'ahs together, he will be counted among the men and women who remember Allah." (Narrated by Abu Dawud with a sound chain of narration). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may God be pleased with her, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "If one of you feels drowsy in prayer, let him sleep until the drowsiness leaves him, for if one of you prays while drowsy, he might go to seek forgiveness and curse himself." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "If one of you gets up at night and the Quran is difficult for him to recite, and he does not know what to say, then let him lie down." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Whoever stands in Ramadan believing and seeking reward, his previous sins will be forgiven." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, may Allah be pleased with him, it is narrated that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to encourage standing (in prayer) during Ramadan without commanding it as a compulsory act, saying: "Whoever stands (in prayer) during Ramadan out of faith and seeking reward, his past sins will be forgiven." (Reported by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him), from the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) who said: "Whoever stands during Laylat al-Qadr with faith and in expectation of reward, his past sins will be forgiven." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, that some men from the companions of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, saw Laylat al-Qadr in a dream in the last seven nights. So the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "I see that your dreams have agreed concerning the last seven nights, so whoever seeks it, let him seek it in the last seven nights." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, used to observe I'tikaf in the last ten days of Ramadan and say: "Seek the Night of Decree in the last ten days of Ramadan." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from her, may Allah be pleased with her, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Seek out the Night of Qadr in the odd-numbered nights of the last ten days of Ramadan." (Reported by Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from her, may Allah be pleased with her, she said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) used to "When the last ten days of Ramadan began, he would stay up at night, wake his family, and gird his loins." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It is narrated from her that she said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) used to strive in Ramadan more than he used to strive in other months, and he used to strive in the last ten nights of Ramadan more than he used to strive in other nights. (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from her, she said: I said: "O Messenger of Allah, what do you think if I know which night is Laylat al-Qadr, what should I say in it?" He said: "Say: O Allah, You are Oft-Forgiving, and You love to forgive, so forgive me." (Narrated by Tirmidhi and said it is a Hasan Sahih hadith) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Were it not that I would be burdening my Ummah - or the people - I would have commanded them to use the siwak with every prayer." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Hudhayfah (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) awoke from sleep, he would rinse his mouth with the siwak. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, she said: We used to prepare for the Messenger of Allah, his toothstick and his ablution water. When Allah willed to awaken him during the night, he would use the toothstick, perform ablution, and pray. (Reported by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (may Allah bless him and grant him peace) said: "I have urged you to use the toothstick." (Narrated by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Shuraih bin Hani', may Allah be pleased with him, he said: I said to Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her: With what did the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, begin when he entered his house? She said: With the siwak. (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Musa Al-Ash'ari, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: I entered upon the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, and the end of the Siwak was on his tongue. (Agreed upon). This is the wording of Muslim. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her) narrated that the Prophet (peace be upon him) said: "The Siwak is a purifier for the mouth and a pleasure for the Lord." (Narrated by An-Nasa'i and Ibn Khuzaimah in his Sahih with authentic chains of narration). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him), from the Prophet (peace be upon him) who said: "The Fitrah is five, or five are from the Fitrah: circumcision, shaving the pubic hair, trimming the nails, plucking the armpit hair, and clipping the mustache." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Ten things are from the Sunnah of *Fitrah*: trimming the mustache, letting the beard grow, using the *siwak*, sniffing water into the nose, clipping the nails, washing the knuckles, plucking the armpit hair, shaving the pubic hair, and washing the mouth." The narrator said: "And I forgot the tenth, unless it was rinsing the mouth." Waki' - and he is one of its narrators - said. (25) (Narrated by Muslim) (26) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]
And from Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, from the Prophet, peace be upon him, he said: "Trim the mustaches and let the beards grow." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Islam is built on five: testifying that there is no god but Allah and that Muhammad is His servant and Messenger, establishing prayer, giving zakah, making pilgrimage to the House, and fasting Ramadan." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Talhah bin Ubaidullah, may Allah be pleased with him, narrated: A man came to the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, from the people of Najd, with disheveled hair. We could hear the sound of his voice, but we could not understand what he was saying, until he approached the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. He was asking about Islam. The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "Five prayers in the day and night." He said: "Is there anything else upon me?" He said: "No, unless you volunteer to do more." Then the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "And the fasting of Ramadan." He said: "Is there anything else upon me?" He said: "No, unless you volunteer to do more." He said: And the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, mentioned Zakat (charity) to him. He said: "Is there anything else upon me?" He said: "No, unless you volunteer to do more." The man turned away, saying: "By Allah, I will not add to this nor subtract from it." The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "He has succeeded if he is truthful." (Agreed Upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him, sent Muadh, may Allah be pleased with him, to Yemen and said: "Invite them to testify that there is no god but Allah, and that I am the Messenger of Allah. If they obey that, then inform them that Allah Almighty has obligated them to perform five prayers every day and night. If they obey that, then inform them that Allah has obligated them to give charity which is taken from their rich and returned to their poor." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "I have been commanded to fight people until they testify that there is no god but Allah and that Muhammad is the Messenger of Allah, and they establish the prayer, and they give the zakat. If they do that, their blood and their property are protected from me, except by the right of Islam, and their reckoning is with Allah." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him), he said: When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) passed away, and Abu Bakr (may Allah be pleased with him) became caliph, and some of the Arabs apostatized, Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) said: "How can we fight the people when the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: 'I have been ordered to fight the people until they say: There is no god but Allah. Whoever says it has protected his wealth and his life from me, except by its right, and his reckoning is with Allah'?" Abu Bakr said: "By Allah, I will fight whoever separates prayer and zakat, for zakat is the right of wealth. By Allah, if they withhold from me even a rope that they used to pay to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), I will fight them for withholding it." Umar (may Allah be pleased with him) said: "By Allah, it was nothing but that I saw Allah had opened Abu Bakr's chest for fighting, and I knew that it was the truth." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Ayyub (may Allah be pleased with him) that a man said to the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him): "Tell me of a deed that will admit me to Paradise." He said: "You worship Allah and associate nothing with Him, you establish prayer, you give zakat, and you maintain the ties of kinship." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It is narrated from Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) that a Bedouin came to the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him) and said, "O Messenger of Allah, guide me to a deed that, if I do it, I will enter Paradise." He said, "Worship Allah and associate nothing with Him, establish prayer, give the obligatory charity, and fast Ramadan." The Bedouin said, "By Him in Whose hand is my soul, I will not add to this." When he turned to leave, the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him) said, "Whoever would be pleased to look at a man from the people of Paradise, let him look at this man." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Jarir bin Abdullah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: I pledged allegiance to the Prophet, peace be upon him, to establish the prayer, pay the zakat, and to be sincere to every Muslim. (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, narrated that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "No owner of gold or silver who does not pay its due will have, on the Day of Resurrection, plates of fire made for him, and they will be heated in the fire of Hell and his sides, forehead, and back will be branded with them. Whenever they cool down, they will be restored to him, on a Day the length of which is fifty thousand years. Then he will see his way, either to Paradise or to Hell." It was said: "O Messenger of Allah, what about camels?" He said: "And no owner of camels who does not pay their due, and their due is to milk them on the day they are brought to water, but on the Day of Resurrection, they will be laid out for him on a vast, level plain, and none of them will be missing, not one calf. They will trample him with their hooves and bite him with their mouths. Whenever the first of them passes him, the last of them will be returned to him, on a Day the length of which is fifty thousand years. Then he will see his way, either to Paradise or to Hell." It was said: "O Messenger of Allah, what about cattle and sheep?" He said: "And no owner of cattle or sheep who does not pay their due will have, on the Day of Resurrection, but they will be laid out for him on a vast, level plain, and none of them will be missing. There will be no ewe with crooked horns, nor one with bald horns, nor one with a broken horn. They will butt him with their horns and trample him with their hooves. Whenever the first of them passes him, the last of them will be returned to him, on a Day the length of which is fifty thousand years. Then he will see his way, either to Paradise or to Hell." It was said: "O Messenger of Allah, what about horses?" He said: "Horses are of three types: for one man they are a sin, for one man they are a covering, and for one man they are a reward. As for the one for whom they are a sin, it is a man who ties them up for show and pride and enmity towards Muslims; so they are a sin for him. As for the one for whom they are a covering, it is a man who ties them up in the way of Allah, and then does not forget the rights of Allah on their backs or their necks; so they are a covering for him. As for the one for whom they are a reward, it is a man who ties them up in the way of Allah for the Muslims in a meadow or a pasture, so whatever they eat from that meadow or pasture, it is written for him as good deeds for the amount they ate, and it is written for him as good deeds for the amount of their dung and urine. And if they gallop the length of their tether, running a distance of one or two leaps, Allah will write for him the number of their tracks and their dung as good deeds. And if their owner passes by a river and they drink from it, and he does not intend to water them, Allah will write for him the number of what they drank as good deeds." And performing Witr before sleep is only recommended for those who are not confident they will wake up at the end of the night. If one is confident, then the end of the night is better. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Allah the Almighty said: Every deed of the son of Adam is for him except fasting, for it is for Me, and I reward it. Fasting is a shield, so if one of you is fasting, he should not behave lewdly or quarrelously. If anyone insults him or fights him, he should say: 'I am fasting.' By Him in Whose hand is the soul of Muhammad, the breath of the one who fasts is sweeter to Allah than the scent of musk. The one who fasts has two joys: he rejoices when he breaks his fast, and he rejoices when he meets his Lord." (Agreed upon). (This is the wording from the narration of Al-Bukhari. In another narration of his: He leaves his food, his drink, and his desires for My sake. Fasting is for Me, and I reward it, and a good deed is multiplied by ten. In a narration of Muslim: "Every deed of the son of Adam is multiplied: a good deed by ten times its like up to seven hundred times. Allah the Almighty said: 'Except for fasting, for it is for Me, and I reward it. He leaves his desires and his food for My sake. The one who fasts has two joys: a joy when he breaks his fast, and a joy when he meets his Lord. And the breath of his mouth is sweeter to Allah than the scent of musk.") [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, that the Messenger of Allah (may Allah bless him and grant him peace) said: "Whoever spends a pair in the cause of Allah will be called from the gates of Paradise: 'O servant of Allah, this is better.' Whoever is from the people of prayer will be called from the gate of prayer, and whoever is from the people of Jihad will be called from the gate of Jihad, and whoever is from the people of fasting will be called from the gate of Ar-Rayyan, and whoever is from the people of charity will be called from the gate of charity." Abu Bakr, may Allah be pleased with him, said: "May my father and mother be sacrificed for you, O Messenger of Allah! There is no need for one who is called from those gates. Will anyone be called from all those gates?" He said: "Yes, and I hope you will be among them." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Sahl bin Sa'd, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him, he said: "Indeed, in Paradise there is a gate called Ar-Rayyan, through which the fasters will enter on the Day of Resurrection. No one else will enter through it. It will be called out: 'Where are the fasters?' So they will rise, and no one else will enter through it. When they have entered, it will be closed, and no one else will enter." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Sa'id al-Khudri, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, said: "No servant fasts for a day in the cause of Allah, but that Allah will keep his face seventy years away from the Fire because of that day." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him), from the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) who said: "Whoever fasts Ramadan out of faith and in the hope of reward, his past sins will be forgiven." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him, said: "When Ramadan comes, the gates of Paradise are opened, the gates of Hell are closed, and the devils are chained." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, that the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's blessings and peace be upon him) said: "Fast by sighting it, and break your fast by sighting it, and if it is hidden from you, then complete the count of Sha'ban thirty." (Agreed upon, and this is the wording of Bukhari). And in the narration of Muslim: "And if it is covered from you, then fast thirty days." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, was the most generous of people, and he was most generous in Ramadan when Jibril met him, and Jibril would meet him every night of Ramadan and study the Quran with him. So the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, when Jibril met him, was more generous with good than the sending wind. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her) reported that the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) when the last ten nights of Ramadan began, would stay up at night praying, wake his family, and tie his loins. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Narrated Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Prophet (peace be upon him) said: "None of you should fast a day or two before Ramadan, unless he has a custom of fasting on a particular day, and he happens to fast on that day." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them, he said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Do not fast before Ramadan. Fast when you see it and break your fast when you see it. If it is obscured from you, then complete thirty days." (Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and he said it is a hasan sahih hadith.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Narrated Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "When the second half of Sha'ban begins, do not fast." (Narrated by Tirmidhi, who said it is a hasan sahih hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu al-Yaqzan, Ammar bin Yasir, may Allah be pleased with them both, he said: "Whoever fasts the day of doubt has disobeyed Abu al-Qasim, may Allah bless him and grant him peace." (Reported by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said: A hasan sahih hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of Talhah bin 'Ubaidullah (may Allah be pleased with him) that when the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) saw the crescent moon, he would say: "O Allah, make it a crescent of security and faith, of safety and Islam. My Lord and your Lord is Allah. It is a crescent of guidance and goodness." (Tirmidhi) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]
Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "Take Suhoor, for in Suhoor there is blessing." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Zayd ibn Thabit, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: We ate the pre-dawn meal with the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, then we stood up for prayer. It was asked: How long was between them? He said: Fifty verses. (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, had two muezzins: Bilal and Ibn Umm Maktum. So the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Bilal calls to prayer at night, so eat and drink until Ibn Umm Maktum calls to prayer." He said: And there was nothing between them but that one descended and the other ascended. (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Amr ibn al-As, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah said: "The distinction between our fasting and the fasting of the People of the Book is the pre-dawn meal." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of Sahl bin Sa'd (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) said: "People will continue to be well as long as they hasten to break their fast." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu 'Attiyah, he said: Masruq and I entered upon 'Aishah, may Allah be pleased with her. Masruq said to her: "Two men from the companions of Muhammad, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, both of whom do not neglect good deeds: one hastens the Maghrib prayer and breaking the fast, and the other delays the Maghrib prayer and breaking the fast?" She said: "Who hastens the Maghrib prayer and breaking the fast?" He said: "Abdullah - meaning Ibn Mas'ud." She said: "This is how the Messenger of Allah, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, used to do." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him, said that Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, said: "The dearest of My servants to Me are those who are quickest to break their fast." (Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi, who said it is a Hasan hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Umar ibn Al-Khattab, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "When the night comes from this direction and the day goes from this direction, and the sun has set, then the fasting person has broken his fast." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Ibrahim Abdullah bin Abi Awfa, may Allah be pleased with them both, he said: We were traveling with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) while he was fasting. When the sun set, he said to some of the people: "O so-and-so, descend and prepare us some drink." He said: "O Messenger of Allah, if you had waited?" He said: "Descend and prepare us some drink." He said: "Indeed, you have a day to complete." He said: "Descend and prepare us some drink." He said: So he descended and prepared them some drink, and the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) drank. Then he said: "When you see the night approaching from here," and he gestured with his hand towards the east, "then the fasting person has broken his fast." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Salman bin 'Amir Ad-Dabbi, the Companion, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, he said: "When one of you breaks his fast, let him break his fast with dates, and if he does not find dates, then let him break his fast with water, for it is pure." (Reported by Abu Dawud and At-Tirmidhi, who said: A hadith hasan sahih). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, would break his fast on fresh dates before praying. If there were no fresh dates, he would break his fast on dried dates. If there were no dried dates, he would drink a few sips of water. (Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said: This is a hasan hadith.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "When it is the day of fasting for any of you, he should not speak obscenely or shout. If anyone insults him or fights him, let him say: 'I am fasting.'" [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: The Prophet, peace be upon him, said: "Whoever does not give up false speech and acting upon it, then Allah has no need for him to give up his food and drink." (Narrated by Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "If one of you forgets and eats or drinks, let him complete his fast, for it is Allah who has fed him and given him drink." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Laqit bin Sabra (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: I said, "O Messenger of Allah, tell me about ablution." He said: "Perform ablution thoroughly, and make sure to interlace your fingers, and sniff water deeply into your nose, unless you are fasting." (Reported by Abu Dawud and At-Tirmidhi, who said it is a hasan sahih hadith.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her) narrated: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) would wake up in the morning in a state of ritual impurity from his wife, then he would perform Ghusl and fast. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha and Umm Salamah, may Allah be pleased with them, they said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) would wake up in a state of Janabah without a wet dream, and then he would fast. (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The best of fasting after Ramadan is the month of Allah, Al-Muharram, and the best of prayer after the obligatory prayer is the night prayer." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may God be pleased with her, she said: The Prophet, peace be upon him, did not fast more in any month than he did in Sha'ban, for he used to fast all of Sha'ban. In another narration: He used to fast Sha'ban except for a little. (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Mujibah al-Bahiliyyah, from her father or uncle, that he came to the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, then he left and returned to him after a year, and his condition and appearance had changed. He said: "O Messenger of Allah, do you not recognize me?" He said: "And who are you?" He said: "I am al-Bahili who came to you last year." He said: "What has changed you, when you were of good appearance?" He said: "I have not eaten food since I left you except at night." Then the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "You have tormented yourself!" Then he said: "Fast the month of patience, and one day of every month." He said: "Add more for me, for I have strength." He said: "Fast two days." He said: "Add more for me." He said: "Fast three days." He said: "Add more for me." He said: "Fast from the sacred months and leave, fast from the sacred months and leave, fast from the sacred months and leave." And he said with his three fingers, and he closed them, then he released them. (Reported by Abu Dawud). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "There are no days in which righteous deeds are more beloved to Allah than these days," meaning the ten days. They said: "O Messenger of Allah, not even jihad in the cause of Allah?" He said: "Not even jihad in the cause of Allah, except for a man who went out with himself and his wealth and did not return with anything of that." (Narrated by Al-Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Qatadah, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, was asked about fasting on the day of Arafah? He said: "It expiates the sins of the past year and the coming year." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, fasted on the day of Ashura and ordered its observance. (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of Abu Qatada (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) was asked about fasting on the day of Ashura and he said: "It atones for the past year." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Narrated Ibn Abbas (may Allah be pleased with them): The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "If I remain alive until the next year, I will fast the ninth (of Muharram)." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Ayyub (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Whoever fasts Ramadan and then follows it with six days of Shawwal, it will be as if he has fasted for a lifetime." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Abu Qatadah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) was asked about fasting on Monday, and he said: "That is the day I was born, and the day I was sent or the revelation was sent down to me." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) from the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) who said: "Deeds are presented on Mondays and Thursdays, and I would like my deeds to be presented while I am fasting." (Reported by Al-Tirmidhi and he said it is a hasan hadith, and it was reported by Muslim without mentioning fasting). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, she said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, used to be keen on fasting on Mondays and Thursdays. (Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and he said it is a hasan hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: My beloved friend (Prophet Muhammad, peace be upon him) advised me to do three things: to fast three days of every month, to pray two rak'ahs of Duha, and to perform Witr prayer before sleeping. (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Ad-Darda' (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: My beloved, peace be upon him, advised me to do three things which I will not abandon as long as I live: to fast three days of every month, to pray Duha, and not to sleep until I have prayed Witr. (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-'As, may Allah be pleased with them both, he said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "Fasting three days of every month is fasting for the entire year." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Mu'adhah al-Adawiyyah, that she asked Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her: Did the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, fast three days each month? She said: Yes. I said: From which part of the month did he fast? She said: He did not care from which part of the month he fasted. (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Dharr, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "If you fast for three days of the month, then fast on the thirteenth, fourteenth, and fifteenth." Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi, who said: It is a hasan hadith. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Qatadah bin Milhan, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, used to order us to fast the White Days: the thirteenth, fourteenth, and fifteenth. (Narrated by Abu Dawud). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, "used not to break his fast on the days of white (13th, 14th, and 15th of the lunar month) whether at home or on a journey." (Narrated by Al-Nasa'i with a good chain of narration). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Zaid bin Khalid Al-Juhani (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that the Prophet (peace be upon him) said: "Whoever provides iftar for a fasting person, he will have a reward similar to him, without diminishing the reward of the fasting person in the slightest." (Narrated by Tirmidhi, who said it is a Hasan Sahih hadith.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Umm Amara Al-Ansariyyah, may Allah be pleased with her, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, entered upon her and she presented him with food. He said: "Eat." She said: "I am fasting." Then the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Verily, the angels pray for the fasting person when he eats in his presence until they finish," and perhaps he said: "Until they are full." (Reported by Al-Tirmidhi and he said: It is a hasan hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported that the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came to Sa'd ibn 'Ubadah (may Allah be pleased with him). He brought bread and oil, and they ate. Then the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "May the fasting break their fast with you, may the righteous eat your food, and may the angels pray for you." (Narrated by Abu Dawud with a sound chain of narration). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, who said: Allah's Messenger, peace and blessings be upon him, used to perform I'tikaf in the last ten days of Ramadan. (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may God be pleased with her, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, used to perform I'tikaf in the last ten days of Ramadan until God Almighty took his soul. Then his wives performed I'tikaf after him. (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, used to perform I'tikaf in every Ramadan for ten days. When it was the year in which he passed away, he performed I'tikaf for twenty days. (Reported by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: Islam is built upon five: testifying that there is no god but Allah and that Muhammad is His Messenger, establishing the prayer, giving zakat, making pilgrimage to the House, and fasting Ramadan. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, delivered a sermon to us and said: "O people, Allah has enjoined upon you the Hajj, so perform Hajj." A man said: "Every year, O Messenger of Allah?" He remained silent, until he said it three times. Then the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "If I had said yes, it would have become obligatory, and you would not have been able to do it." Then he said: "Leave me to what I have left you. Indeed, those before you were destroyed by their excessive questioning and their disputes with their prophets. So if I command you with anything, do of it what you are able, and if I forbid you from anything, abandon it." (Reported by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him he said: The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, was asked, "What deeds are best?" He said: "Faith in Allah and His Messenger." It was said: "Then what?" He said: "Jihad in the cause of Allah." It was said: "Then what?" He said: "A Hajj Mabroor (accepted pilgrimage)." (Agreed upon) "Al-Mabroor" is that in which its owner does not commit any sin. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "Whoever performs Hajj, and does not engage in sexual intercourse or commit any sin, will return as he was on the day his mother gave birth to him." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "The performance of `Umrah after `Umrah is an expiation for whatever sins have been committed between them, and the reward for Hajj Mabrur (a Hajj accepted by Allah) is nothing but Paradise." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, she said: I said, "O Messenger of Allah, we see that Jihad is the best of deeds, shall we not fight?" He said: "But the best Jihad for you is Hajj Mabrur (a Hajj accepted by Allah)." (Narrated by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from her, the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "There is no day on which Allah frees more of His servants from the Fire than the Day of 'Arafah." (Reported by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "An 'Umrah in Ramadan is equivalent to performing Hajj with me." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, a woman said: "O Messenger of Allah, the obligation of Allah upon His servants is Hajj. My father is an old man, unable to stay steady on the mount. Shall I perform Hajj on his behalf?" He said: "Yes." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Laqit bin `Amir, may Allah be pleased with him, that he came to the Prophet, may Allah bless him and grant him peace, and said: My father is an old man who cannot perform Hajj or `Umrah, nor can he travel. He said: "Perform Hajj for your father and `Umrah." (Narrated by Abu Dawud and Tirmidhi, who said: It is a hasan sahih hadith.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Al-Sa'ib bin Yazid, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: I performed Hajj with the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, in the Farewell Pilgrimage, and I was seven years old. (Narrated by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them, that the Prophet, may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him, met a caravan at Ar-Rauha' and said: "Who are you?" They said: "Muslims." They asked: "Who are you?" He said: "The Messenger of Allah." Then a woman raised a boy and said: "Does this boy have Hajj?" He said: "Yes, and you have a reward." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Anas, may God be pleased with him, that the Messenger of God, may God's peace and blessings be upon him, performed Hajj on a saddle, and it was his camel. (Narrated by Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, he said: 'Ukaz, Majanna, and Dhu al-Majaz were markets during the pre-Islamic era. They felt it was a sin to trade during the seasons, so it was revealed: "There is no sin on you in seeking bounty from your Lord" (Al-Baqarah: 198) concerning the seasons of Hajj.' (Narrated by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was asked: "Which deed is best?" He replied: "Belief in Allah and His Messenger." It was said: "Then what?" He replied: "Striving in the cause of Allah." It was said: "Then what?" He replied: "A pilgrimage that is accepted." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: I said, "O Messenger of Allah, which deed is most beloved to Allah Almighty?" He said: "Prayer at its appointed time." I said: "Then which?" He said: "Kindness to parents." I said: "Then which?" He said: "Jihad in the cause of Allah." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Dharr (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: I asked, "O Messenger of Allah, which deed is best?" He said, "Faith in Allah and striving in His cause." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (may Allah bless him and grant him peace) said: "A morning journey or an evening journey in the cause of Allah is better than the world and all that is in it." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: A man came to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and said: "Who are the best of people?" He said: "A believer who strives with himself and his wealth in the way of Allah." He said: "Then who?" He said: "A believer in a mountain pass, who worships Allah and keeps the people safe from his evil." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Sahl bin Sa'd (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) said: "A day of guarding the frontier in the cause of Allah is better than the world and all that is on its surface. And the space of a whip of one of you in Paradise is better than the world and all that is on its surface. And a journey one makes in the cause of Allah, morning or evening, is better than the world and all that is on its surface." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Salman, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "Standing guard for one day and one night is better than fasting for a month and praying during it. If he dies during it, his deeds will continue to be recorded for him as he used to do them, and his sustenance will continue to be provided for him, and he will be safe from the trials." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Fudalah bin 'Ubaid, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Every deceased person is sealed upon his deeds, except for the one who stands guard in the cause of Allah, for his deeds are increased for him until the Day of Resurrection, and he is secured from the trial of the grave." (Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said: It is a hasan sahih hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of Uthman (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) say: "A day of guarding the frontier in the cause of Allah is better than a thousand days of any other position." (Reported by Al-Tirmidhi and he said: It is a Hasan Sahih Hadith.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Narrated Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Allah has guaranteed to him who goes out in His cause, with no other motive than jihad in My cause and belief in Me and affirmation of My Messengers, that He will either cause him to enter Paradise, or bring him back to his home from which he set out with whatever he gains of reward or spoils of war. And by Him in Whose Hand is the life of Muhammad, no one is wounded in the cause of Allah – and Allah knows best who is wounded in His cause – but he will come on the Day of Resurrection with his wound as it was, its colour being the colour of blood and its scent being the scent of musk. And by Him in Whose Hand is the life of Muhammad, if it were not for the fact that some people may dislike to stay behind, I would never have stayed behind any raiding party setting out in the cause of Allah. But I cannot find the means to carry them, nor do they find the means to stay behind with me. And by Him in Whose Hand is the life of Muhammad, I would love to fight in the cause of Allah and be killed, then fight and be killed, then fight and be killed." (Reported by Muslim and some of it by Bukhari). "Al-Kalam" means wound. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "No one is wounded in the cause of Allah except that he will come on the Day of Resurrection, and his wound will be bleeding, its color the color of blood, and its scent the scent of musk." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Mu'adh (may Allah be pleased with him) from the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) that he said: "Whoever fights in the cause of Allah, even for the time it takes a camel to give milk, Paradise is assured for him. And whoever is wounded in the cause of Allah, or suffers a blow, it will come on the Day of Resurrection as it was when it was inflicted, its color being saffron and its fragrance being musk." (Reported by Abu Dawud and Tirmidhi, who said it is a hasan hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: A man from the Companions of the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, passed by a valley with a spring of fresh water. He liked it and said: "If only I could withdraw from the people and reside in this valley, but I will not do so until I seek permission from the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him." He mentioned this to the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, who said: "Do not do so. For one of you to stand in the cause of Allah is better than praying in his house for seventy years. Do you not love that Allah forgives you and admits you to Paradise? Fight in the cause of Allah. Whoever fights in the cause of Allah for the time it takes for a she-camel to be milked will have Paradise decreed for him." (Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi, who said it is a hasan hadith). ("Al-fawaq" is the time between two milkings). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, it is narrated that it was said: "O Messenger of Allah, what is equivalent to striving in the cause of Allah?" He said: "You cannot do it." They asked him twice or thrice, and each time he said: "You cannot do it!" Then he said: "The example of the one who strives in the cause of Allah is like the one who fasts, prays, and is obedient to the verses of Allah without ceasing, neither from prayer nor from fasting, until the one who strives in the cause of Allah returns." (Agreed upon, and this is the wording of Muslim). And in a narration of Bukhari, a man said: "O Messenger of Allah, guide me to a deed that is equivalent to striving." He said: "I do not find one." Then he said: "Can you, when the striver goes out, enter your mosque and pray without ceasing, and fast without breaking your fast?" He said: "And who can do that?!" [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, the Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) said: "The best of people's livelihoods for them is a man holding the reins of his horse in the cause of Allah. He flies on its back whenever he hears a cry for help or a panic; he flies on its back, seeking death in its most likely places. Or a man with his sheep, or at a mountain pass, or in the valley of these valleys, observing the prayer, giving the Zakat, and worshipping his Lord until he meets his certain end. No one is among the people except in goodness." (Reported by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Indeed, in Paradise there are one hundred degrees, prepared for those who fight in the cause of Allah. The distance between two degrees is like the distance between the heaven and the earth." (Narrated by Al-Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Saeed Al-Khudri, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever is pleased with Allah as his Lord, Islam as his religion, and Muhammad as his Messenger, Paradise is guaranteed for him." Abu Saeed was amazed by this and said, "Repeat it for me, O Messenger of Allah." He repeated it for him and then said: "And another, by which Allah raises a servant one hundred degrees in Paradise, the distance between each two degrees being like the distance between the heavens and the earth." He said: "And what is it, O Messenger of Allah?" He said: "Jihad in the cause of Allah, Jihad in the cause of Allah." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Bakr bin Abi Musa Al-Ash'ari, he said: I heard my father, may Allah be pleased with him, while he was in the presence of the enemy, say that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The gates of Paradise are under the shade of swords." A man in ragged clothes stood up and said: "O Abu Musa, did you hear the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say this?" He said: "Yes." Then he returned to his companions and said: "Peace be upon you." Then he broke the sheath of his sword and threw it away, then he went forward with his sword to the enemy and struck with it until he was killed. (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu 'Abs 'Abd ar-Rahman bin Jubayr, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "No foot of a servant is covered in dust in the cause of Allah, and then the Fire touches it." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, who narrated that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him, said: "A man will not enter the Fire who has wept from the fear of Allah until the milk returns to the udder, and the dust in the cause of Allah and the smoke of Hellfire will not be combined on a servant." (Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and he said it is a Hasan Sahih Hadith.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them, who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him, say: "Two eyes will not be touched by the Fire: an eye that wept out of fear of Allah, and an eye that spent the night guarding in the cause of Allah." (Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and he said: it is a Hasan hadith.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Zaid bin Khalid, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "He who equips a warrior for the cause of Allah has indeed fought, and he who looks after a warrior's family with goodness has indeed fought." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Umamah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The best charity is the shade of a tent in the cause of Allah, or a servant given in the cause of Allah, or a mare given for breeding in the cause of Allah." (Narrated by Tirmidhi and said: A hasan sahih hadith.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that a young man from Aslam said: "O Messenger of Allah, I wish to go on an expedition, but I do not have the provisions to equip myself." He said: "Go to so-and-so. He had equipped himself for an expedition, but fell ill. So he went to him and said: 'The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) sends you his greetings and says: Give me what you have equipped yourself with.' He said: 'O so-and-so, give him what you have equipped yourself with, and do not withhold anything from it. By Allah, do not withhold anything from it, lest it be not blessed for you.'" (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Sa'id al-Khudri, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, sent to Banu Lihyan, and said: "Let one of every two men go forth, and the reward will be shared between them." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Al-Bara' (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: A man came to the Prophet (peace be upon him) wearing iron armor. He said: "O Messenger of Allah, should I fight or embrace Islam?" He said: "Embrace Islam, then fight." So he embraced Islam, then he fought and was killed. The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "He did little but earned much reward." (Agreed upon, and this is the wording of Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported that the Prophet (peace be upon him) said: "No one who enters Paradise likes to return to this world, even if he had all that is on the earth, except the martyr. He wishes to return to this world and be killed ten times because of the honor he sees." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It is narrated from Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-As, may Allah be pleased with them, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Allah forgives every sin of the martyr except the debt." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Qatada (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) stood among them and mentioned that Jihad in the cause of Allah and faith in Allah are the best of deeds. A man stood and said, "O Messenger of Allah, what do you think if I am killed in the cause of Allah, will my sins be expiated for me?" The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said, "Yes, if you are killed in the cause of Allah while you are patient, seeking reward, advancing and not retreating." Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said, "How did you say?" He said, "What do you think if I am killed in the cause of Allah, will my sins be expiated for me?" The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said, "Yes, if you are patient, seeking reward, advancing and not retreating, except for debt, for Jibril (peace be upon him) told me that." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) that a man said: "Where am I, O Messenger of Allah, if I am killed?" He said: "In Paradise." Then he threw away the dates that were in his hand and fought until he was killed. (Reported by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (may Allah bless him and grant him peace) and his companions set out until they reached Badr before the pagans. The pagans arrived, and the Messenger of Allah (may Allah bless him and grant him peace) said: "None of you should advance to anything until I am in front of it." The pagans drew near, and the Messenger of Allah (may Allah bless him and grant him peace) said: "Rise up to a Paradise whose breadth is the heavens and the earth." 'Umayr ibn al-Humam al-Ansari (may Allah be pleased with him) said: "O Messenger of Allah, a Paradise whose breadth is the heavens and the earth?" He said: "Yes." He said: "Well, well!" The Messenger of Allah (may Allah bless him and grant him peace) said: "What makes you say 'Well, well'?" He replied: "I hope to be among its people." He took out some dates from his pouch and began to eat them. Then he said: "If I live to eat these dates of mine, it will be a long life!" He threw away what dates he had with him, then he fought them until he was killed. (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him it is narrated that he said: Some people came to the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, saying, "Send us men to teach us the Quran and the Sunnah." So he sent them seventy men from the Ansar, who were called the Reciters. Among them was my uncle Haram. They used to recite the Quran and study it by night, and by day they would bring water and place it in the mosque, and gather firewood, which they would sell. They would then buy food with it for the people of Suffah and the poor. The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, sent them, but they were ambushed and killed before they reached their destination. They said, "O Allah, convey to our Prophet that we have met You, and we are pleased with You, and You are pleased with us." A man named Haram, the uncle of Anas, attacked him from behind and stabbed him with a spear until it passed through him. Haram said, "By the Lord of the Kaaba, I have succeeded." The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said, "Your brothers have been killed, and they said: 'O Allah, convey to our Prophet that we have met You, and we are pleased with You, and You are pleased with us.'" (Agreed upon, and this is the wording of Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: My uncle Anas bin Al-Nadr, may Allah be pleased with him, was absent from the Battle of Badr, so he said: "O Messenger of Allah, I was absent from the first battle in which you fought the idolaters. If Allah witnesses me in a battle against the idolaters, Allah will surely see what I do." When the day of Uhud came, the Muslims were scattered. He said: "O Allah, I apologize to You for what these people have done" - meaning the companions - "and I dissociate myself from what these people have done" - meaning the idolaters.
