Then he advanced, and Sa'd bin Mu'adh met him. He said: "O Sa'd bin Mu'adh, Paradise, by the Lord of Al-Nadr, I find its scent from beyond Uhud!" Sa'd said: "What could the Messenger of Allah do that I could not do!" Anas said: We found on him more than eighty wounds from a sword, or a stab from a spear, or an arrow. And we found him killed and mutilated by the idolaters, so no one recognized him except his sister by his fingertips. Anas said: We used to think - or we thought - that this verse was revealed about him and those like him: "Among the believers are men who were true to what they pledged to Allah. So some of them have fulfilled their vows, and some of them are still waiting, and they have not changed [their commitment] in the least." (Al-Ahzab: 23). (Agreed upon) And it has preceded in the chapter on striving. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Samurah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "I saw last night two men who came to me and took me up a tree, and brought me into a house that was the most beautiful and excellent I have ever seen. They said, 'As for this house, it is the house of the martyrs.'" [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, that Umm Al-Rabi' bint Al-Bara', who was the mother of Harithah ibn Suraqah, came to the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, and said: "O Messenger of Allah, will you not tell me about Harithah?" He had been killed on the day of Badr. If he was in Paradise, I would be patient, and if he was otherwise, I would strive to weep for him. He said: "O Umm Harithah, indeed there are levels in Paradise, and your son has attained the highest Paradise." (Narrated by Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Jabir bin Abdullah (may Allah be pleased with them) who said: My father was brought to the Prophet (peace be upon him) after he had been mutilated. He was laid before him. I went to uncover his face, but some people forbade me. Then the Prophet (peace be upon him) said: "The angels have been shading him with their wings." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Sahl bin Hunaif, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever asks Allah the Almighty for martyrdom with sincerity, Allah will grant him the ranks of the martyrs, even if he dies in his bed." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "Whoever sincerely asks Allah for martyrdom, Allah will grant him its reward even if he does not die with it." (Reported by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Narrated Abu Hurairah: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The martyr does not feel the prick of death except as one of you feels the prick of a sting." (Tirmidhi, who said: It is a hasan sahih hadith) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abdullah bin Abi Awfa, may Allah be pleased with them both, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, on one of his days when he encountered the enemy, waited until the sun declined. Then he stood among the people and said: "O people, do not wish for the encounter with the enemy, and ask Allah for safety. And when you encounter them, be patient, and know that Paradise is under the shade of swords." Then he said: "O Allah, Revealer of the Book, Disperser of the clouds, Defeater of the confederates, defeat them and grant us victory over them." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Sahl bin Sa'd (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Two things are not rejected, or rarely rejected: supplication at the time of the call to prayer and at the time of battle when one part of them is engaged with the other." (Narrated by Abu Dawud with a sahih chain of narration). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) went on a military expedition, he would say: "O Allah, You are my support and my helper. By You I move and by You I travel and by You I attack and by You I fight." (Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said it is a hasan hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Musa, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, if he feared a people, he would say: "O Allah, we place You in their necks, and we seek refuge in You from their evils." (Narrated by Abu Dawud with a Sahih chain of transmission). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both) that the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) said: "Horses have good tied to their forelocks until the Day of Resurrection." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It is narrated from Urwah al-Bariqi (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Goodness is tied to the forelocks of horses until the Day of Resurrection: reward and spoils of war." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever keeps a horse in the cause of Allah, believing in Allah and confirming His promise, then its fullness, and its dung, and its urine will be in his scale on the Day of Resurrection." (Narrated by Al-Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And Abu Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) reported that a man came to the Prophet (peace be upon him) with a hobbled she-camel and said: "This is for the sake of Allah." The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "You will have seven hundred hobbled she-camels like it on the Day of Resurrection." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hammad - and it is said: Abu Su'ad, and it is said: Abu Asad, and it is said: Abu 'Amir, and it is said: Abu 'Amr, and it is said: Abu Al-Aswad, and it is said: Abu 'Abs - Uqbah bin 'Amir Al-Juhani, may Allah be pleased with him, said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say on the pulpit: "And prepare against them whatever you are able of power. Indeed, strength is archery. Indeed, strength is archery. Indeed, strength is archery." (Narrated by Muslim). And from him, he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "Lands will be conquered for you, and Allah will suffice you, so let none of you be too weak to amuse himself with his arrows." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "Lands will be opened to you, and Allah will suffice you, so let none of you be too weak to amuse himself with his arrows." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him it is narrated that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "Whoever learns archery and then abandons it is not of us, or he has disobeyed." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, may Allah be pleased, he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "Indeed, Allah causes three people to enter Paradise by one arrow: its maker, who intends good by making it, the one who shoots it, and the one who supplies it. Shoot and ride, and shooting is more beloved to me than riding. And whoever abandons shooting after he has learned it, out of disinterest in it, then it is a blessing that he has abandoned" or he said: "disbelieved in it." (Narrated by Abu Dawud) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Salama bin Al-Akwa', may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Prophet, peace be upon him, passed by some people who were practicing archery and said: "Shoot, O sons of Isma'il, for your father was a skilled archer." (Narrated by Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Amr bin Absah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: Whoever shoots an arrow in the path of Allah, it is equivalent to freeing a slave for him. (Reported by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said: This is a Hasan Sahih hadith.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Yahya Khuraim bin Fatik, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever spends an expenditure in the cause of Allah will have it multiplied seven hundredfold." (Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and he said: It is a hasan hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Sa'id (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "No servant fasts for a day in the cause of Allah, but that Allah removes his face from the Hellfire by that day seventy years." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Umamah, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, he said: "Whoever fasts one day in the cause of Allah, Allah will place a trench between him and the Fire as wide as that between the heavens and the earth." (Narrated by Tirmidhi and said: A hasan sahih hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever dies and has not gone for jihad, nor has he thought to himself of going for jihad, dies on a branch of hypocrisy." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: We were with the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) on an expedition, and he said: "There are men in Medina who did not march a march, nor cross a valley, but they were with you, detained by illness." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Musa, may Allah be pleased with him, that a Bedouin came to the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, and said: O Messenger of Allah, a man fights for spoils, and a man fights to be remembered, and a man fights to show his position? And in one narration: fights for bravery, and fights for pride. And in another narration: fights out of anger, so who is in the cause of Allah? So the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever fights so that the word of Allah is supreme, he is in the cause of Allah." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-'As, may Allah be pleased with them both, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "No raiding party or expedition that fights and gains spoils and is safe but has hastened two-thirds of its reward. And no raiding party or expedition that fails and is struck but has its full reward." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Umamah, may Allah be pleased with him, that a man said: "O Messenger of Allah, permit me to go on a spiritual retreat." So the Prophet, peace be upon him, said: "The spiritual retreat of my Ummah is Jihad in the cause of Allah, the Almighty." (Reported by Abu Dawud with a good chain of narration). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-As, may Allah be pleased with them both, from the Prophet, peace be upon him, he said: "A return is like an expedition." (Narrated by Abu Dawud with a good chain of narration). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Al-Sa'ib bin Yazid, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: When the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, returned from the Battle of Tabuk, people met him. I met him with the boys at Thaniyat al-Wada'. (Narrated by Abu Dawud with a sound chain of narration with this wording). And Al-Bukhari narrated: We went to meet the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, with the boys at Thaniyat al-Wada'. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Umamah, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, he said: Whoever does not go for Jihad, or equip a warrior, or look after a warrior's family in a good way, Allah will afflict him with a calamity before the Day of Resurrection. (Narrated by Abu Dawud with a Sahih chain of narration). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Strive against the polytheists with your wealth, yourselves, and your tongues." (Narrated by Abu Dawud with a Sahih chain). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Amr, and it is said Abu Hakim an-Nu'man bin Muqrin (may Allah be pleased with him) said: I witnessed the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) if he did not fight at the beginning of the day, he would delay the fighting until the sun declined, the wind blew, and victory descended. (Narrated by Abu Dawud and At-Tirmidhi, who said it is a Hasan Sahih hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) said: "Do not wish to meet the enemy, and when you meet them, be patient." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]
And from him and from Jabir, may Allah be pleased with them both, that the Prophet, peace be upon him, said: "War is deception." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Narrated Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "Martyrs are five: one who dies of plague, one who dies of a stomach ailment, one who drowns, one who dies in a building collapse, and the martyr in the cause of Allah." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Who do you consider martyrs among you?" They said: "O Messenger of Allah, whoever is killed in the cause of Allah is a martyr." He said: "Then the martyrs of my Ummah would be few!" They said: "Then who, O Messenger of Allah?" He said: "Whoever is killed in the cause of Allah is a martyr, and whoever dies in the cause of Allah is a martyr, and whoever dies of the plague is a martyr, and whoever dies of a stomach ailment is a martyr, and the drowned is a martyr." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-Aas, may Allah be pleased with them both, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever is killed defending his property is a martyr." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu al-A'war Sa'id ibn Zayd ibn 'Amr ibn Nufayl, one of the ten promised Paradise, may Allah be pleased with them, he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "He who is killed defending his property is a martyr, and he who is killed defending his blood is a martyr, and he who is killed defending his religion is a martyr, and he who is killed defending his honor is a martyr." (Reported by Abu Dawud and Tirmidhi, who said it is a hasan sahih hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: A man came to the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) and said: "O Messenger of Allah, what do you think if a man comes wanting to take my property?" He said: "Then do not give him your property." He said: "What do you think if he fights me?" He said: "Fight him." He said: "What do you think if he kills me?" He said: "Then you are a martyr." He said: "What do you think if I kill him?" He said: "He is in the Fire." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said to me: "Whoever frees a believing slave, Allah will free from the Fire, for every limb of the freed slave, a corresponding limb of his own, even his private parts for his private parts." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Dharr, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: I said, O Messenger of Allah, which deeds are best? He said: "Faith in Allah, and striving in the cause of Allah." I said: Which slaves are best? He said: "The most valuable among their people and the most expensive." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ma'rur bin Suwaid, he said: I saw Abu Dharr, may Allah be pleased with him, wearing a garment, and his slave was wearing the like of it. I asked him about that, and he mentioned that he had insulted a man during the time of the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, and taunted him with his mother. So the Prophet, peace be upon him, said: "Indeed, you are a man with ignorance in you." He then said: "They are your brothers, and your servants whom Allah has placed under your authority. So whoever has his brother under his authority, let him feed him what he eats and clothe him what he wears, and do not burden them with what overwhelms them. If you burden them, then help them." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, he said: "If one of you comes to his servant with his food, and he does not sit him down with him, then he should give him a bite or two, or a meal or two, for he is the one who dealt with its preparation." (Narrated by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of Ibn `Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both) that the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) said: "If a servant advises his master and worships Allah well, he will have his reward twice." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "The righteous slave who is owned has a double reward. By Him in Whose hand is the soul of Abu Hurayrah, if it were not for Jihad in the cause of Allah, Hajj, and my mother's kindness, I would have loved to die as a slave." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Narrated Abu Musa Al-Ash'ari: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "The slave who worships his Lord well and fulfills his master's due rights by giving good advice and obeying him, will have a double reward." (Reported by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, it is narrated that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "Three have a double reward: A man from the People of the Book who believed in his prophet and believed in Muhammad. And a believing slave who fulfills his obligations to Allah and to his masters. And a man who had a slave girl, educated her well, taught her well, then freed her and married her, he has a double reward." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of Ma'qil ibn Yasar, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Worship during the Great Calamity is like emigration to me." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Narrated Abu Huraira (RA) that a man came to the Prophet (peace be upon him) to demand a debt, and he spoke harshly to him. His companions became angry and moved to attack him. The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said, "Leave him, for the creditor has the right to speak. Then he said, 'Give him a camel of the same age.' They said, 'O Messenger of Allah, we cannot find anything but a better camel than his.' He said, 'Give it to him, for the best among you are the best in repaying debts.'" (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "May Allah have mercy on a man who is lenient when he buys, when he sells, and when he claims his debt." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Qatadah (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) say: "Whoever wishes that Allah save him from the distress of the Day of Resurrection, let him grant respite to a debtor or remit his debt." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "There was a man who used to lend money to people. He used to say to his young servant: 'If you come across someone who is in difficulty, forgive him, perhaps Allah will forgive us.' So he met Allah, and Allah forgave him." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Mas'ud Al-Badri (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "A man from among those who came before you was held accountable, and nothing good was found for him, except that he used to associate with people, and he was wealthy, and he used to order his servants to give respite to the debtor. Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, said: 'We are more deserving of that than him. Grant him respite.'" (Reported by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Hudhayfah, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: Allah, the Almighty, brought a servant of His, whom Allah had bestowed wealth, and said to him: "What did you do in the world?" He said: "And they cannot hide from Allah any statement." He said: "My Lord, You gave me wealth, and I used to trade with people, and it was my character to be lenient. I would make it easy for the wealthy and give respite to the needy." Allah, the Almighty, said: "I am more deserving of that than you. Forgive my servant." Then 'Uqbah bin 'Amir and Abu Mas'ud al-Ansari, may Allah be pleased with them, said: "This is how we heard it from the mouth of the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Hurairah that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Whoever gives respite to one in difficulty or forgives him, Allah will shade him under the shade of His Throne on the Day when there is no shade but His shade." (Tirmidhi said: It is a Hasan Sahih Hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Jabir, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, bought a camel from him and weighed it for him, and he gave him more than was due. (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Safwan Suwaid bin Qais, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: I and Makhramah Al-Abdi brought some garments from Hajr, and the Prophet, peace be upon him, came to us and asked us about trousers. I had a weigher who weighed for a fee. So the Prophet, peace be upon him, said to the weigher, "Weigh and give extra." (Narrated by Abu Dawud and Tirmidhi, who said it is a hasan sahih hadith.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Muawiyah, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever Allah wills good for, He makes him understand the religion." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "There is no envy except in two cases: a man whom Allah has given wealth and he spends it in the cause of truth, and a man whom Allah has given wisdom and he judges by it and teaches it." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Musa, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The example of what Allah has sent me with of guidance and knowledge is like that of rain that falls upon the earth. Some of it is good land, which absorbs the water and brings forth abundant vegetation and grass. And some of it is barren land, which holds the water, and Allah benefits people by it; they drink from it, and irrigate their land, and plant in it. And some of it is a plain, which neither holds water nor brings forth vegetation. This is the example of the person who understands the religion of Allah and benefits from what Allah has sent me with of guidance and knowledge. And the example of the person who does not pay attention to it and does not accept the guidance of Allah with which I have been sent." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Sahl bin Sa'd, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said to Ali, may Allah be pleased with him: "By Allah, if Allah guides one man through you, it is better for you than red camels." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-'As, may Allah be pleased with them, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Convey from me, even if it be a verse, and narrate from the Children of Israel, and there is no harm. And whoever lies about me intentionally, let him take his abode in Hellfire." (Narrated by Al-Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever travels a path in search of knowledge, Allah will make easy for him a path to Paradise by means of it." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him too, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever calls to guidance will have a reward equal to the reward of those who follow him, without that diminishing their reward in any way." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, it is narrated, the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "When the son of Adam dies, his deeds are cut off except for three: a continuous charity, or knowledge from which benefit is derived, or a righteous child who prays for him." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) say: "The world is cursed, and everything in it is cursed, except for the remembrance of Allah the Almighty, and what it entails, and a scholar or a student." (Narrated by Tirmidhi, who said: A hasan hadith.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "He who goes out in search of knowledge is in the cause of Allah until he returns." (Tirmidhi) He said: This is a hasan hadith. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, he said: "A believer will not be satisfied with good until his end is Paradise." (Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and said it is a hasan hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Narrated Abu Umamah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The virtue of a scholar over a worshipper is like my virtue over the least among you." Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Indeed, Allah, His angels, and the inhabitants of the heavens and the earth, even the ant in its hole and the fish, send blessings upon those who teach people good." (Narrated by Tirmidhi and he said: It is a hasan hadith.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Abu Ad-Darda' (may Allah be pleased with him) reported that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "Whoever embarks on a path to seek knowledge, Allah will make easy for him a path to Paradise. The angels spread their wings for the seeker of knowledge, pleased with his actions. The creatures in the heavens and on earth, even the fish in the water, ask for forgiveness for the scholar. The superiority of the scholar over the worshipper is like the superiority of the moon over all other stars. The scholars are the inheritors of the Prophets, and the Prophets did not leave behind dinars or dirhams, but rather they left behind knowledge. So, whoever takes it, has taken a great fortune." (Narrated by Abu Dawud and At-Tirmidhi) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) say: "May Allah make bright the face of one who hears a saying from us and conveys it as he heard it. For many a person to whom a saying is conveyed is more appreciative of it than the one who heard it." (Narrated by Tirmidhi and said: This is a hasan sahih hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever is asked about knowledge and conceals it will be bridled with a bridle of fire on the Day of Resurrection." (Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, and he said: It is a hasan hadith.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever acquires knowledge that should be sought for the sake of Allah the Almighty, but acquires it only to gain something from this world, will not smell the scent of Paradise on the Day of Resurrection." (Meaning its fragrance.) (Narrated by Abu Dawood with a Sahih chain of narration.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-As, may Allah be pleased with them both, he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "Allah does not take away knowledge by snatching it from people, but rather He takes away knowledge by taking the lives of scholars. Until when no scholar is left, people will take ignorant ones as leaders. They will be asked and will issue religious verdicts without knowledge, so they will go astray and lead others astray." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was brought on the night of his Night Journey two cups, one of wine and one of milk. He looked at them and took the milk. Gabriel (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Praise be to Allah, Who guided you to the pure nature. If you had taken the wine, your Ummah would have gone astray." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, from the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, he said: "Every important matter that is not begun with the praise of Allah is incomplete." A hasan hadith. (Reported by Abu Dawud and others). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It is narrated from Abu Musa Al-Ash'ari (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "When a servant's child dies, Allah the Almighty says to His angels: 'Did you take the child of My servant?' They say: 'Yes.' He says: 'Did you take the fruit of his heart?' They say: 'Yes.' He says: 'What did My servant say?' They say: 'He praised You and said: To Allah we belong and to Him we return.' Allah the Almighty says: 'Build a house for My servant in Paradise and call it the House of Praise.'" (Reported by Tirmidhi, who said it is a hasan hadith.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Allah is pleased with the servant who eats a meal and praises Him for it, and drinks a drink and praises Him for it." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-'As, may Allah be pleased with them both, that he heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "Whoever sends blessings upon me once, Allah will send blessings upon him tenfold." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The closest of people to me on the Day of Resurrection will be those who invoked the most blessings upon me." It was narrated by Tirmidhi, who said it is a hasan hadith. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aws bin Aws, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "Indeed, one of your best days is Friday, so offer prayers to me more on it, for your prayers are presented to me." They said: "O Messenger of Allah, how will our prayers be presented to you when you have become decayed?" He said: "He said: 'Be decayed,' [meaning] "Indeed, Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, has forbidden the earth from consuming the bodies of prophets." Narrated by Abu Dawood with a sound chain of narration. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "May his nose be rubbed in the dust, a man who hears me mentioned and does not send blessings upon me." (Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi, who said it is a hasan hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God’s peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Do not make my grave a place of celebration, but rather send blessings upon me, for your blessings reach me wherever you are." Narrated by Abu Dawud with a sound chain of narration. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "No one sends salutations to me except that Allah returns my soul to me so that I may return his salutations." (Narrated by Abu Dawud with a sound chain of narration). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ali, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The miser is he who remembers me and does not send blessings upon me." (Tirmidhi narrated it and said: A hasan sahih hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Fadalah ibn Ubayd, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, heard a man supplicating in his prayer who had not praised Allah the Almighty nor sent blessings upon the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him. So the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "This is hasty." Then he called him and said to him - or to someone else: "When one of you prays, let him begin by praising his Lord, the Exalted, and glorifying Him, then send blessings upon the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, then supplicate whatever he wishes." Narrated by Abu Dawud and Tirmidhi, who said it is a sahih hadith. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Muhammad Ka'b bin 'Ujrah (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came out to us, and we said: "O Messenger of Allah, we have learned how to greet you, so how should we send blessings upon you?" He said: "Say: 'O Allah, send blessings on Muhammad and on the family of Muhammad, as You sent blessings on the family of Ibrahim. You are indeed Praiseworthy and Glorious. O Allah, send blessings on Muhammad and on the family of Muhammad, as You sent blessings on the family of Ibrahim. You are indeed Praiseworthy and Glorious.'" (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Mas'ud bin Ubadah Al-Badri, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, came to us while we were in the gathering of Sa'd bin Ubadah, may Allah be pleased with him. Bashir bin Sa'd said to him: Allah the Almighty commanded us to send blessings upon you, O Messenger of Allah, so how should we send blessings upon you? The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, remained silent until we wished he had not asked him. Then the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Say: O Allah, send blessings on Muhammad and on the family of Muhammad, as You sent blessings on the family of Abraham. And send blessings on Muhammad and on the family of Muhammad, as You sent blessings on the family of Abraham. Indeed, You are Praiseworthy and Glorious. And peace, as you have learned." (Reported by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Humaid As-Sa'idi, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: They said: "O Messenger of Allah, how do we send blessings upon you?" He said: "Say: 'O Allah, send blessings upon Muhammad and upon his wives and his descendants, as You sent blessings upon the family of Ibrahim. And send blessings of peace upon Muhammad and upon his wives and his descendants, as You sent blessings of peace upon the family of Ibrahim. Verily, You are Praiseworthy, Most Glorious.'" (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Two words are light on the tongue, heavy in the balance, and beloved to the Most Merciful: Glorified be Allah and praised be He, Glorified be Allah the Almighty." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, may Allah be pleased, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "To say 'Glory be to Allah, and praise be to Allah, and there is no god but Allah, and Allah is the greatest,' is more beloved to me than that upon which the sun rises." (Reported by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever says, 'There is no god but Allah, alone, without partner, to Him belongs sovereignty and to Him belongs all praise, and He is over all things competent,' one hundred times a day, it will be equivalent to freeing ten slaves, and one hundred good deeds will be written for him, and one hundred sins will be erased from him, and it will be a protection for him from Satan for that day until he reaches the evening. And no one will come with better than what he brought, except a man who did more than him." And he said: "Whoever says, 'Glory be to Allah, and praise be to Him,' one hundred times a day, his sins will be erased, even if they were like the foam of the sea." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Ayyub Al-Ansari, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, peace be upon him, that he said: "Whoever says: 'There is no god but Allah, alone, without partner. To Him belongs sovereignty and to Him belongs all praise, and He is powerful over all things,' ten times, it will be as if he had freed four slaves from among the descendants of Ishmael." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Dharr, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said to me: "Shall I not tell you the dearest words to Allah? The dearest words to Allah are: 'Glory be to Allah and praise be to Him'." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Narrated by Abu Malik Al-Ash'ari (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "Purity is half of faith, and 'Al-hamdu lillah' (Praise be to Allah) fills the scale, and 'Subhan Allah' (Glory be to Allah) and 'Al-hamdu lillah' fill - or fill - what is between the heavens and the earth." (Reported by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Sa'd bin Abi Waqqas (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: A Bedouin came to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and said: "Teach me some words to say." He said: "Say: 'There is no god but Allah alone, without partner; Allah is the Greatest, the Most Great; and praise be to Allah, abundantly; and glory be to Allah, the Lord of the Worlds; and there is no might nor power except with Allah, the Mighty, the Wise.'" He said: "These are for my Lord, so what is for me?" He said: "Say: 'O Allah, forgive me, have mercy on me, guide me, and provide for me.'" (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Thawban (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) finished his prayer, he would seek forgiveness three times, and say: "O Allah, You are Peace, and from You comes peace. Blessed are You, O Owner of majesty and honor." Al-Awza'i, one of the narrators of the hadith, was asked: How should one say the seeking of forgiveness? He said: One should say: "Astaghfirullah, Astaghfirullah" (I seek forgiveness from Allah, I seek forgiveness from Allah). (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) when he finished the prayer and gave the salutation, would say: "There is no god but Allah, alone, without a partner. To Him belongs the dominion, and to Him belongs all praise, and He is Able to do all things. O Allah, there is none who can withhold what You give, and none who can give what You withhold, and the wealth of a wealthy person is no avail against You." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abdullah bin Az-Zubair, may Allah be pleased with them both, that he used to say after every prayer, when he said the Taslim: "La ilaha illallah wahdahu la sharika lah, lahul-mulku wa lahul-hamdu wa huwa 'ala kulli shay'in qadir. La hawla wa la quwwata illa billah, la ilaha illallah, wa la na'budu illa iyyah, lahun-ni'matu wa lahul-fadlu wa lahuth-thana'ul-hasanu. La ilaha illallah, mukhliṣīna lahud-dina wa law karihal-kafirun." Ibn Az-Zubair said: "And the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, used to recite these words after every prayer." (Reported by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the poor among the Emigrants came to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and said: "The wealthy people have gone away with the high ranks and the everlasting bliss. They pray as we pray, and they fast as we fast, and they have abundance of wealth with which they perform Hajj and Umrah, and fight in Jihad, and give charity." He said: "Shall I not teach you something by which you can overtake those who have preceded you, and by which you can surpass those who will come after you, and no one will be better than you except the one who does what you do?" They said: "Yes, O Messenger of Allah." He said: "You should glorify Allah, praise Allah, and magnify Allah after every prayer, thirty-three times each." Abu Salih, the narrator from Abu Hurayrah, when asked about the manner of reciting them, said: "He says: 'Subhan Allah, Walhamdulillah, Wallahu Akbar,' until all of them are thirty-three." (Agreed upon). Muslim added in his narration: "So the poor Emigrants returned to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and said: 'Our wealthy brothers have heard what we did and they have done the like of it?' The Messenger of Allah said: 'That is the grace of Allah, He gives it to whom He wills.'"
((Al-Duthur)) is the plural of "dathr" (with a fatha on the 'd' and a sukun on the thaa'), which means abundant wealth. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, from the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, he said: "Whoever glorifies Allah after every prayer thirty-three times, and praises Allah thirty-three times, and magnifies Allah thirty-three times, and when completing one hundred says: 'There is no god but Allah, alone without partner, to Him belongs sovereignty and to Him belongs praise, and He is over all things competent,' his sins will be forgiven, even if they were like the foam of the sea." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Ka'b bin 'Ujrah (may Allah be pleased with him) from the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) that he said: "There are some things that are recited after every obligatory prayer, and the one who recites them will not be disappointed - or the one who does them: Thirty-three glorifications (Subhan Allah), thirty-three praises (Alhamdulillah), and thirty-four declarations of Allah's greatness (Allahu Akbar)." (Reported by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Sa'd bin Abi Waqqas (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to seek refuge after the prayers with these words: "O Allah, I seek refuge in You from cowardice and stinginess, and I seek refuge in You from being returned to the most abject of old age, and I seek refuge in You from the trials of this world, and I seek refuge in You from the trials of the grave." (Narrated by Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Mu'adh, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, took his hand and said: "O Mu'adh, by Allah, I love you." Then he said: "I advise you, O Mu'adh, do not fail to say after every prayer: O Allah, help me to remember You, to thank You, and to worship You in the best way." Narrated by Abu Dawud with a sound chain of transmission. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "When one of you finishes his Tashahhud, he should seek refuge in Allah from four things, saying: 'O Allah, I seek refuge in You from the punishment of Hell, and from the punishment of the grave, and from the trials of life and death, and from the evil of the trial of the Dajjal.'" (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ali, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: When the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, stood up for prayer, it was among the last things he would say between the Tashahhud and Tasleem: "O Allah, forgive me what I have sent forth and what I have delayed, what I have concealed and what I have declared, what I have squandered, and what You know better than I. You are the Advancer, and You are the Delayer; there is no god but You." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, she said: The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, used to say frequently in his bowing and prostration: Glorified are You, O Allah, our Lord, and with Your praise, O Allah, forgive me. (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from her, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, used to say in his bowing and prostration: "Glory be to the Most Holy, the Lord of the angels and the Spirit." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "As for bowing, glorify the Lord in it, and as for prostration, strive in supplication, for it is likely that you will be answered." (Reported by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The closest a servant comes to his Lord is when he is prostrating, so make much supplication." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, used to say in his prostration: "O Allah, forgive me my sin, all of it, its small and its great, its first and its last, its public and its secret." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her) reported that the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was missed one night. She searched for him and found him bowing or prostrating, saying: "Glory be to You and praise be to You. There is no god but You." In another narration: "My hand touched the soles of his feet while he was in the mosque, and they were standing upright, and he was saying: 'O Allah, I seek refuge in Your pleasure from Your displeasure, and in Your forgiveness from Your punishment, and I seek refuge in You from You. I cannot count Your praises. You are as You have praised Yourself.'" (Reported by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Sa'd bin Abi Waqqas (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: We were with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and he said: "Is any one of you incapable of earning a thousand good deeds every day?" A questioner from his companions asked: How can one earn a thousand good deeds? He said: "He glorifies Allah a hundred times, and a thousand good deeds are written for him, or a thousand sins are expiated for him." (Narrated by Muslim). Al-Humaidi said: It is so in the book of Muslim: "or expiated". Al-Barqani said: And Shu'bah, Abu 'Awanah, and Yahya Al-Qattan narrated it, from Musa, from whom Muslim narrated it, and they said: "and expiated" without "a thousand". [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Dharr, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "On the morning of each of you, charity is due on every joint. So every glorification is charity, and every praise is charity, and every declaration of oneness is charity, and every declaration of greatness is charity, and enjoining good is charity, and forbidding evil is charity, and all of that is fulfilled by two rak'ahs which he prays from the forenoon prayer." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from the Mother of the Believers, Juwayriyya bint Al-Harith (may Allah be pleased with her), that the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) left her in the morning after praying Fajr, while she was in her place of prayer. Then he returned after the forenoon had passed, while she was still sitting. He said: "Are you still in the state I left you?" She said: "Yes." The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "I have recited four phrases three times after you, which if they were weighed against what you have recited since today, they would outweigh them: Glorified be Allah, and praise be to Him, the number of His creation, the pleasure of His Self, the weight of His Throne, and the ink of His Words." (Reported by Muslim). And in a narration of his: Glorified be Allah, the number of His creation; Glorified be Allah, the pleasure of His Self; Glorified be Allah, the weight of His Throne; Glorified be Allah, the ink of His Words. And in the narration of Al-Tirmidhi: Shall I not teach you words that you say? Glorified be Allah, the number of His creation, Glorified be Allah, the number of His creation, Glorified be Allah, the number of His creation; Glorified be Allah, the pleasure of His Self, Glorified be Allah, the pleasure of His Self, Glorified be Allah, the pleasure of His Self; Glorified be Allah, the weight of His Throne, Glorified be Allah, the weight of His Throne, Glorified be Allah, the weight of His Throne; Glorified be Allah, the ink of His Words, Glorified be Allah, the ink of His Words, Glorified be Allah, the ink of His Words. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Musa Al-Ash'ari, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, he said: "The example of the one who remembers his Lord and the one who does not remember Him is like the living and the dead." (Narrated by Bukhari). And Muslim narrated it, saying: "The example of the house in which Allah is remembered and the house in which Allah is not remembered is like the living and the dead." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Allah the Almighty says: I am as My servant thinks of Me, and I am with him when he remembers Me. If he remembers Me to himself, I remember him to Myself. If he remembers Me in a gathering, I remember him in a gathering better than them." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The singled out have preceded." They said: "And who are the singled out, O Messenger of Allah?" He said: "Those who remember Allah frequently, both men and women." (Narrated by Muslim). And it was narrated: "Al-Mufarradun" with a shaddah on the raa and with a kasrah. And the famous pronunciation, as said by the majority, is with the shaddah. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) say: "The best remembrance is: There is no god but Allah." Narrated by Tirmidhi and he said it is a hasan hadith. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abdullah bin Bishr, may Allah be pleased with him, that a man said: "O Messenger of Allah, the laws of Islam have become too many for me, so tell me something to hold on to." He said: "Let your tongue remain moist with the remembrance of Allah." Narrated by At-Tirmidhi, who said it is a hasan hadith. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Jabir, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, he said: "Whoever says: 'Glory be to Allah, and with His praise,' a palm tree will be planted for him in Paradise." Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and he said it is a hasan hadith. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "I met Ibrahim, peace be upon him, on the night I was taken on a journey. He said: 'O Muhammad, convey my greetings to your Ummah, and tell them that Paradise has good soil, is sweet with water, and is a level plain. Its planting is: Glory be to Allah, and all praise is to Allah, and there is no god but Allah, and Allah is the greatest.'" [Tirmidhi] and he said it is a Hasan Hadith. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu al-Darda, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Shall I not inform you of the best of your deeds, and the purest of them with your King, and the most elevating of them in your ranks, and better for you than spending gold and silver, and better for you than meeting your enemy and striking their necks, and they striking your necks?" They said: "Yes." He said: "The remembrance of Allah, the Most High." Narrated by Tirmidhi and Al-Hakim Abu Abdullah said its chain of narration is authentic. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Sa'd bin Abi Waqqas (may Allah be pleased with him) that he entered with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) upon a woman who had date pits or small stones in front of her, with which she was counting her tasbih. He said: "Shall I tell you what is easier for you than this, or better?" He said: "Glorified is Allah, the number of what He has created in the sky, and Glorified is Allah, the number of what He has created in the earth, and Glorified is Allah, the number of what is between them, and Glorified is Allah, the number of what He will create. And Allah is the Greatest, the like of that. And all praise is due to Allah, the like of that. And there is no god but Allah, the like of that. And there is no might nor power except with Allah, the like of that." (Tirmidhi said: It is a hasan hadith) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Musa, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said to me: "Shall I not guide you to a treasure from the treasures of Paradise?" I said: "Yes, O Messenger of Allah." He said: "There is no might nor power except with Allah." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, she said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, used to remember Allah the Almighty at all times. Narrated by Muslim. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them, from the Prophet, may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him, he said: "If any one of you, when he goes to his wife, says: 'In the name of Allah. O Allah, keep Satan away from us, and keep Satan away from what You have provided for us,' and if a child is destined to be born to them from that union, Satan will not be able to harm him." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of Hudhayfah and Abu Dharr, may Allah be pleased with them both, who said: When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) went to bed, he would say: "In Your name, O Allah, I die and I live." And when he woke up, he would say: "Praise be to Allah Who revived us after He caused us to die, and to Him is the resurrection." (Reported by Al-Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "Allah the Almighty has angels who roam the roads seeking those who remember Him. When they find a group of people remembering Allah, they call out to each other: 'Come to what you need!' They surround them with their wings up to the lowest heaven. Their Lord, who knows best, asks them: 'What are My servants saying?' They say: 'They are glorifying You, magnifying You, praising You, and exalting You.' He says: 'Have they seen Me?' They say: 'No, by Allah, they have not seen You.' He says: 'What if they had seen Me?' They say: 'If they had seen You, they would have worshipped You more, magnified You more, and glorified You more.' He says: 'What are they asking for?' They say: 'They are asking You for Paradise.' He says: 'Have they seen it?' They say: 'No, by Allah, our Lord, they have not seen it.' He says: 'What if they had seen it?' They say: 'If they had seen it, they would have been more eager for it, sought it more, and desired it more greatly.' He says: 'What are they seeking refuge from?' They say: 'They are seeking refuge from the Fire.' He says: 'Have they seen it?' They say: 'No, by Allah, they have not seen it.' He says: 'What if they had seen it?' They say: 'If they had seen it, they would have fled from it more and feared it more.' He says: 'Then I bear witness that I have forgiven them.' One of the angels says: 'Among them is so-and-so, who is not one of them; he just came for a need.' He says: 'They are people whose companion will not be wretched.'" (Agreed upon)

In a narration by Muslim from Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) from the Prophet (peace be upon him) who said: "Allah has angels who travel about, seeking out the gatherings of remembrance. When they find a gathering where remembrance is taking place, they sit with them, and some of them cover each other with their wings until they fill the space between them and the lowest heaven. When they disperse, they ascend to heaven. Allah the Almighty, who knows best, asks them: 'From where have you come?' They say: 'We have come from Your servants on earth, who are glorifying You, magnifying You, proclaiming Your oneness, praising You, and asking of You.' He says: 'What are they asking of Me?' They say: 'They are asking You for Your Paradise.' He says: 'Have they seen My Paradise?' They say: 'No, our Lord.' He says: 'What if they had seen My Paradise?' They say: 'And they are seeking Your protection.' He says: 'From what are they seeking My protection?' They say: 'From Your Fire, our Lord.' He says: 'Have they seen My Fire?' They say: 'No.' He says: 'What if they had seen My Fire?' They say: 'And they are seeking Your forgiveness.' He says: 'I have forgiven them, and I have given them what they asked for, and I have protected them from what they sought protection from.' He says: 'Then they say: Our Lord, among them is so-and-so, a sinful servant, who just passed by and sat with them.' He says: 'And I have forgiven him too. They are people whose companion will not be wretched.'" [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him and from Abu Sa'id, may Allah be pleased with them both, they said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "No group of people sits remembering Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, except that the angels surround them, mercy covers them, tranquility descends upon them, and Allah mentions them among those who are with Him." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Waqid Al-Harith bin 'Awf (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was sitting in the mosque with people. Then two men came to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), and one went away. They stood before the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). As for one of them, he saw an opening in the circle and sat in it. As for the other, he sat behind them. As for the third, he turned and left. When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) finished, he said: "Shall I not tell you about the three men? As for one of them, he sought refuge with Allah, so Allah gave him refuge. As for the other, he felt shy, so Allah felt shy of him. As for the third, he turned away, so Allah turned away from him." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of Abu Sa'id al-Khudri (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: Mu'awiyah (may Allah be pleased with him) came upon a group in the mosque and said: "What is keeping you seated?" They said: "We are sitting to remember Allah." He said: "Is it only for that reason that you are sitting?" They said: "We are sitting for no other reason." He said: "As for me, I did not swear you in out of suspicion, and no one was as close to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) as I was, and I heard less from him than others: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) came upon a group of his companions and said: 'What is keeping you seated?' They said: 'We are sitting to remember Allah, and to praise Him for guiding us to Islam and for His favor upon us.' He said: 'Is it only for that reason that you are sitting?' They said: 'By Allah, we are sitting for no other reason.' He said: 'As for me, I did not swear you in out of suspicion, but Jibril came to me and informed me that Allah is boasting of you to the angels.'" (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "Whoever says in the morning and evening: 'Glory be to Allah and praise be to Him,' one hundred times, no one will come on the Day of Resurrection with better deeds than what he brings, except for someone who said the same as he said or more." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, it is narrated that a man came to the Prophet, peace be upon him, and said: "O Messenger of Allah, what I have suffered from a scorpion sting last night!" He said: "Had you said when you entered the evening: 'I seek refuge in the perfect words of Allah from the evil of what He created,' it would not have harmed you." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, that he used to say when he woke up: "O Allah, by You we have reached the morning, and by You we reach the evening, and by You we live, and by You we die, and to You is the resurrection." And when he reached the evening, he would say: "O Allah, by You we have reached the evening, and by You we live, and by You we die, and to You is the destination." Narrated by Abu Dawood and Al-Tirmidhi, who said it is a hasan hadith. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, Abu Bakr Al-Siddiq, may Allah be pleased with him, said: O Messenger of Allah, command me with words to say when I wake up and when I go to sleep. He said: Say: "O Allah, Creator of the heavens and the earth, Knower of the unseen and the seen, Lord of all things and their Owner, I bear witness that there is no god but You, I seek refuge in You from the evil of my soul and the evil of Satan and his associating (others with Allah)." He said: "Say it when you wake up, and when you go to sleep, and when you go to your bed." Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, and he said it is a hasan sahih hadith. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Narrated Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Prophet of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), when it was evening, would say: "We have reached the evening and the kingdom has reached the evening, and to Allah belongs all praise. There is no god but Allah, alone, without partner." The narrator said: I think he said in them: "To Him belongs the dominion, and to Him belongs all praise, and He is Able to do all things. O my Lord, I ask You for the good of this night and the good of what follows it, and I seek refuge in You from the evil of this night and the evil of what follows it. O my Lord, I seek refuge in You from laziness and evil old age. O my Lord, I seek refuge in You from the evil of this night and the good of what follows it. And I seek refuge in You from the evil of this night and the evil of what follows it. O my Lord, I seek refuge in You from the punishment of the Fire and the punishment of the grave." And when it was morning, he would say this as well: "We have reached the morning and the kingdom has reached the morning, and to Allah belongs all praise." (Muslim narrated it). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abdullah bin Khubaib - with the pronunciation of the letter Kha with a dot underneath - may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said to me: "Recite: Say, 'He is Allah, the One,' and the two Surahs of seeking refuge in the morning and in the evening, three times. They will suffice you against all things." Narrated by Abu Dawud and Tirmidhi, who said it is a good and sound Hadith. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Uthman bin Affan, may Allah be pleased with him, that he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "No servant says every morning and every evening: 'In the name of Allah, with whose name nothing in the earth or in the heavens can cause harm, and He is the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing,' three times, but nothing will harm him." It was narrated by Abu Dawood and At-Tirmidhi, and he said it is a Hasan Sahih hadith. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Hudhayfah and Abu Dharr, may Allah be pleased with them, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, when he went to his bed, would say: "In Your name, O Allah, I live and I die." (Narrated by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ali, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said to him and to Fatimah, may Allah be pleased with them: "When you go to your bed, or: when you take your place of sleep - then say 'Allahu Akbar' thirty-three times, and say 'Subhan Allah' thirty-three times, and say 'Alhamdulillah' thirty-three times." And in one narration: "Subhan Allah" thirty-four times." And in one narration: "'Allahu Akbar' thirty-four times." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "When one of you goes to his bed, let him dust off his bed with the inside of his garment, for he does not know what might have come upon it. Then let him say: 'In Your name, my Lord, I lay down my side, and in Your name I shall raise it. If You should take my soul, then have mercy on it, and if You should return my soul, then protect it with what You protect Your righteous servants.'" (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, reported that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, when he went to bed, would blow into his hands and recite the Mu'awwidhat (verses of seeking refuge) and then wipe his body with them. (Agreed upon). In another narration, it is stated: "The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, when he went to his bed every night, would cup his hands, then blow into them and recite: 'Say, He is Allah, the One (Surah Al-Ikhlas), and 'Say, I seek refuge in the Lord of the dawn (Surah Al-Falak), and 'Say, I seek refuge in the Lord of mankind (Surah An-Nas),' then he would wipe with them whatever he could of his body, beginning with his head and face and what he could reach of his body, doing that three times." (Agreed upon). The linguists said: "An-Nafth is a gentle blowing without saliva." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Al-Bara' bin Azib, may Allah be pleased with them both, he said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said to me: "When you come to your bed, perform ablution as you do for prayer, then lie down on your right side and say: 'O Allah, I have submitted myself to You, and I have turned my face to You, and I have entrusted my affair to You, and I have resorted to You for refuge, desiring You and fearing Your punishment. There is no refuge nor salvation from You except with You. I believe in Your Book which You have revealed, and in Your Prophet whom You have sent.' If you die on that night, you will die on the natural disposition (fitrah). And let these be the last words you utter." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) when he retired to his bed would say: "Praise be to Allah Who fed us and gave us to drink, and Who sufficed us and gave us shelter, for how many are there who have no one to suffice them and no one to give them shelter." (Reported by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Hudhaifah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) when he wanted to sleep, he would place his right hand under his cheek, then he would say: "O Allah, protect me from Your punishment on the Day You resurrect Your servants." (Narrated by Tirmidhi and he said it is a hasan hadith, and narrated by Abu Dawud from the narration of Hafsah (may Allah be pleased with her) and in it he used to say it three times). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]
And from Al-Nu'man bin Bashir, may Allah be pleased with them both, from the Prophet, peace be upon him, he said: "Supplication is worship." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may God be pleased with her, she said: The Messenger of God, may God's blessings and peace be upon him, used to like the comprehensive supplications and abandon what was other than that. (Narrated by Abu Dawood with a good chain of transmission). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, narrated: The most frequent supplication of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, was: "Our Lord, give us in this world [that which is] good and in the Hereafter [that which is] good and protect us from the punishment of the Fire." (Agreed upon). Muslim added in his narration: Anas used to make this supplication whenever he wanted to make a supplication, and whenever he wanted to make a du'a, he would include it. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, peace be upon him, used to say: "O Allah, I ask You for guidance, piety, chastity, and richness." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Tariq ibn Ashim, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: When a man embraced Islam, the Prophet, peace be upon him, would teach him prayer, then he would order him to supplicate with these words: "O Allah, forgive me, have mercy on me, guide me, grant me well-being, and provide for me." (Narrated by Muslim). And in another narration from him, from Tariq, that he heard the Prophet, peace be upon him, and a man came to him and said: "O Messenger of Allah, how should I say when I ask my Lord?" He said: "Say: 'O Allah, forgive me, have mercy on me, grant me well-being, and provide for me,' for these words encompass your worldly life and your hereafter." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-As, may Allah be pleased with them both, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "O Allah, Turner of hearts, turn our hearts to Your obedience." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Seek refuge in Allah from the severity of affliction, the reaching of misery, the evil of fate, and the rejoicing of enemies." (Agreed upon). And in a narration: Sufyan said: "I doubt that I added one of them." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, used to say: "O Allah, reform for me my religion, which is the safeguard of my affairs, and reform for me my worldly life, in which is my livelihood, and reform for me my hereafter, to which is my return. And make my life an increase in every good, and make death a rest for me from every evil." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ali, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said to me: "Say: O Allah, guide me and set me aright." And in another narration: "O Allah, I ask You for guidance and for rectitude." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) used to say: "O Allah, I seek refuge in You from helplessness and laziness, cowardice and old age, and stinginess. And I seek refuge in You from the punishment of the grave, and I seek refuge in You from the trials of life and death." And in another narration: "And the burden of debt and the overpowering of men." (Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Bakr As-Siddiq, may Allah be pleased with him, that he said to the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him: "Teach me a supplication that I may say in my prayer." He said: "Say: 'O Allah, I have wronged myself greatly, and none can forgive sins but You. So, forgive me with forgiveness from You, and have mercy upon me. Indeed, You are the Most Forgiving, the Most Merciful.'" (Agreed upon). In one narration: "and in my house." And it was narrated: "greatly." And it was narrated: "greatly" with Thaal (ث) and "greatly" with Baa' (ب), so one should combine them, saying: "greatly, greatly." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Musa, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, that he used to supplicate with this supplication: "O Allah, forgive me my sins and my ignorance, and my extravagance in my affairs, and what You know better of me. O Allah, forgive me my jest and my seriousness, and my mistakes and my intentional sins, and all of that is with me. O Allah, forgive me what I have sent forth and what I have delayed, and what I have concealed and what I have disclosed, and what You know better of me. You are the One Who sends forth, and You are the One Who delays, and You have power over all things." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, used to say in his supplication: "O Allah, I seek refuge in You from the evil of what I have done and from the evil of what I have not done." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both) that he said: Among the supplications of the Messenger of Allah (may Allah bless him and grant him peace) was: "O Allah, I seek refuge in You from the disappearance of Your favor, the reversal of Your well-being, the suddenness of Your punishment, and all of Your displeasure." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Zayd ibn Arqam (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) used to say: "O Allah, I seek refuge in You from helplessness and laziness, from stinginess and old age, and from the torment of the grave. O Allah, give my soul its piety, and purify it, for You are the best of those who purify it. You are its Guardian and its Master. O Allah, I seek refuge in You from knowledge that is of no benefit, and from a heart that does not humble itself, and from a soul that is not satisfied, and from a supplication that is not answered." (Reported by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, used to say: "O Allah, to You I have submitted, and in You I have believed, and in You I have placed my trust, and to You I have turned, and with You I have contended. To You I appeal for judgment. So forgive me what I have sent ahead and what I have left behind, what I have concealed and what I have made public. You are the One Who sends forth and the One Who delays; there is no god but You." Some narrators added: "And there is no might nor power except with Allah." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, used to supplicate with these words: "O Allah, I seek refuge in You from the trial of the Fire, and the punishment of the Fire, and from the evil of wealth and poverty." Narrated by Abu Dawud and Tirmidhi, who said it is a hasan sahih hadith. This is the wording of Abu Dawud. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ziyad bin 'Alaqah, from his uncle, who is Qutbah bin Malik, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, used to say: "O Allah, I seek refuge in You from the abominations of manners, deeds, and desires." Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and he said it is a hasan hadith. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from the shape of Ibn Humaid, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: I said, O Messenger of Allah, teach me a supplication. He said: "Say: O Allah, I seek refuge in You from the evil of my hearing, and from the evil of my sight, and from the evil of my tongue, and from the evil of my heart, and from the evil of my semen." Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said it is a hasan hadith. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, used to say: "O Allah, I seek refuge in You from leprosy, madness, elephantiasis, and evil diseases." Narrated by Abu Dawood with a sound chain of narration. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) used to say: "O Allah, I seek refuge in You from hunger, for it is a terrible bedfellow, and I seek refuge in You from betrayal, for it is a terrible companion." (Narrated by Abu Dawud with a sound chain of narration). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ali, may Allah be pleased with him, that a manumitted slave came to him and said: "I am unable to pay my manumission fee. Help me."
