(Narrated by Muslim). Brave, skilled. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both) that a group of people said to him: We enter upon our rulers and say to them the opposite of what we say when we leave them? Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both) said: We used to consider this hypocrisy during the time of the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him). (Narrated by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Jundub bin Abdullah bin Sufyan (may Allah be pleased with him) who narrated that the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Whoever seeks to make people hear of his deeds, Allah will expose him to them; and whoever shows off his deeds, Allah will show off his deeds." (Agreed upon). (Also narrated by Muslim from the narration of Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them). "Samm'a" with a shaddah on the 'meem', and its meaning is: he displays his deeds to people for ostentation. "Allah will make him hear of it" means: Allah will expose him on the Day of Resurrection. And the meaning of "whoever shows off" is: whoever displays good deeds to people so that they may glorify him. "Allah will show off his deeds" means: Allah will reveal his innermost secrets before all creation. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever seeks knowledge that should be sought for the sake of Allah the Mighty and Majestic, but seeks it only to gain a worldly benefit, will not smell the fragrance of Paradise on the Day of Resurrection." meaning its scent. Narrated by Abu Dawud with a sound chain of narration, and the hadiths on the subject are numerous and well-known. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Dharr, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: It was said to the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him: Do you see a man who does a good deed and people praise him for it? He said: "That is the immediate good news for the believer." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The share of adultery for the son of Adam is inevitable. The adultery of the eyes is looking, the adultery of the ears is listening, the adultery of the tongue is speaking, the adultery of the hands is touching, the adultery of the feet is walking, and the heart desires and wishes. And the private parts will confirm that or deny it." (Agreed upon. This is the wording of Muslim, and the wording of Bukhari is abridged.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, peace be upon him, he said: "Beware of sitting in the roads." They said: "O Messenger of Allah, we have no choice but to sit in our gatherings to talk." The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "If you insist on sitting, then give the road its due." They said: "And what is the due of the road, O Messenger of Allah?" He said: "Lowering the gaze, refraining from harming others, returning the greeting, enjoining good, and forbidding evil." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Talha Zaid bin Thabit (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: We were sitting in the courtyards, talking, when the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) came to us and said: "What is it with you and sitting in the streets? We said: We only sit for no harm, we sit to recall, and to talk. He said: "If you must, then fulfill its rights: lowering the gaze, returning the greeting, and speaking kindly." (Reported by Muslim). "Al-Su'adat" with the pronunciation of the Sad and the Ain, meaning: the roads. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Jarir (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: I asked the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) about the glance of surprise, and he said: "Turn your gaze away." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Umm Salamah (may Allah be pleased with her), she said: I was with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), and Maimunah was with him. Then Ibn Umm Maktum approached, and this was after we were ordered to wear the hijab. So the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Veil yourselves from him." We said: O Messenger of Allah, is he not blind and does not see us, nor does he know us? So the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Are you both blind? Do you not see him?!" (Narrated by Abu Dawood and At-Tirmidhi, who said it is a Hasan Sahih hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Saeed, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "A man should not look at the private part of another man, nor a woman at the private part of another woman, nor should a man lie with another man under one garment, nor should a woman lie with another woman under one garment." (Reported by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from 'Uqbah ibn 'Amir (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "Beware of entering upon women." A man from the Ansar said: "What about the Hamu (the husband's brother or other male relatives)?" He said: "The Hamu is death." (Agreed upon). The Hamu is the husband's relative such as his brother, his nephew, or his cousin. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "No man should be alone with a woman except with a mahram." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Buraydah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) said: "The honor of the wives of the Mujahideen is forbidden to those who stay behind, as is the honor of their mothers. No man who stays behind [and does not participate in Jihad] encroaches upon the family of a Mujahid and betrays him in them, but he will be made to stand on the Day of Resurrection and will be made to take from his good deeds as much as he wishes until he is satisfied." Then the Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) turned to us and said: "What do you think?" (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them, he said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) cursed the effeminate men and the masculine women. And in another narration: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) cursed the men who imitate women and the women who imitate men. (Reported by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) cursed the man who imitates women, and the woman who imitates men. (Narrated by Abu Dawud with a sound chain of narration). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him it is narrated that the Messenger of Allah (may Allah bless him and grant him peace) said: "Two types of the people of the Fire are those whom I have not seen: a people with them are whips like the tails of cattle, with which they beat people, and women who are clothed yet naked, inclining and causing others to incline, their heads like the humps of a leaning camel. They will not enter Paradise, nor will they smell its fragrance, though its fragrance can be perceived from such and such a distance." (Narrated by Muslim)

"Clothed" means clothed by the blessings of Allah, "naked" means naked from the gratitude for them. It is also said that it means they cover some of their bodies and expose some of it, showing off their situation and the like. It is also said that it means they wear thin clothing that reveals the color of their skin.

As for "inclining," it is said that it means inclining away from the obedience of Allah and what they are obliged to protect. "(Causing others to incline)" means they teach others their blameworthy actions. It is also said that "inclining" means they walk with an affected gait, swaying their shoulders. It is also said that "inclining" means they style their hair in a leaning style, which is the hairstyle of prostitutes. "(Causing others to incline)" means they style others' hair in that manner.

The meaning of "their heads are like the humps of a camel" is that they enlarge and make them bigger by wrapping a turban or band or the like around them. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "Do not eat with your left hand, for Satan eats and drinks with his left hand." (Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them) that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "Let none of you eat with his left hand, nor drink with it, for Satan eats and drinks with his left hand." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The Jews and Christians do not dye, so oppose them." (Agreed upon). The meaning is to dye white hair of the beard and head with yellow or red, as for black, it is forbidden as we will mention in the next chapter, if Allah Almighty wills. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: Abu Quhafah, the father of Abu Bakr As-Siddiq (may Allah be pleased with them both), was brought on the day of the Conquest of Mecca, and his head and beard were white like the Samamah plant. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Change this and avoid black." (Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]
Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) forbade Qaza'. (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, saw a boy who had shaved some of his head and left some of it. He forbade them from doing that and said: "Shave it all, or leave it all." Narrated by Abu Dawud with a sound chain of narration according to the conditions of Bukhari and Muslim. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Narrated by Abdullah bin Ja'far (may Allah be pleased with them both) that the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) gave the family of Ja'far (may Allah be pleased with him) three days' respite, then he came to them and said: "Do not weep for my brother after today." Then he said: "Call my brother's children to me." So we were brought to him like young birds. He then said: "Call a barber for me." So he ordered him, and he shaved our heads." Reported by Abu Dawud with a sound chain of narration according to the conditions of Bukhari and Muslim. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]
And from Ali, may Allah be pleased with him, it is reported that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, forbade women from shaving their heads. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Asma (may Allah be pleased with her) that a woman asked the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him) and said: "O Messenger of Allah, my daughter was afflicted with measles, and her hair fell out. I have married her off, so should I add to it?" He said: "May Allah curse the one who adds (hair) and the one to whom it is added." (Agreed upon)
And in another narration: "the one who adds (hair) and the one who requests to have it added." Her saying "fatamaraqa" is with the letter Raa' (ر) and its meaning is: it scattered and fell. "Al-wāṣilah" is the one who adds hair to her hair, or the hair of others with other hair. "And al-mawṣūlah" is the one whose hair is added to. "And al-mustawṣilah" is the one who asks someone to do that for her. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]
And from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, similar to this, agreed upon by Bukhari and Muslim. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Humaid bin Abd al-Rahman that he heard Mu'awiyah, may Allah be pleased with him, in the year he performed Hajj, on the pulpit, and he took a lock of hair that was in the hand of a guard, and said: "O people of Medina, where are your scholars? I heard the Prophet, peace be upon him, forbid this and say: 'The Children of Israel were destroyed when their women took these'." It is agreed upon. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) cursed the one who joins hair and the one who has her hair joined, and the one who tattoos and the one who has herself tattooed. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: Allah has cursed the women who tattoo, and those who have themselves tattooed, and the pluckers of eyebrows, and those who file their teeth for beauty, the changers of Allah's creation! A woman said to him concerning that, and he said: Why should I not curse those whom Allah's Messenger (peace be upon him) has cursed, and it is in Allah's Book! Allah the Almighty said: "And whatever the Messenger has given you, take it; and what he has forbidden you, refrain from it" (Al-Hashr: 7). (Agreed upon). Al-Mutafallijah is: she who files her teeth so that they are slightly spaced apart, and beautifies them, and that is Al-Washr. And Al-Namisah: [is] she who plucks the hair of another's eyebrow and thins it to make it beautiful. And Al-Mutanammisah: she who orders someone to do that to her. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, she said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever does an action which is not in accordance with our way, it will be rejected." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Abu Qatada (may Allah be pleased with him) from the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him) who said: "When one of you urinates, he should not take his private part with his right hand, nor cleanse himself with his right hand, nor breathe into the vessel." (Agreed upon) And there are many other authentic hadiths on this topic. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "None of you should walk with one sandal; either he wears both of them or he takes both of them off." In another narration: "or he should uncover them both." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "If the strap of one of your sandals breaks, then do not walk in the other until you fix it." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) forbade a man from wearing his sandals while standing. (Narrated by Abu Dawud with a hasan chain of narration) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both) narrated that the Prophet (peace be upon him) said: "Do not leave fire burning in your houses when you sleep." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Musa Al-Ash'ari, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: A house in Medina burned down with its inhabitants during the night. When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was informed about them, he said: "Indeed, this fire is an enemy to you. So when you sleep, extinguish it." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Jabir, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, peace be upon him, who said: "Cover the utensils, and tie up the waterskins, and close the doors, and extinguish the lamps, for Satan does not untie a waterskin, nor open a door, nor uncover a utensil. If any of you cannot find anything but to lay a stick across his utensil and mention the name of Allah, let him do so, for the little wicked one (al-fuwaisiqah) can set ablaze the house of the people." (Narrated by Muslim). "Al-fuwaisiqah" means a mouse, and "tudrim" means burns. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]
And from Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both) who said: "We were forbidden from imposing burdens on ourselves." (Narrated by Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Masruq, he said: We entered upon Abdullah bin Masud, may Allah be pleased with him, and he said: O people, whoever knows something, let him say it, and whoever does not know, let him say: Allah knows best, for it is part of knowledge for a man to say about what he does not know: Allah knows best. Allah the Almighty said to his Prophet, peace be upon him: {Say, "I do not ask of you any reward for it, nor am I of those who undertake (more than is necessary)."} (Reported by Al-Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of Umar ibn al-Khattab, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The deceased is tormented in his grave because of the wailing over him." And in another narration: "because of what was wailed over him." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "He is not among us who strikes his cheeks, tears his clothes, and calls out with the calls of the Jahiliyyah." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Burda, he said: Abu Musa was in pain, and he fainted, and his head was in the lap of a woman from his family. She began to cry out with a wail, and he could not respond to her. When he recovered, he said: I am free from whoever the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) was free from. Verily, the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) was free from the wailing woman, the head-shaving woman, and the garment-tearing woman. (Agreed upon) The wailing woman is she who raises her voice in wailing and lamentation. The head-shaving woman is she who shaves her head at a calamity. The garment-tearing woman is she who tears her garment. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "Whoever is wailed over, he will be punished on the Day of Resurrection for what he was wailed over." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Umm `Atiyyah Nusaybah - with both a dammah and a fathah on the noon - may Allah be pleased with her, she said: "The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, took a pledge from us at the time of allegiance that we would not wail." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Al-Nu'man bin Bashir, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: Abdullah bin Rawahah, may Allah be pleased with him, fainted and his sister began to weep and say: "Oh my strength, oh so-and-so, oh so-and-so," enumerating his virtues. When he recovered, he said: "Was there nothing I did that was not said to me: 'You are like this'?" (Narrated by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Narrated Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both): Sa'd bin Ubadah (may Allah be pleased with him) fell ill, so Allah's Messenger (peace be upon him) went to visit him, accompanied by Abdur Rahman bin Awf, Sa'd bin Abi Waqqas, and Abdullah bin Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with them). When he entered, he found him in a swoon. He said: "Is he unconscious?" They replied: "No, O Allah's Messenger." Then Allah's Messenger (peace be upon him) wept. When the people saw the Prophet's (peace be upon him) weeping, they wept too. He said: "Do you not hear? Allah does not punish with tears of the eye, nor with the sadness of the heart, but He punishes with this," and he pointed to his tongue, "or He has mercy." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Malik Al-Ash'ari, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "The wailing woman, if she does not repent before her death, will be raised on the Day of Resurrection wearing a garment of pitch and a shirt of scabies." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Usayd bin Abi Usayd, the Tabi'i, from a woman who pledged allegiance: She said: "Among the conditions that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) took from us, in the good deeds that he took from us, that we not disobey him in, was that we do not scratch our faces, nor call out "Woe!", nor tear our garments, nor spread our hair." (Reported by Abu Dawud with a hasan chain of narration) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Musa, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "No one dies, and his mourners stand up and say: 'Woe is me, my leader,' or something like that, but that two angels are appointed to push him (with their fists): 'Were you like this?'" [Reported by Tirmidhi and he said it is a hasan hadith.]
"Al-lahzu" means to push with the fist in the chest. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "There are two qualities in people that are considered disbelief in them: disparaging the lineage of others, and wailing loudly for the deceased." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, narrated that some people asked the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) about soothsayers. He said: "They are nothing." They said: "O Messenger of Allah, they sometimes tell us something that turns out to be true." The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "That is a word of truth which the jinn snatch and whisper into the ear of their ally, and they mix it with a hundred lies." (Agreed upon). In a narration of Al-Bukhari from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, she heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) say: "The angels descend in the 'anan - which means the clouds - and they mention a matter that has been decreed in the heaven. The devil steals a hearing of it, hears it, and then whispers it to the soothsayers, who mix it with a hundred lies of their own."
His saying: "fa yuqirruha" is with the opening of the ya and the joining of the qaf and the ra, meaning: he throws it, and "al-'anan" is with the opening of the 'ayn. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Qubaisha bint Abi 'Ubaid, from some of the wives of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, and may Allah be pleased with them, from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, who said: "Whoever comes to a diviner and asks him about something and believes him, his prayer will not be accepted for forty days." (Reported by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Qubisa bin Al-Makhariq, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "Al-'iyāfah, and al-ṭiyarah, and al-ṭaraq, are from al-jibṭ." (Narrated by Abu Dawood with a good chain of narration).
And he said: "Al-ṭaraq" is al-zajr: meaning the frightening of birds, and it is to take an omen or a bad omen from their flight. If they flew to the right, he would take it as a good omen, and if they flew to the left, he would take it as a bad omen. Abu Dawood said: "And al-'iyāfah" is drawing lines.
Al-Jawhari said in Al-Siḥāḥ: Al-jibṭ is a word that refers to an idol, a soothsayer, a sorcerer, and the like. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever acquires knowledge of the stars, acquires a branch of magic; the more he acquires, the more he acquires." (Narrated by Abu Dawud with a sound chain of narration). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Mu'awiyah bin Al-Hakam, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: I said, "O Messenger of Allah, I am newly come from the days of ignorance, and Allah has brought Islam. And among us are men who go to soothsayers?" He said: "Then do not go to them." I said: "And among us are men who consider omens?" He said: "That is something they find in their hearts, so let it not deter them." I said: "And among us are men who draw lines?" He said: "A prophet from the prophets used to draw lines, so whoever's drawing matches his, then that is it." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Mas'ud al-Badri, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, forbade the price of a dog, the dowry of a prostitute, and the fee of a soothsayer. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported that the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) said: "There is no contagion, nor is there an evil omen, but I like the good omen." They asked: "What is the good omen?" He said: "A good word." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them) that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "There is no contagion, nor evil omen. If there is ill fortune in anything, it is in the house, the woman, and the horse." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of Buraydah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Prophet (peace be upon him) did not believe in omens. (Narrated by Abu Dawood with a sahih chain of narration) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Urwah bin Amir, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The omen was mentioned to the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, and he said: "The best of it is the good omen, and it does not turn away a Muslim. If any of you sees what he dislikes, let him say: 'O Allah, none brings good deeds except You, and none repels evil deeds except You, and there is no might or power except with You.'" (A sahih hadith narrated by Abu Dawud with a sahih chain of narration). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It is narrated from Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both) that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "Indeed, those who make these images will be punished on the Day of Resurrection. They will be told: 'Bring to life what you have created.'" (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, that she said: The Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) returned from a journey, and I had covered a shelf with a curtain that had pictures on it. When the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) saw it, his face changed color, and he said: "O Aisha, the people who will receive the most severe punishment from Allah on the Day of Resurrection are those who imitate the creation of Allah." She said: So we cut it up and made one or two cushions out of it. (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "Every image-maker will be in the Fire, and for every image he made, a soul will be created, and it will torment him in Hell." Ibn Abbas said: "If you must do it, then make trees and what has no soul in it." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "Whoever creates a picture in this world will be tasked with breathing the soul into it on the Day of Resurrection, and he will not be able to do so." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "The people who will suffer the most severe punishment on the Day of Resurrection will be the image-makers." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "Allah the Almighty said: 'And who is more unjust than one who tries to create like My creation! So let them create a speck, or let them create a grain, or let them create a barley grain.'" (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Talha, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Angels do not enter a house in which there is a dog or a picture." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them) that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) promised Gabriel that he would come to him. Gabriel was late, which caused the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) great distress. He went out and met Gabriel, and complained to him. Gabriel said: "We do not enter a house in which there is a dog or a picture." (Narrated by Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, narrated that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, had promised Gabriel, peace be upon him, to meet him at a certain time. That time came, but Gabriel did not come to him. She said: He was holding a stick in his hand, and he dropped it, saying: "Allah does not break His promise, nor do His messengers." Then he looked around and saw a puppy under his bed. He said: "When did this puppy enter?" I said: "By Allah, I did not know about it." So he ordered that it be removed. Then Gabriel, peace be upon him, came to him. The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "You promised me, and I sat waiting for you, but you did not come." Gabriel replied: "The puppy that was in your house prevented me. We do not enter a house in which there is a dog or an image." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu al-Hayyaj Hayyan bin Husayn, he said: Ali bin Abi Talib, may Allah be pleased with him, said to me: "Shall I not commission you with what the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, commissioned me with? That you do not leave an image without obliterating it, nor a raised grave without leveling it." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, narrated that he heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "Whoever keeps a dog, except for a hunting dog or a dog for herding livestock, his reward will decrease by two qirats every day." (Agreed upon). In another narration: "a qirat." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Whoever keeps a dog, his good deeds will be reduced by one qirat each day, except for a dog kept for guarding crops or livestock." (Agreed upon). And in a narration by Muslim: "Whoever keeps a dog, other than a dog for hunting, or livestock, or guarding the land, his reward will be reduced by two qirats each day." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "The angels do not accompany a company with a dog or a bell." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]
And from him, the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The bell is the devil's musical instrument." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) forbade riding on a Jallalah camel. (Narrated by Abu Dawud with a sound chain of narration) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported that the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) said: "Spitting in the mosque is a sin, and its expiation is to bury it." (Agreed upon). And what is meant by burying it is, if the mosque is made of earth or sand, etc., then to cover it under its earth. Abu Al-Mahasin Al-Ruwayani, from our companions, said in his book (The Sea): And it is said that what is meant by burying it is to remove it from the mosque. As for if the mosque is paved or plastered, then rubbing it on it with his shoes or otherwise, as many ignorant people do, then that is not burying it, but rather an increase in sin and an increase in filth in the mosque. And whoever does that must wipe it afterwards with his garment or his hand or otherwise, or wash it. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may God be pleased with her, that the Messenger of God, may God’s prayers and peace be upon him, saw on the qibla wall mucus or spittle or phlegm, so he scraped it off. (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) said: "These mosques are not suitable for anything of urine or filth, they are only for the remembrance of Allah the Almighty and the recitation of the Qur'an," or words to that effect, the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him). (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) that he heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) say: "Whoever hears a man calling out for a lost thing in the mosque, let him say: 'May Allah not return it to you,' for mosques were not built for this." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "If you see someone selling or buying in the mosque, then say: 'May Allah not grant profit to your trade.' And if you see someone seeking a lost item, then say: 'May Allah not return it to you.'" It was narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and he said: (Hasan Hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Buraydah (may Allah be pleased with him) that a man called out in the mosque, saying: "Who called for the red camel?" So the Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) said: "May you not find it, for the mosques were built for what they were built for." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Amr ibn Shu'ayb, from his father, from his grandfather, may Allah be pleased with them, that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) forbade buying and selling in the Masjid, and that a lost item should not be announced there, nor should poetry be recited there. (Narrated by Abu Dawud, and Tirmidhi, who said it is a hasan hadith.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Al-Sa'ib bin Yazid, the companion, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: I was in the mosque when a man threw pebbles at me. I looked and it was Umar bin Al-Khattab, may Allah be pleased with him. He said: Go and bring me these two. I brought them to him. He said: Where are you from? They said: We are from the people of Ta'if. He said: If you were from the people of the city, I would have made you feel pain for raising your voices in the mosque of the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him. (Reported by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both) that the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Whoever eats of this tree - meaning garlic - let him not come near our mosque." (Agreed upon). And in a narration of Muslim: "our mosques." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Prophet, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him, said: "Whoever eats from this tree, let him not approach us, nor pray with us." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Prophet (may peace be upon him) said: "Whoever eats garlic or onion, let him keep away from us, or let him keep away from our mosque." (Agreed upon). And in a narration of Muslim: "Whoever eats onion, garlic, or leeks, let him not approach our mosque, for the angels are harmed by what harms the children of Adam." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Umar ibn Al-Khattab, may Allah be pleased with him, that he gave a sermon on Friday and said in his sermon: "O people, you eat two trees, which I see only as foul: onions and garlic. I have seen the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, if he smelled them from a man in the mosque, he would order that he be taken out to Al-Baqi'. So whoever eats them, let him cook them." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Mu'adh bin Anas Al-Juhani, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, forbade sitting in a hunched-up position on Friday while the Imam is giving the sermon. (Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said: It is a hasan hadith.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Umm Salamah that the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) said: "Whoever has a sacrifice to offer, let him not cut his hair or his nails after the crescent of Dhu al-Hijjah has appeared, until he has sacrificed." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, from the Prophet, peace be upon him, who said: "Allah the Almighty forbids you to swear by your fathers. So whoever swears, let him swear by Allah or keep silent." (Agreed upon). And in another narration in Al-Bukhari: "So whoever swears, let him not swear except by Allah or keep silent." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abdul Rahman bin Samura, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Do not swear by idols, nor by your fathers." (Narrated by Muslim). "Al-Tawaghi" is the plural of "Taghut," which means idols. Hence the hadith: "This is the Taghut of Daws," meaning their idol and what they worship. It is narrated in other than Muslim: "by Al-Tawagheet," the plural of "Taghut," which is Satan and the idol. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Buraydah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) said: "Whoever swears by trust is not one of us." (A hadith which is authentic, narrated by Abu Dawud with an authentic chain of narration) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, it is narrated that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Whoever swears and says, 'Verily, I am free from Islam,' then if he is a liar, he is as he said. But if he is truthful, he will not return to Islam safely." (Narrated by Abu Dawud) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both) that he heard a man say: "No, by the Kaaba." Ibn Umar said: "Do not swear by other than Allah, for I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) say: 'Whoever swears by other than Allah has committed disbelief or shirk.'" (Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi, who said it is a hasan hadith). Some scholars interpreted his saying: "disbelief or shirk" as an exaggeration, as it is narrated that the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "Showing off is shirk." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Prophet (peace be upon him) said: "Whoever takes the property of a Muslim unjustly, he will meet Allah while He is angry with him." He said: Then the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) recited to us the confirmation from the Book of Allah, the Almighty: "Indeed, those who exchange the covenant of Allah and their oaths for a small price..." (Al-Imran: 77) until the end of the verse. (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Umamah Iyas bin Tha'labah Al-Harithi (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Whoever unjustly takes a Muslim's right with his oath, Allah has made the Fire obligatory for him and forbidden Paradise for him." A man said to him: "Even if it is something small, O Messenger of Allah?" He said: "Even if it is a twig from the Arak tree." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-Aas, may Allah be pleased with them both, from the Prophet, may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him, he said: "The major sins are: associating partners with Allah, disobedience to parents, killing a soul, and the false oath." (Narrated by Bukhari). And in another narration: An Arab came to the Prophet, may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him, and said: "O Messenger of Allah, what are the major sins?" He said: "Associating partners with Allah." He said: "Then what?" He said: "The false oath." I said: "And what is the false oath?" He said: "That which appropriates the property of a Muslim man," meaning by an oath in which he is a liar. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

'Abd al-Rahman ibn Samura (may Allah be pleased with him) reported that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "If you swear an oath and then see that something else is better than it, then do what is better and expiate your oath." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever swears an oath and then sees something else that is better than it, let him atone for his oath and do what is better." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Musa, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Verily, by Allah, if Allah wills, I will not swear an oath and then see something better than it, except that I will expiate for my oath and do what is better." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "For one of you to insist on his oath regarding his family is more sinful in the sight of Allah, the Exalted, than for him to give its expiation which Allah has ordained for him." (Agreed upon) The word "yalaj" with a fathah on the lam and a shaddah on the jim means: he persists in it and does not expiate. The word "athim" is with the thaa' muthallathah, meaning: more sinful. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, who said: This verse, "Allah will not impose blame on you for what is in your oaths by mistake," was revealed concerning a man saying, "No, by Allah," and "Yes, by Allah." (Narrated by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And Abu Huraira, may Allah be pleased with him, narrated that he heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "An oath is an expenditure for the commodity, and a destroyer of livelihood." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Qatadah (may Allah be pleased with him) that he heard the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) say: "Beware of excessive swearing in selling, for it sells but then it erases (all blessings)." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "No one should ask by the Face of Allah except Paradise." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever seeks refuge in Allah, grant him refuge. Whoever asks of Allah, give him. Whoever calls you, respond to him. Whoever does you a favor, reward him. If you do not find anything to reward him with, then pray for him until you think you have rewarded him." (Sahih Hadith narrated by Abu Dawud and An-Nasa'i with chains of narration from the two Sahihs). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him), the Prophet (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) said: "The most disliked name to Allah the Mighty and Majestic is a man who calls himself 'King of Kings'." (Agreed upon). Sufyan bin Uyaynah said: "'King of Kings' is like 'Shahanshah'." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Buraydah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Do not call a hypocrite 'master', for if he is a master, you have incurred the wrath of your Lord, the Mighty and Majestic." (Narrated by Abu Dawud with a Sahih chain of narration) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) entered upon Umm Al-Sa'ib, or Umm Al-Musayyib, and said: "What is wrong with you, Umm Al-Sa'ib - or Umm Al-Musayyib - that you are trembling?" She said: "Fever, may Allah not bless it." He said: "Do not curse the fever, for it removes the sins of the son of Adam, just as the bellows remove the impurities of iron." (Reported by Muslim). "Tuzafzifeen" means to move rapidly, and it means to shiver. It is with the pronunciation of the letter 'ta' with a doubled 'za' and a doubled 'fa', and it has also been narrated with a doubled 'ra' and two 'qaafs'. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Abu Al-Mundhir, Ubayy bin Ka'b (may Allah be pleased with him), who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Do not curse the wind, and when you see what you dislike, say: 'O Allah, we ask You for the good of this wind, and the good of what is in it, and the good of what it has been commanded with. And we seek refuge in You from the evil of this wind, and the evil of what is in it, and the evil of what it has been commanded with.'" (Reported by Al-Tirmidhi, who said it is a Hasan Sahih Hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "The wind is from the breath of Allah, it brings mercy and it brings torment. So when you see it, do not curse it, but ask Allah for its goodness and seek refuge in Allah from its evil." (Narrated by Abu Dawood with a hasan chain of narration). His saying, peace and blessings be upon him, "from the breath of Allah" means with the opening of the letter "Ra'" (meaning mercy) from Him to His servants. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, she said: When the wind blew fiercely, the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, would say: "O Allah, I ask you for its good, and the good of what is in it, and the good of what it was sent with. And I seek refuge in You from its evil, and the evil of what is in it, and the evil of what it was sent with." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Zayd ibn Khadhal Al-Juhani, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Do not curse the rooster, for it awakens [people] for prayer." (Narrated by Abu Dawud with a sound chain of narration) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of Zayd ibn Khalid (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: Allah's Messenger (peace be upon him) led us in the morning prayer at Al-Hudaybiyah after it had rained during the night. When he finished, he turned to the people and said: "Do you know what your Lord has said?" They said: Allah and His Messenger know best. He said: "He said: 'This morning some of My servants became believers in Me and some became disbelievers. As for the one who said: We have been rained upon by the grace and mercy of Allah, he is a believer in Me and a disbeliever in the stars. As for the one who said: We have been rained upon by the star of such and such, he is a disbeliever in Me and a believer in the stars.'" (Agreed upon). And "sky" here means rain. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both) reported: The Messenger of Allah (may Allah bless him and grant him peace) said: "If a man says to his brother: 'O disbeliever,' then one of them has earned it. If he was as he said, then it is so; otherwise, it returns to him." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Dharr, may Allah be pleased with him, that he heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "Whoever accuses a man of disbelief, or says to him: 'Enemy of Allah,' when he is not so, it returns to him." (Agreed upon). "Hurr" means "returns." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "The believer is not one who slanders, nor one who curses, nor one who is indecent, nor one who is obscene." (Narrated by Tirmidhi and said it is a hasan hadith.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Anas, may God be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of God, may God's blessings and peace be upon him, said: "Nothing is marred by indecency, and nothing is adorned by modesty." (Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi, who said it is a hasan hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Prophet (peace be upon him) said: "The extremists have perished," he said it three times. (Narrated by Muslim. "Al-Mutanatti'oon" means those who exaggerate in matters.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from 'Abd Allah ibn 'Amr ibn al-'As, may Allah be pleased with them, that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Allah hates the eloquent man among men who twists his tongue as a cow twists its tongue." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Jabir bin Abdullah, may Allah be pleased with them, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The dearest of you to me, and the closest of you to me in seat on the Day of Resurrection, will be the best of you in character. And the most hateful of you to me, and the furthest of you from me on the Day of Resurrection, will be the talkative, the pretentious, and the arrogant." (Narrated by Al-Tirmidhi and said it is a hasan hadith). It has previously been explained in the chapter on good character. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It is narrated on the authority of Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her) that the Prophet (peace be upon him) said: "None of you should say, 'My soul has become evil (khabuthat), but rather say, 'My soul has become disgusted (laqist).'" (Agreed upon). The scholars said that the meaning of "khabuthat" is "ghathiyat," which is the same meaning as "laqist," but the word "khabuth" was disliked. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Do not call grapes *al-karm*, for *al-karm* is the Muslim." (Agreed upon). (This is the wording of Muslim). And in another narration: "For *al-karm* is the heart of the believer." And in a narration for Bukhari and Muslim: "They say *al-karm*, but *al-karm* is the heart of the believer." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Wa'il ibn Hujr, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, peace be upon him, he said: "Do not say al-Karm, but say al-'Inab and al-Habalah." Narrated by Muslim. Al-Habalah with a Fatha on the Ha and Ba, and it is also said with Sukun on the Ba. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Ibn Mas'ud (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "A woman should not describe another woman to her husband in a way that makes him as if he is looking at her." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "None of you should say: 'O Allah, forgive me if You wish; O Allah, have mercy on me if You wish.' He should be firm in his supplication, for there is no one to compel Him." (Agreed upon). In a narration of Muslim: "But he should be firm and exaggerate his desire, for there is nothing that is too great for Allah to give." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said, "When one of you supplicates, he should be firm in his request and say: 'O Allah, give me...' He should not say: 'O Allah, if You wish, give me,' for there is no compulsion for Him." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Hudhayfah ibn al-Yaman, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him, he said: "Do not say: 'Whatever Allah wills and so-and-so wills,' but rather say: 'Whatever Allah wills, then so-and-so wills.'" It was narrated by Abu Dawud with a sound chain of narration. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Barzah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) disliked sleeping before the night prayer and talking after it. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, prayed Isha in the last part of his life. When he concluded the prayer, he said: "Do you know about this night of yours? For after one hundred years, no one who is on the face of the earth today will remain." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that they waited for the Prophet (peace be upon him), and he came to them near midnight and prayed with them, meaning the 'Isha' prayer. He said: Then he addressed us, saying: "Verily, the people have prayed and then slept. And you will remain in prayer as long as you are waiting for the prayer." (Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Narrated by Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "If a man calls his wife to his bed and she refuses, and he spends the night angry with her, the angels curse her until morning." (Agreed upon). And in a narration: until she returns. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It is narrated on the authority of Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "It is not permissible for a woman to fast while her husband is present except with his permission, nor to allow anyone into his house except with his permission." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It is narrated from Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Does any one of you not fear, when he raises his head before the Imam, that Allah may turn his head into the head of a donkey! Or that Allah may make his form the form of a donkey?" (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) forbade placing the hand on the hip while praying. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Aisha, may God be pleased with her, she said: I heard the Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "There is no prayer in the presence of food, nor while one is repelling the two impurities." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas bin Malik narrated that the Messenger of Allah said: "What is the matter with people who raise their eyes to the sky in their prayers!" He spoke sternly about that, even saying: "They must cease that, or their sight will be snatched away!" [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Narrated by Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her), she said: I asked the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) about looking around in prayer, and he said: "It is a snatching that Satan snatches from the prayer of the slave." (Reported by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said to me: "Beware of turning around in prayer, for turning around in prayer is destruction. If you must, then do so in a voluntary prayer, not in an obligatory prayer." (Reported by At-Tirmidhi, who said it is a hasan sahih hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Abu Murthad, Kanz bin Al-Husayn, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) say: "Do not pray facing the graves, nor sit on them." (Reported by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Al-Juhaim Abdullah bin Al-Harith bin Al-Simmah Al-Ansari (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "If the one who passes in front of a praying person knew what was upon him, he would stand still for forty [periods] rather than pass in front of him." The narrator said: "I do not know whether he said forty days, forty months, or forty years." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Narrated Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Prophet (peace be upon him) said: "When the prayer is proclaimed, there is no prayer but the obligatory prayer." (Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Prophet (peace be upon him) said: "Do not single out the night of Friday for standing in prayer, nor single out the day of Friday for fasting, unless it is part of a fast that one of you is observing." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "None of you should fast on Friday except the day before or the day after it." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Muhammad bin Ibad, he said: I asked Jabir, may Allah be pleased with him: Did the Prophet, peace be upon him, forbid fasting on Friday? He said: Yes. (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from the Mother of the Believers, Juwayriyah bint Al-Harith (may Allah be pleased with her) that the Prophet (peace be upon him) entered upon her on a Friday while she was fasting. He said: "Did you fast yesterday?" She said: "No." He said: "Do you want to fast tomorrow?" She said: "No." He said: "Then break your fast." (Reported by Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]
From Abu Hurayrah and Aisha, may Allah be pleased with them, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, prohibited continuous fasting. (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, forbade al-Wisal. They said: You observe al-Wisal? He said: I am not like you, I am fed and given drink. (Agreed upon) And this is the wording of Al-Bukhari. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "It is better for one of you to sit on a burning ember, which burns his clothes and penetrates his skin, than to sit on a grave." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: Allah's Messenger (peace be upon him) forbade plastering the grave, sitting on it, and building upon it. (Reported by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Jarir bin Abdullah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Any slave who flees has been absolved by the covenant." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, he said: "If a slave runs away, his prayer will not be accepted." (Narrated by Muslim). And in another narration: "He has disbelieved." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, that the Quraish were concerned about the case of the Makhzumi woman who had stolen, and they said: "Who will speak to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) about her?" They said: "Who would dare to do so except Usama ibn Zayd, the beloved of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him)?" So Usama spoke to him, and the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Do you intercede in a matter of the boundaries set by Allah, the Almighty?" Then he stood and gave a sermon, and said: "The people before you were destroyed because if a noble person among them stole, they would leave him, but if a weak person stole among them, they would inflict the prescribed punishment on him. By Allah, if Fatimah, the daughter of Muhammad, were to steal, I would cut off her hand." (Agreed upon) In another narration: "The face of the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) changed color," and he said: "Do you intercede in a matter of the boundaries set by Allah?" Usama said: "Ask for my forgiveness, O Messenger of Allah." He said: "Then he ordered that woman's hand be cut off." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Beware of the two curses." They said: "And what are the two curses?" He said: "The one who relieves himself in the path of people or in their shade." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade urinating in stagnant water. Narrated by Muslim. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Nu'man bin Bashir, may Allah be pleased with them, that his father brought him to the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) and said: "I have granted my son here a slave who was mine." The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "Did you grant all your children a slave like this?" He said: "No." The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "Then take him back." In another narration: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "Did you do this for all your children?" He said: "No." He said: "Fear Allah and be just among your children." So my father went back and returned that gift. In another narration: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "O Bashir, do you have any children besides this one?" He said: "Yes." He said: "Did you give all of them a gift like this?" He said: "No." He said: "Then do not let me be a witness, for I do not bear witness to injustice." In another narration: "Do not let me bear witness to injustice." And in another narration: "Let someone else bear witness to this." Then he said: "Would you be pleased if they were all equally dutiful to you?" He said: "Yes." He said: "Then do not do so." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Zaynab bint Abi Salama (may Allah be pleased with them both), who said: I entered upon Umm Habiba (may Allah be pleased with her), the wife of the Prophet (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him), when her father, Abu Sufyan bin Harb (may Allah be pleased with him), passed away. She asked for some perfume that had a yellowish hue, like khaluq or something similar. She applied it to a slave girl, and then touched her own cheeks with it. Then she said: "By Allah, I have no need for perfume, except that I heard the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) say on the pulpit: 'It is not permissible for a woman who believes in Allah and the Last Day to mourn for a deceased person for more than three nights, except for a husband, for four months and ten days.'" Zaynab said: Then I entered upon Zaynab bint Jahsh (may Allah be pleased with her) when her brother passed away. She asked for some perfume and applied it. Then she said: "By Allah, I have no need for perfume, except that I heard the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) say on the pulpit: 'It is not permissible for a woman who believes in Allah and the Last Day to mourn for a deceased person for more than three nights, except for a husband, for four months and ten days.'" (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) forbade the town dweller from selling for the desert dweller, even if he was his brother from his father and mother. (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Umar, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Do not intercept the goods until they are brought down to the markets." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Do not intercept the caravans, and let not the townsman sell for the bedouin." So Tawus said to him: What is the meaning of: "Let not the townsman sell for the bedouin?" He said: "Do not be a broker for him." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And Abu Huraira (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade the city dweller from selling for the desert dweller, and from outbidding each other, and that a man should not sell what his brother has sold, nor propose to a woman who is already betrothed to his brother, nor should a woman demand the divorce of her sister so as to empty her vessel. In another narration, it states that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade receiving goods (before they reach the market) and that a resident (of the city) should not buy for a Bedouin, and that a woman should not ask for the divorce of her sister, and that a man should not bid on what his brother has bid on, and he forbade outbidding and withholding milk. (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them both, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "No one of you should sell on the sale of another, nor should one of you propose to a woman who has been betrothed to his brother, unless he permits him." (Agreed upon, and this is the wording of Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from 'Uqbah ibn 'Amir that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "A believer is the brother of a believer. It is not lawful for a believer to buy from his brother's sale, nor to propose to his brother's fiancée until he leaves her." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Allah is pleased with three things for you and displeased with three things for you. He is pleased with you that you worship Him and associate nothing with Him, that you hold fast to the rope of Allah all together and do not become divided, and He is displeased with you that you engage in gossip, ask too many questions, and waste wealth." (Narrated by Muslim, and its explanation has preceded). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Warad, the scribe of Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah, he said: Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah dictated to me in a letter to Mu'awiyah, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, used to say after every obligatory prayer: "There is no god but Allah, alone, without partner, to Him belongs dominion and to Him belongs all praise, and He is Able to do all things. O Allah, there is no preventer of what You have given, nor giver of what You have withheld, and the fortune of the fortunate avails them nothing against You." And he wrote to him that he "used to forbid idle talk, wasting wealth, and asking too many questions. And he used to forbid disobedience to mothers, burying daughters alive, and withholding and giving." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "None of you should point a weapon at his brother, for he does not know, perhaps Satan might snatch it from his hand, and he falls into a pit of Hell." (Agreed upon). In a narration by Muslim, he said: Abu al-Qasim (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Whoever points a metal object at his brother, the angels curse him until he stops, even if he is his brother from his father and mother." The saying of the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) "yanz'u" is pronounced with an unpointed 'ayn' with a kasrah on the 'zay', and with a pointed 'ghayn' with a fatha on it. Their meanings are similar. With the unpointed letter, it means to throw, and with the pointed letter, it also means to throw and corrupt. The origin of "naz'u" is to stab and corrupt. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade passing a drawn sword from hand to hand. (Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, who said it is a hasan hadith). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

From Abu al-Sha'tha' who said: We were sitting with Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, in the mosque when the mu'adhdhin called the adhan. A man got up from the mosque and walked away. Abu Hurayrah followed him with his sight until he left the mosque. Then Abu Hurayrah said: As for this man, he has disobeyed Abu al-Qasim, may Allah bless him and grant him peace. (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him), who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Whoever is offered basil should not refuse it, for it is light to carry and pleasant in scent." (Reported by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]
And from Anas bin Malik, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, used to not refuse perfume. (Narrated by Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Musa Al-Ash'ari, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, heard a man praising a man and exaggerating in his praise. So he said: "You have destroyed him, or you have broken his back." (Agreed upon). (23). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Bakr, may Allah be pleased with him, that a man was mentioned in the presence of the Prophet, may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him. A man praised him, so the Prophet, may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Woe to you! You have cut off your companion's neck." He said it repeatedly: "And if one of you must praise, then let him say: I think so and so, if he thinks it is so, and Allah is his reckon-er, and no one testifies as pure before Allah." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Hammam bin Al-Harith, from Al-Miqdad, may Allah be pleased with him, a man started praising Uthman, may Allah be pleased with him. So Al-Miqdad knelt down and started throwing gravel in his face. Uthman said to him, "What is your matter?" He replied, "The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: 'When you see praise-givers, throw dust in their faces.'" (Narrated by Muslim). These hadiths are about prohibition, and there are many authentic hadiths about permissibility. The scholars said: The way to reconcile the hadiths is to say that if the praised person has complete faith and certainty, self-discipline, and full knowledge such that he is not tempted, deceived by it, or his soul plays with him, then it is neither forbidden nor disliked. But if there is a fear of any of these things for him, then praising him to his face is severely disliked. And the different hadiths concerning this are interpreted according to this detail. Among what has been mentioned about permissibility is the saying of the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, to Abu Bakr, may Allah be pleased with him: "I hope you are among them," meaning among those who will be called from all gates of Paradise to enter it. And in another hadith: "You are not among them," meaning: You are not among those who drag their lower garments out of arrogance. And the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said to Umar, may Allah be pleased with him: "Satan never sees you taking a path except he takes a different path than yours." And the hadiths about permissibility are many, and I have mentioned a selection of their beginnings in the book "Al-Adhkar." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them, that Umar ibn al-Khattab, may Allah be pleased with him, went out to Sham. When he reached Sargh, the commanders of the armies - Abu Ubaidah ibn al-Jarrah and his companions - met him and informed him that the plague had broken out in Sham. Ibn Abbas said: Umar said, "Summon the first Muhajirun for me." So I summoned them, and he consulted them and informed them that the plague had broken out in Sham. They differed. Some of them said, "You went out for a purpose, and we do not think you should turn back from it." Others said, "The rest of the people and the companions of the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, are with you, and we do not think you should lead them into this plague." He said, "Leave me." Then he said, "Summon the Ansar for me." So I summoned them, and he consulted them. They followed the same path as the Muhajirun and differed as they had differed. He said, "Leave me." Then he said, "Summon the elders of Quraysh who were here from the Hijra of the Conquest." So I summoned them, and not two men among them differed. They said, "We think you should return with the people and not lead them into this plague." So Umar, may Allah be pleased with him, called out to the people, "I will be setting off in the morning, so set off with me." Abu Ubaidah ibn al-Jarrah, may Allah be pleased with him, said, "Are you fleeing from the decree of Allah?" Umar, may Allah be pleased with him, said, "If anyone else had said this, O Abu Ubaidah!" - and Umar disliked contradicting him - "Yes, we flee from the decree of Allah to the decree of Allah. Tell me, if you had camels and they descended into a valley with two sides, one fertile and the other barren, would you not have grazed them on the fertile side by the decree of Allah, and grazed them on the barren side by the decree of Allah?" He said: Then Abdur-Rahman ibn Awf, may Allah be pleased with him, came, as he had been absent on some errand. He said: "I have knowledge of this. I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, say: 'If you hear of it in a land, do not go to it, and if it falls in a land while you are in it, do not go out fleeing from it.'" Then Umar, may Allah be pleased with him, praised Allah Almighty and turned back. (Agreed upon). And the side of the valley. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Usamah bin Zayd, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him, he said: "If you hear of the plague in a land, do not enter it, and if it occurs in a land while you are in it, do not go out of it." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Avoid the seven destructive sins." They said: "O Messenger of Allah, what are they?" He said: "Associating partners with Allah, sorcery, killing a soul which Allah has forbidden except by right, consuming Riba (interest), consuming the property of an orphan, turning your back on the enemy in battle, and slandering chaste, unsuspecting believing women." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]
Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) prohibited traveling with the Quran to the land of the enemy. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Umm Salamah (may Allah be pleased with her) that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "The one who drinks in a silver vessel is only making fire from Hell boil in his stomach." (Agreed upon). And in a narration of Muslim: "That the one who eats or drinks in silver and gold vessels." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Hudhaifah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, forbade us from wearing silk and brocade, and from drinking from gold and silver vessels, and said: "They are for them in this world, and for you in the Hereafter." (Agreed upon). And in a narration in the two Sahihs from Hudhaifah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "Do not wear silk or brocade, and do not drink from gold and silver vessels, and do not eat from their plates." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Anas bin Sirin, he said: I was with Anas bin Malik, may Allah be pleased with him, among a group of Magians. Faludhaj was brought on a silver dish, but he did not eat it. It was said to him: Move it. So he moved it to a dish made of Khulanj, and it was brought, and he ate it. (Narrated by Al-Bayhaqi with a Hasan chain of narration). Al-Khulanj is the dish. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) forbade men from wearing saffron. (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-'Aas, may Allah be pleased with them, he said: The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, saw Ali wearing two saffron-dyed garments, and he said: "Did your mother command you to wear this?" I said: "Shall I wash them?" He said: "Rather, burn them." And in another narration, he said: "Indeed, this is from the clothing of the disbelievers, so do not wear it." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Ali, may Allah be pleased with him, said: I memorized from the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him: "No full separation after puberty, and no silence for a day until night." Al-Khattabi, in his explanation of this hadith, said: Silence was one of the practices of asceticism in the pre-Islamic era, so they were forbidden from it in Islam and were ordered to remember and speak good. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Qais bin Abi Hazim, he said: Abu Bakr Al-Siddiq, may Allah be pleased with him, entered upon a woman from Ahmas, who was called Zainab, and he saw that she was not speaking. He said: What is wrong with her that she is not speaking? They said: She has performed Hajj in silence. So he said to her: Speak, for this is not permissible. This is from the deeds of ignorance (Jahiliyyah)! So she spoke. Narrated by Bukhari. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Sa'd ibn Abi Waqqas (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Whoever falsely claims a father other than his real father, knowing that he is not his real father, Paradise will be forbidden for him." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]
