And Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Do not be disinclined towards your fathers, for whoever is disinclined towards his father, he is a disbeliever." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Yazid bin Sharik bin Tariq narrated: I saw Ali, may Allah be pleased with him, on the pulpit delivering a sermon. I heard him say: "By Allah, we do not have any book that we read except the Book of Allah and what is in this parchment." He then unfolded it, and it contained the regulations for the blood money of camels and some rulings on wounds. It also stated: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "Al-Madinah is a sanctuary between 'Air and Thawr. Whoever commits an offense or harbors an offender in it, upon him is the curse of Allah, the angels, and all the people. Allah will not accept any compulsory or voluntary act from him on the Day of Resurrection. The covenant of the Muslims is one; even the humblest of them can guarantee it. Whoever breaks a covenant with a Muslim, upon him is the curse of Allah, the angels, and all the people. Allah will not accept any compulsory or voluntary act from him on the Day of Resurrection. Whoever claims lineage from other than his father, or associates himself with other than his masters, upon him is the curse of Allah, the angels, and all the people. Allah will not accept any compulsory or voluntary act from him on the Day of Resurrection." (Agreed upon) "The covenant of the Muslims" means their promise and their trust. "He broke it" means he violated his covenant. "Compulsory" means repentance, and it is said to mean stratagem. "Voluntary" means ransom. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Dharr, may Allah be pleased with him, that he heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "No man claims kinship with other than his father, while he knows it, but he has committed disbelief. And whoever claims what is not his, then he is not from us, and let him take his seat in the Fire. And whoever calls a man an infidel, or says: 'Enemy of Allah,' when he is not, it will return to him." (Agreed upon, and this is the wording of Muslim's narration). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Indeed, Allah is jealous, and the jealousy of Allah is that a servant should commit what Allah has forbidden him." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him, he said: "Whoever swears and says in his oath: By Al-Lat and Al-'Uzza, then let him say: There is none worthy of worship but Allah, and whoever says to his companion: Come, let us gamble, then let him give charity." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of Al-Nuwas bin Sam'an (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) mentioned the Dajjal one morning. He spoke about him in a low tone and then in a raised tone, until we thought he was in the date palms. When we went to him, he perceived this in us and said: "What is wrong with you?" We said: "O Messenger of Allah, you mentioned the Dajjal this morning, and you spoke of him in a low tone until we thought he was in the date palms." He said: "The Dajjal is not what I fear for you more than that. If he appears while I am among you, I will be his opponent on your behalf. But if he appears and I am not among you, then each person will be his own opponent, and Allah is the Guardian over every Muslim. He is a young man with curly hair, his eye is bulging, as if I resemble him to 'Abd al-'Uzza bin Qatan. So whoever among you meets him, let him recite the opening verses of Surat Al-Kahf. He will emerge from a path between Sham and Iraq, and he will spread corruption to the right and to the left. O servants of Allah, remain firm." We said: "O Messenger of Allah, how long will he remain on Earth?" He said: "Forty days: one day like a year, one day like a month, one day like a week, and the rest of his days like your days." We said: "O Messenger of Allah, on that day which is like a year, will the prayers of one day suffice us?" He said: "No, estimate its duration." We said: "O Messenger of Allah, what is his speed on Earth?" He said: "Like the rain that the wind follows. He will come to a people and call them, and they will believe in him and respond to him. He will command the sky to rain, and the earth to grow, and their livestock will return in the evening with their humps higher than they ever were, their udders fuller, and their flanks stretched. Then he will come to another people and call them, and they will reject his words, and he will turn away from them, and they will wake up barren with nothing left of their wealth. He will pass by a ruin and say to it: 'Bring forth your treasures!' and its treasures will follow him like the swarms of bees. Then he will call a young man full of youth and strike him with a sword, cutting him into two pieces, a throw of a target. Then he will call him, and he will come forward, and his face will be radiant, laughing. While he is like that, Allah will send the Messiah, son of Mary, peace be upon him, and he will descend at the white minaret in the east of Damascus, between two dyed cloths, placing his hands on the wings of two angels. When he lowers his head, it drips, and when he raises it, pearls like dew will fall from him. No disbeliever will find his breath but will die, and his soul will reach as far as his sight extends. He will seek him until he catches him at the gate of Lod and kills him. Then Jesus, peace be upon him, will come to a people whom Allah has protected from him, and he will wipe their faces and tell them of their ranks in Paradise. While he is like that, Allah will reveal to Jesus, peace be upon him: 'I have brought forth servants of Mine whom no one can fight. So gather My servants at the Tur.' And Allah will send forth Gog and Magog, and they will descend from every elevated place. The first of them will pass by the Sea of Tiberias and drink what is in it. The last of them will pass by and say: 'There was water here once.' And the Prophet of Allah, Jesus, peace be upon him, and his companions will be besieged, until the head of an ox will be better for one of them than a hundred dinars for one of you today. Then the Prophet of Allah, Jesus, peace be upon him, and his companions, may Allah be pleased with them, will beseech Allah, and Allah will send forth a worm in their necks, and they will wake up as if dead, like a single soul. Then the Prophet of Allah, Jesus, peace be upon him, and his companions, may Allah be pleased with them, will descend to Earth, and they will find no space of a hand's breadth but it is filled with their stench and their foulness. Then the Prophet of Allah, Jesus, peace be upon him, and his companions, may Allah be pleased with them, will beseech Allah, and Allah will send forth birds like the necks of camels, and they will carry them and throw them wherever Allah wills. Then Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, will send down rain that no house of clay or fur will be able to withstand, and it will wash the Earth until it leaves it like a mirror. Then it will be said to the Earth: 'Bring forth your fruit and restore your blessing.' On that day, a group will eat from a pomegranate, and take shelter under its rind. And the milk will be blessed, so that one gulp of camel's milk will suffice a large group of people, and one gulp of cow's milk will suffice a tribe of people, and one gulp of sheep's milk will suffice a section of people. While they are like that, Allah will send forth a good wind, and it will take them under their armpits, and it will take the soul of every believer and every Muslim. And the wicked will remain, coupling like donkeys, and upon them the Hour will come." (Narrated by Muslim).

His saying: "A path between Sham and Iraq": meaning a road between them. And his saying: "'atha" (عاث): with the unmarked 'ayn and the tri-dotted thaa, and 'ayth means severe corruption. "Al-dhara" (الذرى): with the donation of the dhal, which is the highest part of the humps, and it is the plural of dharwah, with the donation and the kasrah. "Al-ya'asib" (واليعاسيب): male bees. "And two pieces" (وجزلتين): meaning two pieces. "And al-gharad" (والغرض): the target at which arrows are shot, meaning he throws it a throw like an arrow throw at the target. "And al-mahrudah" (والمهرودة): with the unmarked dal and the mu'jam, and it is dyed cloth. His saying: "No ability" (لا يدان): meaning no strength. "And al-naghf" (والنغف): worms. "And farasa" (وفرسى): plural of faris, which is a slain person. And "al-zalqah" (والزلقة): with the fath of the zay and the lam and the qaf, ... and it is narrated: al-zulfa (الزلفة) with the dammah of the zay and the sukun of the lam and the fa, and it is a mirror. ... "And al-'asabah" (والعصابة): a group. "And al-rusul" (والرسل): milk. "And al-luqhah" (واللقحة): milk. "And al-fi'am" (والفئام): with the kasrah of the fa and then a long alif: a group. ... And "al-fakhdh" (والفخذ) of people: less than a tribe. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Rub'i bin Hirash, he said: I went with my father Abu Mas'ud Al-Ansari to Hudhayfah bin Al-Yaman, may Allah be pleased with them. Abu Mas'ud said to him: "Tell me what you heard from the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, about the Dajjal." He said: "The Dajjal will emerge, and with him will be water and fire. As for what people see as water, it is burning fire. As for what people see as fire, it is cool, sweet water. So whoever among you witnesses him, let him fall into what he sees as fire, for it is sweet, pure water." Abu Mas'ud said: "And I have also heard it." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Abdullah bin Amr bin Al-As (may Allah be pleased with them both) narrated that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "The Dajjal will emerge among my Ummah and will remain for forty. I do not know whether it is forty days, forty months, or forty years. Then Allah the Almighty will send Jesus, son of Mary (peace be upon him), and he will seek him out and destroy him. Then people will live in ease for seven years, with no enmity between any two people. Then Allah the Mighty and Majestic will send a cold wind from the direction of Sham, and there will not remain on the face of the earth anyone who has an iota of goodness or faith in his heart but will be taken by it. Even if one of you enters the heart of a mountain, it will enter upon him until it takes his soul. Then the worst of people will remain, light as birds and savage as beasts. They will not recognize good, nor will they condemn evil. Then Satan will appear to them and say: 'Will you not respond?' They will say: 'What do you command us?' And he will command them to worship idols, while they are enjoying their sustenance and living well. Then the Trumpet will be blown, and no one will hear it but he will tilt his neck and raise his neck. The first man to hear it will be a man who is tending to his camel's trough. He will fall down unconscious, and then people will fall down unconscious. Then Allah will send - or he said: Allah will send down - rain like dew or shade, and from it the bodies of people will grow. Then it will be blown again, and they will be standing, looking. Then it will be said: 'O people, come to your Lord and make them stand, for they will be questioned.' Then it will be said: 'Bring forth the companions of the Fire.' It will be said: 'From how many?' It will be said: 'From every thousand, nine hundred and ninety-nine.' That is the Day that will make the young men old, and that is the Day when the shin will be uncovered." (Narrated by Muslim) "Al-Layt": the side of the neck. And it means he lowers the side of his neck and raises the other side. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "There is no city that the Dajjal will not enter except Mecca and Medina. There is no entrance to them but that the angels are arrayed, guarding them. So he will descend upon a salt flat, and the city will shake three times, and Allah will expel from it every disbeliever and hypocrite." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Seventy thousand of the Jews of Isfahan will follow the Dajjal, wearing their turbans." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Umm Shareek (may Allah be pleased with her) that she heard the Prophet (peace be upon him) say: "The people will flee from the Dajjal to the mountains." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Imran bin Husayn, may Allah be pleased with them both, who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "Between the creation of Adam and the Day of Resurrection, there is no greater ordeal than the Dajjal." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, he said: "The Antichrist will emerge, and a man of the believers will go towards him. The scouts of the Antichrist will meet him and say: 'Where are you going?' He will say: 'I am going to this one who has emerged.' They will say to him: 'Do you not believe in our Lord?' He will say: 'Our Lord is not hidden!' They will say: 'Kill him!' Some of them will say to each other: 'Did your Lord not forbid you from killing anyone other than him?' So they will take him to the Antichrist. When the believer sees him, he will say: 'O people, this is the Antichrist that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, mentioned.' The Antichrist will order him to be stretched out, saying: 'Take him and disfigure him.' So they will beat his back and stomach severely, and he will say: 'Do you not believe in me?' He will say: 'You are the false Messiah!' He will be ordered, and a saw will be used on him from his forehead down to his legs. Then the Antichrist will walk between the two pieces, and then he will say to him: 'Stand up.' And he will stand up straight. Then he will say to him: 'Do you believe in me?' He will say: 'My insight into you has only increased.' Then he will say: 'O people, he will not do this to anyone else after me.' The Antichrist will take him to slaughter him, but Allah will make his neck of copper, so he will not be able to reach him. He will take him by his hands and feet and throw him, and people will think he has thrown him into the fire, but he will have been thrown into Paradise." Then the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "This is the greatest of people in terms of testimony before the Lord of the worlds." (Narrated by Muslim). Bukhari narrated some of it with a similar meaning. "Al-Masalih" are the guards and the vanguard. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: "No one asked the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) about the Dajjal more than I did. He said to me: 'What harm can he do to you?' I said: 'They say he has a mountain of bread and a river of water!' He said: 'He is more insignificant to Allah than that.'" (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Anas, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "No prophet has ever warned his Ummah against the one-eyed liar, but he was one-eyed, and your Lord, Glorious and Mighty, is not one-eyed. Written between his eyes is 'kafara' (disbelief)." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Shall I not tell you a Hadith about the Dajjal that no Prophet before me told his people? He is one-eyed, and he will come with something like Paradise and Hell. So that which he says is Paradise, that is actually Hell." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings be upon him) mentioned the Dajjal among the people, and he said: "Verily, Allah is not one-eyed. Verily, the Messiah, the Dajjal, is one-eyed in his right eye, as if his eye were a floating raisin." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The Hour will not come until the Muslims fight the Jews, until the Jew hides behind a rock and a tree, and the rock and the tree say: 'O Muslim, here is a Jew behind me, come and kill him.' Except for the Gharqad, for it is of the trees of the Jews." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, may Allah be pleased with him, it is narrated: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "By Him in Whose hand is my soul, this world will not pass until a man passes by a grave and rolls over it, saying: 'Would that I were in the place of the owner of this grave!' And he will not be afflicted by debt, but by affliction." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, may Allah be pleased with him, it is reported that the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) said: "The Hour will not come until the Euphrates River recedes and exposes a mountain of gold, over which people will fight. Ninety-nine out of every hundred will be killed, and each man will say, 'Perhaps I will be the one who escapes.'" In another narration: "The Euphrates River is about to recede and expose a treasure of gold. Whoever witnesses it should not take anything from it." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "They will leave Medina when it is at its best, and none will visit it except the scavengers - meaning the scavengers of beasts and birds. The last two to be gathered will be two shepherds from Muzaynah, intending for Medina, calling their sheep, and they will find it inhabited by wild animals. When they reach Thanīyat al-Wadā', they will fall on their faces." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Sa'id al-Khudri, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "There will be a Caliph among your Caliphs in the last days who will give out money without counting it." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Musa Al-Ash'ari, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, peace be upon him, said: "There will come a time for people when a man will go around with charity in gold, and he will not find anyone to take it from him. And one man will be followed by forty women, seeking refuge with him, due to the scarcity of men and the abundance of women." (Reported by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "A man bought a property from another man and found in his property a jar containing gold. The one who bought the property said to the seller: 'Take your gold, for I only bought the land from you, not the gold.' The owner of the land said: 'I sold you the land and whatever is in it.' They took their case to a judge, who asked them: 'Do you have children?' One of them said: 'I have a son.' The other said: 'I have a daughter.' The judge said: 'Marry the son to the daughter, and spend on themselves from it, and give charity.'" (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, may Allah be pleased with him, that he heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "Two women were with them their two sons, a wolf came and took away the son of one of them, so she said to her companion: 'It only took your son,' and the other said: 'It only took your son.' So they took their dispute to David, peace be upon him, and he judged it for the elder. So they went out to Solomon, son of David, peace be upon him, and informed him, and he said: 'Bring me the knife, I will cut it in two between them.' Then the younger said: 'Do not do that, may Allah have mercy on you, it is her son.' So he judged it for the younger." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Murdis Al-Aslami, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: He said to the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him: "The righteous will go one after another, and a dregs will remain, like the dregs of barley or dates, and Allah will not care about them." (Narrated by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Rifā'ah bin Rāfi' al-Zuraqī, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: Gabriel came to the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, and said: "What do you count the people of Badr among you as?" He said: "Among the best of Muslims," or a word to that effect. He said: "And likewise, those among the angels who witnessed Badr." (Narrated by Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Ibn Umar, may Allah be pleased with them, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "When Allah the Almighty descends punishment upon a people, the punishment will afflict everyone in their midst, and then they will be resurrected according to their deeds." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Jabir, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: "There was a trunk to which the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, used to stand, meaning during the sermon. When the pulpit was set up, we heard from the trunk a sound like that of a pregnant camel until the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, descended and placed his hand on it, and it became still." In another narration: "When it was Friday, the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, sat on the pulpit, and the palm tree from which he used to preach cried out until it almost split. In another narration: It cried out like a child. So the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, descended until he took it and held it to himself, and it began to moan with the moaning of a child being soothed until it settled down. He said: 'It wept for what it used to hear of the remembrance.'" (Narrated by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Tha'labah Al-Khushani, Jurthum bin Nashir, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, he said: "Indeed, Allah the Almighty has ordained obligations, so do not neglect them, and He has set limits, so do not transgress them, and He has forbidden things, so do not violate them, and He has remained silent about things out of mercy for you, not out of forgetfulness, so do not search for them." A hasan hadith. Narrated by Al-Daraqutni and others. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abdullah bin Abi Awfa (may Allah be pleased with them both) who said: We went on seven expeditions with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) eating locusts, and in another narration: We ate locusts with him. (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]
And Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) reported that the Prophet (peace be upon him) said: "A believer is not stung twice from the same hole." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, it is narrated that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "There are three whom Allah will not speak to on the Day of Resurrection, nor look at them, nor purify them, and for them is a painful punishment: a man who has surplus water in the desert and withholds it from the traveler, and a man who sold a commodity to another man after the 'Asr prayer, and he swore by Allah that he would take it for such and such a price, and the other confirmed it, while he was not telling the truth. And a man who pledged allegiance to a leader, but he only pledged allegiance for worldly gain. If he is given something from it, he remains loyal, but if he is not given anything from it, he does not remain loyal." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, he said: "Between the two blows of the trumpet, there are forty." They said: "O Abu Hurayrah, forty days?" He said: "I refuse." They said: "Forty years?" He said: "I refuse." They said: "Forty months?" He said: "I refuse." And all of a person's body decays except for the base of his spine, from which he will be recreated. Then Allah will send down water from the sky, and they will grow like vegetables sprout." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: While the Prophet, peace be upon him, was in a gathering talking to the people, a Bedouin came to him and said: "When is the Hour?" The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, continued talking. Some of the people said: "He heard what he said, and disliked what he said." Others said: "Rather, he did not hear." When he finished his talk, he said: "Where is the one who asked about the Hour?" He said: "Here I am, O Messenger of Allah." He said: "When the trust is lost, then await the Hour." He said: "How will it be lost?" He said: "When the matter is entrusted to those who are not worthy of it, then await the Hour." (Narrated by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "They pray for you. If they are correct, it is for you, and if they are mistaken, it is for you and against them." (Reported by Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, may God be pleased with him, it is narrated: "You are the best nation produced [as an example] for mankind. It was said: The best of people for people are those who bring them in chains around their necks until they enter Islam." Narrated by Al-Bukhari. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, from the Prophet, may God bless him and grant him peace, who said: "Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, wonders at a people who enter Paradise in chains." (Narrated by Bukhari). Its meaning is: they are captured and bound, then they submit and enter Paradise. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, from the Prophet, may God's prayers and peace be upon him, who said: "The dearest of lands to God are its mosques, and the most hateful of lands to God are its markets." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Salman Al-Farsi, may Allah be pleased with him, from his saying, he said: If you can, do not be the first to enter the market, nor the last to leave it, for it is the battlefield of Satan, and there he sets up his banner. (Narrated by Muslim thus). And Al-Barqani narrated it in his Sahih from Salman, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Do not be the first to enter the market, nor the last to leave it, for there Satan laid his eggs and hatched his chicks." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Asim Al-Ahwal, from Abdullah bin Sarjis, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: I said to the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him: "O Messenger of Allah, may Allah forgive you." He said: "And for you." Asim said: I said to him: "Did he ask forgiveness for you, may Allah be pleased with him, peace and blessings of Allah be upon him?" He said: "Yes, and for you," then he recited this verse: "And ask forgiveness for your sin and for the believing men and believing women." (Muhammad: 19). (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Mas'ud Al-Ansari, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Indeed, among the words that people have attained from the first prophethood is: If you have no shame, then do whatever you wish." (Reported by Al-Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Prophet, peace be upon him, said: "The first thing that will be judged between people on the Day of Resurrection will be blood." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may God be pleased with her, she said: The Messenger of God, may God's peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Angels were created from light, jinn were created from a smokeless flame of fire, and Adam was created from what has been described to you." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]
And she, may Allah be pleased with her, said: "The character of the Prophet of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, was the Quran." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from her, she said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever loves to meet Allah, Allah loves to meet him, and whoever hates to meet Allah, Allah hates to meet him." So I said: O Messenger of Allah, is it hating death? For all of us hate death! He said: "It is not like that, but when the believer is given good news of the mercy of Allah, His pleasure, and His Paradise, he loves to meet Allah, and Allah loves to meet him. And when the disbeliever is given good news of Allah's punishment and His wrath, he hates to meet Allah and Allah hates to meet him." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Umm al-Mu'minin Safiyyah bint Huyayy, may Allah be pleased with her, she said: The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, was in I'tikaf, and I came to visit him at night. I spoke with him, then I got up to leave. He got up with me to escort me. Two men from the Ansar, may Allah be pleased with them, passed by. When they saw the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, they hurried. So the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Slow down, it is Safiyyah bint Huyayy." They said: "Glory be to Allah, O Messenger of Allah!" He said: "Indeed, Satan runs through the son of Adam like blood, and I feared that evil, or he said: something, would be cast into your hearts." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Al-Fadl Al-Abbas bin Abdul Muttalib (may Allah be pleased with him) that he said: I witnessed the Battle of Hunayn with the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him). I and Abu Sufyan bin Al-Harith bin Abdul Muttalib stayed close to the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) and did not leave him. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) was on his white mule. When the Muslims and the polytheists met, the Muslims turned back. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) began to urge his mule towards the infidels, and I held the reins of the Messenger of Allah's mule, holding it back so that it would not go too fast, while Abu Sufyan held the stirrup of the Messenger of Allah. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "O Abbas, call out to the companions of the Samurah!" Al-Abbas said, and he was a man with a loud voice, so I called out with my loudest voice: "Where are the companions of the Samurah?" By Allah, when they heard my voice, their turning back was like the turning back of cows to their calves. They said: "We are here, we are here!" So they fought the infidels, and the call was among the Ansar, saying: "O company of the Ansar, O company of the Ansar!" Then the call was confined to the sons of Al-Harith bin Al-Khazraj. The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him), while on his mule, as if stretching himself over it, looked at their fighting and said: "This is when the furnace is heated." Then the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) took some pebbles and threw them at the faces of the infidels, then he said: "They are defeated, by the Lord of Muhammad!" I went to look, and the fighting was as it was, as far as I could see. By Allah, it was only after he threw the pebbles at them that I saw their strength waning and their command retreating. (Narrated by Muslim). "Al-Watis" is the oven, and its meaning is: the war intensified. And his saying "their strength" is with the unmarked "H": meaning their might. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "O people, Allah is good and accepts only that which is good. And Allah has commanded the believers with what He commanded the Messengers, saying: 'O Messengers, eat from the good and do righteousness.' And He said: 'O you who have believed, eat from the good of what We have provided you.' Then he mentioned a man who travels long distances, disheveled and dusty, stretching his hands towards the sky, saying: 'O Lord, O Lord,' while his food is unlawful, his drink is unlawful, his clothing is unlawful, and he has been nourished with unlawful things. How can his supplication be answered?!" (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, may God be pleased with him, it is narrated that the Messenger of God, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "There are three whom God will not speak to on the Day of Resurrection, nor purify them, nor look at them, and for them is a painful punishment: an old man who commits adultery, a lying king, and a proud poor person." (Narrated by Muslim) (4) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, may Allah be pleased with him, it is narrated that the Messenger of Allah, may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Sayhan, Jayhan, the Euphrates, and the Nile are all rivers of Paradise." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: The Messenger of Allah (may Allah bless him and grant him peace) took me by the hand and said: "Allah created the earth on Saturday, and created the mountains in it on Sunday, and created the trees on Monday, and created the disliked things on Tuesday, and created the light on Wednesday, and scattered the creatures in it on Thursday, and created Adam (may Allah bless him and grant him peace) after 'Asr on Friday, at the end of creation, in the last hour of the day, between 'Asr and night." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Sulayman Khalid bin Al-Walid, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: "Nine swords broke in my hand on the day of Mu'tah, and nothing remained in my hand except a Yamani sword." (Narrated by Al-Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from 'Amr bin Al-'As (may Allah be pleased with him) who heard the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) say: "If a judge rules, and he strives to his best judgment, and he is correct, then he has two rewards. If he rules and strives to his best judgment, and he errs, then he has one reward." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It is narrated from Aisha (may Allah be pleased with her) that the Prophet (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Fever is a blast of hellfire, so cool it down with water." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from her, may God be pleased with her, from the Prophet, may God’s peace and blessings be upon him, he said: “Whoever dies and has fasting upon them, his guardian shall fast on his behalf.” (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

On the authority of Auf bin Malik bin Al-Tufayl, Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, narrated that Abdullah bin Al-Zubayr, may Allah be pleased with them both, said concerning a sale or a gift that Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, had given: "By Allah, Aisha will stop, or I will place her under guardianship." She said, "Did he say this?" They said, "Yes." She said, "It is a vow to Allah upon me that I will never speak to Ibn Al-Zubayr." Ibn Al-Zubayr sought her intercession when the estrangement became prolonged, and she said, "By Allah, I will never intercede for him, nor will I break my vow." When this became difficult for Ibn Al-Zubayr, he spoke to Al-Miswar bin Makhramah and Abd Al-Rahman bin Al-Aswad bin Abd Yaghuth and said to them: "I adjure you by Allah to take me to Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, for it is not permissible for her to vow to cut off ties with me." So, Al-Miswar and Abd Al-Rahman brought him, and they sought permission to enter Aisha's presence. They said: "Peace be upon you and the mercy and blessings of Allah. May we enter?" Aisha said, "Enter." They said, "All of us?" She said, "Yes, all of you enter." She did not know that Ibn Al-Zubayr was with them. When they entered, Ibn Al-Zubayr entered the veil, embraced Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, and began to implore her and weep. Al-Miswar and Abd Al-Rahman also began to implore her to speak to him and accept him, saying: "The Prophet, peace be upon him, forbade what you know of estrangement, and it is not permissible for a Muslim to shun his brother for more than three nights." When they urged Aisha with reminders and adjurations, she began to remind them and weep, saying: "I have made a vow, and a vow is a serious matter." They did not cease until she spoke to Ibn Al-Zubayr, and in fulfillment of her vow, she freed forty slaves. After that, she would remember her vow and weep until her tears drenched her head covering. (Narrated by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from 'Uqbah ibn 'Amir (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) went out to the martyrs of Uhud, and he prayed for them after eight years, as if bidding farewell to the living and the dead. Then he ascended the minbar and said: "I am a forerunner for you, and I am a witness over you. Your appointment is with the Pool, and I am looking at it from my position. I do not fear for you that you will associate others with Allah, but I fear for you that you will compete for this world." He said: This was the last look I cast upon the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him). (Agreed upon). In another narration: "But I fear for you that you will compete for this world, and fight each other, and perish as those before you perished." 'Uqbah said: This was the last thing I saw the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) doing on the minbar. In another narration, he said: "I am a forerunner for you and I am a witness over you, and by Allah, I am looking at my Pool now. I have been given the keys to the treasuries of the earth, or the keys of the earth. And by Allah, I do not fear for you that you will associate others with Allah after me, but I fear for you that you will compete for it." The intention of praying for the martyrs of Uhud is to supplicate for them, not the known prayer. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Zayd 'Amr bin Al-Ahtab Al-Ansari (may Allah be pleased with him) that he said: The Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) led us in the dawn prayer, then he ascended the Minbar and gave us a sermon until the Dhuhr prayer time arrived. He descended and prayed, then ascended the Minbar until the 'Asr prayer time arrived. He descended and prayed, then ascended the Minbar until the sun set, and he informed us of what was to be, and he who had memorized it had memorized it. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, who said: The Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever vows to obey Allah, let him obey Him, and whoever vows to disobey Allah, let him not disobey Him." (Narrated by Al-Bukhari) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Umm Shareek, may Allah be pleased with her, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, ordered her to kill geckos, and he said: "It was blowing on Abraham." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever kills a gecko in the first blow, he will have so-and-so many rewards, and whoever kills it in the second blow, he will have so-and-so many rewards, less than the first. And if he kills it in the third blow, he will have so-and-so many rewards." (Narrated by Muslim). And in another narration: "Whoever kills a gecko in the first blow, one hundred rewards are written for him, and in the second, less than that, and in the third, less than that." (Narrated by Muslim). The linguists said: "Al-wazagh" is the large type of house lizard. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Hurayrah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "A man said, 'I will give charity.' He went out with his charity and put it in the hand of a thief. The next morning, people were saying, 'Charity was given to a thief!' He said, 'O Allah, to You be all praise! I will give charity again.' He went out with his charity and put it in the hand of a fornicatress. The next morning, people were saying, 'Charity was given to a fornicatress!' He said, 'O Allah, to You be all praise for a fornicatress! I will give charity again.' He went out with his charity and put it in the hand of a rich man. The next morning, people were saying, 'Charity was given to a rich man last night!' He said, 'O Allah, to You be all praise for a thief, and for a fornicatress, and for a rich man!' Then it was said to him: 'As for your charity to the thief, perhaps he will refrain from stealing. As for the fornicatress, perhaps she will refrain from fornication. As for the rich man, perhaps he will take heed and spend from what Allah has given him.'" (Narrated by Al-Bukhari with this wording, and Muslim with its meaning.) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from him that he said: We were with the Messenger of Allah (ﷺ) at a feast. A foreleg was presented to him, which he liked. He took a bite from it and said: "I am the chief of mankind on the Day of Resurrection. Do you know why? Allah will gather the first and the last in one plain. A caller will call them, and a spectator will see them. The sun will draw near to them, and people will be overcome by distress and hardship that they cannot bear. Some people will say to others: 'Do you not see what you are in? Do you not see who can intercede for you with your Lord?' Some people will say to others: 'Your father Adam.' They will go to him and say: 'O Adam, you are the father of mankind. Allah created you with His hand, and breathed into you of His spirit, and commanded the angels, and they prostrated to you, and He caused you to dwell in Paradise. Will you not intercede for us with your Lord? Do you not see what we are in, and what we have reached?' He will say: 'My Lord is angry today with an anger that He has never been angry before, nor will He be angry thereafter. He forbade me to approach the tree, and I disobeyed. Myself, myself, myself. Go to someone else. Go to Noah.' They will go to Noah and say: 'O Noah, you are the first of the messengers to the people of the earth, and Allah has named you a grateful servant. Do you not see what we are in? Do you not see what we have reached? Will you not intercede for us with your Lord?' He will say: 'My Lord is angry today with an anger that He has never been angry before, nor will He be angry thereafter. I had a supplication that I made against my people. Myself, myself, myself. Go to someone else. Go to Abraham.' They will go to Abraham and say: 'O Abraham, you are the Prophet of Allah and His beloved from among the people of the earth. Intercede for us with your Lord. Do you not see what we are in?' He will say to them: 'My Lord is angry today with an anger that He has never been angry before, nor will He be angry thereafter. I had told three lies. Myself, myself, myself. Go to someone else. Go to Moses.' They will go to Moses and say: 'O Moses, you are the Messenger of Allah. Allah preferred you with His messages and with His speech to mankind. Intercede for us with your Lord. Do you not see what we are in?' He will say: 'My Lord has become angry today with an anger that He has never been angry before, nor will He be angry thereafter. I have killed a soul which I was not commanded to kill. Myself, myself, myself. Go to someone else. Go to Jesus.' They will go to Jesus and say: 'O Jesus, you are the Messenger of Allah and His Word which He bestowed on Mary and a Spirit from Him. You spoke to people while in the cradle. Intercede for us with your Lord. Do you not see what we are in?' Jesus will say: 'My Lord has become angry today with an anger that He has never been angry before, nor will He be angry thereafter.' And he did not mention a sin. 'Myself, myself, myself. Go to someone else. Go to Muhammad (ﷺ).' In another narration: 'They will come to me and say: "O Muhammad, you are the Messenger of Allah and the Seal of the Prophets. Allah has forgiven you your past and future sins. Intercede for us with your Lord. Do you not see what we are in?" So I will go and fall prostrate under the Throne. Then Allah will open to me such praises and glories of Him as He has not opened to anyone before me. Then it will be said: "O Muhammad, raise your head. Ask, and it will be granted to you. Intercede, and your intercession will be accepted." I will raise my head and say: "O my Lord, my Ummah, O my Lord, my Ummah." Then it will be said: "O Muhammad, admit from your Ummah those who have no account into the Right Gate of the Gates of Paradise, and they will share with the people in the remaining gates." Then he said: "By Him in Whose Hand is my soul, the distance between the two doorposts of the doors of Paradise is as between Mecca and Harar, or as between Mecca and Busra." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, he said: Ibrahim, peace be upon him, came with Umm Ismail and her son Ismail while she was nursing him, until he placed her at the House, under a large tree above Zamzam, in the highest part of the Masjid. At that time, there was no one in Mecca, nor was there any water. So he placed them there, and placed with them a waterskin containing dates and a waterskin containing water. Then Ibrahim turned away and left. Umm Ismail followed him and said: "O Ibrahim, where are you going, leaving us in this valley where there is no one to talk to and nothing?" She said that to him repeatedly, and he kept not looking back at her. She said to him: "Did Allah command you this?" He said: "Yes." She said: "Then He will not let us perish." Then she returned. Ibrahim, peace be upon him, went on until he reached the mountain pass where they could see him. He faced the House and raised his hands and supplicated with these supplications. He raised his hands and said: "Our Lord, I have settled some of my descendants in a valley without cultivation..." until he reached "...they are grateful." And Umm Ismail began to nurse Ismail and drink from that water. Until when the water in the waterskin ran out, she became thirsty, and her son became thirsty, and she began to look at him writhing - or he said, rolling on the ground. She went off, disliking to look at him. She found the Safa to be the nearest mountain to her on earth. She stood on it, then faced the valley, looking to see if she could spot anyone. She saw no one. So she descended from Safa until she reached the valley, lifted the hem of her garment, then ran as a person exhausted runs, until she crossed the valley. Then she came to Marwah and stood on it and looked to see if she could spot anyone. She saw no one. She did this seven times. Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, said: The Prophet, peace be upon him, said: "That is the running of people between them." When she reached Marwah, she heard a sound and said: "Hush" - meaning to herself. Then she listened carefully, and heard again and said: "You have made yourself heard. If there is any help, then help." Then she saw the angel at the spot of Zamzam. He struck the ground with his heel - or he said, with his wing - until the water appeared. She began to scoop it up with her hands, saying thus, and she scooped water into her waterskin, and it was gushing forth even after she scooped. And in one narration: "as much as she scooped." Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with them both, said: The Prophet, peace be upon him, said: "May Allah have mercy on Umm Ismail, if she had left Zamzam" - or he said: "if she had not scooped from the water, Zamzam would have been a flowing spring." He said: So she drank and nursed her son. The angel said to her: "Do not fear destruction, for here is a House of Allah, which this boy and his father will build, and Allah does not let His people perish." The House was high above the ground like a mound, where torrents would come and go from its right and left. It was so until a group from Jurhum, or a family from Jurhum, passed by them coming from the direction of Kada'. They camped in the lower part of Mecca. They saw a bird circling, and said: "This bird is circling over water. We knew that there was water in this valley, and there is no water in it." So they sent one or two messengers. They found water and returned and informed them. They came, and Umm Ismail was at the water. They said: "Do you permit us to camp with you?" She said: "Yes, but you have no right to the water." They said: "Yes." Ibn Abbas said: The Prophet, peace be upon him, said: "And Umm Ismail found this [company], and she loved to have company. So they camped, and they sent for their families, and they camped with them, until they were many households there. The boy grew up and learned Arabic from them and their ways, and they were pleased with him as he grew up. When he came of age, they married him to a woman from among them. Umm Ismail died. Ibrahim came after Ismail had married, to inspect his property, and did not find Ismail. So he asked his wife about him, and she said: "He went out to seek provisions for us" - and in one narration: "to hunt for us." Then he asked her about their life and their condition, and she said: "We are human beings. We are in hardship and difficulty," and she complained to him. He said: "When your husband comes, give him my greetings and tell him: Change the threshold of your door." He said: "That is my father, and he has commanded me to leave you. Go back to your family." So he divorced her and married another woman from among them. Ibrahim stayed away from them for as long as Allah willed, then he came to them again, but did not find him. He went to his wife and asked about him. She said: "He went out to seek provisions for us." He said: "How are you?" And he asked her about their life and their condition, and she said: "We are in goodness and abundance, and she praised Allah Almighty." He said: "What is your food?" She said: "Meat." He said: "And what is your drink?" She said: "Water." He said: "O Allah, bless them in their meat and water." The Prophet, peace be upon him, said: "And they did not have grains at that time. If they had, he would have blessed them in it." He said: "So they are two things that no one is without in Mecca except that it does not suit them." And in one narration: He came and said: "Where is Ismail?" His wife said: "He went hunting." His wife said: "Will you not alight, so you can eat and drink?" He said: "And what is your food and what is your drink?" She said: "Our food is meat, and our drink is water." He said: "O Allah, bless them in their food and drink." He said, and Abu al-Qasim, peace be upon him, said: "The blessing of the supplication of Ibrahim, peace be upon him." He said: "So when your husband comes, give him my greetings and tell him to keep the threshold of his door firm." When Ismail came, he said: "Did anyone come to you?" She said: "Yes, an old man of good appearance came to us, and she praised him. He asked me about you, and I told him. He asked me how our life was, and I told him that we are well." He said: "And did he instruct you to do anything?" She said: "Yes, he sends you his greetings and tells you to keep the threshold of your door firm." He said: "That is my father, and you are the threshold. He commanded me to keep you." Then he stayed away from them for as long as Allah willed, then he came after that, and Ismail was straightening arrows for himself under a large tree near Zamzam. When he saw him, he stood up to him, and did as a father does to a son, and a son to a father. He said: "O Ismail, Allah has commanded me with something." He said: "So do what your Lord commands you to do." He said: "And you will help me." He said: "And I will help you." He said: "Allah has commanded me to build a house here," and he pointed to a mound that was higher than its surroundings. At that moment, they raised the foundations of the House. Ismail used to bring stones and Ibrahim used to build, until when the building rose, he brought this stone and placed it for him, and he stood on it while he was building, and Ismail handed him stones, and they both said: "Our Lord, accept from us. You are the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing." And in one narration: Ibrahim went out with Ismail and Umm Ismail, with a waterskin containing water. Umm Ismail used to drink from the waterskin, and her milk would increase for her son until they arrived in Mecca. He placed her under a large tree, then Ibrahim returned to his family. Umm Ismail followed him until when they reached Kada', she called to him from behind: "O Ibrahim, to whom are you leaving us?" He said: "To Allah." She said: "I am pleased with Allah." Then she returned, and she began to drink from the waterskin, and her milk would increase for her son, until when the water ran out, she said: "If only I could go and see if I could find anyone." He said: "So she went and ascended Safa, and she looked and looked to see if she could find anyone. When she reached the valley, she heard. And she came to Marwah, and she did this for seven circuits. Then she said: "If only I could go and see what the boy is doing." So she went and looked, and behold, he was in the same condition as if he were gasping for death. She could not bear it, so she said: "If only I could go and see if I could find anyone." So she went and ascended Safa, and she looked and looked and could not find anyone until she completed seven circuits. Then she said: "If only I could go and see what he is doing." Then she heard a voice and said: "Help, if there is any good with you." Then she saw Gabriel, peace be upon him, and he struck the ground with his heel thus, and winked his heel on the ground, and the water sprang forth. Umm Ismail was astonished, and she began to scoop it up, and the hadith was mentioned at length. (Narrated by Bukhari) with all these narrations. "Ad-Dahha" is a large tree. His saying: "Qaffa": meaning, he turned away. ... "Al-Jari": the messenger. "Wa alfa": meaning he found. His saying: "Yanshaghu": meaning, he gasps. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Sa'id bin Zaid (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: I heard the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) say: "The truffle is from the Manna, and its water is a cure for the eye." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It is narrated from Al-Agharr Al-Muzani (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Indeed, my heart is sometimes covered with heedlessness, and I ask for Allah's forgiveness one hundred times a day." (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, he said: I heard the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, say: "By Allah, I ask for Allah's forgiveness and turn to Him in repentance more than seventy times a day." (Reported by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, may Allah be pleased with him, it is narrated that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "By Him in Whose hand is my soul, if you did not commit sins, Allah would take you away, and He would bring forth a people who commit sins, and they would ask for Allah's forgiveness, and He would forgive them." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them) that he said: "We used to count for the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) in one sitting, one hundred times: 'O Allah, forgive me and accept my repentance. Indeed You are the Accepter of Repentance, the Most Merciful.'" (Reported by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi). And he said: "It is a hasan saheeh ghareeb hadith." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Abbas, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever adheres to seeking forgiveness, Allah will make for him a way out of every distress and a relief from every worry, and will provide for him from where he does not expect." Narrated by Abu Dawud. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Whoever says: 'I seek forgiveness from Allah, other than whom there is no god, the Ever-Living, the Sustainer, and I turn to Him in repentance,' his sins will be forgiven, even if he had fled from the battlefield." (Narrated by Abu Dawud and Al-Tirmidhi, and Al-Hakim said: It is a hadith which is authentic according to the criteria of Bukhari and Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Shaddad bin Aus (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that the Prophet (peace be upon him) said: "The best way of asking for forgiveness is to say: 'O Allah, You are my Lord. There is no god but You. You created me and I am Your slave. I am with Your covenant and promise as much as I can. I seek refuge in You from the evil of what I have done. I acknowledge Your favor upon me, and I admit my sin. Forgive me, for there is no one who can forgive sins but You.' Whoever says this during the day, believing in it, and dies before the evening, he will be among the people of Paradise. And whoever says this during the night, believing in it, and dies before the morning, he will be among the people of Paradise." (Narrated by Al-Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Thawban (may Allah be pleased with him) who said: When the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) finished his prayer, he would say: "Astaghfirullah" (I seek forgiveness from Allah) three times, and say: "O Allah, You are As-Salam, and from You is As-Salam. Blessed are You, O Owner of Majesty and Honor." Al-Awza'i, one of its narrators, was asked: How is the seeking of forgiveness? He said: He says: "Astaghfirullah, Astaghfirullah." (Reported by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Aisha, may Allah be pleased with her, she said: The Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, used to say frequently before his death: "Glory be to Allah and praise be to Him, I seek forgiveness from Allah, and I turn to Him in repentance." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) narrated that he heard the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) say: "Allah the Almighty said: 'O son of Adam, as long as you call upon Me and hope in Me, I will forgive what you have done, and I will not mind. O son of Adam, if your sins were to reach the heavens, then you sought forgiveness from Me, I would forgive you and I would not mind. O son of Adam, if you came to Me with sins nearly as great as the earth, and then you met Me without associating anything with Me, I would come to you with forgiveness nearly as great as the earth.'" (2) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Umar (may Allah be pleased with them both) that the Prophet (peace and blessings be upon him) said: "O women, give charity and ask for much forgiveness, for I have seen you as the majority of the people of the Fire." One of them said: "Why are we the majority of the people of the Fire?" He said: "You curse often and are ungrateful to your husbands. I have not seen any deficiency in intellect and religion that is more dominant over a wise man than you." She said: "What is the deficiency in intellect and religion?" He said: "The testimony of two women is like the testimony of one man, and you spend days not praying." (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Jabir (may Allah be pleased with him) reported that the Messenger of Allah (may Allah's peace and blessings be upon him) said: "The inhabitants of Paradise will eat and drink in it, and they will not defecate, nor blow their noses, nor urinate. Rather, their food will be a belch like the scent of musk, and they will be inspired to glorify and magnify Allah as they are inspired to breathe." (Reported by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "Allah the Almighty said: 'I have prepared for My righteous servants that which no eye has seen, no ear has heard, and no human heart has imagined.' Recite if you wish: 'No soul knows what has been kept hidden for them of comfort for the eyes as a reward for what they used to do.' (Al-Sajdah: 17) (Agreed upon)." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, he said: The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "The first group to enter Paradise will be on the appearance of the moon on the night of its full moon. Then those who follow them will be like the brightest shining star in the sky. They will not urinate or defecate, nor will they spit or blow their nose. Their combs will be of gold, and their fragrance will be musk, and their incense burners will be of aloeswood – fragrant wood. Their wives will be Houris with large, beautiful eyes. They will all be of one character, in the form of their father Adam, sixty cubits high in the sky." (Agreed upon). And in a narration by Bukhari and Muslim: "Their vessels will be of gold, and their sweat will be musk. Each one of them will have two wives, the marrow of whose shins will be visible through the flesh due to their beauty. There will be no differences or hatred among them. Their hearts will be like the heart of one man. They will glorify Allah morning and evening." His saying: "of one character." Some narrated it with a fatha on the kha and a sukun on the lam, and some with a damma on both. Both are correct. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Narrated Al-Mughirah bin Shu'bah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "Moses (peace be upon him) asked his Lord, 'What is the lowest rank of the people of Paradise?' He said: 'It is a man who will come after the people of Paradise have entered Paradise. It will be said to him: "Enter Paradise." He will say: "O Lord, how can that be, when people have already taken their places and received their rewards?" He will be told: "Are you satisfied to have the kingdom of one of the kings of the world?" He will say: "I am satisfied, my Lord." He will be told: "You shall have that, and the like of it, and the like of it, and the like of it, and the like of it." He will say in the fifth time: "I am satisfied, my Lord." He will be told: "This is for you, and ten times as much, and whatever your soul desires, and your eyes delight in." He will say: "I am satisfied, my Lord." Then he asked: 'And what is the highest rank?' He said: 'Those are the ones whom I intended. I planted their nobility with My Own Hand, and sealed it. No eye has seen, nor ear has heard, nor has it occurred to the heart of any human being.'" (Narrated by Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Ibn Mas'ud, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: The Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, said: "I know of the last person to exit the Fire, and the last person to enter Paradise. A man will come out of the Fire crawling. Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, will say to him: 'Go and enter Paradise.' He will come to it, and it will seem to him that it is full. He will return and say: 'My Lord, I found it full.' Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, will say to him: 'Go and enter Paradise.' He will return, and say: 'My Lord, I found it full.' Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, will say to him: 'Go and enter Paradise, for you shall have the like of the world and ten times its like,' or 'for you shall have the like of ten times the world.' He will say: 'Are you mocking me, or laughing at me, while You are the King?'" He said: "I saw the Messenger of Allah, peace be upon him, laugh until his molars showed. He used to say: 'That is the lowest of the people of Paradise in rank.'" (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Musa, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "Indeed, for the believer in Paradise, there is a tent of one hollowed-out pearl, its length in the sky is sixty miles. The believer will have wives in it, and the believer will go around to them, and some of them will not see the others." (Agreed upon). "A mile": six thousand cubits. [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri, may Allah be pleased with him, from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, he said: "Verily, in Paradise there is a tree, a rider on a swift, lean horse would travel for a hundred years without traversing it." (Agreed upon). And they narrated in "Al-Sahihain" also from the narration of Abu Hurairah, may Allah be pleased with him, that he said: "A rider would travel in the shade of it for a year without traversing it." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, from the Prophet, peace and blessings be upon him, who said: "The dwellers of Paradise will look up at the dwellers of the higher chambers above them as one looks at a brilliant star in the horizon, east or west, because of the difference in their ranks." They said: "O Messenger of Allah, are these the stations of the Prophets that no one else can reach?" He said: "Yes, by Him in Whose hand is my soul, men who believed in Allah and testified to the Messengers." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It was narrated from Abu Hurairah (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "A space of the length of a bow in Paradise is better than that the sun rises or sets upon." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

Anas (may Allah be pleased with him) reported that the Messenger of Allah (may peace be upon him) said: "There is a market in Paradise which they visit every Friday. Then a north wind blows, and it scatters fragrance on their faces and clothes, and their beauty and handsomeness increase. They return to their families, and they have increased in beauty and handsomeness. Their families say to them: 'By Allah, you have increased in beauty and handsomeness!' They say: 'And you, by Allah, have increased in beauty and handsomeness after we left you!'" (Muslim) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

It is narrated from Sahl bin Sa'd (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace and blessings of Allah be upon him) said: "The dwellers of Paradise will see the apartments in Paradise just as you see the stars in the sky." (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from him, may Allah be pleased with him, it is narrated: I witnessed a gathering with the Prophet, peace be upon him, in which he described Paradise until he finished. Then he said at the end of his hadith: "In it is that which no eye has seen, no ear has heard, and no human heart has conceived." Then he recited: "Their sides forsake their beds" to the Almighty's saying: "So no soul knows what is kept hidden for them of delights of the eye." (Narrated by Bukhari). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Sa'id and Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with them, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "When the people of Paradise enter Paradise, a crier will call out: 'You will live and never die, you will be healthy and never fall ill, you will be young and never grow old, and you will live in bliss and never be miserable.'" (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Hurayrah, may Allah be pleased with him, that the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, said: "The lowest rank of any one of you from Paradise is that he will be told: 'Wish.' So he will wish and wish. Then he will be told: 'Have you wished?' He will say: 'Yes.' He will be told: 'Then you shall have what you have wished for, and the like of it in addition.'" (Narrated by Muslim). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Abu Sa'id Al-Khudri (may Allah be pleased with him) that the Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said: "Indeed, Allah, the Mighty and Majestic, will say to the people of Paradise: 'O people of Paradise,' and they will say: 'Here we are, our Lord, at Your service, and all good is in Your hands.' He will say: 'Are you satisfied?' They will say: 'And why should we not be satisfied, our Lord, when You have given us what You have not given to anyone among Your creation!' He will say: 'Shall I not give you something better than that?' They will say: 'And what is better than that?' He will say: 'I shall bestow My pleasure upon you, and I shall never be angry with you after that.'" (Agreed upon) [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Jarir bin Abdullah, may Allah be pleased with him, who said: We were with the Messenger of Allah, peace and blessings be upon him, and he looked at the moon on a full moon night, and he said: "Indeed, you will see your Lord with your own eyes as you see this moon. You will not be crowded in seeing Him." (Agreed upon). [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]

And from Suhaib (may Allah be pleased with him), the Messenger of Allah (may Allah bless him and grant him peace) said: "When the people of Paradise enter Paradise, Allah the Blessed and Most High will say: 'Do you desire anything more? They will say: 'Did You not whiten our faces? Did You not admit us to Paradise and save us from the Fire?' Then the veil will be lifted, and nothing will be dearer to them than the sight of their Lord." (Reported by Muslim). Allah the Almighty says: "Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds, their Lord will guide them through their faith. Beneath them rivers will flow in the Gardens of Pleasure. Their call therein will be, 'Exalted are You, O Allah,' and their greeting therein will be, 'Peace.' And the conclusion of their call will be, 'Praise to Allah, Lord of the worlds.'" (Yunus: 9-10). Praise be to Allah, who guided us to this, and we would not have been guided had Allah not guided us. O Allah, bless Muhammad and the family of Muhammad as You blessed Ibrahim and the family of Ibrahim, and bestow Your blessings upon Muhammad and the family of Muhammad, as You bestowed Your blessings upon Ibrahim and the family of Ibrahim. Indeed, You are Praiseworthy and Glorious. Its author (may Allah be pleased with him) said: "I finished it on Monday, the fourth of Ramadan in the year six hundred and seventy." [Translated by Gemini 2.5 Flash]
